title: Packr Travel Packing List
description:
Save time before going on a trip with Packr! Packr will help you pack your suitcase for each trip. The packing list is based on your destination (city, country or region), travel dates and activities.

◆ PACKING CHECKLIST ◆

Packr creates a packing checklist for your suitcase from 24 pre-defined activities.
Based on length of stay, weather and planned activities, your packing list will be ready in no time. This is the perfect tool for your summer vacations, long week-ends, road trips and even camping.

◆ LESS STRESS ◆

Every journey is different, each traveler has his own habits. Packr learns from each of your trips to organize the packing checklist, and adjusts the items based on your previous trips.
You will never forget to pack THAT thing again !

◆ BETTER PREPARED ◆

A quantity can be set for each item, some items' quantity will be automatically adjusted to the length of your stay.
You can also create your own packing lists.

◆ PRACTICAL FEATURES ◆

Premium users can synchronize trips on all devices such as iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch.
You can also share the checklist with your travel companions or print it out.


Packr has already travelled several thousand times around planet Earth packing over a million items in each traveller's suitcase.

Packr has been used for trips to cities like Paris, London, Barcelona, New York City, Montreal, Berlin, Majorca... And countries like France, United Kingdom, Spain, Greece, USA, Italy, Canada, Germany and 1000+ more locations.


Terms of Use:
https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
releaseNotes:
Packr version 2.6 is now available.


◆ New features & enhancements ◆ 

Offline mode is now available.

Faster loading of images on the Home Screen.

10 new activity icons.

Easily add custom items to the default lists with a long press in the packing list.

Icons are now grouped by category when adding a new list.

Renaming default list items is now available for Premium users.


◆ Bug Fixes ◆ 

- Fixed minor issues with offline mode.
- Fixed item count when editing the packing lists.
- Fixed crash when adding/editing a List/Activity.
- Fixed "Laundry" button not displaying its correct active state.
- Fixed duplicating a trip to make an identical copy.
- Fixed Contact Us form not sending the message.
- Fixed crashing on Apple Silicon devices.
- Custom pictures can now be selected from the Photo gallery.
- Fixed renaming items in the packing list.
- Fixed trips not appearing for certain timezones.
- Fixed weather not loading correctly.
- Fixed printing of the packing list.
- Fixed TripIt connection.
- Fixed nearby attractions not showing up.



Love the app? Rate us! Your feedback keeps Packr engine running.
Have a question? Tap "Contact us" in the app or send us an email: hello@packr.app
reviews:
I bought the premium version of this app because of the connect to TripIt feature. Unfortunately it would never connect and kept giving me the connecting circle of death that didn’t go anywhere. I contacted tech support and am still awaiting a response 4 weeks now and counting. | I packed everything more quickly than usual and I didn’t forget anything. Will keep using it | I travel a few times per year so I am not a huge traveler. But I did not find this app user friendly. Maybe it just didn’t suit my needs but I’m not impressed. | It has lists that auto populate based on the length of your stay, weather, etc but I really want to just attach my own things in addition, reservations, activities, restaurants. Maybe I just don’t understand this app. And it has nothing to explain it | Not $3, but $3 a month. Super annoying setup where you can just start making a list, you have to put in dates, destinations, and type of trip. I’m looking for a packing list app that lets me input my own lists. Keep it simple. | I’ve been using this app for many years and I’ve been very happy. I only use it once or twice a year and it was free before. I don’t mind paying to keep the app but now it’s wanting me to pay $20 a year. I would be happy to pay $20 just to have the app forever but there’s no way I’m going to pay that every year.I’m very disappointed because I really liked this app | This app told me to bring a scarf to Disneyland this weekend. It’s not going to be cold enough. You need to change your app and only tell people to bring a scarf when it’s below freezing. | Very basic packing list. It is good to include power adapters, health insurance card, but neglects things like an umbrella, hat and jacket and small scissors. Also …for a long trip it suggested 15 shirts …which is ridiculous. I take no more than 5 shirts even if going for months. Clothes can be washed. 
I don’t see any reason to pay for this app. It’s ok I suppose if you don’t already have a packing list of your own. There are many better packing lists for free on websites. | The way the ads appear and they way the interact (close ads overlap, etc), the app is unusable. | Used to be great. Now it’s just ads. How can an app about packing have so many ads? It’s insane. They also deleted all my old packing lists, so I can’t even reference those. Time to find another app. | I downloaded it and immediately opening the app my phone was overloaded with ads inside the app. Absolutely do not like this app at all | I recommend this app to everyone. I particularly hate packing because it’s so stressful, but the customized activity lists make packing a breeze. | Don’t like being forced to watch an ad to use the app | If dobt get premium sibscriptions doesnt seem like you can do much | Update: After using this for a weekend trip, this may not be the app for me. It is extremely frustrating that every time I open the app, it prompts me for an update. However, the App Store does not have an update.

But then all my lists keep getting put out of alphabetical order. This is annoying to find to check out and try to pack. Then items will be added to a person when creating a trip and it is not on the list that I have so where did it come from?

I will be looking for about her app.

———————————————

I am searching for a good packing list. While this one is okay, it is frustrating. I have spent all day trying to load it up with our trips and it is just not user friendly. It is constantly putting my lists out of alphabetical order. So for me to sort it manually within each list and trip is just annoying. I also wish that I could easily remove a person from a trip and changing from multi-trip to single when duplicating a trip. | Updating my review because now there’s offline mode. Great app! | This app makes it so easy to put together a list for packing. As someone who struggles to stay organized, this app helps so much with providing suggested items per planned activity. SO much better than trying to make sure I think of everything on my own. I undoubtedly will either forget something or overpack planning it on my own. | This app is extremely helpful. It customizes your packing lists for the weather at your destination (and can update this). It also customizes it for your planned activities and duration of stay. It is a great way to make sure that you have what you need and don’t forget anything. it is by far the best list of this sort that I have encountered. The only small improvement I might suggest is for long trips on which you will be washing every few days, it would be helpful if you could specify the number of days between each washing so that the app knew what to recommend for packing. Nevertheless, it does a great job. | I’ve never used another tool, but this one has everything I need — pre-built lists, weather forecast and the ability to customize. Love it! | I have used Packr on iPhone and iPad for years. I did not realize there was a Mac app until recently so I downloaded it.

I have tried different packing list apps and packing list methods over the years including a spreadsheet, Notes, a Word document, and other packing list apps. I even tried Macsparky's Reminders packing list idea. I always come back to Packr. Why have I tried other apps if I like Packr? Because I like to try new apps! But I will not stray again. Packr just works for me. I ike that I can make different lists for different needs for different trips and reuse them over and over. 

Thank you for a great app! | I created my trip, selected the categories and when I submitted to continue, it gave me the option to either pay $3/mo or $20/yr for premium or watch an ad. I opted for the ad, because I hadn’t gotten far enough into the app to know if I like it. The full screen, 10-second ad counted down but then it was done, the ad wouldn’t close! The little “x” was there in the top right corner but it didn’t work. I closed and relaunched the app twice, re-created the trip (because it wasn’t saved), and the same thing happened. I could have written out my entire packing list on paper in the time I wasted trying to make this app work. So disappointed. | This app is great, and it just keeps getting better. It works wonderful for multi city vacations or just quick getaways. One of my favorite features is saving customizable list. This allows me to have specialists for each of my trip needs, from camping in the mountains to water sports at the lake. Plus I can add my personalized photo to the top of the trip. | Used to be able to create a new default list with icons to choose.  Not saving new lists or adding an icon.  I thought you could add more than one trip photo. Can't find information on a huge venue tourist site in a city. | I like the concept of Packr but one major flaw. I want it to automatically sync between my iPad and my iPhone. All my other apps automatically sync (icloud) but it appears this has to be manually synced every time you make a change. Very inefficient. | I wanted to try out the app to see how it worked. No matter what activity I chose it pushed the buy-pro. I deleted the app. If you can’t give it a test run to see how you like it, I’ll try another app | My devices have separate apps and don’t load the same trips. It would be nice if they would sync and have the same trips. Is there a profile? Not even seeing a way to log in. | Been a premium user for a while. Really wanted to love it because I travel for work a ton and need customized packing lists. This app has so many bugs and I am tired of items not showing up in lists I create, or reverting back to old lists after being updated. The idea is great but the execution is just not there. | Use basically every trip | Very basic app for the price | After creating your trip, you’re met with a full screen advertisement that can’t be closed even after the allotted time. The X button is unresponsive. | I purchased Packr Premium several years ago and absolutely love it. I had a problem when I deleted this app off of my iPad and thought I had lost all my lists, but the developer fixed it within a day. I use this app for all of my trips because I love the weather forecasts which help me know how to pack. I also have saved customized packing list for different activities like backpacking or international travel. I have recommended this app to several travel buddies who were green with envy when they saw all it could do. If you travel, it’s worth every penny. | I was packing for Coachella and this made my life so much easier because I was dealing with a health problem that made me very uncomfortable and not feel like myself. A month or so in advance, I was brainstorming things I wanted to pack and had come up with a preliminary list. Then as I was packing for the few days before leaving for the trip, I was adding as I went. Finally I finished everything on my list and I didn’t know what else to bring. I had to sleep and then leave in 6 hours lol. It was great!! I didn’t forget anything. 

I really like the layout of this app. Sometimes it can get confusing with lists and removing stuff in lists it asks you if you want it removed forever, i just ignore them and it seems to work out fine since i dont really need to pack for trips that frequently. It works well for when you want an app that’s not your Notes or Reminders app | This app is my CONSTANT GO TO to help me with my business and pleasure travels!
THANK YOU for being such an AWESOME APP!!!!!!!! | I’ve several other packing list apps and have settled on Packr. It just does packing lists and does it really well. I highly recommend it. Also their tech support is awesome. | Can’t get passed the first add. The X is so far off the edge you can’t close the add. 
USELESS GARBAGE. | You can’t get to the packing list.  Watch an ad that allows you to advance but the button to advance to the list page doesn’t work.  Honestly, it’s an app that tells you how many pairs of socks you should bring on a 3 day trip, why the ads?  Delete immediately. | it crashes on my macbook. too bad. I had used in the past | I am a very heavy packer. Though I’m still this way, this app has helped me improve greatly. It’s very cool how it tells you the number of things to bring like socks, and shirts, gives you the ability to add things and tailors needs to the weather forecast…which it also has. It’s been 5-Starts since I bought it and has continued to be with updated and new features added | Do not download. Interface commonly crashes and though it is ad centric, the ads are coded in such a way as not to allow access through once viewed. Lists aren’t generated. | Do not have what I need | It might just be me. I love the app, but I’m not sure how I see the other family members I added. How do I see the list for my son? | This app thinks of everything. You tell it where you’re going and for how long and it gives you the most thoughtful packing list ever. It thinks of every single thing you may need for your trip! I highly recommend it!! | The new version makes you pay to even make a list anymore. The old didn’t. BAD. Try Packing List: Trip Planner instead. | Greatest app of all humanity for packing! | I can’t print my list.  The option is there, but it closes the app and doesn’t bring up a list. This doesn’t help me. If you want to carry your phone while you pack, this may be fine. | App crashed and I lost my $4.99 for the upgrade to premium. | I use this app for every trip I take!   Perfectly organized and easy to use!   The only reason I gave four stars is because the local  attractions are not so local!   A trip to the Bahamas brings me activities to do near Greece! | Premium in app purchase doesn’t share with family, I bought it and thought my wife could share it with 1 purchase. Not fair and the sharing feature isn’t explained well. | I love this app for packing lists. I have used TripIt for a couple years for keeping track of travel info. This works well with that to help me prep and pack for those trips. I’m he suggested lists consider weather and what I will be doing (after I make selections) to make the list very practical. I can also add my own notes and modify the list as I see fit. I also love the ability to share a list. I’m his has been helpful for my husband and me as we can just check that app and make updates (instead of assuming the other grabbed it or grabbing double.) 

The only addition that would have been helpful for this trip is a section for pets. I could be similar to the section for babies, but including things like food, leash, crate, meds, etc. would be super helpful for those of us who have pets but don’t always travel with them. | I want the travel butler back!!!

title: Flamingo — Travel Days Tracker
description:
Flamingo flies with you and makes sure you comply with international and US state travel and tax requirements. An essential tool for global expats, digital nomads, permanent residents, dual residents, overseas homeowners, and frequent travellers.

AUTO TRIP RECORDING
With geolocation tracking, Flamingo automatically determines if you have left your residence country or state and accurately records your trip details so that you don’t have to. Keep tabs on the countries and states you’ve visited and how many days you spent there.

SCHENGEN AREA CALCULATOR
If you frequently travel to the EU Schengen Travel Area as a non-resident, it can be a hassle to keep up with the 90 in 180 days rule. Flamingo counts how many combined days you’ve already spent in Schengen countries and how many more you have left in the 180-day period. If you’re already located in the EU as a non-resident, Flamingo tells you the date when you have to leave to avoid overstaying.
The built-in calculator helps you determine not only the earliest date you can travel to the EU for your desired number of days, but also for how many days you can stay if you arrive on your desired date.

VISA-FREE STAY
Based on your citizenship, Flamingo automatically identifies to which countries you need a visa, e-visa, or visa on arrival and where you can travel absolutely visa-free.
Coming soon: Flamingo will also tell you how long you can stay in each country visa-free, monitor your duration of stay and alert you when you’ll be close to overstaying.

RESIDENCE STATUS FOR COUNTRIES & US STATES
Flamingo helps you determine your physical presence for domicile and residency by automatically recording and counting how many days you spend there.
*Especially useful for Statutory Residence Test for UK expats and Substantial and Physical Presence Tests for US expats and permanent residents.

EXPORT REPORTS
You can download a customizable CSV report with your travel details with the tap of a button. Share it with authorities and lawyers in seconds or keep it for your own travel records. 

COMPLETE PRIVACY
Your travel, residency, and visa data is stored locally only on your device. We do not collect, nor store, your information on our servers. 
*With Flamingo PRO you can sync your data via iCloud across all your devices.

***Flamingo tracking and counting are created for information purposes only. Always consult with your legal advisor about specific requirements for your residency and visa status.

Terms of Use (EULA): https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
Privacy Notice: https://flamingotracker.com/policy
releaseNotes: Schengen calculator bug fixes
reviews:
I’ve had this app installed for at least 8 months and so far it has logged 18 days even though it has permissions to run in the background. 

Would now need to go back and update the timeline manually. 

The core value proposition of the app doesn’t work. | We investigated numerous apps for tracking travel and residency, and one app clearly stood out. We have a complex situation involving time spent in numerous countries and several US states. This app's intuitive design simplifies what could be a complex and distracting tracking process—it has been a big stress reducer, to say the least. But what truly impressed us was the level of customer support. I had a few unique scenarios I wanted to clarify, and after reaching out, I received prompt, detailed, and supportive responses. It is unusual to find a blend of well-designed software and exceptional support. I confidently recommend this app to anyone in need of managing their travel and residency details. It's an excellent tool, supported by a dedicated, thoughtful, and caring team. | I got this app to track my location for tax purposes. We have homes in both Florida and Minnesota. We just became FL residents. I wanted to be able to easily prove I was out of MN 183 days. I just checked the app and after only 33 days it is totally wrong. I was in FL 29 days and in MN for 4. It says I was 7 nights in and 26 nights out of my state of residency. I’m so disappointed as I trusted this app would do what it’s supposed to do. Now I don’t have the easy, accurate records to prove my residency for 2024. It’s too late to start another residency tracking app for this year. What a waste of money. So glad I only paid for a month and not a whole year. | Finally what I was looking for! Due to my work, I go from state to state throughout the year and come tax season it’s hard for me to figure out in what state I should file my taxes. With this app, the headache is gone as it counts my days automatically. I can also easily put in my previous trips to count the times I traveled before I installed the app. I also like the design and how intuitive it is.

title: Trip Scout - My Travel Planner
description:
The New York Times, USA Today, and Travel & Leisure have said Tripscout is THE essential app for the modern traveler. 


Discover a destination like a local insider and plan the perfect trip with your personalized, always up-to-date travel guide - and it’s 100% FREE! 
 
See why the world’s top travelers plan their trips with Tripscout:

1. THE BEST TRAVEL ARTICLES & VIDEOS ARE HANDPICKED FOR YOU:
Discover the best articles and videos from top publishers and local influencers for YOUR trip so you can stop filtering through irrelevant recommendations, sponsored ads, and out of date guidebook content.

2. TURN INSPIRATION TO ACTION WITH TRAVEL PRO EFFICIENCY:
Every restaurant, cafe, shop, or site featured in the content is mapped to our 100M+ points of interest so you can efficiently save anything you discover with one tap, compare photos and local tips from recent travelers, and easily stitch together a full, personalized itinerary and map on your phone.

3. A PERSONALIZED EXPERIENCE THAT PUTS YOU FIRST:
The best travel content is not one-size-fit all and we personalize all content based on your actual trip dates, budget, interests, and travel companions to make sure you’re always in-the-know on the experiences you care about.

4. TRAVEL GUIDE & MAPS WORK COMPLETELY OFFLINE
Travel stress-free by downloading your entire travel guide and map offline so you don’t have to worry about using data when traveling overseas or cruising at 50,000 feet in airplane mode.

Hundreds of travel bloggers and publications have featured Tripscout as the essential resource for the modern traveler and have given our apps some very high endorsements, such as:

-- “Basically the best thing ever for travelers.” - Conde Nast Traveler
-- “Helps travelers explore the local side of the city” - USA Today
-- “Perfect for the curious traveler” - American Airlines
-- “Makes travel easier, but just as exciting.” - Forbes 
-- "Finally, a travel app that’s purposefully, blissfully simple” - Travel+Leisure

Keep exploring and stay curious! 

P.S. You can review our terms of use and privacy policy together at: https://tripscout.co/privacypolicy/
releaseNotes: Stability and performance improvements.
reviews:
It took my dates, but nothing would populate when searching for “hotel”, “bar”, or anything else.  I even typed “store” into the search bar, but it just said “no results”.  Went with another app called TripIt.  Much better. | This app seems abandoned. Last update was a year ago. Most contents in the app just wouldn’t load. However, when I tried to use it in Portland ME, I could not find Portland Head Light, one of the oldest lighthouses in America, commissioned in 1791 by George Washington. There is no way to add manually. We can only add what’s already there. Need to update please. | Very short overview.   Limited content. | If you’re into 70%+ of their posts being TikTok videos that they share, along with nondescript titles or descriptions, cool I guess. But that’s literally all it is, along with the thumbnails/ previews all being broken. 
Trash. | It won’t let me change “searching in xx” if I try to switch the card pulls up from bottom of screen then immediately goes back down. Unable to swap and use a big portion of the app’s functionality. | It has a really nice interface, easy information at a glance! It’s really helpful and I can see myself using it in the future. It doesn’t have Istanbul, which is my upcoming trip, though. Would be nice! Thanks, lots of potential! | It seemed easy at first. I want to have hotels, museums and restaurants in my itinerary. The app couldn’t locate one restaurant. Also, I set up an itinerary and the app lost all the information so I would have to start over. | Like the idea. Unfortunately it is Very buggy. I can’t search what I want. And the design is not very intuitive | Don’t bother, this app is designed to serve ads and collect personal info in exchange for doing basic google searches. | Great idea and app, has great potential if the searches were more up to date | Literally just an app for bookmarking travel spots.  Obvious features that would make it far more useful such as notes, personal ratings, and being able to jointly share itineraries are missing. | I cannot recommend this app. The last update wiped my itinerary! Now I’m hoping support fixes it before I need to rebuild it all. 

I feel dumb for not taking screenshots of each day. But I liked the flexibility of changing my plans in here. | No se cómo manejar bien el app, para mi falta información de su manejo. | This app has no original content.   It just refers you to other articles and links filled with advertisements.   Stick with apple guides if you’re looking for crisp, well curated guides | Nothing original about this and they post terrible content all on Instagram. They just use other people’s work! | This app has a lot of good content, but the amount of notifications this app spams you with is absolutely insane. I heard a lot of good things about this app, so I just downloaded it the other day and I’ve been immediately bombarded with 30+ notifications per day. I just looked to see if there was a way to personalize what kind/how many notifications you get and there doesn’t appear to be any options for it. It’s either you get spammed with notifications all day, or you don’t get any at all. Or you just deselect a bunch of things that you’re interested in, but that totally defeats the purpose of the app. I don’t think I’ve ever left a negative review on here before, but I expected much better from such a highly regarded app. | best travel Apps EVER!!! | I couldn’t find anything, and it was much easier to just google locations. The app was much too complicated for my liking. | All this App does is refer you to TicToc or Instagram which I have no interest in adding to my phone. Very little original content. | Almost no useful info for places | Gracias | Kind of pointless. Miss Google Trips. | Too many error messages. Can’t even make a profile to start. App is updated. Just a lousy app | we can for our next one in Fall? | I love love love this app. I even use it when not traveling just to daydream and plan for the future. Love it! | Love it. Best place to get travel inspiration ideas. | Easy to use for travel plans and has lots of good information! | The perfect pocket guidebook for all of my travel needs! Helps feed my wanderlust, plan my upcoming trips and guides me while I’m in my destinations traveling! The content seems to be endless and always updating with the most recent things I should know about where I’m going! ♥️♥️♥️ | Planning a trip to Iceland and it was so helpful.  All the great places to stay and so informative to plan just about everything.    Such a genius idea creating this app.     Thanks Trip Scout | Very helpful | Literally opened the app to use it for the first time and nearly panicked thinking I got my own dates wrong. Calendar isn’t synced, sept is really October’s calendar for example. Event locations not updated to show new location addresses… not really impressed. 

I’ll stick with my old school way of planning. | These are tons of experienced travelers. They don’t take you to the top rated five star restaurant everyone is talking about... they take you to the hole in the wall, home cooked meal that seats a total of 7 people. And the meal is better than you’ve ever tasted. I have used this app from Cairo to Croatia to Iceland and it has saved me so much time on trying to find the interesting, desolate places! | Although Covid has put a damper on our travel this past year, we are ready to get back on the horse and continue seeing the wonders of the world.  We used TripScout exclusively to plan our last trip to Europe and it made our planning and executing seamless and informative.  Their network of travel experts, and travelers input makes it an extremely useful tool both for the novice traveler and nomads like my wife and I….on the road again yada,yada,yada | Amazing app. Need an android version for my friends. | I love how tailored everything on Trip Scout is for my travel plans! I have all the best recommendations and tips for a great vacation right in this app! | By far the most diverse yet organized platform out there for anyone planning to travel, or who travels frequently!! A must have app! | Love this app. Easy to use. Great for trip planning and inspiration. | Huge fan of this app and loving the upgrades!  I recommend this app to all of my traveler friends - backpackers, luxury vacation, solo travelers, family travel, etc - because it is so easy to navigate and sort through based on your own specific travel profile and what fits you as you plan your trip.  When I’m not able to get away, I love reading articles on TripScout’s app and dreaming about future travel! | Incredibly easy to use and packed full of worthy trip planning information. Tripscout offers multiple perspectives on travel and helps plan my dining, lodging and short term excursions given the content is so up to date. It’s also an enjoyable escape where I can take a few minutes and feel inspired about my next trip. | It’s amazing so helpful and perfect ♥️♥️♥️♥️♥️ | Absolutely love using this app. Travel is much easier and far more interesting when using Tripscout to plan and execute trips. As added bonuses the Tripscout Instagram account has incredible photos and the new Facebook group is really helpful when considering travel | [Updated to reflect app updates] I’ve been using TripScout now since the early years, and I can’t be happier. The updates are amazing, the new design is sleek and beautiful, and it makes me want to get back out there, whenever that will be possible 🤞🏻🤞🏻

Can’t wait to see where things go! | The best travel app. | Best Travel app. Fun and easy to use and full of information needed for planning much needed trip. | The agenda and sites are great, especially for Nola | Still exploring the app, so far I have found good articles on what to do and with each place it explains the story behind it which I think it’s awesome | Super easy to find activities, place them on a map and then see them. | Even now that we can’t travel still useful for planning future trips 💓

title: inRoute - Intelligent Routing
description:
Plan optimal routes or chart your own course using weather, elevation, curves and more. Then navigate safely with voice-guided, turn-by-turn directions that automatically check your route for severe weather. 

***Featured in Essential Navigation Apps on the US App Store***
***As seen on the TODAY show in the Traveling This Summer segment***
“adding to both the safety of the ride and the pleasure of knowing beforehand what to expect” - Florin Tibu, “autoevolution”
“I used InRoute for planning six world record attempts. No weather app gives you more information, period.” - Carl Reese, Multiple World Record Holder

Key Features (some require inRoute Pro--see below):
• Voice guided navigation of up to 150 locations with automatic severe weather alerts*
• Optimize waypoint order for fastest time, or manually reorder
• Import from XLSX, GPX and KML files
• Create custom routes based on weather, elevation and curviness, or build your own route from available alternates on each leg of a route
• Interactive charts showing route elevation, curviness, weather (temperature, humidity, precipitation, wind speed/direction, severe weather alerts), and sunrise/sunset times*
• Search along a route—the whole route, every x miles/hours, or the next x miles/hours from a place—find gas, hotels, campgrounds or places to eat close to a route
• Enter your RV specs to avoid clearance issues and weight restrictions
• Set Departure and Layover Times—weather forecasts, road conditions (e.g. congestion), and travel times accurately reflect conditions throughout the trip
• Save your favorite routes and places, sync between devices, organize into folders, print via Airprint, and share with family and friends
• Easily add places to the map using a Dropped pin, Search, or Contacts
• Export routes to Apple Maps, Google Maps, Navigon, and Waze. Some apps use inRoute's "Agenda Nav" feature. See the in-app FAQ for more info.
• Export to GPS devices and apps compatible with GPX files
• Routes are stored on your device so you can access them even if you lose connection
*Weather forecasts are available worldwide. Severe weather alerts are currently available in the US, EU, Canada and Israel.

inRoute Pro (for iPhone, iPad, CarPlay & Mac):
- $4.99 monthly, or $39.99 annually. 1 week free trial
- Create routes with up to 150 locations (8 in free version)
- Sync routes and pins between devices
- Weather charts/custom routes
- Severe weather alerts during navigation (US, Canada, EU areas)
- Export/share routes as GPX files
- RV routes based on vehicle description

Price may vary by location. Subscriptions will be charged to your credit card through your iTunes account. Your subscription will automatically renew unless canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Manage your subscriptions in Account Settings after purchase.

Privacy Policy and Terms of Use: http://carobapps.com/privacy-policy

Note: Since continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life, inRoute will automatically shut down if you haven't used it in a while.
releaseNotes:
- GPX file updates allowing inRoute's Via points to become Shaping Points on some Garmin GPS devices
- Removed "Basic GPX" option (no longer needed)
- Minor interface updates and bug fixes
reviews:
Have been trying out basic version and opted to pay for a month. Problems occurred with syncing between devices and Rob quickly replied with suggestions on how to fix. Rare that tech folks can respond quickly and effectively. Kudos to all. | Inroute is the easiest to use and best navigation app that I have tried . | The only problem I have with this app is when I’m looking for smaller roads to make a waypoint, I enlarge them to try to see what number of road it is and there is no label on the road. I’m doing this on a iPhone. | I love this app! I only discovered it recently because it was rated as great for car play, but it has quickly become essential for me to plan my routes based on the elevation chart. Living near the Rocky Mountains, elevation is often a key factor in route planning. | All works well just wish the map didn’t lag when searching and creating waypoints | There needs to be a way to change the numbers of points entered so that you can put them in order or can add a point that you see is needed later into the middle of the line somewhere and get it in the right order. Also when you are using, the route developed, it would be more desirable if the turns were referenced by road numbers rather than by street names because most of these people using inRoute are using it for commercial purposes and we use road numbers rather than street names. Desperately need the road number as the points description. The local street name does not help a person who is not from that area. The road number is the descriptor that we need. When the points have been positioned where they need to be, I do wish that the line and route would follow the pointsexactly by their number order and not try to route along the shortest route as the crow flies. We put in a specific order for a reason. Permits require exact, turning points and roots of travel. | I have multiple businesses and I use this routing app for multiple purposes I use it for routing out routes for showings, routing out routes to drive on trips. It just really comes in handy it’s worth every penny and it’s very very user-friendly. | I’ve tried at least half a dozen apps and this is the best for our travel. I can adjust the way points according to my mileage and easily find the best route. It’s not the most user friendly app but they are constantly improving | I’ve tried most of them and this is the best gps for me. I make multiple stops a day at regular addresses. This platform provides an excellent solution to gps guidance. It Integrates, imports , and optimizes routes in a not too complex way. I am very thankful for this app. | Can’t see all the road numbers. Tried everything and still nothing. Not very impressed with the app. | The app has the most flexibility in finding stuff every x miles. It is worth reading the tutorial to get the most out of it. | I find some of the user flow confusing in this app. I’m planning an 18 day trip. Its helped order my way points. It’s confusing why every way point can be a start or end stop as well. That’s un-necessarily complex UX. The segments don’t display time. 

In the list view (which is nice) it shows distance and time since origin - I see no immediate value in this. 

What I want is how long is the drive. While it alternates from stops to layovers, there does seem to be a fair amount of confusing / unnecessary text. For example “next step”
Is redundant as the next line has the step name. This makes the readability easier rather than burying these details. Would love for stops to include URLs to camp sites (I can add them). 

Happy to chat more if the devs are around. | Usability must be improved. There is no posted speed limit displayed, it does not seem to understand traffic problems ahead, you start on your smartphone and then on your RV display it says you have to end navigation and start again, and if you start any other app you have to start from scratch. Not what you’d expect for what you pay. | Not sure if I was maybe looking to have the ap do more than it is set up for, but I found this ap to not be very user friendly. It does not seem to give many options past just the mapped route. I couldn’t figure out how to even get roadside information like RV Parks, rest stops, fuel stations, etc. | Wished it had exit numbers | I can’t figure out how to turn toll roads off. | Purchased pro version of app for RV. I could not enter any specifications. App continues to ask to upgrade to pro version. Paid the monthly and cancelled.
Update:  went through the app restore process previous purchase and upgrade to no avail several times. | I work in the oversize, super load industry. Pretty much everybody I know uses this app because it is the best one for what we do. I have had many conversations with the people at inRoute, and they have made many, if not all of the changes I recommended to improve it. They listen. The one thing that still stands out as an annoyance is when you create a route, and then close the app. When you reopen the app and the route you created, it often tries to reroute you a different way than what you had chosen, or tries to get you to loop around or make u-turns. On some roads you have to figure out how to force the app to go the route that you want. 
Now, inRoute will tell you that you have to change your settings when you create the route because it will use current Apple Maps information and reroute you if it thinks it needs to or if you chose the wrong transportation method. This should not happen, but it does quite frequently. When a route is created, it needs to stay that way, under all circumstances. If there is a new road closure or detour along the route you created then they should simply have a pop-up window that tells you what the issue is instead of rerouting you automatically. The user should have the option to reroute, not Apple Maps or the inRoute app by default. Specifically, in my industry, we follow permitted routes. These routes are already determined by DOT to be safe, open, and available to us. And when I share this route with other users in my industry and they open up the app even when they select the “adjust” setting when trying to open it, the route still changes the route on us. This is a big glitch because I have had coworkers running with other oversize crews get on the wrong road because of the app making changes by itself. Yes, they should know the route or be able to read a permit, but the app should not change the route - no matter what! This is a big issue in the oversize industry. 
So, lastly, let me just say inRoute needs to stop this from happening and allow the user to make the changes if necessary, based on what I suggested above, that perhaps a pop-up window would come up and give the app user the opportunity to change the route, if necessary. The app should not do this automatically. It happens more often than you know. I’ve tried to get inRoute to change this before and they always tell me that when you’re sharing it, the other person needs to have the same settings. Well, my answer to that is when they download the map after I’ve shared it there is a selection that they can say “adjust”, and it will adjust the settings on their app to match the settings that the route was created with. And they still have issues. Other than this, I think it’s a great app. I’ve used it for nearly 3 years and they have made many improvements several of which I have suggested because of the industry I’m in.
It’s still the best app out there for planning a route, especially multi-state routes. | Needs to speed the directions while on a phone call instead of just beep. | The GPS map doesn’t spin around and stays North to South no matter what direction you’re driving and makes directions very difficult. | Rated four star because gps or maps need to be updated and the buttons could be a more user friendly. | Only 4 because of Apple Maps. Would be great if I could highlight railroad tracks and crossings when I ask for them. This app is used by a lot of truck drivers who move oversized loads. More information is better. Thank you. | This is my first time writing a review for an app. I enjoy using it as it helps me plan my trip before I leave. I gave it four stars simply because I couldn't find good sound quality, and the road highlights on the map are quite thick when zoomed out. | Worked great until the update. Now it won’t even open. Have uninstalled, reinstalled, restated phone, and everything else I can think of. Emailed company and no response. Would like to receive the service I pay for. | Need to include exit numbers. Also, a possible way to check bridge height while in hybrid mode. Other than that love using the app. Thank You. | I am a Road Captain for our local chapter here in Central Texas. I use this app all the time creating routes. 
My problem is that I can only use this app on my work phone, which is an iPhone. My personal phone is not. I would love to use this on another platform, and so would so many other users. 
Is there a plan to provide this free or paid service to Android users? | This app helps me see exactly how far I have between stops.. | This app is great for drivers like myself that haul tall wide heavy and long 
Very handy , worth every penny | Necesito que sea como antes que la aplicación me deba la oportunidad de enviar las confirmaciones | This could be the perfect app.  
I use this more then Apple map, Google map and Waze.   

InRoute is still much better then the others mentioned here for a family trip or simple deliveries. I love the weather updates and road closure updates as well as toll information, for all this,  I give 5 stars. 

Features I’d like to see added are speed limit notifications while using the app, satellite street view with split screen for over all route view while entering the desired route, these additions would increase the value of InRoute and the need for other apps to create a route in InRoute wouldn’t be needed.  

4 star for my type of work due to other apps needed to run at the same time for all information mentioned above. | Great does everything I need it to thanks for making it | I’ve tried the application for 2 days and found it is useless app. 
I removed my trail subscription , deactivated the service and uninstalled the app. 
Today I noticed that they charged my account for $4.31 while I’m not using your service at all. 
Be careful, don’t try the app until further update in this review.

Update:
The customer service didn't reply.
I was not able to get my money back.
Stay away and don't be fooled by the reviews that seems NOT to be true. | If you like driving past way points multiple times, flipping countless u turns, and backtracking half the time then this is the app for you. If you’re trying to be efficient in your route pass up on this app. But if you like driving around just to waste time then maybe give it a try. | I use this app everyday creating my daily lawn routes. Has saved me a lot of money and most importantly time. | I love the app but I’d like to see exit numbers and highway numbers when I zoom in on an exit to drop a pin. Zooming in reviews the local names of the roads but not the road number. If you could add these it would be closer to perfect. WE NEED EXIT NUMBERS!!! | Dependable - Accurate - User Friendly - Great planning tool | Trying this on my latest RV trip. Overall it’s OK. Could be a lot easier to customize routes but offset by the ability to save specific routes once customized. 

Major issues: 
1. No speed limit information - which is a major flaw
2. No off line maps.

Minor issues
1. User interface is one of the worst. Hard to find specific actions you want - including just saving routes.
2. Really not good for simply monitoring your driving. Really requires a destination to be useful. | Won’t plan route not good for delivery driver if you need to prioritize deliveries | Great app | The app keeps reversing the order of my stops on my route, no matter how many times I change it and/or save it. I’m planning a roughly circular route going south to west to north to east, the app keeps changing it to WSEN. Also, when I try to zoom in to see the number of a highway, the number stays small even though the highway itself enlarges.

I will not be renewing my subscription for the next month. | Motorcyclist and iphone users dream app. The best of the best. migrated from a dedicated Garmin device to this and brought all my routes over no problem. | This app is well thought out and purposefully built for the traveler. I had searched long and hard for an app that would serve me well on my cross country motorcycle treks …. Recommended it to all my friends. Sponsorship ??? | It is a good well thought out system, but if it were going to get better, it would have the exit number on the interstate highways. | Every update keeps this app getting better and better. It’s my go-to route creation tool for all my motorcycle trips. Highly recommended! | Love the app I am an oversize load escort. Even when raining when other apps stopped working enroute kept working. The only complaint I have is it would be great if you added exit numbers. Because sometimes I have to go to google to find exit numbers to stay on routes that we are permitted to go on by the states.it is the best tool that an escort can have in this business because we are not permitted to leave the route the states have given for any reason. | Great product. Needs mile post on the ramps | I really can’t say enough good things about this app. Sure, there are plenty of apps out there that will route you among multiple waypoints, but this one is different. To say it is designed intentionally is an understatement. The app automatically routes you to the next waypoint after reaching the previous one. The best part is little to know interface is required to keep the app running, which cuts down under distractions and ultimately increases productivity. I have found the app works best on an iPad but it’s great on iPhone as well. For five bucks, I think it’s the best money you can spend if you are in the delivery business or just want to efficiently route multiple steps into your day. What a steal- five stars all day. | I wish it would tell me of a turn while I’m on the phone | Be careful- not all routes are public roads. Pulling a fifth wheel is not easy. | Great app but needs a pause route button for when we stop at a waypoint but don’t want to end the route so it will quite giving verbal directions or tell you to return to route while walking around with my phone in my pocket. Otherwise love it!!! Also it would be nice if it also showed the speed limit for the road you are traveling on like the other navigation apps do.

title: Nowy: AI Travel Social Planner
description:
Are you looking for an effortlessly AI travel itinerary planning app that includes everything in one place? - Automatically create your visual itineraries, and personalized travel plans that you can add activities, experiences, hotels and flight altogether?

Look no further than NOWY: Your Ultimate AI TRAVEL PLANNER!  

Nowy is an AI Visual trip planner app that creates personalized itineraries, visual trip plans & detailed travel guides based on your personal preferences and interests all-in-one place. Say forever goodbye to spending hours searching and planning your next vacation.

INTRODUCTION TO NOWY: AI TRAVEL SOCIAL PLANNER

Nowy is your ultimate AI travel planning and pocket-sized travel buddy! Download Nowy to:

+ AI Travel Planner to create visual itineraries
+ AI Travel Assistant
+ Add you hotels, flights, activities and experiences and book anytime seamlessly!
+ Save your custom routes, maps, transportation, bookings, guides
+ Uncover nearby hidden treasures & local gems
+ Share your full itinerary

Transform YOUR travel planning experience with groundbreaking Nowy AI planner to effortlessly craft YOUR personalized itineraries tailored to YOUR preferences, saving you time and ensuring truly unique adventures in a Day-to-day detailed trip. Find the hidden gems of the city you want to travel to, do seamless bookings, and make social connections worldwide for unforgettable journeys. 

Discover the future of trip planning in uniquely your own way. With Nowy, you will have access to a wide range of AI-powered travel features. Create a personalized itinerary and make it as much or as little as you want with the help of the latest AI technology used in this app!

KEY FEATURES OF NOWY: AI TRAVEL SOCIAL PLANNER

GET PERSONALIZED VISUAL ITINERARIES – 3 SIMPLE STEPS

1. Travel Destination
2. Days of duration
3. Any of travel needs or preferences

Nowy's AI Planner will create your personalized itinerary with AI-curated storytelling, full maps, routes, transportation, and bookings saved for use.


1. REAL-TIME AI-POWERED TRAVEL TALES

+ Chat with Nowy AI Assistant 24/7!
+ Get personalized and quick answers to your travel questions.
+ Discover your dream destinations and hidden gems with AI-powered recommendations.


2. CREATE VISUAL ITINERARIES AND SAVE YOUR CUSTOM ROUTES

+ Discover your favorite destinations. 
+ Collect your favorite place.
+ Map your locations and personalize your travel routes
+ Automatic maps, travel durations, routes, and transportation options
+ Instant bookings linked to book what you see now!


3. EXPLORE AND INSPIRE WITH NOWY SOCIAL TRAVEL HUB

+ Find your dream destinations with inspiring travel stories and authentic experiences
+ Discover top adventures and top destinations from the world's top attractions.
+ Discover local attractions and hidden gems with the help of the Nowy community.


4. UNCOVER HIDDEN TREASURES NEARBY

+ Find fun places around you
+ Get instant travel ideas from a map view
+ Use filters to get the best destination results, including types of places, price ranges, ratings.


5. AI-ENHANCED TRAVEL STORYTELLING

+ Save your time for extra research
+ Use the power of AI for storytelling 
+ Easily create and share your adventures


6. COLLECT POSTS AND LINKS FOR YOUR TRIP PLANS

+ Journal your trip stories and link them to your trip plan
+ Save your travel memories and keep track of your journey
+ Share your posts using the Nowy Postcard 


7. CONNECT WITH THE COMMUNITY AND SHARE THE WANDERLUST

+ Build your community with like-minded adventurers
+ Follow your friends and connect with fellow travelers
+ Exchange thoughts, ideas, and travel experiences
+ Save your posts, collections, and likes for future trips and visits!


So, what are you waiting for? DOWNLOAD NOWY: AI TRAVEL SOCIAL PLANNER now and Embark on your dream trip with Nowy's AI-powered planning!
releaseNotes:
Planning your perfect adventure just got easier with Nowy 4.0.1! Now you can easily add tours and experiences to your AI-powered itinerary, alongside flights, hotels, and attractions.

Here's what's new:
- Effortless Activity Planning: Search, view, and add exciting destination-related activities to your trip itinerary in just a few clicks.
- Cherish Your Travel Footprint: Introducing "My Travel Map"! Transform any of your travel photos into a personalized world map to show all of the destinations you've ever visited.
- Take a Trip Down Memory Lane: Nowy 4.0.1 transforms your travel photos into customized travel memories featuring your photos, bringing your trip itineraries to life - a beautiful way to relive your adventures.

Upgrade to Nowy 4.0.1 today and experience the ultimate all-in-one travel companion.
reviews:
Just tried out the upgraded 'photos to journeys' , never been easier to generate a trip. A must-have feature for any travel enthusiast! | 'My Travel Map' is a cool feature! I can view all my travel photos pinned on a world map. I just got new photos from Thailand, and it can sync immediately. The new update truly change how I look back my trips! | I really like Nowy and can't plan a trip without it now! Not only it give me great ideas and itineraries using the planning features, but also the way it organizes all the guides and trips together. I've tried the new features of auto-journaling and well done - so much time saved! I absolutely love it. I do hope the journal part can be more flexible so that I can correct some of the AI-identified places | The function to automatically generate an itinerary starting from the days of duration of the trip is quite nice | I have used more than dozens of travel apps, but this one hands down the best I’ve ever used. It does not only gives you a detailed plan for attractions in cities - which is just a start, you can find the closest hotels, add your flight; customize your routes and find any activities as well. You can switch it to Google map as well. I’m so impressed with this app and really is “The” travel cọmpanion. | Nowy has many useful features, including AI-powered travel itinerary generation, hotel booking, and flight booking. Although I don’t have any travel plan at the moment, I can create and share future plans with my family and friends. Additionally, it’s easy to edit! | OMG this is such a game changer! They used AI to help me journal my past trips too and never thought it can be such an easy and fun way to journal my trips. I have been using Nowy to plan my trips and now I can journal past trips as well. It makes me wanna travel more! | Finally found a travel app that I can search any cities and even small destinations in Brazil and Mexico. It’s amazing, easy to use, great idea and cute pages. The best thing I like is the AI can keep recọmmending different hidden gems besides what you already had in the existing itinerary. Simply amazing! | It is really great and does everything I need. It’s perfect for organizing trip details and plan everything together.  I personally love it and worths 5 stars | I loves traveling and exploring new places but always struggles with planning. I can’t believe how this app is so easy to get a planning for you. Definitely recọmmend this app to anyone who wants to simply your travel. | I am so happy to have found Nowy! I used to spend so much time with vacation planning, but Nowy does it all for me in just a few minutes. Plus, I can book flights, hotels, and activities all in this app! No need for 10 different apps or websites anymore. Highly recommend Nowy!!! | I was booking a last minute trip to Amsterdam and decided to try Nowy to help me plan. Let’s just say, I am so impressed! It helped us find a last minute hotel one stop from the main station for a really good price. It also gave us suggestions of where to eat, what museums to attend and planned out the days with efficient travel routes. Some of the highlights of my trip that Nowy’s AI assistant suggested were: the Heineken Experience, the body museum, and a nighttime canal cruise to Amsterdam during the winter light festival (which was our favorite). It also gave us some great suggestions of local places where the locals eat. I can’t wait for my next trip! | I used to use Google Drive and sheet to plan out my trips. I NO longer need to do so.
This is app has made our trip planning so easy especially while planning a 10 day road trip from Las Vegas to Arizona and Utah! The itinerary has all the website, photos and addresses everything. Surprisingly we can see our live location inside the our trip and know the distance to the next stop!

After we finished the trip and organized the final itinerary, I found the itinerary can be shared completely to our friends and see the full itinerary by the share link! This is amazing and I don’t need to send Doc any more. What a life saver!

So good and helpful! | I was trying to plan a 3-day trip to Tokyo, and the AI generated a decent itinerary based on my preference. I shared the itinerary with my friend, and it got us started on planning out the Tokyo trip!! Highly recommend it to anyone looking to save time when planning trips. I hope the app will automatically find me the best deals based on my finalized itinerary. | I’ve been searching for an app that’s user friendly and aesthetic to journal my trips and after using Nowy for a while I know this is it! The app is easy to navigate through and has many great options to customize your trips the way you want. On top of that, I can search what fun locations are near me to explore. As a lazy but eager traveler, this feature has pushed me to go outside more. There’re new features coming out continuously to create better user interfaces. I absolutely love it! | This is an awesome app, great idea, very useful for travel and provide a lots of information. Thanks for the designer.

title: Pogo - Travel Planner
description:
Pogo - Plan on the Go — Plan a trip and find the best things to do in one simple, fun and beautiful app.

– Save everything in one place

Say goodbye to travel stuff splattered across notes, emails, Instagram and WhatsApp. With Pogo, you can save everything for a trip on one Pinboard. From places and notes to documents and checklists. 

- Book a Stay with Booking.com

Find a place you like the look of in Pogo? Simply view in Booking.com to save the hassle of searching around. When you're done, jump right back into your Pinboard and continue planning your trip.

- View a personalised map with all your Pins

Tap on 'Map View' and see a personalised Map of all the pins you've got saved in your Pinboard. When you arrive at your destination it makes planning where to go and what to do so much easier.

– Discover tried and tested recommendations

Fed up of spending countless hours scouring the web, looking for the best things to do? With Pogo, it's easy to discover personalised and authentic recommendations from like-minded travellers.

– Share your travel tips and plan together

Make tedious trip planning group chats a thing of the past. With Pogo, you can easily invite others to a Pinboard to plan a trip together. So you can all add stuff, see what's on the agenda, and vote for your favourites.


— ABOUT POGO

Pogo was started with the mission to help fellow travel lovers make the most of every moment they get away. 

From our experience — and by talking to lots of people in the travel community — we realised that although travelling is great, sometimes stuff can get in the way of having a good time.

The unnecessary hassle of organising a trip. The pains of deciding where to go and what to do. Stuff going wrong whilst you're away. 

We exist to help you escape this bad stuff. So you're free to have a more mindful, authentic and memorable trip.

Our mobile app provides a home for all of your travel plans. So you can get inspiration, organise a trip and protect yourself all in one place.
releaseNotes:
We’ve got a BIG update for you, the Pogo Community, that really hope you love:

- Book Hotels - We’ve implemented the ability to book hotels directly in Pogo. No need to leave the app.
- Hotel Liking - Hotel research has never been easier. Like a hotel? Simply swipe it to the right in the list or double tap a hotel in Map View.
- Offline Mode - Upon opening Pogo for the first time on this version, a copy of your Pinboards will be kept on your phone so you don’t need Wifi/Data to access all your Pinboards when travelling.
- Bug fixes - As usual we’ve also done some other bug fixes that have been kindly fed back to us from our users. Thank you all for you feedback, it helps a lot.

Please feel free to get in touch with us at hello@pogo.travel with your thoughts or feedback. We love hearing from you and we’re working hard on implementing all the features you guys are eager to have in Pogo.

Until next time,

The Pogo Team

Has a lot of potential, but definitely needs work! Hope it improves quickly! | I love and miss the layout and design of pluto i was obsessed! But pogo is good as well! I love the detail and i love planning trips with this app! | The idea is there and I love the search and find option but the app is slow and anytime I click to view a category the app freezes or restarts. Which really makes it more hassle than what it’s worth. | THE REBRAND IS SO BAD, I’m devastated. Pluto was one of my favorite apps and I can’t stand using the new version. The old branding was unique, beautiful and had character, not to mention the usability and functionality was also amazing. Was this rebrand tested with literally any users?? It could not have gotten positive responses. | Sorry, but the new branding is horrendous. I LOVED the old Pluto, and had it proudly on my home screen. The new logo, name, everything is so awful I’m tempted to delete the app altogether. I know rebranding takes time, effort, and money, but this was not the way to go, in my honest opinion. It was very difficult to navigate. the flow didn’t make sense. I just was not impressed overall. | Tbh I never write reviews especially for an APP 💀BUT I’m planning a road trip soon and super exited so I wanted something to help keep me organized ✨it’s actually pretty good and cute and neat it’s like Pinterest in a way . I’m not a bot either :) thanks Pluto ! | The aesthetic of this app is incredible. 

One HUGE thing I wish it had is an actual
itinerary in date/time order. You can save everything in this app but it won’t show you a timeline like other travel apps do. 
Add that and a widget for your home screen, and I wouldn’t need any other app for travel. 

Unfortunately right now it doesn’t work 100% alone for me, I still use TripIt for the itinerary timeline feature. | I was looking for an app that would allow me to collaborate trip ideas with my friends. With very few reviews, I was uncertain, but decided to give Pluto a try and I’m so glad I did! 
So far the user experience is top notch. The app is running very smoothly, no lags or glitches. It’s very intuitive and user-friendly, and in minutes I was easily able to navigate myself around, start a trip and invite my friend to collaborate. 
A few suggestions:
When initially walking through the first steps, I would like to be able to pick a region to travel, not just a specific state or city. For instance, I wanted to be able to say Pacific Northwest, but that wasn’t an option. Also, I would like to be able to create my own categories within the trip. 

Solid five stars for usability and of course that it’s free. | i’ve been on the hunt for a travel/itinerary app that was easy on the eyes and incredibly user friendly! | I normally look at Pinterest or YouTube to look up things to do. I love that they already have popular things to try. | Awesome app for planning our holiday! there were lots of things I look for - but until now, I haven’t seen them all in one place. 
The app is very easy to use. You can also save ideas and places to eat. 
And also it served you up inspiration from the app’s recommendations. Top marks! | This app is off to a great start, they definitely have more to add, but I’m enjoying the flexibility and functionality they have now. It’s allowed me to share the plan with my friends and family going on a trip together. Also it allowed us to collaborate on the plan so that everyone has input on what we are doing on the trip so no one feels left out. | The app crashes as soon as you open it

title: Expedia: Hotels, Flights & Car
description:
The Expedia app is an all-in-one travel companion where you can plan, book and manage your whole trip, plus earn rewards, in one place. Members instantly get discounted Member Prices on flights, hotels, cruises, car rentals, and activities. With our new rewards program, One Key™, you can earn, combine and use OneKeyCash™ rewards across Expedia, Hotels.com, and Vrbo. Dreaming of a beach vacation in Florida? Or a romantic getaway in Paris? Get more out of any trip with the Expedia app. 

One Key members save instantly:   
- Instantly save 10%* or more on over 100,000 hotels worldwide with Member Prices.   
- Price Tracking: Get notified if the price of a flight drops. 
- Price Drop Protection: Get refunded if the price of your flight drops after booking.** 
- Earn OneKeyCash in the Expedia app and get rewarded fast. 

In-trip extras as your status rises, like free room upgrades when available. 

Discover your next trip: 
- Search millions of flights, hotels, rental cars, packages, attractions, and more.  
- Add a hotel to your flight to save even more.  
- Choose from over 500,000+ hotels worldwide, including boutique and luxury hotels, airport hotels, hostels, B&Bs, vacation rentals, and resorts.  
- Read verified reviews you can trust. 
- Sort your search by price, free cancellation or no change fees, departure and arrival time, and more.  

Easy, smart trip planning: 
- Chat GPT integration: Get your travel-related questions answered with expert insight and personalized recommendations with the launch of our AI-powered trip planner. 
- Shareable Trips: Collaborate, plan and share trip information with others, all in one place.  
 
 Manage your whole trip in one app:  
- Free cancellation on most hotels.*  
- All your reservations in one place: view upcoming trip details, hotel information, and maps for directions.  
- Trip alerts: for flight delays, gate changes, hotel check-out times, and more. 
- Share itineraries with family and friends via email or text message.  
- Get inspired by our curated travel guides.  
 
Download the Expedia app now and join for free to enjoy One Key member benefits.   
 
 *Member Prices are available on select hotels to logged in members and app users. The discount will be applied to the price of selected hotels (excluding applicable taxes and other fees). Price predictions are not a guarantee. Available to One Key members on select routes.  Expedia’s usual booking Terms and Conditions apply and Reward Terms apply, see site for details. Free cancellation on most hotels. Some hotels require you to cancel at least 24-48 hours before check-in. See property pages on our app for details.   

 
** Available for a fee on select flights and free for Gold and Platinum One Key Members. Refund will be the difference if the price of your flight on Expedia drops. Terms apply. See site for details.  

 
The Expedia app uses information for analytics, personalization, and advertising. By using our app, you agree to our privacy and cookies policies.
releaseNotes: Thanks for exploring the world with Expedia as your on-the-go travel companion. This update contains bug fixes and performance improvements to make your digital experience as smooth as possible. Bon voyage, traveler!
