title: Tour - Travel Planner
description:
Tour is the most fun, easy-to-use trip planner made for group travel. Made by a group of three travelers (and friends), Tour is the only intelligent trip planner with a drag and drop itinerary timeline. Find things to do, plan with friends in real-time, & keep track of all your travel information – all in one place. Download & start planning your dream trip today!

KEY FEATURES
- Simply drop the dragger into the timeline to start planning your dream trip
- Adjust times using sliders & rearrange your itinerary by dragging & dropping
- Invite as many friends as you want to collaborate together in real-time (just like Google Docs)
- Automatically calculated travel time between activities (car, biking, walking, etc.)
- Your plans are beautifully visualized on a map
- Add activities to Lists. Build out your bucket list or vote on where to go

EXPLORER'S CLUB FEATURES*:
- With Flight Autofill, just give us your flight number & we’ll handle the rest
- Discover nearby museums, landmarks, parks, colleges, nightlife, restaurants, & more supplied by Foursquare. Add them to your itinerary with just one tap.
- Know exactly how long it takes to get between places with precise travel calculations
- Access your itinerary anytime, anywhere with full offline support (including maps!)
- Create unlimited itineraries
- If you’re part of a trip, all your friends get these perks within that trip for free!

*Explorer’s Club is our subscription-based premium set of features. Try it for free for 1 week.

–

DRAG, DROP, & GO
As travelers, we were annoyed with using spreadsheets, notes, & calendar apps. So, we created an all-in-one drag and drop interface to fit all your travel planning needs! Simply drop the dragger into the timeline to get started

FRIENDS TRAVEL TOGETHER
Like to travel with friends? We've got your back. Tour makes it easy to collaborate in real-time with as many friends as you want.

PUTTING IT ON THE MAP
Tour automatically visualizes all your stops on a map. Perfect for road trips, you can easily tap through the pins & see how long it takes to travel between places. With Explorer’s Club, you can find things to do overlayed on top of your existing plans

WHAT’S ON YOUR BUCKET LIST?
Add all your activities to Lists to keep track of places you want to go before adding them to your plans. Build out your bucket list and simply press Add to Trip when you're ready to go. For group travel, you can use Lists as a poll

ORGANIZE YOUR TRANSPORTATION
Easily keep track of flights, drives, bus rides, trains, & any other form of transportation. Tap the travel card to get public transit & other directions in Apple Maps, Google Maps, or Transit

WHEREVER YOU’RE STAYING
Already booked your hotel, hostel, or Airbnb? Just add your information on the Stays tab & easily add it to your itinerary

THE FUTURE IS SOCIAL
Share trips, destinations, and activities with friends, family, and followers. Like each others' trips and activities in lists

PLEASE NOTE
Tour is a work in progress. We’re a small team that is constantly releasing updates to improve your experience and add new & exciting functionality. If you encounter a bug, please email us and we will try our best to fix it ASAP. Thank you for your patience and support.

TERMS OF SERVICE
https://tourapp.co/tos

While Tour is free to use, we offer a premium subscription-based set of features called Explorer’s Club. Payment will be charged to your App Store account. The remainder of your free trial will be forfeited if you purchase your subscription prior to the free trial expiration date. You can manage your subscription in the account settings. Subscriptions renew automatically unless canceled.

PRIVACY POLICY
https://tourapp.co/privacy

STAY IN TOUCH
Join our travel community on Discord: tourapp.co/discord
Follow us on social media for travel inspiration: @officialtourapp
Join our subreddit for technical app updates: /r/officialtourapp/
Please visit our website so we get ranked higher: tourapp.co
releaseNotes:
Tour 6.13.4 brings critical bug fixes to your favorite features in our most powerful and stable release yet.

• Adjusted padding to optimize for iPhone 14 Pro models
reviews:
I’ve been using this app to plan my bachelorette party and I love this app but I can’t share my itinerary with half my girls because it’s not compatible with android, Samsung, or google phones. Not everyone has Apple so it’s best to make your app cross compatible for all devices. | So far I am liking this app very much. I am using it to plan a trip to London and with the exception of o e bug I am finding it useful. 

When adding an activity to a daily itinerary the transportation menu only gives you walk,car,bike as options and excludes public transportation. Once you have added the activity you have to select the travel time in the itinerary and switch it to public transportation. 

It would be nice if the app tied into Google maps and calculated transportation time rather than relying on the person to figure it out. | Great for people who enjoy outstanding graphic visuals as opposed to bland black and white itineraries thrown together on Google docs. | I’ve used this for my last 5 trips. I’m never going back to TripIt! | I am absolutely blown away at how beautiful this app is. I am building apps with the same technology that the developers of this app uses, and I admire them for being able to pull this off so well. | I’ll start with what I love:
- Beautiful UI with nice details throughout
- Does a great job of using location photography and the UI to make the places your going exciting (compared to a lot of overly utilitarian apps out there like TripIt)
- The map with lines to where all you’re going and the sequence is awesome and something I’ve really wanted on past trips before finding this app
- Easy to discover places to go in the city you’re going

What still needs some work:
- When searching for places to add, the font size is too large and cuts off the right end of names so it can be hard to tell which is which (like with hotel names that can be different locations for the same chain)
- Before getting to exact times for each place you want to go there needs to be a staging step where you can add locations w/o time to decide on which you want to go to, then add a time or to the timeline after sharing or knowing for sure you want to go. 
- The drag and drop is frustrating currently because as you add more places to the timeline it ends up making existing ones shorter instead of pushing them to the next hour. Having to go back and make something that became 10-15 minutes (which very few events make sense to be that short) and resizing them doubles to triples the time it takes to add all the events.

What would make it a 6 star app:
- Having hotels in it is fantastic...but why not the flights? If you’re going to multiple destinations it leaves an odd whole in your timeline to not have the flights and be able to plan for how early you need to checkout of the hotel or how much time you have for other stuff.
- iPhone is great for while you’re traveling, but an iPad version would help a ton for planning the trip and seeing the details of locations and events with more room. | Tried this app during the beta and liked it, but I did not get to try it much. Now I can’t get it to work because all it does is crash.

Edit: Still crashes on startup. I did not say it crashes when opening old trips because I can’t even open the app.
Edit2: I don’t know if it’s a bot answering my reviews, but again: opening old trips is not the issue. The issue is that I can’t open the app because all it does is crash. I wish I could enjoy the potential of this app, but it is impossible when it won’t open.
Edit3: App is now working! | Looking forward to seeing this continue evolving. | Adding more than 2 cities to a trip didn’t work. Sometimes a third popped up, but when adding a fourth both the third and fourth just disappeared. | UI seems nice but functionally there are some issues as others have mentioned. Right now I can’t even remove a trip, it just freezes up during the loading state. Really want something like this to work but at the least, devs should have some sort of tests in place that catch these kinds of major bugs.

Edit: originally gave 3 stars but I literally can’t even open my trips now without an error. It’s not functional at all. | Tried to plan a bachelor party with this app but with out the ability to share with the boys defeats the point of creating an itinerary | I really wanted to love this app, but it isn’t very intuitive and is hard to use. I am trying to plan a trip to Japan with multiple destinations, and when I try to adjust the dates of one the rest of them get messed up! I also somehow got the destinations out of order and can’t figure out how to put them back. I also experienced loading screens that went on forever, it was the screen when I picked Japan as my destinations and it displayed an error message. I’m hoping these problems get fixed, because I really like the app otherwise. | This app is the worst thing I’ve ever experienced. It was incredibly glitchy, very inaccurate information, and in general just hard to use. 
I don’t know who the makers of this app are, but you need to go back to the drawing board. I’d honestly rather use Google Maps as a tourist planning app than this, and we all know how Google Maps is not even good. 
Also, the logo is a complete ripoff of the Tesla logo. Really shows lack of creativity. Just from seeing the logo I knew there wasn’t much hope. 
Have a nice day. | Well the developers are my friends + this app kind of blew my mind. So I'll give it a five star. Probably add an instruction video at the very beginning? Actually took me a while to find the drag feature. Very impressive overall.

title: Roadie: Road Trip Planner & RV
description:
Plan epic road trips with Roadie. It's a clean and simple route planner for roadtrippers and campers like you - no matter if you map out your annual cross-country road trip or you live the #vanlife dream and explore the world in your campervan. Nothing beats the freedom of the open road.

PLAN MULTI-STOP ROUTES

Plan your trip itinerary on an interactive map and pin as many locations on the map as you need. Search locations of attractions, trails, or national parks and save points of interest in a list. You can now add your personal notes to every stop.

SEE DISTANCES & DRIVING TIMES

See distances connecting the road trip waypoints and know the driving times between multiple stops. Easily plan your time on the road and your gas and fuel consumption.

SHARE YOUR TRIP (like Google My Maps)

Share your trip and collaborate with friends on finding the most interesting sights and the best places to stay the night.

FIND PLACES ALONG THE ROUTE (like Roadtrippers)

Use search shortcuts to quickly find good restaurants, interesting sights or good value campsites. Type "pizza" or "burger" in the search to display these places on the map. Or just click on any place or POI in the map and add it to your list of stops or starred places.

MARK FAVORITE PLACES

Star places to visit and save them for later on the interactive map. You can add a note to be reminded of why you want to visit this place. Once you are on the highway or you map out your next road trip it is easy for you to see if one of your saved places is nearby and you can add it to your route.

USE OFFLINE & NAVIGATE

Change the order of places to visit with an easy-to-use drag-and-drop. Use the app offline while you drive on the highway and never miss out on attractions and sights along your route. Start the navigation with one click in your preferred navigation app and get driving directions in Apple Maps, Google Maps or Waze.

EXPORT & IMPORT YOUR ROUTES

You can make a backup of all of your routes by exporting them in GPX format. You can import them into Google My Maps or share them with friends.

MORE FEATURES COMING SOON

We're constantly updating and improving the app and its functionality. If you think something is missing or if you have any other feedback please share your idea with us. Just write an email to support@getroadie.app

———

You can use the Roadie Road Trip Planner app free of charge forever. There are some restrictions in the free version, though. For example, you can only add up to 30 stops to your routes.

All restrictions can be removed by purchasing the “Premium Membership”. You can buy the lifetime membership ($35.99) and pay only once or buy a monthly/yearly membership subscription. Prices may vary by location. Subscriptions will be charged to your credit card through your App Store account. Subscriptions are offered for either 1-month ($2.49) or 1-year ($17.99) periods. They will automatically renew unless canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. You can turn off auto-renew at any time from your App Store account settings. Free trials may only be used once. Any unused portion of a free trial will be forfeited if you purchase a subscription.

———

Terms of Service: https://getroadie.app/terms

Privacy Policy: https://getroadie.app/privacy_policy
releaseNotes: We've improved the search for places on the map and added more search categories.
reviews:
Just wanted to say what a great app this is!  So pleased to have everything at our fingertips vs having to use 4 different apps for things like gas stations, rest stops and offbeat attractions.  

Well done | I’ve used Roadie twice to take a long road trip, and loved it both times. it’s extremely easy to use simply plug in your destinations and add them to your route. it offers a way to kind of schedule/rearrange your itinerary, which is extremely helpful. You can use the itinerary to plan out how long each day will be or what you plan on doing each day of your trip. I did what seem to be bugs in certain areas. For example I was planning a trip that was going on the “Going to The Sun” road and for some reason it kept calculating the route going around the whole park to the other side. | I can’t fully commit to paying for premium if I can’t see what I am paying for.  I need an app I can commit to for my trips. There’s not enough with the free version to make an informed decision.  So I will go with the competitor RoadTripper. With that I can see what I am paying for. Too bad. I was open to trying something different from the usual. 

Unfortunately they lost me as a customer from the beginning.  Maybe in the future they’ll change this and I can consider them for my next series of trips. 

Roadie if your reading this, please consider. | Free version is worthless. Maybe it’s better if you pay. | I would use this app over Google maps but they make you pay just to invite your friends to your map which is kinda stupid considering that majority of the times you are going to want to share with friends | Love the idea, but tons of little issues that make it super annoying to try and use. Definitely not subscribing for another month but I appreciate their efforts. Maybe in another few iterations it'll get to a product that feels pleasant to use. | What is the point of this app VS just going straight to Apple Maps?  This still just takes you to Apple Maps and in fact makes it a lot less seem-less. Bugged I wasted my money because I forgot to cancel before trail was up and was charged for a full year. Not sure where they got all their good reviews. | The app was everything I wanted while planning my road trip from Kentucky to Utah and California!  Super easy to use and works great, and I like that I was able to name stops and split it up into sections so it made it easy to keep track of what day I was planning each stop! | I’ve spent 15 minutes playing and find it way to lacking on everything. I cannot even find the way to read the step by step instructions for a route.

Very minimal web site also. Not discussion that I see about the Premium at all.

Not enough reviews to be rated after 3 years.

I feel they need a macOS app as I prefer using a real keyboard and a larger screen display to plan my trips. Yes, the iPad app will run on an M1 Mac albiet in a tiny screen window.

I'll stick with the great Road Trip Planner - far more features. | After easily installing, I had issues with the app. Mainly text and print not lining-up correctly. Deleted and will stick with Waze. | Used the app for road-tripping all over the West. Convenient and effective. The developers are accessible and ultra responsive. Totally worth the upgrade! | I thought I would be able to put in multiple stops and build a itinerary but, I don’t think it allows and the app is not user friendly. | ဆက်မသုံးတော့ဘူး | This is the app I would have made - super fast, clean, simple, but still has everything you need to plan a trip. Extremely well done, I bought the lifetime immediately (thank you for having that as an option and not forcing me into a subscription plan). | Just getting started. So far, simple & easy to read. | Not paying for an app that you can't try first. | I was hoping to import a trip into this app hoping to use some of its features, but all I get is an error. Tried several different trip files and restarting ect, but nothing has worked. Wish I could get the $30 bucks back. | Very disappointed the the paid version of this app. I was hoping to use the app to plan ahead and see stops to add along the way. We are going from texas to Florida, I mapped the route, clicked hotels and it showed a group of hotels in north Arkansas (a state we are not even entering). The companies soliton is too zoom in, piece by piece rather being able to conclusively plan the trip, we have too basically look 4-5 times but by bit. There is not way better than any free app such as Google Maps to plan a route. In fact google maps actually shows things “along the route”. | Easy to use and share plans.
Wish I could plan day of driving or have app auto plan days. Seeing upcoming weather and better ‘attractions’ highlights would make it a killer app. | Hard to navigate, adds stops out of order and you can’t change them. It’s impossible to sort out. Canceling | Can’t find and add stops, can’t get alternative routes for entire trip. | Love this app.. work better than road warriors | We downloaded the app to find scenic routes, and interesting things along the way. Attractions, Gas Stations, Campsites, Hotels, Parks, etc. are all behind the paywall. Without purchasing the premium subscription, it’s a less useful map app. | This app is paid app when most are free | I love the interface. Very easy to use and can search for just about anything I type into the map search. The smart insert feature is also great when adding a new point to your route in the middle. It gives you estimated miles and times between your points so you know how long/far you will be traveling any leg. Your can save trip routes for planning more than one trip at a time (2 in free version, infinite in purchased version). 
As I pull a travel trailer (RV) for my trips, there are a few things I would like to see added and be able to test in the free version before I purchase the upgrade.
1- allow specs of my travel trailer (length, height, weight, propane on board) to be entered so the app can map around any low clearance bridges, weight limited roads, propane limited tunnels, hairpin turns, etc. to be sure the road mapped is safe for travel with my RV.
2- ability to identify specified miles and/or time travel down a route so that a campground/stay search can be done in that area. Currently, I take a guess by sight, add a random stay point to the route and see how long/far it takes to get there. If wrong, remove point, guess further up or back and repeat until my miles/time is close to what I want to travel in a leg. It’s functional but could be made much easier if the app can just pin a point in the route at how far/long you want to travel as an option.

With these 2 functionality adds, this app would be worth purchasing for me. | I hate that so many apps these days say they’re free but once you start trying to maneuver around the app, you find out you can’t do much of anything without paying some monthly or annual fee. | After paying for the app, as the free version would not allow me to complete my trip, I found it kept rerouting me to roads I did not want to travel on. Would not allow me to select the road I wanted. It is like a section of the road did not exist even though it shows the road on the map. I attempted to use the Contact Us (send an email) and it does not work. Fortunately they only got one months worth of payment out of me. The trip I am planning is on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Once you purchase the app they provide a sample trip of the Blue Ridge Parkway and it is jacked up too.

Update:  after contacting the developer they did a great job of explaining the issue and provide a resolution. Response from developer was fast and professional. I will continue to use the app for my upcoming trips. | When I opened the app, it grabbed a location near me from GPS and made it my home location. When I attempted to change it to my actual address, I was prompted to upgrade to the full version to be able to do so. Really? How are you supposed to plan a trip without setting a starting point?

Failure to be able to change even the most basic information without paying for the full version renders the app unusable to me. I can understand that adding locations, or notes, would require an update to the full version, but preventing a user from setting up a basic profile is pretty unforgivable. Deleting this app immediately! | This is not a very good user friendly app and I wish I had never purchased it!!!! Sad :-( | So easy to use. Can’t wait to plan more trips | Was trying to plan a road trip from Illinois - Oregon - California - Oregon - Illinois and this app was just perfect for giving us the ability to plan out stops for fuel, find great rest stops along the way and even some crazy attractions.
I would recommend this app to anyone who is wanting to plan any kind of road trip. On my trip back to Illinois, I was able to follow Rte 66 and see all of the attractions that I have been wanting to go see. 
The only thing that I had to watch out for was when finding the next stop on my route was that the ‘Smart Add’ feature sometimes inserted the stop in the wrong place so it had me going backwards at a couple of points. But other than that, this is a great app. Thanks for making it happen. | Downloaded the free version, worthless, doesn’t make me want to pay for upgrade, put locations in bizarre order, making the trip twice as long as needed, says you can tap and drag to change order of places? How? Guess you have to pay?
Useless! | This app would be a 10/10 if it had landscape mode!!!

Update: landscape mode added! It’s awesome now. | Love the concept. It started basic but getting better and it appears the developers listened to feedback and have since updated the app to make it even better. | The app says it works on iPad and iPhone.  I downloaded it on my iPad.  It wouldn’t orient itself with the iPad.  It only works when the iPad is held vertically.  My case prevents that.  I then tried it on my iPhone X.  I was able to creat an account.with no trouble.  However, when I tried to actually use the app, it would send me to location services in settings.  This continued even after I enabled everything for the app.  I’ve defeated the app and will look for one that I can actually plan trips on. | Handles multiple stops very elegantly, love that collaboration is now possible. Overall very intuitive to use. Would love to see a smart order feature that orders all stops in a route and/or section, and would also be a nice to have to calculate the price of fuel for the trip. 

Once you’re on the road I could also see a good feature being what is easily accessible for the next 5 or so exits. Often we’re looking for a bathroom or something to eat and by the time we figure out whether it’s on our side of the freeway we’ve passed the exit 😂

Glad to have this app, and have had a lovely experience with any communication with the development team. | This is a great simple app for planning a road trip. Love the design and simplicity, and the developer is very responsive to feedback. | It’s an app that just draws a line from one place to another, and you can add stops along the way. Not much else. If it does any of the other things- I can’t find out how because there’s like 6 buttons and the ui is bad. | This is a great app. Would like just a couple more options but a really great app. Thank you!!

title: Hopper: Flights, Hotels & Cars
description:
The Hopper app has helped over 100 million travelers find and secure the best price on flights, hotels, homes and car rentals - each and every time they book their trips.

Book Flights, Hotels, Homes & Rental Cars 
Find millions of flights, hotels, homes, rental cars (and cute bunnies) – all in one app. Book your trip safely and securely, in just a couple taps and a swipe. 

Always Get the Best Price 
You can watch a trip right in the app and we’ll send you a notification when it’s the best time to buy — recommending you to book now, or maybe wait just a little longer.

Easily Find The Cheapest Travel Dates 
Simply search your preferred destination and use Hopper’s color-coded deals calendar to easily find the cheapest travel dates for your trip.

Not Ready to Book Right Away?
Hopper lets you freeze the price, so that you never miss a travel deal. For a small fee, take the time you need to finalize your plans, or wait for your next paycheck to come in. If the price goes up, you only pay the price you froze it at. But if the price goes down, you just pay the lower price. 

Travel with Confidence
Avoid fees and frustration! Make any trip flexible with Hopper’s Cancel and Change for Any Reason plans. Get instantly rebooked without extra costs if your flight is delayed or you miss a connection with Hopper’s Flight Disruption Guarantee. Travel stress free with 24/7 access to Hopper’s Customer Support. 

Help the Planet, One Booking at a Time. 
With every booking that occurs on Hopper, we pledge to plant 2 trees to offset the carbon footprint. To date, we’ve planted over 31 million trees. 

Hopper has no ads, no spam, and no stress — just accurate predictions and travel deals.

So what are you waiting for? Start saving money with the bunny today. Download Hopper for free now, and let’s start planning your next trip!

Hopper Love
• “The 10 Best Free Apps for Air Travel Junkies” - TIME
• “The Most Downloaded OTA in the U.S. in 2021” - Apptopia 
• “The app helps travelers find the cheapest flights, hotels and rental cars.” - The Points Guy
• “Compared to exact searches on Expedia, Kayak and Orbitz, we regularly found that the deal quoted on Hopper was the best” - Travel and Leisure
• “Hopper can be a better option than direct booking for those who need more flexibility.” - The Wall Street Journal
• “Find me a hotel on Hopper!” - The Late Late Show with James Corden
• “Travel Unicorn Hopper First Came for Expedia. Airbnb Is Next” - TechCrunch
• “Hopper is committed to offsetting the carbon emissions of every flight and hotel stay it sells.” - Forbes, The Top 100 Most Customer-Centric Companies of 2022

Say Hello to the Bunnies
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hoppertravel
Instagram: @hopper
Twitter: @hopper
Website: http://www.hopper.com

Need support? Head over to https://help.hopper.com to find answers to frequently asked questions. You can also reach us toll-free at +1-833-933-4671 if calling from US or Canada, or at +1 (347)-695-4555 if calling from outside the US or Canada.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and UI improvements.

This review is totally honest, I’m recommend hopper! | Always there when I need a quick flight ✈️✈️✈️ | To use | I have an account and cannot log into the website I have called numerous times to technical support. title: Booking.com: Hotels & Travel
description:
Save on your next trip with the Booking.com app! Find great hotel or apartment deals and book in just a few minutes. You can also book flights, rental cars, and more through the app.

- Book your whole trip in one app (accommodations, flights, car rentals, taxis and attractions)
- Stay flexible with free cancellation (available at most properties)
- 24/7 customer service in more than 40 languages
- No booking or credit card fees
- Chat directly with your property in the app
- Enjoy mobile-only discounts by booking in the app
- Use filters to easily find the perfect place out of millions of available accommodations 
- Get paperless confirmation of your reservation 
- Manage your bookings on the go, making changes whenever and wherever you want
- Discover local attractions and make the most of your trip
- Share your experience and get local advice on our Travel Communities forums

Access millions of accommodations
From cozy country homes to funky city apartments, find the perfect place out of millions of available accommodations. Our app offers hotels, apartments, bed and breakfasts and more.

Quickly find the perfect place to stay
Filter hotels by price, review score, WiFi quality, and other things important to you. Search cheap hotels by city, attraction, landmark, or hotel name. Special requests? Pet-friendly hotels? We have filters for everything. You can also compare your favorite accommodation options side by side to ensure you get the best price and quality.

Deals for any budget
Discover daily accommodation deals and save on your next hotel, apartment, or villa booking.
Get exclusive mobile-only discounts of 10% or more on select properties when you book in the app. Find your ideal accommodation at an ideal price.

Stay flexible with free cancellation
Change of plans? Not a problem. You can cancel for free at most hotels, apartments and other properties on Booking.com. And the app makes things even easier — it only takes a few taps to cancel, and you’re free to find a place that better suits your needs.

Last-minute travel
Heading somewhere in a hurry? With the app, you can quickly book hotels at the last minute (as well as far in advance). Finding a place in short order has never been easier. Our app allows you to search for properties nearby, fill in a few details, and secure your reservation. You can also change, cancel, or make additional reservations on the go.

Jet off with the perfect flight
Book domestic or international flights on the go with ease. The app allows you to search thousands of airfare deals per day. Plane tickets available for all major airlines and destinations.

Hit the road with car rentals
Car hire has recently been added to the app. Whether you just need a ride to explore your destination, or you’re going on an epic road trip, the Booking.com app can help. Rent a car from all the major companies and hit the road!

Reserve taxis with ease
Book in advance for a seamless connection from the airport to your destination. You can also book taxis to and from other pick-up points, such as hotels and local attractions.

Find and book a great experience
Whether you’re looking for attraction or museum tickets, boat tours and walking tours, you can book experiences online in minutes, with free cancellation on many options. 

Get and share tips with other travelers
Connect with fellow travelers, share your experiences, and get local advice on the best accommodations, attractions, and more. Discover new experiences and plan your trip with our app.
releaseNotes: Thanks for using Booking.com! This update contains several bug fixes and performance improvements. Enjoy the latest and greatest version of our app.

I found that most hotel stays are now “non-refundable” and I wasn’t offered the insurance option.  I think my booking.com days are coming to an end.  I also found my reservation was cheaper on another app after I had already booked the trip.  Some of my prior stays were terrible and the app doesn’t make up for any unpleasant stays. He gave us clear directions, met us on the street when we arrived and even provided us with umbrellas. He was not only a friendly host, but also provided a beautiful property! The view is unmatched and the studio was large. The balcony had comfy furniture and the shower was large! This was by far the best experience I’ve had with a property from booking.com from my month long trip to Europe. Thank you again, Nikola! God bless to you and your family. | Excellent sea view and location, beach entrance just cross the street, staff is care and polite, the price is reasonable, will stay here next time visiting QUY NHƠN | If you’re looking to put your short-term rentals on Booking.com, please save yourself the headache and do not do it. Booking.com customer service is the worst I’ve ever dealt with. Had guests destroy my home and they did nothing to help after telling me for months the “finance department will reach out to me to resolve this issue” months later and countless calls/messages still have not heard a thing.

title: Stippl - Travel Planner
description:
One travel app to replace them all!

Welcome to Stippl, your revolutionary travel companion! Say goodbye to the hassle of using multiple apps for planning trips. Stippl is the first-of-its-kind, all-in-one travel planner designed to streamline every aspect of your journey – from planning and budgeting to packing, tracking, and cherishing your travel memories.

 PLAN - Your Journey, Simplified
* 		Drag 'n Drop Planner: Effortlessly organize your route. Switch destinations, adjust nights, and craft your perfect itinerary.
* 		Transportation: Whether it's by plane, train, or by car, manage your transport in one place.
* 		Destination management: Add stays, must-do activities and your personal notes to any destination. 
* 		Collaborative Planning: Plan with friends in one shared environment
* 		Booking overview: See what’s booked and what’s next on your booking list.

 BUDGET - Smart Financial Control
* 		Expense Estimator: Add your upfront costs and get a clear forecast of your travel budget.
* 		On-the-Go Expense Tracking: Record expenses and monitor paid and pending amounts.
* 		Group Expenses: Split and settle bills within your travel group.

 PACK - Hassle-Free Preparation
* 		Pre-Defined Packing Lists: Start with our carefully curated packing lists.
* 		Shared Packing Lists: Collaborate & assign travel members on items that need to be packed once.
* 		High-five when you're all packed and ready to go!

 TRAVEL PROFILE - Your Travel Hub
* 		Favourite Places: Save and share your favourite spots.
* 		Connect: Follow friends and family, share recommendations, and track each other’s journeys.
* 		Travel Memories: Keep all your travel experiences in one place.

 JOURNAL & REELS - Your Stories, Beautifully Told
* 		Photo and Story Journal: Document your journey as it unfolds.
* 		Auto-Generated Travel Reels: Turn your photos into stunning reels, ready to share with the world.

 DISCOVER - Unlimited Inspiration
* 		Explore Itineraries: Browse through itineraries created by the community and amazing travel influencers.
* 		Copy-Paste Adventure: See a journey you love? Grab it, tweak it, and make it yours!

Embark on a Seamless Journey with Stippl!
Prepare to turn every trip into an unforgettable story with Stippl. 

______

Stippl PRO

Subscriptions will automatically renew unless canceled within 24-hours before the end of the current period. You can cancel anytime with your iTunes account settings. Any unused portion of a free trial will be forfeited if you purchase a subscription. For more information, see our terms & conditions.
releaseNotes: Some fixes for the eSIM flow in this update.
reviews:
Saw this app on a social media page. I really wanted to like it but the app is poorly designed. Once you enter a trip and locations, there is no edit option. You have to delete the trip and start over. I searched for a help section for instructions but the only choice is to ask on FB, Insta, or email. When I finally gave up and tried to delete my account, the app would freeze once I selected delete, thus not letting me delete. Negative stars in my opinion. | This app is fantastic. Saw someone using it on social media and wanted to give it a try. It is perfect to give yourself a rough draft of your trip or a complete day to day guide. I prefer to figure things out as I go, but there are many features that make it easier. Whether you are going on a family trip or backpacking across Asia, this app will be perfect for you. | Parts of this app I love, but it’s extremely limiting. For example, you can’t alter the dates between one destination to the next. Let’s say you’re taking a cruise and it takes 2 sea days to get from Singapore to Phuket, you can’t account for those 2 days in the planner, it only gives you a 24 hour option which is crazy. The next thing I don’t like is the app doesn’t sync from my phone to my iPad. This is extremely annoying. Whatever changes I make using my iPhone I’ll have to separately go into the iPad app and make those same changes. The third thing I don’t like about this app to the point I may just stop using it all together is every time I do ANYTHING in the app, such as pick a place to eat, the app will freeze for AT LEAST 2 minutes. I wish this app was way more customizable in terms of dates, in between places, etc like TripIt. What I love about it is how it will create a little video of your trip and you can visually see your route, I also love the suggestions like hotels, things to do, and places to eat…love those features. I’d be more than happy to pay for this if they make it better all the way around. | App does not render. Please help | I got the app, signed in with google and it’s stick on the Take Off screen after going thru the steps. When I close it, it wants me to sign in again. Was hoping this would be a great app for travel planning but these glitches make it a no go if I can’t even get into it! | Garbage! Good luck trying to even sign up! Complete joke 😜 | i’m writing this review before i finish planning my trip because i just love this app so far. it still seems like a work in progress but for the most part it’s fully functional! i wish there was a way to add what time you’re landing in the place at the beginning of the trip. if we were also able to see the time zones and the difference between then, that would be perfect. like the US has like 4 time zones and that’s confusing if you don’t know that and are planning a trip [wrote something here but erased it, they have a feature i didn’t figure out till now] overall it’s a cool app! if i could afford to travel more i’d use this app as my main planner instead of the google doc that i use. also note to developers: it would be cool if down the line there was a feature to export the trip as a pdf or whatever pdf file apple uses (pages? i don’t like it tbh). that would be awesome!

only complaint is about adding hotels. sometimes i press the plus, add a link, and it doesn’t show up. i think it saves to my wishlist… | I am trying to plan a trip for October 7th-24th of 2024. If I put those dates in, it wants my first night somewhere to be the 6th and won’t let me change it. We will be on a plane the night of the 7th so our first night under destinations I want to be the 8th. In order to do this I had to make our trip start the 9th. Our last night somewhere will be the 23rd but it told me I had 16/15 nights planned so I had to make the end date the 25th to get the planning itinerary right. This is messed up. My trip for the 7-24 looks like it’s for the 9-25th now for the countdown but right for the Nights planned section. Please correct this and allow us to adjust the nights planned dates for those flying overnight. If this is corrected I would give more stars but this is a really major flaw and doesn’t allow for any flight planning. | Love this app! Finally a user friendly way of planning my trip with friends! Thanks! | I’ve reinstalled several times and the app opens to a blank, white screen. | With this latest update, the app still does not load on my phone. It shows a white screen. | I’ve downloaded this app 3x and it won’t load past the opening white screen each time. I was very excited to try it. | The app looks cool but I’m giving up… you should have used Google maps to find the cities. So many of them can’t be selected even though they appear when exploring the map… why can’t we just add places as easily as finding them on Google maps? Same with finding hotels, very cumbersome… | The app is pretty cool. It allows you see the distance between your locations, add hotel info, track your spending and etc. which is nice and for planning a long trip it will help keep you organized. However, I’ve adjusted the dates of my trip and the new dates will not save. I have even deleted the trip and traded it and it will not save. | Wanted to input a 3-week trip itinerary through multiple countries and I was unable to create a trip directly. Instead, I had to select 1 of the five countries, then manually choose cities in the other countries via the search bar. One issue with this search bar, at the time I was using it, was that neither the capital of Kosovo (Pristina) nor the capital of Albania (Tirana) were options.

I’d have to say though, amidst its imperfections, it is actually a very helpful tool in visualizing how far apart ALL of the cities in your itinerary are, enabling you to make a more manageable trip that more accurately depicts travel times.

title: OOO - Trusted Travel Tips
description:
Out Of Office (OOO) is a recommendation app that allows you to see travel ideas and inspiration from people you know and trust.

PERSONALIZED RECOMMENDATIONS: Answer a short quiz and help us give you personalized travel recommendations. 

CONNECT WITH FRIENDS: Find friends in the app and invite your contacts to join your inner circle.

ADD YOUR RECOMMENDATIONS: Add any recommendation from your travels to our platform so your followers can see where you went and what you liked

SAVE FUTURE TRAVEL INSPO: Wishlist any places and recommendations that you want to remember to inspire future travel.
releaseNotes: Performance improvements and bug fixes.
reviews:
This has been such an incredible app to find the best new and delicious restaurants in cities. We go to NYC often and love trying new hot spots and OOO always has the best options. 5 stars!! | I’m struggling to find places in the app. Things like local restaurants and even museums are “not found”. | Cool app and an upgrade from Yelp, specifically geared to travelers. Ability to find community through recommendations and get a real time look in at what people are doing across the world. | Explain for the life of me why Philadelphia is not listed. I see South Philadelphia and Philadelphia county and someplace called new Philadelphia. I don’t see Center City Philadelphia or just simply Philadelphia in general I don’t understand. | This app has a great concept for planning trips, however is very slow when searching destinations to add. | Very glitchy - takes a long time to load. Shows all results of things to do, after you put in the location, to places in completely different countries!! | The map feature only shows you the most recent 10 recommendations. To see them all I have to scroll and load each recommendation which takes FOREVER. And when I click into any recommendation, I lose my place and have to start over. So it’s virtually impossible for me to actually see all my recommendations laid out. So disappointing, I’ll have to just use google maps | Before you begin there is a short questionnaire which asks who you are traveling with. I put family and children, yet when I inserted my travel destination and had an itinerary generated, it recommended things that were not kid friendly.

Additionally, the questionnaire asks what your budget looks like. Although I chose the lowest bracket, it recommended five star restaurants that were completely unaffordable for me. 

There were a couple hidden gems in the recommendations, but overall it isn’t worth the space it would take up on my phone unless some more moms joined the community to beef up the kid and budget friendly recommendations. | Looking for a great planning tool that allows you to share with others in your group. This is the one, nice layout and many recommendations for your area of stay. | I could not for the life of me figure out how to see any reviews for places in a city. Whoever designed the ui for this app should be fired. | I want to live this app but it’s certainly glitching on me. I’m clicking on what I know is a restaurant I have saved in San Fran and it’s saying it’s a beach. | Great to find people who like what you like, so you can get a better idea of what you may like in new places.

I’ve added a bunch, and the location are off. For example, upstate NY is occasionally included in NYC and 2 of my Japanese restaurants in NYC are being listed as a cathedral location. | I love the concept of the app, but some features don’t work or don’t have a real purpose. It’s really hard to just search an area without looking at someone else’s list. When you search something and add it to a list, the UI just throws you back to a random place and you have to start your search over again. Needs some work on user experience, but I’ll keep using and hope bugs get fixed! | People use Apple Maps for the same use as an app like this. This is just a places finder. So no point and not recommended. | So excited to use this app! Look me up and share your travel tips! @bohemianspirit | I love this app—so helpful for planning trips! If I have one suggestions, it’s that I wish you could add comments/reminders to yourself when you add a place to a trip (e.g., what dish everyone loves at a restaurant). I think you can’t add notes like that when you’re planning, only once you’ve marked it as a recommendation. | I use OOO both for finding new restaurants and as a quasi-travel diary so when I go back to a city I can remember my own favorites! 

With fake reviews / AI seeming to be on the rise on other sites, it’s fantastic that OOO allows you to filter by reviews of people you know. | I love this app, but I think it’s going to take some updates and improvement before this app becomes trendy. Users should be able to categorize places manually because some of them are incorrect—e.g., it lists one of my hotels as something to “do” instead of as a place to stay—and there is no way to change it. I also saved a recommendation in Utah and it is showing up as a location in Michigan. But I would love to see this app grow and for more people to start using it, it has such awesome potential!! | You’re only able to make itineraries with limited items. I work really hard to find hidden gems so it doesn’t really make sense that I can make an itinerary using only the most popular spots | The best way to make the perfect itinerary for all your stops & trips 😍 | Love all the features so far, but how can I make a reservation as I don’t see how you do it using open table. Is a booking feature coming soon? | Not only is the brand name perfect. I love how the app is designed and it’s features. I can definitely see this app being a must have for travellers with a few extra features. 
I use it to plan my trips and save my must go to places. It’s been super handy! 

I would love to see a option on the trips section to share the itinerary via PDF. I can imagine it would look perfect to share with friends who don’t use the app or if you are planning a trip for a family member. 

Keep up the great work! I’m a super fan! Finally an app that not only is pretty but also super useful 🫶🏼 | I love this app. Just starting to use it and I am in love with the My trips part of it. Love being able to add places of interest with times for each day! The only thing is that some of the places I rec show incorrect info on my page. I recommended a place in Utah Wyoming and the final place on my place is showing Ann Arbor, MI. Another is showing incorrect town with a picture that had nothing to do with my review.  Also the feedback does not work on the app. Unable to send any feedback. | EDITS:
Would also love to see the ability to add a “manual” item- for example: hop-on, hop-off bus tours. Would be super helpful to leave a review and just save my pictures and notes from the experience for keepsakes.

This could easily be the next big social media craze, especially with travel coming back! I love the concept: plan and document all my trips in one place, with ability to recap them in the perfect mix of photos and written descriptions, WITH A SCHEDULE :) so I can easily pass down detailed plans. Amazing. BUT, there are definitely features missing before it can go viral… I’d love to see: - The ability to add photos to a place just for you/even if you don’t “rec” a place, so I don’t have to post personal pictures to the internet if I want to use it like a social network with a cute recap of me and my partner on a trips’ pictures for our friends and family. This would go along great with better privacy/sharing settings, so I can share my trips and photos and comments/notes with people, allow others to add comments who are tripmates and maybe a “view only” tier with public/private comments for what I want a friend to be able to see (if someone from work asks for trip recs, but maybe I don’t want them to see my reservation notes on a place but do want them to see my review). | As a travel agent, I LOVE using this app to build trips for my clients. Once all of your activities/hotels/restaurants are loaded, my clients are able to click on the itinerary and everything shows up on the map in their app, which saves them  TONS of time from having to Google everything individually outside the app. Super trendy, modern, and unique recs from all the users. Such a fun travel space to be in! | Amazing for travels recs and finding new places.  I’ve been sending lists of my recs for years and now this makes it so much easier to share with friends! | I hope more people use it, such a cool idea | A really awesome function that should be incorporated in to this beautiful app would be a visually appealing countdown feature for “My Trips”. A bonus would be the ability to create a Home Screen widget for your countdown as well! | So much potential. I got so excited for this app and to use it but has a few problems. This is my first ever review on here because guess what? Your feedback option does not work. You click on submit and does nothing. Do you guys not test your app after updates?
Also, does anybody who works for this app ever use it at all? If so, you can easily catch the glitches and what needs to be fixed. For example, when you click the “back” button, it doesn’t really go back to the previous page you’re on. When i am checking out another person’s profile, clicks on their recs, and then tries to go to back to their page, it doesn’t. It leads me back to my profile! It is so annoying. Please fix this. The app is way too focused on “aesthetic” but has no quality. Way too many problems. | I love this ap!! I love having lists for all my trips in one place, love the aesthetic, & the map feature ! 

I would LOVE to be able to make my own notes for businesses that only I can see. That way any research I’ve done on the place can be there too. For example- a place that doesn’t take reservations for breakfast, I’d like to note that :) | Love the look and design of this app, and the concept and information you get for trips is amazing!! Really helpful to create your own trip folders or wishlists all in one place with pictures, location etc etc. convenient and helpful to get you to all the places you’re wanting! 

The docked star is due to some interface annoyances through using the app. When clicking into someone’s recommendation from a trip and clicking the back arrow it brings you all the way back to the search page rather than that person’s trip to continue looking through their reccos. So you have to find your way back to where you were if you want to continue browsing. | Love this concept and the ease of use of the app. As a business owner, I wish there was a way we could edit information that isn’t correct, such as hours of operation. I understand the concept is for this to be different than Yelp, just wish we could provide accurate information. | This app is a beautiful way to plan trips and to remember past trips. | So helpful to see hometown recommendations! Love love love this app and can’t wait to see all the new features that get added 🙌🏽 | As someone who loves traveling and giving recs, this is perfect. Still needs some things worked out,   Like my profile picture and background photo do not load or show? probably a bug issue. Also I would love it if you were able to have a tab with a grid of all the photos you’ve took at locations, similar to Instagram, and the ability to change the main photo on your profile of trip locations. Otherwise great app can would love to see this grow | While I’m pretty proud of the state of my travel spreadsheets, this app blows them away. The social aspect, easily saving and sharing ideas with friends, make planning so much easier. | Pros:
+ GPS enabled search
+ Clean, intuitive functions
+ Collaborative space

Cons:
- does not map from location to location
- there’s no default view of a trip to show the entire itinerary, you have you click day by day 
- you can’t share trips to Instagram stories, there should be an attractive easy display for sharing on social media 
- there is no FAQ or feedback section in the app to suggest changes 
- you cannot make notes about a location or place you select for your trip, therefore I still prefer using notes over this app until it adds features

I am happy to use this app for an upcoming trip and will provide an updated review if the app features are updated. | I love this concept! The app is super easy to navigate and fun to use. I love logging all of the places I’ve been to, because it both helps give people I know recommendations, and it gives me a nice memory bank of where I’ve been. I used this to plan a recent trip, and it was such a neat way to keep track of where I wanted to go and what I wanted to do. Love the map feature to see where in a city my friend’s recommendations are, and to find where my next stop is on vacation! | Love all the features so far. Genius idea!! When I’m planning trips, especially international trips, I use google maps to organize the itinerary based on location and proximity. I’m def gonna start inviting friends to join to make our lives easier. 
 For more effective itinerary planning, I would suggest adding the following:
1. Times
2. Option to add attachments, videos or images because some of the images don’t do these places justice)
3. Finally notes within scheduled places (as shown in the previews) and also notes to add activities that are not listed. 

I also love how the map shows the proximity of places to each other but is it possible to add a feature where we can see the actual distance from one place to another and perhaps driving directions? Currently, google maps only opens for directions to one place. | truly changes the game | Really great concept and I love the user friendliness. However, each time I try to see a list of someone’s recs on their page (or even my own), the recs do not load. The only way I can see recs is by searching a city right now. Needs an update probably

UPDATE: it works fine. This ^ was only happening for a few hours the first day. Really cool app! | Great for planning trips and sharing recommendations with friends! | It’s so awesome that you can put locations on the day you plan to visit but why not add time? It’s not a full function collaboration or trip planing tool if you can’t plan times in your day. | Cool app. Will definitely be using in future travels. Just wish there was an option to add your own photos and notes. Could possibly make this option private or public for others to see. | There are many things I love about this app. I just started using “plan my trip”.  
Not only am I adding all the places/ things I want to do as I prepare but this will also serve as a record for me for future,  Have u ever tried to remember that little restaurant you had stumbled across but couldn’t. Just park it here. | Love the app, such a great concept, very user friendly, and very great aesthetically. Just one thing- please make an update where you can make folders within each city of recommendations so that we can distinguish between food recs/activities/shopping, etc. Right now they are all in one category under each city and I’m afraid my recommendations will get lost in the sauce and get confusing if I keep adding to it! Would love a bit of organization and categories within each city. Thank you! | I’m already obsessed with the app as-is. It’s been. A very practical, helpful tool for trip research & planning - especially for group trips with friends or family. I don’t have a ton of friends on the app yet, so my planning process is still to go to Pinterest or travel blogs for ideas and then I save my wishlist things to do in Out of Office. If they keep building out additional features that make it more useful, building a user base I want to follow, and create more opportunities for engagement across users, this app will be an absolutely must have for anyone who enjoys a trip! | I love to see what friends and influencers that I follow are doing when they travel. Places to stay, eat, sights to see! I sometimes DM people and ask but this makes it so much easier especially when planning a trip and giving others recommendations. 10/10 recommend! | This is hands down one of the most beneficial travel apps I have ever used. For someone who loves to travel the reviews and recommendations have been spot on! Can’t wait to use the app on my next trip! | A user friendly interface that’s so easy to use! And because I trust my friends (and some influencers), it makes picking my hotel or restaurant so simple! Why didn’t someone think of this sooner? (Love the name, btw)

title: Airbnb
description:
FIND YOUR PERFECT STAY WITH AIRBNB CATEGORIES
Explore our curated collections of homes chosen for their style, location, or nearby activities. Whether you’re looking for a cozy cabin with views or apartments by the beach, Airbnb Categories helps you find places to stay that are right for your trip. 

CUSTOMIZE YOUR SEARCH WITH 100+ FILTERS
Narrow down your choices easily with filters that help you book homes that meet your needs. Search by certain amenities, like pools and fireplaces, or filter for confirmed accessibility features, like step-free bedroom access.

MANAGE ALL YOUR TRAVEL DETAILS EASILY
The Airbnb app keeps all your essential trip info in one convenient place, so you can quickly revisit or share your travel details with others. You’re also able to chat with your Host and receive up-to-the-minute booking updates, making it easier to get there, get inside, and get connected to wifi.

TRY FUN EXPERIENCES LED BY LOCALS
Airbnb Experiences are fun activities led by Hosts. They’re a great way to immerse yourself in a new place with a local expert as your guide. Browse both in-person and online options, whether you want an Experience that gets you out and about or one you can enjoy from the comfort of your couch. Book, save, or share your favorites—all with the Airbnb app.

IT’S NEVER BEEN EASIER TO AIRBNB YOUR HOME
As a new Host, Airbnb Setup matches you with an experienced Superhost in your area who’ll provide one-to-one help from your first question to your first booking—by phone, video call, or chat. You’ll also have one-tap access to Community Support agents to guide you through anything from account issues to billing support.
releaseNotes: Feel at home wherever you travel with Airbnb. We’re always working to better your experience through improvements and updates to the app.
reviews:
The worst treatment of hosts I have ever seen!! As a host be ready to be a SLAVE for the AirBnB and their awful “rules”. They will fine you for whatever reason they like. Including for something that was THEIR fault! Long story. But I am a 5 star host and a 5 star guest. However I will cancel anything that has to do with AirBnB after my last guest leaves. Also be ready to not get paid a whole lot! Missing payouts, etc… If you have an actuall issue, a horrible incoherent robot “service” will reply. Is just OUT OF THIS WORLD god awful! Then if you are lucky to talk to a person, one person will not know what another one is doing. AWFUL! AirBnB, I am so, so, so, so done with you! And I will advise everyone I know to STAY THE HECK AWAY FROM YOU! | I am in Costa rica for vacation I rented a room after check in I found that no electricity and water most of the time. I asked Airbnb for a refund but they are not helpful at all and ignored my request. Next rent was a scam host, it was not even room was a camps I couldn’t sleep because the noise and very dirty, the issue Airbnb allow the hosts to re-listing again so the host keep removing the listing after bad reviews. Totally scam! We should try something else than airbnb! They stand with hostess!!! | When I arrived, I realized the neighborhood was unsafe, and the property was dirty despite the cleaning fee. Unable to stay, I contacted Airbnb for help, but they requested evidence while I was on my way. Meanwhile, there was an active shooting nearby. It's been over 30 hours since I've been trying to reach Airbnb with no solution. I paid $5k for the reservation. I later discovered multiple fatal crimes nearby through police reports. Despite contacting 7 customer service reps, none have resolved my case as they keep clocking out. Now, I'm waiting in my car for Airbnb to call back. It's been 27 hours since my initial claim. | The customer support team is trash. It sounds like the same person every time you call back they always tell you they can’t transfer you. None of them work consistently all of them have different work ethics I can’t transfer you to a supervisor they tell you and you randomly get blockedand your account can get suspended at any random moment | This compay provide its services inside the settlements which are built of stolen Palestinian land ! Boycott Airbnb | Airbnb is such a great idea. The owners made a great invention and have a strong presence in the hospitality industry. I love using the app and all communication from hosts to customer service representatives. Very professional and very helpful! | It won’t even let me book place to stay 😭 keeps saying error please try again how do you have a app that books places for people to stay and it doesn’t even let u use it🤦🏽‍♂️🤦🏽‍♂️🤦🏽‍♂️🤦🏽‍♂️👿👿 | To be honest this app is average. When it comes to customer service AirBnB is abysmal! 

They outsource customer service to India, the support is slow, inarticulate, absolutely no help as they rely on their “specialists” whom you never directly converse with. 

I’m currently traveling and have been dealing with an issue with AirBnB that has gone unresolved for what now is going onto the 6th day - with x3 separate open tickets / claims with customer support. 

I’ve had to find and pay for premium accommodations as AirBnB provides no help beyond fake assurances and fake smiles. 

Proceed with caution when traveling abroad as they will leave you stranded on your own. 

Their is no way AirBnB will continue to dominate the space under this business model. | There are few if any protections for guests in the booking process. Hosts have the power to set ridiculous rules and choose exploitative policies that hurt guests most. Very difficult to plan group trips when hosts set arbitrary rules about visitors. Additionally, the refund/cancellation policy is nearly hidden until after you book and then you’re stuck in a bad deal. If Airbnb is supposed to be the better alternative to hotels, they need to at least put guests first. | Your support team has been little help and now me and my family don’t have a place to stay this weekend. We are doing some remodeling this weekend and will not have access to our utilities. We decided to go with Airbnb because I have a dog and not many hotels are pet friendly. They won’t let me book a place because of a “safety risk” that we might be having a party due to short notice. Why would I book last minute to book a party. I just want a place got my family while out home gets fixed. ZERO customer support, once I contacted them to try and resolve it the support lady simply read off a script that said summarizes to “to bad so sad” and “we sent it to the right team” . Might as well have AI answer their customer service | The hosting side of the app is terrible. Way too many issues. Booking as a guest is fine though never had any issues on that part | I have been a host for several years.  Generally good experience and the guests have been almost all wonderful.  However I did have one damage claim and got no cooperation or payment from AirBnB.  Very frustrating run around and very contrary to the assurances they give.  So just know you are on your own - they take the fees but do not support. | Trash app!! Don’t even let me book lol. | I love booking with Airbnb, it’s easy and has less fees than other sites! | First time using the Airbnb app.  We reserved an apartment located downtown San Antonio. Had great reviews, pictures looked good and a 4.9 on cleanliness. We arrive to our Airbnb and noticed the floor would creek pretty bad. There was dust everywhere. We found hair also in some places. The sofa was covered in stains & crumbs. There was a towel in the washer (only had a washer) the dishwasher was very dirty also the keurig, the bed sheets seem dirty too. It obviously looked like the place has not been cleaned in a while. We didn’t even stay for an hour there. I let the host know, also taking some pictures for evidence. I didn’t get every single thing because I thought the ones I did take were enough for anyone to tell this place was not cleaned. The host ends up telling it was cleaned that day and to send the pictures. He then told me I had to speak with Airbnb customer services because I asked for a refund. They end up telling me I can not get a refund because it was “minor cleanliness” and only cared if I had a picture of the towel in the washer but not the sofa that had stains all over.  I couldn’t even get a partial refund. Airbnb only cares about the host and will side with them even if they are in the wrong. THEY DELETED BAD REVIEWS ON THEIR APP. | They cared and fixed the issue that we had. | It used to be a good way to book reasonably priced accommodation these days you can book a hotel room for less😂 | The problem with AirBnb can be summed up by saying it could potentially ruin a vacation or save a vacation with many factor built in between. Firstly it’s layered as to who to blame.  First there are AirBnb policies and then there are hosts.  A hotel for example may clearly state the rules and allow rearranging travel because they have many rooms available.  Airbnb just has the one place you booked with a host who has options to rearrange, change, or refund.  Also those hosts aren’t necessarily great when it comes to customer service.  For example if you get sick and need to move a reservation around hotels and airlines are understanding.  Airbnb host might just take your money and run with no recourse other than a bad review.  Which AirBnb favors the host because you cannot sort by good or bad reviews.  It gives the average rating and then you have to sort through to find the bad reviews.  While I have experiences reasonable host who are accommodating.  I have also experienced a host who just took my money for no services rendered. This is the reason why I cease to use AirBnb ever again. | Love this app. If anything happens they take care of you! | This app is amazing I love looking at houses hotels and it is so relaxing to look at  when you are bored | Some of these hosts have the most insane cancellation policies found nowhere on earth - 50% refund if cancelled at any point in time, 100% upfront. Not only that, but you can’t even review the host after interacting with them. Shame on you the company for allowing customer service to get this way.  Taking my business elsewhere.. | Title: Great Concept, Disappointing Execution

I genuinely love the concept of Airbnb and the unique travel experiences it aims to offer. It's a fantastic idea that has the potential to transform how we experience new places. However, I am deeply disappointed with how the platform operates, particularly when it comes to customer service and its arbitrary process for handling disputes and bans.

During my last experience, I encountered serious issues that highlight these flaws. The customer service for guests was not only abysmal but also completely opaque, leaving me frustrated and without clear answers or support. Even more distressing was the arbitrary nature of how bans are issued. I had an ex who misused the platform to stalk me by pretending to be a neighbor and even escalated to calling the police on me, leading to my undeserved ban from the platform. This situation was handled poorly, with little to no investigation or consideration of context, which was incredibly disheartening.

Adding to the disappointment is Airbnb's lack of a loyalty program, which feels like a missed opportunity to reward frequent travelers. When faced with the choice between an often too-early 10 or 11 AM checkout at an Airbnb and the flexible 4 PM checkout that Marriott offers for Titanium members, the choice becomes increasingly clear. The lack of such benefits, which are standard among hotel loyalty programs, makes Airbnb less attractive in comparison.

While I remain a fan of what Airbnb aspires to be, these significant shortcomings make it difficult to trust and rely on their service. It’s regrettable because I truly appreciate the innovative approach to travel Airbnb promotes, but without improvements in transparency, fairness, and guest benefits, it’s hard to see myself using this service in the future. | I love Airbnb as a traveler and as a super host! The honest reviews and photos assure me especially when I travel alone that I know what to expect. I stayed at an Airbnb in downtown LA during a trip. Knowing it was going to be shady finding parking plus the fact that I had rented a Porsche and wanted it garage, I immediately checked the “has parking” option as that was the most important thing to me. 

3 hours before I checked in, the “host” told me that I no longer had parking (I could no longer cancel at this point) he told me I would need to park a block away in an unsupervised lot and pay extra. He told me. Obviously this wasn’t okay, but I tend to let things go with the flow instead of cause a problem so I gave it a chance. Downtown LA is so unsafe and not only did this host lie to me and say it was in West Hollywood, it was a few blocks from skid row full of homeless people. The next day I found that someone had scratched my rented Porsche and was charged for the damage. After taking to I kid you not 10 different employees each asking me to explain my situation when they could have easily keep past conversations in file was sloppy. I spent a lot of money with Airbnb and all of it was a lie. I have no doubt the actual renter of the condo stored his own car in the spot he advertises for and hours before someone checks in, he cancels your spot.
I felt very unsafe walking a block to my Airbnb alone at 1am after meeting with friends when I expected to have a safe garage space. 

AIRBNB sided with their renter and I will never rent you airbnb again. I have tried to fix it from the app, from my iPhone setting, uninstall, reinstall- nothing is working. It’s a huge flaw that impacts my experience! | One of my favorite apps ever. Our power even went out for an entire day with no explanation. Airbnb have no help. Told me to request my own money back from the host? That's just weird? They also just ended the conversation when I asked to talk to someone higher up and just kept telling me to figure it out on my own. | DO NOT book with Airbnb. If you are trying to save money by staying at an Airbnb instead of a hotel, STAY AT A HOTEL!! It is reliable, safe, and filled with real customer service people.

I have had plenty of good experiences with the platform until recently. After having to leave a booking due to unsafe property conditions, Airbnb did not provide a refund from the host. 

We requested reimbursement for our alternative housing and communicated with Airbnb customer service for 3 weeks straight. title: Road Trip Planner Viewer
description:
RTP Viewer allows you to view Road Trip Planner files on your Apple device.  Create and edit your files with Road Trip Planner for iOS or OS X, and then anyone can view the files with this app. 

Road Trip Planner Viewer is free, does not require any subscription and respects your privacy by not collecting any of your data.

While you can edit the files with this app, you cannot save your edits.  Our iOS app Road Trip Planner at the App Store is virtually identical to this app and allows you to save your edits.  

Contact us for more information or bug reports.

Multiple sample files are available, including an informative Route 66 sample file.

For more info on Road Trip Planner tap or click the Support URL.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and interface enhancements.

title: TripMapper - Travel Planner
description:
If you love to design your own unforgettable travel experiences and follow your own path, you need TripMapper, a tool to help you build your own tailored itinerary and stay in control of your trip spend. 

Manage your itinerary, invite fellow travellers, plot your locations, attach your tickets, and receive notifications. Then, use the budget calculator to track your spending and payments in real-time.

TripMapper is the home for all your travel plans!

Discover some of our great features, perfectly tailored for you intrepid travellers:

• CARD & LIST VIEW
Choose your preferred itinerary layout and personalise it by adding your own images and notes.

• START & END TIMES
Schedule your daily activities to make the most of every moment whilst on your trip.

• MANAGE TASKS
Add tasks and set due dates so nobody forgets.

• INTERACTIVE ITINERARIES
Need travel inspiration? Explore our pre-made interactive itinerary library, take them in to your TripMapper account and make them your own.

---
And if you upgrade to our ‘Trip+ Unlimited’ plan access the following features:
---

• BUDGETING
Manage and track your spending both before and during your trip.

• CONVERT TRIP CURRENCIES
Convert one currency to another using real-time exchange rates for accurate budgeting. Please note we only convert currencies available to us via the European Central Bank.

• MAP VIEW
Add locations to your trip cards and see them plotted on a large, interactive map.

• OFFLINE MODE
Access and view your itinerary without needing an internet connection.

• INVITE FELLOW TRAVELLERS
Invite your travel companions to contribute to all your plans.

• NOTIFICATIONS & ALERTS
Set yourself useful trip notifications.

• ATTACHMENTS
Attach tickets, booking confirmations and other useful information to your itinerary for easy access.

• PDF DOWNLOAD
Save, print and share your trip itinerary in PDF.

You can read the TripMapper Terms of Service here: https://www.tripmapper.co/terms-of-service
releaseNotes:
Performance and stability enhancements.
Feature updates for business clients.
reviews:
I don’t write reviews, but Tripmapper is the best.  I travel a lot for work, and the job requires that I plan, record, and retroactively access my notes.  There are so many plus points to this app that it’s hard to know where to begin.  Autopopulates pertinent info about locations?  Yes.  Easy to reshuffle appointments on the fly?  Yes.  Easy to collaborate with others on itineraries?  YES.  Web version that synchs with the app?  So much yes.  Downloadable itinerary WITH my notes in a PDF?  Talk dirty to me!  But really, like anything else, there’s room for improvements, but the developers are awesome with feedback and continually making it better.  This is the app you want, and if you’re the kind of person who travels enough to need this app, then you won’t think twice about the subscription.  You’ll never look back. | I plan trips in great detail. I just finished planning a two week trip using this app and am very excited to try it out. I used Inspirock for years and when it was discontinued this was the only website/app that came close.

What I would like to see:
- there is no connection to Google maps to calculate drive times. I had to manually do that myself. 
- Would be nice if it told me how much time I needed between activities so I would know how much time to spend there. Like for example I picked a hike to do and gave myself an hour. Further research showed me it was a 4 hr hike. That info could be datamined from other websites. Or added to the interface. 
- no suggested activities like on wanderlog or triphobo. I had to search for my own activities and put them in. I always search for hidden gems and that’s one feature I loved from Inspirock to help me avoid the crowds.
- would be nice to see my notes in the list view.
- would be nice to have a calendar view. If you add the drive times from Google maps and put it on a calendar you could see when your times may overlap. That’s kind of what list view does but when you see things on a calendar it’s so much easier to organize. I kept adding times and forgetting to switch things to PM. Also having a calendar with a notification of how much free time would help me pick and choose activities.

But it has major upsides:
- the interface and the flow on the app and webpage is easy to put all my stops in order. I love, love the cards. 
- I like how everything is laid out in order, how you can add times, add pictures to remind yourself what you are looking to visit, add the hotels, the driving time, and everything is neat and orderly.
- almost everything is customizable. That’s a huge plus. 
- I love the trip summary. It’s like a giant welcome page. 

I think as more features get added this is probably going to be a very popular app. | Often these travel planner apps have good features but look boring. This app looks great too. | I lke that you can add your vacation costs. Neat idea. | Easy to use trip organizer. Recommend it if you like to plan your own travels. | My vacations are so organized now. I feel like a pro!! | I used the web app for my honeymoon, and it made the trip planning process so easy. I used the iPhone app when I was on the trip and it was awesome. | The free version is good.
