title: PlaceMaker Route Planner
description:
PlaceMaker - Top Rated Route Planning App
Top rated route planner for routes with up to 500 stops per route.  View stops on a map or launch your favorite navigation application.  In-app purchase enables route optimization and route display.

Now with text scanning (and barcode scanning) to enter addresses.

Reviews: "Amazing! Best routing app available!" - Mkoff32
"Best Route Planner" - ozzier23
"The app is very easy to use & excellent routing." - coffee1456,
"It's great for traveling salesmen!" - cider pimp
“I use this App every day...it is awesome...I would give it 100 stars if I could.” - mistazzz
"A real time saver for multiple drive points" - NoBodyzPURRfect
"Best route map - Excellent for multiple stop routing and directions." - Jimjjk
"Simply Amazing...If you are route driver of any kind....you'll never want to be without it again." - imjasper
“Best multi-stop app in the App Store” - BPmax

Quickly create lists of stops, and launch your favorite navigation program.  Sort by distance from current location, manually sort, or optimize stop sort order with one of the premium versions.  Displays the estimated travel time and distance to each stop.  Share a list with others through Google Drive - any changes to the list will be seen by all the users.  Great for delivery routes and delivery drivers.  Barcode reader feature scans FedEx, UPS Mail Innovations, and Royal Mail Mailmark barcodes.

CSV import supports Hermes manifest and generic CSV files.  See http://placemaker.qworkly.com/csvimporthelp.html for more information.

Purchase a premium subscription to reorder lists in optimal order and show the route line on the map.

Subscriptions can be managed via your iTunes account.  Up to 25 stops per list for $4.99/month or $49.99/year, up to 150 stops per list for $9.99/month or $79.99/year, and over 150 stops per list for $14.99/month or $119.99/year.  Up to 500 stops per list is supported by PlaceMaker.  Payment will be made through the iTunes store to your iTunes account and subscriptions automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.  Your account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal.  Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user’s Account Settings after purchase.  No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during the active subscription period.

Privacy Policy:  https://placemaker.qworkly.com/privacy.html
Terms of Use:  https://placemaker.qworkly.com/terms.html

Works with Waze, Google Maps, Apple Maps, Lyft and Uber.

Thanks!
releaseNotes: Improvements to csv import.  Bug fixes and performance improvements. Please send any comments or questions to placemaker@qworkly.com.
reviews:
This app has helped me plan my day, daily, for over 2 years now. So easy to use and helpful when multiple stops are needed daily. | It’s a great tool to organize multiple stops and saves you driving time. | I have 7 different routes with just under 100 stops per route per day made my job so much easier!!! 
I had to enter all addresses manually one time once I did 4 years later there still there | It saves so much time…. No more entering everything on Google Maps and trying to figure out the best route - I’m not great with directions, so this has been a life saver for me. | App se cierra inesperadamente y bloquea o congela el iPhone iOS actualizado al último. 
Revisar | Awesome app , simplified my route big time  ! | I’ve made several requests for my subscription to be cancelled because I haven’t been using PlaceMaker for over one year now. Despite my cancelation requests, PlaceMaker continues to take money from my account . I need this to be cancelled and request a refund. | I do a lot of sight seeing and traveling and I love using this app to help me on my route to follow everything I want to do. It saves time from driving all over the place back n forth. | I use this every day for work. It saved me so much time. I can’t live without it. | Very good | Asked to be very helpful and managing my route and my route time for each stop | Nice ! | Pretty accurate 93% of the time (rough estimate),
You can barcode scan or T scan as well as drop a pin or manual type(w/voice command) and the best feature adding notes or pics to describe your package for easy finding | Helps to plot and schedule jobs | Well thought out.... | Not bad at all! | I signed up for the $14.99 monthly in order to be able to use the optimization. For some reason the free trial thing wasn’t working. I like how it re-organizes everything. But I live in Southern California, and the time that it’s estimating for the route is laughable. It’s about three hours too short lol.

So I have my doubts that the route is truly optimized based on traffic? Sure if traffic didn’t exist that would probably be the best route. But some of the choices don’t make sense. I do like that you can route it with 10 stops in Google maps… but that just does those 10 stops, it’s not truly optimizing the whole route with googles traffic engine.

title: Atlas Obscura Travel Guide
description:
Find your adventurous spirit, get off the beaten path and discover unique places to experience near and far, all contributed by Atlas Obscura’s global community of explorers. 

---

EXPLORE THE MAP
We’ve plotted the entire Atlas Obscura database in a single map, allowing you to easily find unique places nearby or to help plan your next trip.

GET THE BACKSTORY
Learn what makes each place so unique. Each entry has detailed information, photos, and tips from the community.

PLAN & TRACK YOUR ADVENTURES
Create custom lists to organize your itinerary or bucket list. Also, use the “Been There” feature to track your progress exploring the wondrous world of Atlas Obscura.

ADD YOUR DISCOVERIES
Contribute new places to be published in Atlas Obscura, and share photos and tips from your travels with the community.

BROWSE BY INTEREST
Explore Atlas Obscura by whatever fascinates you. From history and architecture to art and natural wonders, get lost in the never-ending collection of off-the-beaten-path places.

If you’re enjoying our app, please take a moment to rate us in the app store. For bug reports or suggestions, reach out at appfeedback@atlasobscura.com, or visit us on Twitter at @atlasobscura where we’ll report any major issues.

Stay curious,

Atlas Obscura
releaseNotes: This release improves how we show pins for places a user has marked as "Been There" or "Want to Go"
reviews:
I’ve been using this Ap for years and years. Before it was an Ap, I’d have it open in a browser and keep hitting refresh. But I love traveling and this Ap is a one stop shop to find everything rad. I can’t say enough about this Ap. | Ok, first off - no scaling for iPad? Please remove iPad as compatibility, then. That’s table stakes for app development at this point.
Finally got in, know of a few listings in my area so tried to pull them up and saw a bubble, but nothing would come up. I’ve deleted the app and will continue to use their website…driving more ad traffic I’m sure…so where’s the motivation for a good mobile app folks? Put some more effort into this and put a couple bucks on the price. | AO never fails to derail me from my serious scrolling as the tales and photos capture my mind …. Every time !!! | Best app to learn the back story or find interesting sites near you or along the way during your travels! I have learned so much and turned my kids into sleuths as we travel! Fun way to engage your kids as you explore! | We use AO all the time during our travels. There are so many cool things to do and see. We recommend it to any of our friends that are traveling. Great app. | I installed it and to its credit it did have some neat information. It’s locked in the position where it installed and can’t be moved. I tried to uninstall it and I cannot. It’s been he only app on my phone that isn’t iPhone proprietary that doesn’t allow it to be uninstalled. I don’t trust this app and want it gone. | enjoy it on a daily basis. this is the way i start my day. we bought the boxed book set too. | Honestly the community is amazing but the app is so riddled with bad ux and ui decisions like why are yall making an api call every time i change a filter just make the whole thing when i hit done?? Hire me to fix your app i am begging you | Love this site!! I use it everywhere I travel and enjoy seeing and experiencing more things than the average tourist. I am always amazed at the awesome Sites and little known destinations that they have compiled. I even used it near my house in upstate New York and despite living in the area for 44 years, still found cool places I’d never heard of or been to. I tell everyone that is going anywhere to use Atlas Obscura | Atlas Obscura is not just an app; it’s a magic carpet ride to the most extraordinary corners of our planet. Its user-generated content brings to light the less trodden paths and uncovers sights and landmarks that traditional guides often overlook. This app is the epitome of adventure and discovery, perfect for those yearning to explore beyond the ordinary.

The interface of Atlas Obscura is intuitive, making it easy to navigate through its vast network of wonders. Whether you’re a seasoned traveler or a curious explorer in your backyard, the app tailors its discoveries to suit your location and interests. It’s like having a knowledgeable friend in your pocket, always ready to show you something fascinating.

One of the most striking features of Atlas Obscura is the diversity of its content. From awe-inspiring natural formations to quirky roadside attractions, the app covers an eclectic mix of places that are both informative and entertaining. Each location is accompanied by detailed descriptions, user reviews, and often, mesmerizing photographs that stir the wanderlust in you.

Moreover, the app fosters a sense of community among users. You can contribute by adding new locations, sharing your experiences, or offering tips, which makes Atlas Obscura a living, evolving atlas of the world’s wonders. This communal aspect adds depth to the app, making it more than just a guide—it’s a platform for sharing and discovery.

However, it’s important to note that while Atlas Obscura opens the door to hidden gems, some locations might require careful planning to visit. The app does a great job in providing essential information, but it’s always wise to do additional research, especially for remote or less accessible places.

In conclusion, Atlas Obscura is a treasure trove for adventurers and curious souls. It’s an invitation to step off the beaten path and plunge into a world of fascinating discoveries. For anyone looking to spice up their travels with unique, offbeat destinations, this app is a must-have. It’s not just about places; it’s about experiencing the myriad stories and wonders that our world has to offer. | I absolutely swear by using this app when I travel to find amazing sightseeing and experiences and real world "Easter eggs"... but it isn't without its frustrastions:

- Currently, newly marked places I've visited no longer give me a grey flag. This makes it confusing to see where I should go next. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling even, to no avail.
- After awhile with the app in use, you'll get an error message "something went wrong" and can't mark anything, and you'll need to restart the app and refind the location to mark. I've had this problem since I started using this a whole year ago and it is still not resolved!!

Also, as a suggestion, I like that places that are permanently closed are still featured, but could be helpful to give them a distinguished color marker, like red or something (but still allow gray flag for those who visited before shutdown). 

Also, when clicking "Directions", it uses my Google Maps, but would be nice if it have me the option to use Apple Maps instead (like Happy Cow app lets me do). 

I want to give it 5 stars, but these bugs sometimes break my flow while I'm exploring. | Good content for atlas obscura but really the app needs some work. Jerky, hangs, not usable at times. | Never fails to enlighten and inform with fascinating articles. | I’ve only been working with the app for a couple of hours but I’m finding it very difficult to navigate.  It’s not intuitive, its slow and clunky. I’m finding basic tasks,  like adding the countries I’ve been to,  really hard to complete.  Maybe it’s me, and I just need more time with it but I still feel like it shouldn’t be this hard to work with. | I love Atlas Obscura, and this app is overall wonderful but I sure wish links would open in the app rather than my browser | Only got this yesterday - it’s great. Helps with vacation planning in a big way. | I love the website and the content, but the app is janky. One major issue is it hangs when trying to filter results. | This app works well and the information is great! I have so many places I want to see and so many I’ve seen and I can put both in separate lists. | Awesome app for the travel who likes off the beaten path. Only downside is the actual map, hard to use on a iPhone. | I travel a lot for work and my photography hobby, and I *love* going to the places I see on this app. Doing so helps me learn about the history, architecture, ecosystems, and sometimes reveals photo opportunities I wouldn’t have found on my own. It also keeps growing as people add sites so if I go to the same city multiple times there are sometimes new suggestions to check out. I love it! | My family and I love this app. They were many times that we went on vacation and ran out of things to do so we open the app and search for surroundings. | I love atlas Obscura, but the app is glitchy. When you are trying to view places, it won’t let you click the lists and clicking a hashtag doesn’t work very well either. | Earth’s most exciting travel app. You’re shortcut to what is interesting and off the beaten path. | We just had a wonderful lunch there. The wait went by quickly the food was delicious. Best of all our server, Claudia was delightful. Highly recommend First Watch. | Great app, fun when you travel to a new place!

5 Baby! | Love road trips and unusual attractions. This is a perfect road trip companion! | Hard to figure out and save routes and attractions | After starting a list, the newly created one doesn’t appear in selection to add other locations. Also no way to delete lists. | Any time I go anywhere, I check with Atlas Obscura to see what else I could see there | Would like to see an iPad version of the app.  The content is great and a more advanced search would be fantastic! | I’ve used this app and their website to find the lesser known attractions. I love the history and stories. You will too! It’s a completely different experience, so if you like the site you probably won’t like the app and vice versa | I love the obscurity | I would love to hear a podcast or read about the Tarahumara abilities to run and how they live | Trying to add places I’ve been to the map, not working. | The world has nothing but bad news, or so it seems.  This is a reason to turn on the iPad. | Right out of the gate it’s my first time using the app and it will not simply load when I try to pick an interest to search 🤦‍♂️. Closed the app and tried again and it still just sits on the loading categories screen and never loads anything. WTH? | AO is an amazing resource | This app is my favorite now! I love seeing new interesting places to check out of just admirer. Make a Bucket list! Lol very well made and beautiful pictures to boot! | Traveling in London and Paris, and this app has amazing info for finding the most interesting and unusual sites. But if you want to use the app features (been there, want to go, new place, etc) it often doesn’t work. It has serious bugs- when you press the options to note if you’ve been to a place or would like to go to it, the app freezes for a time until it’s ok to use again. Very slow. It just needs a thorough debugging and someone with good coding skills to go through, put some money on this atlas obscura, it could be so so great. title: Cheapflights: Flights & Hotels
description:
The Cheapflights app helps you search, compare and book cheap flights, hotels and rental cars from hundreds of airlines, travel agents and accommodation and car rental providers globally. We’re a team of passionate, savvy explorers here to make it easy for you to find the cheapest flights, hotels & car rentals for your next travel destination.

With Cheapflights you can:

•        Compare cheap flights, hotels and rental car offers from hundreds of airlines and travel agents worldwide.
•        See the cheapest days to fly with our Price Calendar.
•        Save and compare results from your search and book later.
•        Log in and save your search preferences for a faster, more personal experience across all your devices.

Millions of people find cheap tickets with us every year. Want to be one of them? Whether you have your eye on last minute flights, domestic flights, international flights, cheap airline tickets and low-cost airfare, the cheapest flights and deals are just a download away.

Our flight comparison service is simple and completely free to use. All you need to do is search, filter and book your trip. We will then send you directly to the airline or travel agent to book your plane tickets without any hidden fees.        
_____________________________________
SEARCH FLIGHTS, HOTELS, VACATION HOMES AND CAR RENTALS FROM HUNDREDS OF SITES
•        Search and compare cheap flights to your destination for free.
•        Find just what you’re looking for by searching by city or airport.
*        Find more than just plane tickets. Search thousands of sites to find the best rental car and hotel deals for you.
*        Looking for.a staycation? Uncover deals on amazing places to visit nearby.

FILTER YOUR OPTIONS AND FIND EXACTLY WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR
•        See only options that fit your price range, airport, airlines, number of stops, take-off and landing times.
•        Filter results by cheapest, quickest, or a happy balance between the two.
•        Save results from your search to compare and book later.
•        Log in to apply your search criteria across all your devices for a seamless experience.
*        Take the stress out of trip planning. Find flexible flight offers with no change fees.

TAKE THE STRESS OUT OF TRAVEL PLANNING        
•        Take a look at checked baggage and seat reservation fees so you’re always prepared before booking.
•        Stay up-to-date on maximum carry-on or hand-luggage sizes and weights to avoid extra baggage costs.
•        See a snapshot of your selected travel dates and times so you can review before booking.
•        When you’ve found your perfect flight tickets, we will send you directly to the airline or travel agent to book.
_____________________________________

        
So, let’s get started. Go ahead and download the Cheapflights app now and search for any city or airport, anywhere in the world.

title: Layla: AI Trip Planner
description:
Hey, I’m Layla, your go-to AI travel planner sidekick! I'm about to make your trip dreams come true without the hassle of spending hours researching 50 different sites. Imagine having a personal travel agent genius at your fingertips—well, that's me!

Let's dive into the Layla AI travel app, where your trip planning wishes meet cutting-edge AI technology. Brought to you by Beautiful Destinations, the folks who know a thing or two about inspiring travel over on social media, I'm your ticket to stress-free trip planning.

First things first, ever found yourself stuck in a travel rut, desperately in need of a spark of trip inspiration? Your travel loves? Consider them the guiding stars steering you towards your next adventure. I've got a stash of mesmerizing destination videos that I’ll use AI to personalise just for you then simply swipe through captivating trip planner content that'll set your wanderlust ablaze.

And oh, the endless scrolling for the perfect flights and hotels? Yeah, I’m putting an end to that. I've partnered up with trusted travel companies like Skyscanner and Booking.com to fetch you live prices, all neatly organized in one place and chosen for the flight options and accommodation I know you’ll love best. No more jumping between tabs or juggling a dozen browser windows. I'm like the AI travel agent you never knew you needed, and I've got your back.

Let's talk about that indecisiveness bug that often creeps in when you're trying to choose where to go next, which accommodation to stay in or which flights to take. Don't sweat it—I've got the antidote. Pop your potential trip picks into your virtual travel planner bucketlist, then effortlessly share it with your vacation buddies for their two cents. It's like a virtual roundtable discussion, minus the headaches.

Looking for an AI travel itinerary? Chat with me, and I'll craft the perfect trip itinerary. In just a few seconds I'll spill the tea on when to visit, what to see, and all the nitty-gritty details to make your vacation planning as easy as a, b, c.

You might know Roam Around or know it as roamaround.io. Roam Around has crafted over 10 million customizable AI itineraries since it launched as the OG AI itinerary planner, and now you can find everything you loved about Roam Around in the Layla AI Trip Planner app.

With Layla and Roam Around joining forces your travel game plan just got elevated to insane new heights.


So, whether you're a seasoned globe-trotter or a travel newbie, let me, Layla be your AI trip planner. Your next epic adventure is just a chat away. Make your travel life a whole lot easier, just download the app to dive deep into the world of travel possibilities without actually packing a suitcase.
Don’t search, just ask me, Layla.
releaseNotes: small updates
reviews:
Absolutely USELESS app. Dumb search functions. Save times and spaces on phone go directly to GOOGLE.COM/FLIGHTS or KAYAK or BOOKING.COM for better search options and results and possible rewards. | Recently downloaded this because we could not decide what to do for the holidays and needed some inspiration.

Layla was so helpful by providing us various options and asking us all of the right questions to arrive at some really exciting travel opportunities.

This was almost like having Omakase Sushi with a Master Sushi chef; once you gave them some inputs and everything you got after was just perfect.

UX was really easy and straightforward.

Really enjoyed using the app and will definitely use it for trips to come, thanks Layla!

title: Plip Trip Planner
description:
Imagine having all of your travel arrangements organized in one, easy to read itinerary!

Plip takes the hassle out of staying organized. Flight information, hotels, appointments, car rental, all at your fingertips. Plip makes it easy to keep track of all the travel details whether you are planning a trip with friends, family, for work, or just for yourself.

Completely 100% FREE

Invite friends, family, and coworkers to collaborate on trips

Per-plan granular privacy controls: some plans are private just for you, some are for everyone on the trip to see and collaborate, some are for sharing more broadly with others (e.g. "what flights are you on?")

Real-Time Collaboration: instant synchronization between all trip members as you type

Maps integration shows you where your plans are and you're going next

Fully featured apps available for your phone and on the web.  Plan and view on your trip on any device!

Flexible: different plan types and free text fields let you plot down whatever information you want.  There are no restrictions or required fields.

Offline mode: no internet? No problem!  View and edit your entire itinerary without internet access.  Don't worry, changes will sync once you get back online.

Filters by plan type let you focus on one part of your trip at a time

Reactions make planning fun and interactive :)

Bulk edit capabilities help organize and update plans quickly
releaseNotes: Bug fixes, performance enhancements, and stability improvements.
reviews:
I have been hoping for an app like this for years.  It is perfectly intuitive and makes trip planning easy.  I love the integrated maps function, since my trips often span several cities and states.  

I have not verified that sharing is seamless, but I love the app so much that I didn’t want to wait to review, | Creating everything is easy, but plan to only travel in the time zone you created the itinerary in. I travelled from US to EU and for some stupid reason, Plip developers thought it would make sense to change the times on my itinerary to the local time. 

So instead of waking up for breakfast at 9am,
I’m now waking up at 4am and my entire schedule is shifted and there’s nothing I can do to shift it back. | At first, I loved the app. But as soon as my travel started all of the times of my events changed. title: Supercharger for Tesla
description:
Find the nearest Tesla superchargers around your location or around any address, city or State you choose.  Supercharge your Tesla experience with this intuitive and powerful app designed to help you better plan your trips and get rid of range anxiety.

*** FEATURES ***
------------------
Regularly Updated - We constantly update our database with the latest Superchargers as they come online. 
Charger Information - Get each station's distance, number of stalls, power rating and even elevation.
Nearest List View - View superchargers closest to your current location sorted by closest distance first.
Navigation Options - Navigate directly to a supercharger from the app using Apple, Google Maps or send the coordinates straight to your Tesla.
Live Traffic - Get live traffic updates to help you better plan your trips.
Favorites - Save your favorite supercharger locations with one convenient tap.
Light app - Super light memory consumption with less than 10 MB of install memory

This app is not affiliated with associated, authorized, endorsed by, or in any way officially connected with the https://www.tesla.com website, or any of its subsidiaries or its affiliates, or Tesla, Inc.
Terms of Use (EULA): https://sites.google.com/view/walabokllcterms
releaseNotes: Minor bug fixes and added new charging locations
reviews:
I rarely have an occasion to use a supercharger, but when I do, I love that it charges my car really fast and I can quickly be on my way. I have a charger in my garage and I don’t drive very far generally. | This app steals your payment info | But hate that my Tesla gets such poor mileage even while driving the speed limit. | So here’s a glitch, I know I am 78 miles from the next charger, but it shows me 78KM. The next one beyond that, is 168 miles… And it shows me that as over 200 KM.

There is no way to change the setting, and the information is wrong for one of them. 

Inaccurate is worse than useless, just ask NASA about that Mars lander that they didn’t convert the English and Metric properly. Oops. | iPhone 14 Pro Max, MQ8T3LL/A, iOS 16.6 (20G75). 

Installed, opened application… and full screen white background. That’s it. Force quit, re-open and same. Turn off iPhone. Wait. Turn on iPhone, launch application… same!

Great If you need a better flashlight application… hey, it’s free.

Developer : Please don’t respond with “…should have contacted technical support.” Because quite frankly… I shouldn’t have to. That’s a fact. | I don’t get enough information from this app. | Way too many ads. No settings options. No ad opt-out | Objectively worse than the supercharger search in the official Tesla app. Doesn’t provide any info like charging cost. Shoves ads in your face. Pretty sure the only reason this is a 5.0 is because of paid fake reviews. | Yes it happened twice. I guess it was too busy. Also, I asked for 100% charge and only given 80% | We like it. More Superchargers are needed in the Northern Neck. We must go from Lottsburg to Tappahannock, which is sometimes the wrong direction for our destination. | I can see a map, but no chargers anywhere! | How to set a location point? AND why?  Deleted after 3 minutes trying. | Did not work in Wisconsin last week!
I googled and found the answer!
Forget this app!

title: Ruter – Mobility in Oslo/Viken
description:
Finally: Everything you need to ride public transport, all in one app. You can plan your journey, buy a ticket and set up a personal profile when you ride with us. With the Ruter app, you can also:
• See departures in real time
• Save places you visit often
• See how crowded the bus is in real time
• Filter modes of transport
• Get relevant service disruption information
• Find the nearest available city bike
• See how long it takes to bike or walk

If you set up a personal profile:
• Tickets, history and favourites will be safely stored with us – even if you change phones
• We can offer you quicker and more convenient customer service

This is just the beginning of the new app – we’ll finish it together. More and better features will be available in the future.
Thank you for travelling with us!
releaseNotes: Mistakes were made and tiny bugs appeared in our machinery. They were spotted by our spies on board and subsequently dealt with. Everything should be back on track now.
reviews:
Tried to sign up with my US number while still in the US, and no confirmation text ever arrived. I tried multiple times. As an organized person I want to be prepared before I go, and I don’t trust that this app will be of any use without a credit card saved.  Please fix this very basic issue. | rent, nesten alltid i rute, lett å kjøpe billett, mange avganger👍🏻 | Three dots jumping for over 20 mins, untill I kill the app or my trips ends | So, to make an account, you need to register with your mobile phone, but I tried registering several times and requested resends. Never have I received an notification to confirm my mobile as a US mobile number.

Other than that, the app can tell you when to get off a stop and how many of them are between before then. | Love the application and how easy it is to purchase fares. I just wish it had offline proof of fare support like Vy does. Sometimes my phone's connection cuts out, which makes me worried if I need to show proof of fare to inspectors which requires an active network connection. The Vy application does not have this issue as it pre-loads the proof each day. | I downloaded app yesterday at 1930 and bought tickets to begin at 730 October 3 for 24 hours. When I opened app in the morning to use tickets, they were already expiring. Had to buy new tickets. Waisted money | Great app. Very useful. Love the travel options it gives. Very precise directions. | I love the fact that it can be in English, I always back and fort Oslo, and tranportation is important and the ticket is good for bus and train | This app was a lot of help during my Oslo visit. You can easily find which bus to take to where you want to go, buy tickets and even follow the bus route on the map. Thumbs up! | This app is a major improvement.  I also really appreciate the support for credit cards not from Norway.  It is really helpful when traveling | The old app was simpler to use! | Tried to pay with two different American credit cards. Gave some obscure error code. Bus didn’t take cash. Pretty unimpressed. | The new app looks more modern but the travel routes it gives just don’t make sense or reflect timed bus connections that well, so will suggest routes that take 30 minutes longer than necessary. It also has very poor walking directions when trying to connect from one bus/tram to another. I essentially only use it to see when my late bus is actually arriving. Otherwise quite fussy to use with a thousand buttons that make simple tasks feel overly complicated. Hopefully improves with time since it’s so new :) | Impossible for anyone who doesn’t live in Norway to use. Awful error messages - what does pia error 308 mean? How about pia error -99? 

Useless. Taking an Uber | Skal kjøpe billetter til meg og familien min og sliter tungt | The original ruterreise app was much better. Give it back and let users decide what app they want to use! The new app is less performant than using the web page! | Ikke mulig å betale med amerikanske kredittkort eller ApplePay! | This new app seems a very big step backwards from an end user experience- the old apps were very straightforward to both find routes and to buy tickets- this one does not seem to do either easily | App works great - helped me navigate train and bus rides to far away places. Huge help and comfort knowing I was headed in the right direction and on time. Thank you RuterReise! | crash crash crash crash crash. App can't even open after I've deleted it and reloaded it several times. Useless currently.

title: Ride On Trip Planner
description:
Montgomery County Department of Transportation (MCDOT) partnered with Moovit, a global bus trip planning mobile app software company, to launch a new Ride On Trip Planner – a Ride On bus passenger load and local trip planning app. This new, innovative app will allow riders to plan their next trip and to tell how crowded a Ride On bus is – before it arrives – with the crowdedness indicator on the app riders can  choose if they want to get on the bus arriving, wait for the next bus depending on how many people are on the bus, or choose another travel option, such as other local transit services, bikeshare, and scooter. It gives riders more control over their transportation experience. The app also includes dashboards for the Ride On Central Communications team to monitor bus loads and more quickly dispatch additional buses when buses are full.

The Ride On Trip Planner app is easy to use and can be downloaded from the Apple app store. Riders choose their current location and their destination and then pick the most desirable route that fits their travel plans. Once the route is chosen, the app will give the exact time the next bus will arrive, while providing step-by-step directions on how to get to the bus stop and how to get to the rider’s destination after getting off the bus. The app will also notify riders when it's time to get off so they can browse other apps and surf the web, without having to worry about missing their stop. The app was created to alleviate stress and worry about bus times and continue to reduce the spread of infectious diseases with the crowdedness indicator.

This Ride On Trip Planner app is being funded by a federal grant to help the community continue to travel locally in a safe and more efficient way. This partnership is a two-year pilot to test the combined Ride On passenger load and trip planning functionalities in the County and beyond. After the pilot is completed, decisions will be made on whether to keep this application, expand its capabilities, or use it to replace the current Ride On Real Time application, based on feedback from County residents and other users.    


The Ride On Trip Planner solution is based on Moovit’s long-running robust native and web transit apps designed for endless scale and serving 100s of millions of users worldwide, with zero downtime. 
The application features:  

•	Multimodal trip planning – in addition to Ride On route options, it will include other options like local transit services, bikeshare and scooter options
•	Real-time arrivals
•	Customized micro-mobility integrations

The Ride On Trip Planner app solution includes the iPhone app, which benefits from Moovit’s rich user interface (UI) and user experience (UX), as well as comprehensive transit data, developed in partnerships with some of the most well-known transit, mobility and accessibility organizations worldwide.

The Ride On Trip Planner app will feature a range of accessibility capabilities to benefit users with disabilities, including blindness or low vision, ambulatory impairments, and hand-motor disabilities, enabling them to use public transit confidently and maximize their opportunities in the workplace, education, and social life. 

The Moovit technology has more than 1.7 billion users in 112 countries, 3,500 cities, 7,500 transit agencies, and in 45 languages, and is a leading Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS) solutions company and the world’s most popular urban mobility app, making getting around cities easier and more convenient.

For more information, visit https://www.RideOnBus.com/TripPlanner .
releaseNotes:
- UX improvements
- Security hardening
- Bug fixes
reviews:
Excellent | I just want a bus schedule showing departure times!!!! No route alternative! Just let me plug in my bus number and give me the schedule!!! | This one is free, has no ads or limitations, and includes all the local modes of transit. It is better than all other similar apps that cover DC and MoCo. Well done. | Good | This app has huge potential and the interface is overall really good. 

However I have noticed on several occasions that the bus does not connect to the GPS real time tracking. Just now, a Route 12 bus went by that wasn’t tracked and so I missed it, thinking the next bus would be in 10 or more minutes.

Auditing the buses to ensure that they are properly connected to the App’s real-time GPS system would be helpful. This is an ongoing issue. If I could trust the real time, it would make me choose to use Ride On buses more often. | Siempre se nota la amabilidad y la entrega al servicio de cada uno de los conductores | Very good | Very good | This app has really helped me plan my day around the bus schedules which I’ve felt to be very reliable. F4 being my favorite | I enjoy using this app for both my regular commute as well as when I need to travel to or from new neighborhoods. The trip planner helps me find the best place to leave from, and once I’m on the bus, I’m grateful for the stop notifier. I love that I get alerts when my stop is next! | I love this app when it works it’s SO helpful for planning and getting places on time. But it just never works. Like it is always showing me the wrong times (next bus at 9:45 am or even 5 am when it is currently 7:00 am and I know the bus schedule for this route) or the routes to get a certain place are just wrong - sometimes it wants me to switch buses when it’s objectively better to stay on the same bus??? It’s very very frustrating.PLEASE fix this ride on 😭😭🙏🙏 | The app often shows an hour for every route, but sometimes the time disappear or the line comes early | Awesome | When it is working properly, this app is helpful. It can suggest routes and give an estimate of when the next bus will arrive.  I have occasionally had problems with phantom buses, that is that it says there is a bus coming but I never see it.  Also it is limited in what routes it will suggest. There are times when I know that I can walk 2 blocks and probably get an earlier bus, but there is no way to check them in the app. | Best Ride Ever!!!!!!!! | The two busses on my route (34 and 4) tend to run early or late but without the live location working, I often miss them. Can you ensure all the busses have their live locator on? This round resolve the problem for me. | Since I’m an old guy, and find myself standing for 20 minutes, very difficult, the app is extremely valuable in planning when I will arrive at a bus stop and will not have a long wait without any place to sit down. I have no idea why the county does not provide benches, but knowing when the bus will arrive, greatly reduces my standing time. | This week alone I’ve had terrible luck with the app which is normally good. I’ve been told a bus is arriving, go to wait for it, only for it to be the bus on the opposite side of the road when it tells me it is not that bus. | Seeing where buses are in real time is cool and all, but on my first time trying to use this app to navigate it took me to the wrong bus stop two separate times. You’re better off using Google Maps. | I can rely on this app because it has accurate data and live updates.  I spend less time waiting because I don’t need to get to the bus stop earlier “just in case” | Love this. Works well and is easy to use! | I appreciate how good the routes are. Great step for an app. | Waiting for this app for long time, now I don’t have to call for any info can easily
See in app.
