title: Drive Weather: Road Conditions
description:
Check the Road Weather Conditions on Drive Weather.

Drive Weather takes the guesswork out of figuring out when and where the bad weather is! It shows the weather forecast on your route based on departure time. The Drive Weather app presents weather, wind speed and direction, temperatures, and radar along with other tools to help plan your road trip to avoid the bad weather and stay safe.

Drive Weather illustrates the National Weather Service's forecast showing drivers the weather along their route when they're expected to be at each point.  In under 60 seconds you can know what weather forecast calls for and when to expect it on your route and have a safer journey. The app allows comparison of different routes, creating stops, interactively changing departure time, and other features that help plan road trips around the weather.

Drive Weather's unique difference is the vast amount of weather information it efficiently communicates.  This provides comprehensive information needed to make informed decisions on what time and what route to take on your road trip ensuring safety and better situational awareness.

Great for truckers, RVers, bikers, van life, and road trips, storm chasers or any other reason you're on the road.  

FREE FEATURES:
• Weather - Rain, Snow, Fog, Freezing Rain, Tornados, Thunderstorms, Hail, Smoke, & Haze
• Temperatures
• Animated Radar
• Cloud Cover Forecast 
• Compare Routes
• Time Tweaker for Truckers and RVers
• Free Version has ads, provides up to 2 days of weather forecast.
• Area Weather for general weather
• Exceptionally cool animated waiting screens
• All data saves on close and reopening.
• Automatic updates while on the road.
• Updates Route while on the road - without internet connection.
• Clean and consistent interface.
• High resolution weather locations - See More Weather and Make Better Decisions.



PRO FEATURES - All the above plus:
• Icy Pavement Indicator
• Wind Speed and Direction, Gusts and sustained.
• Night Location Indicator
• 7 Days of Weather Forecast 
• Severe Weather Alerts
• Ad Free
• Unlimited Route Length
• Add Stops on Your Route 
• Add Waypoints
• Weather Filtering
• Fully Interactive Interface for Better Road Trip Planning.
• Summary View showing times and distances between each stop and waypoint.

Comments, Questions, Concerns email us at conceptElementsApp@gmail.com
releaseNotes: Added syncing history and favorites between devices.
reviews:
We used this app to locate a clear place to view the eclipse.      The drive was 12 hours and weather forecast was accurate throughout the trip.     

It is a fantastic way to locate good weather for day trips.  No more bad weather adventures. | This is a delightfully useful app for knowing the weather along your travel route.

You can change the timeline to see if changing the timing of your departure will let you avoid bad weather or seek good weather.

You can even see radar forecasts for the expected time you’ll be in a particular area.

If you’re looking for an app to help plan routes based on weather this is it. | Easy to use.  So useful. ❤️ | Have been a full subscription holder.  Inevitably the app wants me to res subscribe, restores my subscription then won’t let me access the app.  Really good concept, very flighty.  Seems to work on my iPad, not on my iPhone. | There are many better weather apps! | I met a friend at a former job. A great guy that genuinely cares about people’s safety and growth.
I told him about the company I was employed at and the type of trailers I would be pulling. He looked at the routes and immediately told me to download this app and to upgrade to the premium service in order to have better route planning due to weather.
Without him, I’d still be fumbling with other weather apps and guessing and hoping.
Thanks John for everything that you do. You’re a rare person and one that I proudly call friend!!!!
Take care of Lily. | I used the free version of this app for a road trip from Minnesota to St. Pete Beach,FL.  There was rain and thunder storms shown on the app and the location and intensity shown was spot-on with reality!  I used the radar overlay to help me decide whether to pull off and wait out the storm or press on and get through it.  I pressed on and was out of it in 30 min but if I’d waited it out I would have been delayed for hours as the storm cell was large and moving west to east and I was going north to south. Highly recommend! | Driving to new areas in winter is anxiety producing and careless unless you have this app. Knowing when to reroute made our trip from Texas to northern Nevada possible to keep driving safely. Thx | How do you develop an app for driving with maps and not include Airports for destinations. Wow dude! Really?! | You saved our bacon.  During recent heavy atmospheric river storms in the west, your ap. helped us get through the Sierra mountain snow storms by showing us a slim widow of safe passage time. Thank you!! | I’ve been using this app for the first time on a road trip from Arizona to Washington with constant storms coming in off the Pacific Ocean.  

Wow, has this app been amazing at planning my travel days and times!  Thank you! | Useful when traveling to see weather conditions ahead | Wanted to try a weather related travel app before subscribing, but the app offer zero features unless you subscribe.  I couldn’t even get a bare bones forcast without subscribing.  It may be a great app, but you’ll have to pay to find out | This app doesn’t allow you to even use it unless you pay for it. Addresses are only allowed when you pay for a subscription. Lame app. | Paid my dues for 2024 and I can’t get it to work. Will try to contact IT Monday. 
Denise | I am generally stingy with five-star reviews, but simply MUST award one to DriveWeather! My mid-January Michigan-to-Massachusetts drive in a packed box-truck would have been an horribly anxious ordeal without it. WITH IT (for its $5.99 full-utility subscription-fee…), however, I knew precisely what to anticipate and I am relieved to say that its forecasts were shockingly accurate both in terms of timing and intensity of the weather. When I hit heavy snow in the pridelands of WNY I knew to expect it AND when to expect it to pass. DriveWeather NAILED IT!!

I would venture to guess that it is free-mode the app would have done alot less to allay my fears of heavy weather and to inform my plan for safety's and timing's sakes. Don't cheap out to your own travail. Pay the subscription fee as you are planning your drive and put the full power of this amazing tool at your disposal. | The app overall is good except 2 things. Yearly price and design of the app. User interface (design) it’s one of the worst I’ve ever seen!
Your app needs redesign, than will worth a 5 stars. This app should be a $10 max, cause it’s just a weather app. I would pay for 1 year subscription l, but $18 for weather app it’s kinda a lot! | Planned on leaving because drive weather showed it to be clear on our planned route. Woke up this morning ready to leave to find 2” of snow and ice that drive weather didn’t predict | If you don’t mind paying for information that’s free elsewhere, then this app is for you. | This app has such promise, but certain aspects don’t perform consistently or at all which makes it extremely frustrating to use. The time slider doesn’t ever appear when you add a waypoint. To set the time, then, you have to go back and edit the default which is 1:00.  This requires tapping twice, but the time slider rarely appears regardless. So, I can only plan for the first day of a multi day trip rendering the app useless. When I shared my route with Waze, the precipitation forecast didn’t appear. I thought it would, but sharing the route with Waze, Apple Maps or Google Maps was never addressed in the instructions (nor was history or how to set favorites), so I have no way of knowing. I emailed the developer twice, but never received a response.  Great potential, but app needs some work. | Looking for a good road weather app. I’ll try paying apps. Buying apps is no prob for me. This one has the annoying pop ups to buy. Got 5 pop ups within maybe few minutes to have me choose. | This app is really helpful with winter weather. I was unsure on something and support responded minutes. | This app is by far the most helpful for travel. It’s incredibly simple to use yet provides a ton of important info. It saved us this trip from ending up in the middle of the winters worst storm - we stayed a second day at our campground and then followed the storm, in clear dry weather. Best $ I’ve spent on a travel app!! | I appreciate this app. I really do. I use it when I drive 8 hours to visit my mom. Weather's a bear. But I'm priced out of it now. I don't mind spending $20 or $30 in an app but I don't drive enough to pay almost $20/yr for the occasional use. Also, I feel like it's gotten much more expensive the past couple years vs when I first signed on. From 9.99 to 12.99 to now 17.99—for the pro version, which I'm not sure even existed when I first I first started using the app and, aside from being able to look out seven days ahead, I'm not sure what the pro version brings to the party for the extra money. This last price increase has me out. | Not California friendly | I installed this app. After a brief review, I went PRO! 
The response of developers on questions and process, was phenomenal. 20 minutes, and a brief conversation via email, my issue was resolved. 
Point of record: This IS a REAL TIME app! I’m looking forward to YEARS of using it. | I loved this app when I first got it last year. It was a life saver as I was traveling back and forth from Iowa to Minnesota every weekend. But the last two months I have found that it takes forever to give me the details. And more often it just keeps spinning and spinning never giving me my data. Even after the update I’m still having issues with it just spinning/calculating. Sad as I relied on this a lot for timing my trips. | This app has helped me so much on my 700 mile trips between the Oregon Coast and central California! Kept me prepared and safe especially in  winter. Thank you | Subscription increase and for the last month it is so buggy it is worthless. Plan a route and last leg doesn’t show weather. Waypoints and stop overs constantly mess up with times. This app was much better before.

Updated: dev response was dumb. They should test more instead of blaming the customer of not using it correct. Have had this app for a long time. Last few updates are not stable. | Worth the price for truck drivers or anyone traveling. | Not only do you need to pay to type in address numbers but the developers responses to these reviews is gross. Your app is not that amazing to be acting that way and you should be thankful anyone even pays for this garbage. | There are very few apps that I will pay for.  But, as an intermittent traveler, this one practically pays for itself for the important and accurate weather info it provides.  
It’s clear that they care about how their app works when you look at the version history. They are constantly fine-tuning it to be even better. 
The sliding “leave” time scale is immensely helpful in avoiding bad weather and calculating driving in the dark. It doesn’t stop there. Wind, temperature, freezing rain, etc. are all easily shown.  It even shows the likelihood of the various conditions.
Yes, they've raised the price of this app recently by $2 but unlike other apps, I am happy to pay for it for the ease of use and peace of mind while on the road. | Use this app every time we are planning a trip and during trip…great info for deterring weather on multiple routes! | I drive a lot between Oregon and California. This app has been so helpful! After a month of using the free version I decided to upgrade. Both the free and the premium apps are great though! So simple to use and the accuracy has been spot on for me! | After watching the video tutorial, I decided the UI was not vetted with any sort of formal usability testing making it difficult to see and use. But, I was still considering purchasing- then read the reviews. The developer seems arrogant and contentious is his responses - and frankly I don’t have time to deal with a prima donna. Sir, even if you are utterly convinced you are right, you will not be successful if you feel you must “win” every interaction with a customer. Some humility and grace will build a customer base as opposed to alienating the very people you need to adopt your app. | Apple sent me 3 notifications after I downloaded this useless app and gave them my Apple Card info. Apparently this app tried to charge me $49 three times, even though I didn’t sign up for any paid features. Absolute scammers!! Avoid! EDIT: the response from the developer is baloney. There was no third party. I downloaded the app from here. And it DID ask me for credit card information claiming they want charge it unless I sign up for services. But as soon as I gave them my Apple Card information, I immediately got charged $49 x3 from strange websites. That literally never happened to me and I’ve been using Apple Card for a long time. So that was most definitely connected with this fraudulent app. Avoid! | The version - 8.16.0 does not work. It gets hung up on the “Gathering weather data” animation. This on an iPad Pro (12.9 inch) (5th generation) running iOS ver. 17.1.1
NOTE: As instructed no Drive Weather, I had to delete the app and installer newer version: 8.16.2 - now it works. | I like to try the app before I buy. There isn’t even a lite version to try. | This is what I was looking for as I drive 30,000/yr. I found the app very accurate and am able to plan my trips avoiding unnecessary weather conditions. I could have used this last year when we had a snow blizzard with high winds, drifting snow and low visibility. If I had this app I would have chosen to drive the next day avoiding the long delays……a 5 hour drive turned into a 9+ hour drive. UGH! I highly recommend this app! | Since the last iOS update the app hasn’t worked. | I’m having issues with it all it dose is download forever and never gives me the weather I want my money worth’s | Just purchased pro, so we’ll see how this works on upcoming trip.  I’d like this app to have the capability to SHARE routes with family/loved ones, so they can see weather conditions too.  If this functionality can be added, I’ll update to 5 ⭐️.  Otherwise, pretty cool.  I’ve already plotted our trip and as expected, it’s going to be nasty drive with the wind and ice.  At least we’ll know what to expect driving the route, in real time. | DriveWeather was the app I was looking for to plan out a cross-country route based on future weather forecasts. Not only is the app well thought out, it's easy to use and flexible. Plus the developer is super responsive (even on Thanksgiving Day!). This is the best example of how apps should be developed and supported by every developer! Well done Concept Elements LLC! 

***Oh and by the way, the cost to "own" this app is very reasonable compared to the monthly and annual subscriptions of other apps that do not have a fraction of the features.*** | This App is a life saver.  If you ever need to ensue a safe driving experience when traveling, this app will prove to be invaluable.  I have been using it for the past two years…. Dennis | Saves time and frustration knowing what weather you’re likely to encounter on your next trip. Great tool when planning a route. | I have been using this app for several years. It is by far the best, most accurate, most user-friendly, and easiest approach to projecting weather for upcoming travel days. A+++++ | I live in the “frozen North” and Winter Travel can be treacherous.  This app helps in planning the route and the time of travel. | Inconsistencies keep me from rating as high as I’d like. When you’re planning a long distance multi-day trip this is genius. In fact I’d pay more if it were consistent and reliable. I understand weather forecast have never been reliable. That understood, I travel enough and use multiple sources to know this app Sometimes misses. Some trips it’s good, some trips it’s been unreliable. And . . . Quirks seem to come and go. You just don’t know when those quirks are going to crop up. But, they do appear to get fixed. Hope they can continue to develop into something I don’t have to double check before setting out. Again, the concept is Genius. 

UPDATE: biggest and most prominent problem with app is Wind Gusts out beyond 48-60 hrs. App will give constant wind speed days out but not wind gusts. Gusts can be the problem (especially across bridges) and I would like to see improvement there. These guys work hard to provide a very valuable service. | App was great until a few months ago when it will not update and plan route.. it just keeps circling and circling | Have used this app for a few years & has always worked. Haven’t used for a few months now & all I get is the spinning wheel. Have always loved the app

Update: After uninstalling & reinstalling the app it works. I love the app. It’s great for our long travels several times a year. Thank you

title: Hipcamp: Camping, RVs & Cabins
description:
Find your perfect camping experience with Hipcamp! We work with landowners so you can discover and book tent camping, RV parks, cabin rentals, treehouses, and glamping—everywhere from national parks to blueberry farms. Hipcamp protects habitat and supports a growing love for the land, and to date, we’ve helped people spend more than 7 million nights under the stars. Find one-of-a-kind campsites away from the crowds and trust community photos and reviews with the Hipcamp app.

BOOK UNIQUE CAMPING, RV, & GLAMPING EXPERIENCES


• ADVENTURE: Find last-minute getaways near you or plan ahead to book the best campgrounds, yurts, treehouses, RV sites, or cabins with the app.
• EXPLORE: See real-time availability of campsites in top national parks like Yosemite, Zion, the Great Smoky Mountains, and Yellowstone, as well as destinations from Hawaii to the Hudson Valley.
• FILTER: Select your next stay based on price, location, group size, pet-friendliness, bathrooms, showers, campfires, wifi, and more.
• INVITE: Invite travel companions and easily share camping trip details with your friends and family.
• ENJOY: Purchase homemade goods, gear rentals, and outdoor experiences like yoga classes, foraging tours, and more.
• NAVIGATE: Use the map view to discover places to stay on your road trip.

Featured in the New York Times, USA Today, Fast Company, the New Yorker, the Washington Post, Condé Nast Traveler, Lonely Planet, and more.

SHARE YOUR FEEDBACK


• 24/7 support from real people.
• Questions? Get in touch at hipca.mp/support
• Enjoying the app? Please leave a five-star review!
releaseNotes:
Hey Hipcampers! We're thrilled to bring you:
- Bug fixes and improvements
- Rv Profiles

We hope you love these updates as much as we do! Happy Hipcamping!

Enjoying the app? Please leave a five-star review!

Questions? Get in touch at https://hipca.mp/support. We'd love to hear from you.
reviews:
It’s fast and convenient to search and book camping sites! | This was our first Hipcamp experience and the bar was set REALLY high! These little cabins are even better than pictured. No detail has been missed. It’s clean, the bed is comfy, the view is beautiful, and the location is great. So close to town square and cute restaurants. Be sure to drive over to Calfkiller Brewery—another gem. Truly can’t think of one bad thing to say, this place is the Bee’s Knees! | Absolutely stunning and wonderful gal Jennifer who runs this place. So many butterflies and bees and birds, she takes pride in her piece of heaven. Thanks for sharing your place with the public! -Jen from WA | Perhaps it’s been the areas where I’ve traveled, but have had several incidents where camp spots were not as described and I didn’t have a good way to find another safe place to camp. I found Hipcamp to be not only unhelpful in addressing the camp issues, but they shut down my ability to provide an accurate review on their site. From issues with extreme trash, loose dogs and a locked camp where I couldn’t get in and was very far away from any other options to a place where pictures were extremely misleading and the “quiet” camp spot ended up being next to a road and access to internet wasn’t available I have found this service less reliable than simply using the internet and Google reviews. | Love Hipcamp! Super easy to use. | There’s a terrible bug in the app. After I’ve viewed a few properties, I start seeing the camp sites from the previous property I looked at showing up in latest property I just clicked on. I’ve tried closing and restarting the app several times and it doesn’t seem to fix the issue. This is making it impossible to choose a camp site for our holiday. | I like many of the options of HipCamp.

Things that could be better…

First…
It would be nice to see your favorite button have a map selection for doing a road trip and seeing all your saved locations visually spaced.
Saved spots should have a heart logo over them when searching around the map.

Secondly…
Photos assorted by groups (like realtor.com)
Group 1: tent sites
Group 2: bathrooms (if any) and photos inside
Group 3: amenities 
Group 4: grounds
Group 5: off camp grounds of places nearby | You are unable to get ahold of their customer service, you have to message with their bot who files a “ticket” that they are supposed to respond to but you will never heard back from them. Unfortunately the host we booked with lied about amenities and I’m having trouble getting a refund after having to book other accommodations. | Your App constantly hangs up locks up, covers the screen so it’s impossible to return to other screens I quit using it because it’s such a hassle this is a new iPhone it’s your app. | I just spent 20 minutes writing a review and when I selected the post button it blew up 
I think the link is broken, and then I could not find a way to write a new one, maybe you can find it in a log somewhere a post it | We arrived and our host was not there, but we communicated over email. We had the place to ourselves; quiet, lovely view, bathroom and water. We never saw Clay! | Right by a creek, with great fire pit, and secluded at night. The hosts were very nice and helpful. Things we did not anticipate were people talking on the trail very close by that woke us up every morning that we could see constantly through the day and a very intense work out. I mean, incredible endurance up and down trek to the camp site to get gear for camping. So if you expect total privacy and complete relaxation without any effort, pick somewhere else. Otherwise, this place has some definite beauty with the sacrifice. | great visit.   they even brought flowers and made the site pretty. | I was on a road trip with my spouse and children when we discovered Bob's land at the last minute. We arrived after sunset, were not in the mood for camping, and the kids were exhausted. Bob's Popup was not set up because the season had not yet begun, and he is welcome to stay at the campsite. But when he met us, he changed his mind and instantly set up the Popup. In all of my travels, I've never encountered a more kind, friendly, and compassionate host. The campsite has a river in front of us, and there is a lot of wildlife. Bonfire is allowed, clean, cold water and compost toilets are available. Highly recommended place for camping! | First night done and it was amazing but we always setup multiple hammocks and prefer to just go hammock camping when possible. Could you set up a sub category for that???? | Super stoked to start using this. Me and my dog are first time campers and would like to make it a lifestyle, and I was finding it extremely difficult to find place for us that weren’t booked, had breed restrictions, or restricted dogs all together. Thank you for this app! | We are continually impressed with your software. It makes sharing our space with others a pleasant experience. Your guest communication platform is quite helpful. We can offer help with their campfire etc without going into their space. If my husband has reached out to them I am in the loop as well. The confirmed booking list is great for a quick reminder who our next guest is. 

Again thank you for all your hard work on this platform. We really appreciate it. | Off the Beaten Path Adventures love using Hipcamp on our travel trips.  It’s so easy to search and make reservations even at last minute. Every host so far has been great and helpful.  Keep up the good work. | The one experienced I had the provider of the campsite completely completely lied about the description! It was dirty didn’t look anything like it was pictured! It’s literally described as a cave, and there is no cave it was a tarp that was over a rocky area that wasn’t even present when I arrived. The sofa situation that they had picture which looked like a bed was torn apart by wild animals and left tossed all over the place. The campfire was a mess and had trash by it. | Our host was absolutely wonderful, Cheryl went out of her way to make us feel welcomed and comfortable. It was the most beautiful place to watch the Eclipse! | With several apps to choose from, we chose Hipcamp due to it’s target group, easy use and resources.  As a first time host, we set up a small camp for the 2024 eclipse and drew in the best group of campers!  Thanks so much for a great kickoff. We look forward to years of use and happy campers!  Robert | Wow, just found Hipcamp and so glad I did. I searched multiple areas to figure out what would work best for us. The reservation was super easy to make!! | I was charged for a booking that was never used as had made a booking, but then I couldn’t get a hold of the host and so I tried to make another booking so I have a place for that evening, but I also couldn’t get a hold of them and so I ended up getting a hotel and I was not reimbursed for thestay because Hipcamp leaves it up to the host to refund and of course this host does not want to refund, but they’re listing said they were next to a pack and a trail which was untrue. They were next to a busy intersection of a 6 Lane Rd. and a neighborhood that does not welcome camping in the backyard so I definitely felt unsafe I will not be booking again. It was too confusing and I spent way too much money and I didn’t get a refund for what I got. | Everything from the perfect directions from Susan our Camp Host, to the beautiful working farm, to the great graveled site accommodating our 35ft fifth wheel was just wonderful. The rv sites have access to bathrooms and a kitchen. No Wi-Fi, but if you have access to hot spot on your phone your good. The farm is located about 30 minutes from Williamsburg VA and there’s a Food Lion grocery about 7-8 miles away. We will definitely recommend this camp and will be back if we get back this way! | We really loved our stay at this ranch. Dax was very friendly and welcoming. The river was beautiful. Lots of wildlife made it fun. Dax provided great firewood and picked us a beautiful site for watching the sunset. My boys loved it and want to go back. | Camp Tiny was a great place to park our RV right on Hwy 7 . We were able to hike at Sam’s Throne, Alum Cove Natural Bridge & we were able to get to Fern Falls from the Camp.  If you are wanting a clean safe spot to camp while you explore this area, Camp Tiny is a good spot. A scenic drive to Jasper for a few restaurants, & grocery store was nice! | We had a group of four and stopped here on the way from NC to Arkansas .... Clean , established campsites with terrific views. Sunset was spectacular with an added view of a twinkling Nashville skyline .  Would definitely look to stay here again on future trips .  Google maps was spot on. 
Michael was a terrific host . We had the pleasure of meeting him and it was a treat to hear some of his adventures as well. | My boyfriend and I love to travel, but we never plan where we go/camp. We’ve always been the last minute kind of people. We love that we can pull the app up and find secluded or family, friendly stays! Easy to use, and always are go to. | Highly recommend this peaceful spot for stay over! Tamara responded to my questions quickly & helped me get situat d
Most grateful! I’ll be back | We camp on the East Coast. Finding a campsite in a park can be difficult, especially on weekends. Using Hipcamp, we have stayed at a variety of places when campgrounds were full. Each experience was excellent. We use hipcamp as our go-to when planning new trips. You won’t be disappointed. | Enjoyed the park, and the camping area was nice and clean. Inside of tent could of been cleaner, however the presentation was nice. Would do it again in the future and longer than one night. | I like the idea of this app but find it very frustrating when searching for a campsite there’s no option to see only those available. Even though you can put your date in, all the campsites show up and you have to slog your way through to find an open one on busy dates.
Plus, needs more photos & many more reviews by REAL users, not the professional photographers & influencers- ugh, totally not authentic opinions. | Highly recommend! 
A great way to make some extra cash. | So excited to use this app . For someone who lives in the city with an outdoor passion this is perfect. | Our first use of Hipcamp was with Pennylane Farm in Sorrento Fl. It was a great experience. Mark was very nice and made sure we had what we needed. The farm was beautiful and well maintained. They have two horses that would occasionally come by to visit.   We weren’t sure what to expect camping on someone’s property but after one day, we wanted to stay longer. Unfortunately it was already booked but we will be back to Pennyland Farm. | We found the Collins Family Farm while looking for a RV site for the weekend.  I can’t begin to explain how pleasantly surprised we were.  The hosts communication about the farm as well as local amenities was superb.  Very accommodating and informative.  This place is amazing. From the cute goats, horse, chickens, pigs and “Edwardo” the turkey.  We never longed for animal companionship. On our first night we were met by what I would call the  Collins Family Farm mascot “Cheeta Collins” the most friendly 4 legged feline I’ve come across. He met our dog Kane  and after a few games of tag I truly believe they are life long friends it’s truly a unique and beautiful getaway.  We were so 
Impressed we booked for the following weekend to bring the entire family.  A true gem. | I love hosting hipcampers and always enjoy being able to visit with them and help them have a great experience! | Lisa was a fantastic host. She brought us farm fresh eggs from her neighbor’s chickens. We met her Cutting Horse Flacca and Lisa showed us what a Cutting Horse does. Great, quiet, safe stay. We will be back. | We were able to hang up 3 hammocks and put up a Coleman 4 person tent under the covered portion of this structure. First night we had so much rain and the second night dropped into the 30’s. We put up tapestries and tarps to help with the wind and rain and had a propane heater so we didn’t freeze. The porta-potty was fine to use. 

Lots of twigs and logs around the property for a fire. 

Jesse was a great communicator! We plan on coming back. | Easy to use and seems to have many places all over the country. | I am new to Hipcamp, but so far…GREAT EXPERIENCE! My first host camp is awesome! I highly recommend it to anyone in Sandy, OR area! | I have most of the camp site apps and HipCamp is the ONLY one that delivers every. Single. Time. I’ve had some amazing solo trips and even better, some great memory building trips with my kids. The variety of sites allow me to select how “rough”I want to rough it and there is ALWAYS one in my price range. Really happy I found this app and am able to expose my kids to the great outdoors. | Very simple, easy way to earn cash from your property! | Verizon | Exceptionally beautiful with grand oaks covered in Spanish moss.  Super quiet.  Occasional moo from local cows and a flock of chickens that pass by from time to time.  Clean, organized and with a great host who answers any questions quickly. | Spur of the moment spontaneous adventure- my wife and I found Hickory Nut Point Friday afternoon about 3:00 on Hipcamp. We decided to make the short 40 minute drive. We were greeted by Cameron who graciously gave us a tour of his great property. We camp out of a Jeep Wrangler, so we set up camp, ate dinner while admiring the great view of the lake. It was a nice cool, quiet and peaceful night. This morning we Caught an amazing sunrise over the lake while eating breakfast. We reluctantly broke camp and headed back to the “real world”. Cameron and Rochelle were great host. We’ll be back!!
Thank you,
Stephen and Sherri | It was a very pleasant stay, Tammy was a very good host! I felt very comfortable. The area is so beautiful. The campsite is very well maintained, the bathrooms are in perfect condition and really new. I would definitely return to this place! | Hipcamp is an ingenious way to connect people together and help us bond through a mutual respect and love of the outdoors! Had so much fun at Casita in the Hills Ranch down in Texas!!!! Will definitely book more trips!!!! | I am always amazed by the unique options for camping and glamping across the country. Recently used in Australia as well and it worked great! I also love collecting Hipcamp patches :) | We love Hipcamp! We stayed at a lovely location in Long Beach, WA and since then have used the site for camping reservations! Lots of good choices!

title: by the ways: Road Trip Planner
description:
Enter where you want to start and finish your trip, then discover amazing stops along your route. Try out our most advanced "search along the route" that makes millions of hidden gems visible for you in seconds. This tool is perfect for road trip fans, car travelers, RVer... and anyone who wants to experience more.

BEFORE THE TRIP: BUILD YOUR ROUTE
Explore routes of several 100 kilometers in no time. Enter your starting point and destination and be surprised how many interesting stops await you along the way.

PLACES OFF THE BEATEN PATH 
Discover hidden sights, cafés or accommodations, that only few tourists know about - most of them only a few minutes away from the highway. We've already unlocked millions of places for you in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Denmark. (Coming soon to all of Europe.)

FILTER BY TRAVEL TIME
We show you not only where a detour is worthwhile, but also how much time you need for the detour. You can filter stops by actual travel time (e.g. max. 10 minutes drive).

FOR FAMILIES WHO LOVE TO TRAVEL
While travelling with kids, you'll take many breaks. Instead of a rest stop at a service station - how about an adventure playground or a picnic with a view? by the ways shows you family-friendly stops that are often only 5 minutes away from your route.

ALSO WORKS WITH GOOGLE MAPS & CO.
Once you have found a stop, send the location to your favourite navigation tool - with just one click. And off you go on your adventure. 

Imprint (German): https://www.bytheways.io/impressum
Privacy Policy (German): https://www.bytheways.io/datenschutz
Terms of Use: https://www.bytheways.io/agb
https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
releaseNotes: - a string of minor updates

title: Lambus | Travel Planner
description:
Lambus - Your all-in-one travel companion!

Conquer the world with ease and plan your next adventure with Lambus - the ultimate travel app that has everything you need for your trip! From trip planning to organizing your documents to managing expenses, we've got it all under control so you can focus on your adventure! Whether you're traveling solo or on a group adventure, Lambus is your reliable companion on every trip.

# Simply plan, experience more!
So much world, so little time! That's why we've made itinerary planning as easy as possible. Mark your destinations as stops and add interesting places effortlessly. Want to change something? No problem! Move or delete your stops in a snap. Planning your trip has never been so easy!

# Import itineraries made easy
Whether you're planning a bike tour, motorcycle tour or hiking adventure - with Lambus you can easily import .gpx files from popular manufacturers like Garmin and all participants of your trip will have instant access to the itineraries. Or you can simply create a new route directly in our route planner.

# Everything in one place - No more chaos in your documents
No more confusing lists and lost emails! With Lambus, you collect all your travel documents in one safe place. So you (and your travel companions) can access them at any time, even offline!

# Keep travel expenses under control
Lambus makes it easy to keep track of your travel expenses. You're on a group trip and want to split the expenses? No problem! We'll even do the math for you! Just fill in the form, calculate your debts and pay directly.

# Manage practical notes
Whether you want to share your Airbnb PIN code with the group, create a packing list, or just jot down your passport number, Lambus helps you manage notes easily and securely.

# Get inspired!
Still no idea where to go next? Browse through our Discover feature and get inspired by the many destinations. Whether it's an exciting road trip through the USA, a city break in a European metropolis or a relaxing beach vacation - you'll find it here. Every day we publish exciting trips with stops and travel tips!

# Book your tickets
With our transportation feature, you can not only plan routes between stops, but also easily deposit or book your transportation. Once you book your tickets, they are automatically added to your travel documents!

Visiting more than one place? Lambus is the ultimate travel app for backpackers, road trippers and world travelers! Plan your next adventure effortlessly with our innovative travel planner. What are you waiting for? Download Lambus and start your next adventure with us!
releaseNotes: Thank you for using Lambus! This update contains bug fixes and improvements :-)
reviews:
I really like the UI, it’s easy to navigate and has the right things that you need for planning. 

A few improvements though. First, when you search for places for your plan, the result doesn’t narrow down to your destination. Instead, it will display all the places with similar names in the entire world. When I plan for my trip to Paris, why would I want to see places in Australia and Canada?

Second, management of sub groups within a trip would be great. For example, allow creating trip to Paris and Berlin and Rome under a larger plan called Trip to Europe. And then allow forwarding of reservation emails to the Trip to Europe plan for automatic imports. Thanks. | Would love to see the document section incorporate actual word and excel documents...odd that it doesn’t support that.

Notifications could be more specific...pretty generic at the moment.

Would love to see hiking/camping trips incorporated, to include camp sites.

Great App! Keep building it and improving! | Great idea. But everything is based on where you’re going rather than the chronological order in which you seeing/doing everything. You can list places by date but not specific times in a day. And the main title is the waypoint, not what you’re doing. App is simple & clean but not very useful for me

title: Route Planner: Optiway
description:
Save Fuel, Money, Time and get home earlier with Optiway Route Planner!

We help drivers finish work an hour early, save more than 20% time spent on the road and money on fuel. Optiway Route Planner has been built to solve all your routing problems.
You’re a courier, a delivery driver, or a retailer? Optiway will help make delivery easy!

The most intuitive route planner for the multi-stop deliveries. Updated multi-stop route planner app to figure out your best streets and trips for any package delivery driver, road trip planner and navigator.

Navigate the way you like with support from - Google Maps, Apple maps and Waze

Optiway will help you:

• Optimize up to 200 stops to avoid traffic
• Add stop settings, time windows and more
• Navigate the way you like with support from - Google Maps, Apple maps and Waze
• Easy to export your Route report (PDF or EXCEL)
• Save and plan your delivery history
• Choose the length of time you want to spend at each stop
• Get instant and accurate estimated arrival times
• One-click to navigate to your next stop

Free 7-day trial
Try Optiway  for free with a 7-day trial to see how much time and fuel you can save.

Love Optiway? Please rate us!

The following plans are available for the user: 

Monthly
Annual

The information about each of the passes is as follows: 

Monthly
The pass is valid for 1 month from the date of purchase. 
The pass auto-renews at the end of the subscription period for the same duration until cancelled.
The pass should be canceled 24 hours before the renewal for the renewal not to take effect.

Annual
The pass is valid for the 1 year from the date of purchase.
The pass auto-renews at the end of the subscription period for the same duration until cancelled.
the pass should be cancelled 24 hours before the renewal for the renewal not to take effect.

Your subscription will be charged to your iTunes account at confirmation of purchase and will automatically renew (at the duration selected) unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period.

Current subscription may not be cancelled during the active subscription period. However, you can manage your subscription and/or turn off auto-renewal by visiting your iTunes Account Settings after purchase.

Privacy policy: https://optiway-app.com/Privacy_Policy/
Terms of use: https://optiway-app.com/terms/
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and improvements
reviews: Hi, I love this app as it saves me a lot of time in a day to do my delivery routes and it optimizes my route great and I have recommended this to other delivery drivers in my company and I would like it if they could come out with an update that allows the app to include the apartment number or the unit number as other apps I’ve used have included it automatically and I would love it if they can come out with an update that will do that other than that I love the app and I highly recommend using it as I’ve used other apps, and the optimization hasn’t been as great as this program so I love this very much. Thank you. | Thanks to the route planner app, I'm now able to take on more deliveries while saving money on fuel expenses. | It's helped me save money on fuel and optimize my delivery routes, which means I can get home earlier. I saved about 2 hours last week | Works great! | I highly recommend it to other delivery drivers and couriers.

title: Trip Planner, Social: Seenspot
description:
Think TikTok meets Tripadvisor  - Seenspot makes travel planning so easy, you actually want to do it!

Snap and share your travel videos with Seenspot. Find new friends around you with common interests and build your travel community! Want to see what's going on nearby or around the world? Check out the interactive travel map. Ready to book a stay? Our AI searches through the entire web to show you the best prices.

SHARE

Take a video or upload it from your gallery. Choose to record up to 30-second videos. Upload your own videos and share them with other travelers, with up to 60-second videos. Create your following and find new friends.

DISCOVER (like TikTok, Snapchat and IG Reels, but for Travel)

View the latest travel videos on the Discover screen. Search for your favorite hashtags in the search bar and for other travelers, new friends, or family to follow.

TRIP PLANNER (like Tripsy, Tripadvisor, Wanderlog, Roadtrippers)

Head on over to the travel tab and plan your next trip. Search and bookmark from over 100+ million hot spots like restaurants, hotels, fun things to do, and more!

BOOK TRAVEL (like Expedia, Hopper, and Airbnb)

Search for the best rates on hotels, and activities for your travel needs. We use A.I. to search the web to find you the best deal from partners such as Expedia, Agoda, Kiwi, etc. You are shown ALL the results with zero manipulation! No extra charges or fees!

Map (like Google Maps for Travel)

Tag your location when uploading your video, so people nearby can see them and others around the world! We DO NOT share your location. You choose what location to enter when tagging your video. Your privacy is a top priority!

 REAL-TIME NOTIFICATIONS 

Get notifications when someone follows you or comments on your travel video. Chat with family and friends to keep up to date on your current or upcoming trips. 


JOIN A TRAVEL COMMUNITY

Create your own travel stories to share with the community. You can easily share them on the web, on social, or on a blog.  

SAY Hi

You can find us on IG → @seen_spot

title: COtrip Planner
description:
The COtrip app is the Colorado Department of Transportation's (CDOT) official real-time traffic and traveler information app. The COtrip app provides statewide travel information for Colorado’s interstates, U.S. routes and state highways. It does not include information for county roads or city streets.

Features:
- Zoomable and mobile-friendly map display
- Traffic speeds and road conditions
- Real-time updates on road maintenance, construction, restrictions and road closures
- Camera images and live streaming video
- Trucker mode with resources specific to commercial motor vehicle operators
- Winter weather conditions (seasonal)
- Plow tracker
- Hands-free, eyes-free feature to announce upcoming road conditions that will impact your route

Please Note: Continued use of GPS running in the background can decrease device battery life.

Drop the Distraction
The primary responsibility of every driver is the safe operation of their vehicle. While traveling, mobile communication devices should be used only when the motor vehicle is at a complete stop off the traveled portion of the roadway. Do not text and drive (it's against the law) or use this app while driving. For more information about distracted driving in Colorado and safety tips, visit https://distracted.codot.gov.

Feedback
We welcome your feedback on this app. Please send your suggestions, questions or concerns in an email to cdot_cotrip@state.co.us. For tutorials and more information, visit COtrip.org.

CDOT Privacy Policy: https://codot.gov/topcontent/privacypolicy
releaseNotes:
Emphasize high impact events in search results
Map decluttering improvements
Add safe driving pop-up
reviews:
Road closures and camera info without time stamps is worthless.  The app doesn’t seem to be updating but you can’t tell for sure because the information isn’t tied to a specific time. | Worthless app and data.  Don't bother.  The August review called 2 levels of terrible nails it | This is a useful tool, but a very clunky app to use. Favorites do not seem to work. There is a favorites button present in certain views, but pressing it doesn’t do anything. When I look for a route from Denver to Winter Park, it is currently routing me through Silverthorne and Kremmling. But it shows Berthoud pass is open. This makes no sense because it adds about two hours to my trip. This is obviously a contradictory result. I will generally use this only in conjunction with Google Maps and other sources. CDot warns against using any alternate routing app, but theirs is not ready for prime time. | The colors chosen are too close in shade to make the map meaningful. All bland earth tones. No red or yellow or green usually associated with road conditions. An existing closure (I-70) is not even shown as such. | The go to app for trucking through Colorado | Again the app lets us down.  Big storm in Denver, and the host has frozen.  Now I know that castlerockits handles more states thsn just Colorado.  Weather today is not a nationwide event, and Colorado is not a large population state.  Castlerockits should be able to handle this. CDOT, if you read this, find another vendor or bring it in house.

Don
March 14, 2024 | Come on, you can do better. I click on the I-70 on ramp at red rocks and you have a system failure. Come on, this is easy to fix. | The color scheme designating the road conditions is too difficult to discern. I miss the written list of warnings and restrictions. | When incidents occur they don’t get uploaded to the app soon enough. Closures of Loveland Pass and tunnel metering at Eisenhower should be posted as alerts. | This app should come up on your cars view screen like Apple Maps. So you can see how road conditions are as you travel. That would be very helpful. Too many things that are not important to choose from. And not very good when looking at conditions outside Denver area. | I think the rest of the negative reviews have said it all.  Hope cdot creates a simpler more user friendly app. | Not at all user friendly. Tips on how to sign up have no relevancy to present site | One can view roadways through out Colorado. I am uncertain what people expect but this site is pretty darn cool. I use it to preview road conditions, accidents and other highway issues as I travel or as the site says when I am planning a trip in Colorado. One can actually traffic conditions and if there are stoppages from all sorts of issues. Makes one realize the government can view you just about anywhere in Colorado on public roads. | Terrible app.   Impossible to navigate , information is not current.  Better to use google maps, Apple Maps or Waze | At a road closure and COtrip app isn’t updated to reflect that yet. 

Can’t depend on a site that doesn’t have real-time information posted. | Not sure I have ever utilized a more unhelpful app. Actually quite impressive that CDOT can make such a useless platform. The map interface is worthless, route feature is impossible to navigate, and updates are buried away. 0/5 don’t recommend. | how do i get my phone number back if someone else registered it? | Terrible web support | What happened to the cameras an hwy133 around mile marker 26 and 43 | This app has everything you need to know for planning your Skis trip | The user interface on this is terrible. | Overall i have been happy with this app. But with recent update, The route function no longer works (can’t search for end point). Since this is how i mostly used app, it’s much less useful now. Please fix. | Took what was a useful App for mountain corridor travel and made a useless App. Whoever made all these changes is fleecing the state by drastically complicating what worked into a mess. | The app has no functionality to give current road updates.  Had to use isvailpassopen.com to actually get road info.  Even 511 is total crap now.  That’s wrong with this govt org, have you tried to use this app when driving? It’s awful!!! | The app is very complicated to use when you need it most for road closures | I like selecting the camera layer and then setting directions to see all the cameras along the route.  I also like the road conditions overlay. | Why don’t app developers use a little everyday common sense? | We love this app, and use it all the time! It only has one MAJOR thank you flaw! The colors on the map for road conditions are to close, and therefore, are very hard to distinguish, especially for those with vision issues. Please fix this and choose bright colors that are very different from each other for each of the road conditions. If that is done, this app immediately becomes a 5 Star App! Until then, it gets a three… Barely! | Quick and easy access to road conditions and rest areas. We will be using this to get across Colorado with a group of campers. Should be a fun trip. | The decision to make this a “planner” which focuses on driving directions was a horrible one.  Google Maps and Waze, as well as proprietary car makers’ in-car mapping work superbly.  So why recreate the wheel with this one?  COTrip worked superbly as an indicator of road conditions (verifiable with the cameras and now eliminated video cams) for Colorado residents/voters who know how to get where they are going.  You could easily check what your drive was going to be like and plan alternate routing (or delay your trip) if traffic was heavy or conditions were dangerous.

Now, with 75% of the screen taken up with useless top, bottom and side bars and icons, the map is tiny, and cameras (only still) hard to access.

Conditions and traffic are not updated in real time, which is especially frustrating when ColoradoDOT Twitter feed is also rarely updated.

All in all, a horrible re-do of the app. | There are two levels of terrible here. One is the app itself. The user interface designers made inexplicable choices. More importantly, CDOT’s data flow into this system makes the app mostly worthless. The timeliness, quality, and quantity of information CDOT feeds into the system of their lit road information signs, website, and app means that even a finely polished app would be useless. I get it. It’s challenging. CDOT is one thing, local dispatch another, reality on the ground yet a third. But CDOT is mostly useful as an agency for awarding various contracts (including to make an app). The actual value added by, say, having employees who can use their creativity and skills to integrate these data streams better to make CDOT’s road information system better, is close to 0. Don’t worry – CDOT can award a contract for that (to someone who doesn’t really get it). | Easier to use than the mobile website because at least the map area is a little bigger. But still doesn’t help me understand what’s going on with the huge traffic jam on I70 (and if it is being cleared or what). I tried looking at the cameras, I can see a map with little camera icons but when I tap them nothing happens. I guess I can use the arrows on the camera picture to switch to different cameras but I can’t make sense of where they are on the map so I don’t know what I’m looking at. | This is a very unintuitive app. I use a lot of software programs, and this one is very difficult to use. For example, the time calculation is stuck on walking. I cannot find a place in the iPad app to change it to driving. The program needs a menu to change options and settings. | Google maps is even better.  Sat in several gridlocks along I70 where google maps shows accident.  This says nothing.  Only good thing is the cameras.  Which obviously this app doesn’t look at. | US 6 Loveland pass sometimes shown closed when it is not and usually shown open when the road is closed.
Difficulty navigating the app means the only thing it is good for is looking at the cameras - when they work and are clean enough to show road conditions.
It’s a bad app that replaced a useful app. The old app indicated travel times between various points and was easier to use.
The current iteration is just user vicious and annoying. | … lime green font color for cities, considered readability color contrast, I’ll rate this app higher. | What good is an app if you have to log in each time you use it? | Great app. Has lots of layers can add cameras to see the road conditions, accidents etc. Good app for driving in winter. Says in Apple App Store no data collected. | Either using this app wrong or it does not seem to be very accurate or delayed in getting accurate information. Tried using several times and always the same experience. | Road closures, restrictions, snow plow locator, much more, very helpful. | Information not timely and app logs you out.   Ui is just not any good | I haven’t had to use COtrip.org since last ski season, and I discovered the new app version, but both are completely useless with this redesign. When we were driving from Golden to Frisco last night, the drive times were extremely long on Google maps, but your info said only “heavy traffic” and “poor conditions.” What was not evident was that Hwy 6 over Loveland Pass was closed, forcing delays through the tunnel with all the hazmat trucks backed up. All I could see was your confusing map with various colors and circles. I could tell Loveland Pass was closed, and I figured that was the issue, but I had to discern all this with no context. I wanted to find a description of I-70 with written information.How on earth could you have moved to such a cumbersome system? Look at all these reviews over the past year, and return to functionality, please! | As a trucker this is exactly what we’re looking for | How about a simple non-graphical interface that can be used with one finger that lets you see what’s coming on your route.

Also, there is no reason to for this sort of app to need a login.  

Years ago this app was great and I used it all the time. | Difficult to use, crashes, functions don’t work | How do you have cameras but they don’t work , what’s the point of having them. They have not worked for 4 days now and nobody has done anything. This is at least for the cameras across all of I-70 none of them work and this is for safety, so I guess y’all want people to just guess at the road conditions and then cause more accidents and y’all don’t care if people get hurt or injured or even worse. | Traveling over Christmas and count on the cameras. And they are not working. | What’s the point of this when none of the cameras are operational? I haven’t had one produce an image or video for a month or more now. Must be that good ole Colorado Department of Transportation work ethic. | Some of the information for trucks is unclear or overlapping just enough to makes information unclear in locations. | Colorado don’t update things for over 12 hours at a time hard to plan routes.

title: Circuit Route Planner
description:
Easy-to-use multi-stop route planner and delivery app downloaded by over 10 million drivers - Sign up for a FREE trial today! 
Deliver more packages and finish your route faster. Save time, money, and gas with Circuit Route Planner. 

Adding stops to a route takes seconds. A single click optimizes all your deliveries and automatically maps out the fastest routes. Avoid traffic, find packages quicker, and deliver more efficiently.

Using Circuit Route Planner, you can...
• Find and add stops easily using your keypad, voice, or Apple Live Text
• Add an unlimited number of deliveries and routes per day
• Avoid traffic and delays with a route planner that automatically maps the fastest routes
• Make last-minute changes to routes during the day
• Use it with your favorite GPS - Waze, Google Maps, Apple Maps, and more…
• Set delivery time windows and priority levels for specific stops
• Customize the amount of time to spend at each stop, and add rest breaks
• Get instant and accurate ETAs
• Add package details to make loading your truck and locating an item easier 
And much more…

The top-choice route planning and delivery app for couriers and delivery drivers, used to deliver in over 180 countries. Helping drivers discover the best routes, avoid traffic, boost earnings, and finish ahead of schedule every day.

“I’m a courier and deliver about 150 packages a day. This route planner always gives me the fastest route, so I can deliver more packages in less time. I make more money and save around an hour a day using Circuit. It’s the best app of all the ones I’ve tried” - Nathan, Canada

Circuit Route Planner - Free
The free version of Circuit Route Planner gives you unlimited access to all features, but routes are limited to a maximum of 10 stops.

Circuit Route Planner - Premium 
Try Circuit Route Planner Premium and see how much time and fuel you can save in a week with our 7-day Circuit Route Planner Premium free trial. On average, most multi-drop couriers make savings of over $200 per month.

7-day trial complete? Subscribe to Circuit Route Planner Premium for just $20 USD per month, and your subscription will give you access to unlimited features, stops, and routes. Save time, money, and gas by using a delivery route planner that helps you do more and finish your route faster.

FAQs

Will Circuit Route Planner work in my country?
Circuit Route Planner works in almost every country because it uses location data provided by Google Maps. If Google Maps works where you live, then Circuit Route Planner will work for you. We have users in over 200 countries and on every continent.

Which languages does Circuit support?
Circuit will automatically use your phone language if it is supported. If it is not, it will default to US English

How many routes can I create?
You can have unlimited routes on the free and premium version of Circuit Route Planner

How many stops can I add to my route?
You can add up to ten stops per route on the free version of Circuit Route Planner. 
You can add an unlimited number of stops per route on the premium version of Circuit Route Planner which is $20 per month.

How do I subscribe/cancel my subscription?
Subscriptions auto-renew monthly and are charged to your iTunes account. Cancel anytime by turning off auto-renew in your iTunes account 24 hours before the renewal date. Rates vary by country, and the local price for your region will be provided before you complete payment.

Support: https://help.getcircuit.com/en/collections/385293-circuit-for-individual-drivers
What’s new?: https://getcircuit.com/route-planner/product-updates
Terms of Service: https://getcircuit.com/terms
Privacy Policy: https://getcircuit.com/privacy

title: momondo: Flights, Hotels, Cars
description:
Find, compare & book flights, hotels, and car rental with momondo’s beautiful all-in-one travel and reservation app

We believe that everybody should be able to travel - and there's no better place to start dreaming and planning than the momondo app. A beautiful, user-friendly design makes it easy to search and compare from hundreds of travel sites at once. Find just the right flight, hotel or car rental for your next vacation or business trip, at great prices. Save on travel deals with exclusive Mobile Rates available only on the app.

FIND THE BEST FLIGHT DEALS AVAILABLE FROM 900+ TRAVEL SITES
• We search major airlines, low cost carriers and travel agencies to give you an easy overview of all the airfare options
• We highlight airline ticket options with no change fees, to make it easy to book with flexibility
• With this reservation app, you can make a flight booking directly from your device, wherever you are
• Filter plane tickets by the factors that matter to you, including number of stops, departure and arrival time, duration, airlines and ticket type
• Cheapest, quickest or best flight deal? With one click you can see which ticket is the best deal according to your needs
• Not ready to book? Save your results for later, or share them via email or text
• Search without worry - the prices you see are never affected by your searches
• Beautiful and easy to use – finding the perfect plane ticket doesn’t have to be tricky and dull

SEARCH THOUSANDS OF CAR RENTAL OFFERS AT ONCE
• See rental car deals in 70,000+ locations
• Filter your search to see eco-friendly options like hybrids and electric vehicles
• Easily filter to only see car rentals with free cancellation and enhanced cleaning
• Total transparency, no surprises -  see the total cost of your car rental up-front

SEE DEALS FROM 3M+ HOTELS AND ACCOMMODATIONS IN ONE PLACE
• Search from all the major booking, accommodation, and rental comparison sites as well as individual hotel websites to find the best place to stay
• Use our filter to find stays with free cancellation, so you can cancel and re-book a hotel or vacation rental for free if you find a better deal
• See ratings based on millions of real guest reviews, so you know what everyone else is saying about a property before you book
• Looking for something close to home? Get inspired with amazing hotel ideas in your area.
• Find last minute hotel deals with the Around Me Tonight feature
• Sort accommodation results by cheapest, closest, best review, or most popular
• Search by the amenities that matter most to you
• Beautiful and user-friendly – finding a place to stay has never looked this good or been this easy

A PERSONALIZED SEARCH EXPERIENCE
• Create your own momondo profile to keep everything the way you like it
• Not just a reservation app. Save and sync your preferences, your search history and all your favorite flights and hotels
• Search from one device – and book from another.

LOOKING FOR INSPIRATION?
Not sure where to go? Our Explore feature makes it easy to find destinations within your budget. Your next best vacation destination may be somewhere you’ve never even heard of!

Download the momondo travel app now and open your world
releaseNotes: We fixed some bugs here and there to make our app even better.

Plus, the price alert feature is a game-changer, helping me snag those unbeatable fares. Momondo has become my go-to travel companion, and I can't recommend it enough for anyone looking to plan their next adventure! | I love this app. It gives good results for every search I conduct. The fact that I can track flights makes this app even super. Will recommend it to all interested in traveling. | Ok chất lượng | Algo bueno siempre tiene margen de mejora. | Very good | Perfect 🤩 | Very good | Searching all those sites at once is really powerful and helpful! | This search engine has great options and comprehensive listing of fares and itineraries. Excellent filters too. Very good if you need to search for for mildly complicated transoceanic routes. | As someone who has been a pro at shopping best deals for flights for years, momondo is hands down the best app for the job. | With iPhone 13 app doesn’t work | I’ve loved the speed and ease of this app, but recently realized I need to be more vigilant about where it is sending you for the deals. 

Searched for flights, and upon selecting one we liked, was redirected to a different site, “Flights Mojo.” If this happens to you, DO NOT purchase a flight from Flights Mojo, they are absolutely a scam company. After completing our reservation, we received an email that it was not complete until we called them. The number took us to a call center abroad where we are  informed that the flights we reserved are not available, and then the operator tried to extract more money for completely different flights through completely different cities. It was *extremely* difficult to leave the call with any assurances that we weren’t being charged, and we are still really worried about having given them credit card info. Other reviews of Flights Mojo online have nightmare stories about reservations cancelled and no refunds issued, demands for more and more fees as well as photos of identification and credit cards to be sent. Lots of people left high and dry when they try to use tickets. 
I have no idea if Momondo does any vetting for where it sends you with searches, but please be aware that in this instance they’re allowing a very sketchy company to solicit your financial information. | I have been looking at multiple airlines who fly to me requested destination and This app is only showing one option. Read online for honest customer reviews before paying or book directly with the airline. | Really good in searching for cheap prices and it’s my go-to app for almost all my travel expenses | Wether it’s a room or a flight you’re looking for, I’ve found, by far, the cheapest and yet high quality places and airlines through this app. | Excellent | I’ve bought 2 plane tickets now using momondo and compared to the experience using other services e.g. KAYAK, momondo seems to have all the upsides and none of the downsides. title: Packing List Travel Planner
description:
Worried you’re going to forget something important on your next trip? Not anymore! With Pack This, you’ll never forget a thing again.

**Now with a vacation countdown timer included for free!**

Pack This will be your go-to app to prep for those upcoming getaways, whether big or small. Easily categorize and itemize everything you and the rest of the crew need to do and bring along for every adventure. 

Simply set up your trip dates, who’s going with you, and start building your Pack This lists…

Categorize lists the way YOU want to. We won’t overwhelm you with pre-populated headings and items you don’t need or care about. And once you’ve built one list, we’ve made it easy to duplicate and modify it for similar trips in the future. 

We know planning often gets spearheaded by one “lucky” person in the group. If you are that special someone (and we think you are if your reading this!), adding fellow travelers and tagging them for each task makes your life a whole lot simpler. When your list is complete, email it to each of your travel mates so there’s no confusion on who’s supposed to bring what. 

We didn’t stop there…

Here are a couple of other features we think you’ll love:
* Trip countdown clock that keeps a tally of how many days  until you take off 
* Real-time weather updates (which will make sure you don’t forget an umbrella or a sweater) 

Be the ultimate leader of the pack with Pack This!

P.S. We live for your feedback and would love to hear how you like Pack This. Please leave us a review on the App Store and tell us how we’re doing, what you love, and what you’d like to see.

P.P.S. Please email support@journohq.com with any issues or help you need. Mak or Ann will respond to you quickly! Safe travels!
releaseNotes:
Plan and prep for your adventures like never before!

Here's what's new:
• Squashed a few bugs.
• Performance improvements.

And as always, we have a full-time support team that's here to help with anything you may need. Just email support@journohq.com

Thanks for your love and support!

Travel on,
Dane & The Journo Team

PS. You should join us on Instagram for more travel inspiration: @journohq
reviews:
When you have a dark button on the right side, it implies that that is the next action that you need to perform. So I get hung up every time I want to add something and then it tells me I have to go back and type something first. to help with this confusion. Make that add button disabled until something is typed in the text field.

Also, it would be nice to add multiples of the same object. For example, when I’m packing for a trip that is seven days, I would rather add “socks“ and then dial up a counter to seven. Rather than adding socks seven times, or having to type “seven pairs of socks”. | The apps great. Very easy to use and I like the countdown. I only wish you could do multiple destinations for one trip, like when you go on a cruise. Other than that I’m really liking the app. | This app is really good, it has a lot of great features but when I downloaded it I thought you could collaborate on this app and lists with other people that have also downloaded this app. I bought the pro version and also bought it for another person thinking we could both add to the list and each see what each other had added and packed. I was sad to realize that is not a feature on this app. That was pretty much the big deciding  factor of downloading and upgrading this app. This would be a great feature for you to add. | In general, I like this app. I love that it has the trip countdown. I also really like that sharing a list does not require people to have the app. (That feature helps with my 80-year old technology challenged Mom!)

That being said, for me to get rid of paper & provide a 5-star review, there are a few things I would like to see:
- ability to sync across devices so I can fill in a Master List on a larger screen. 
- ability to share the list and have it dynamically updated by others. (Shared in real time)
- the ability to share the list and add a “due date” to make sure that something is packed. (I can enter “10 days before trip” and it calculates that for me would be a bonus!)
- the ability to create a sublist for organization. So I could create a master list item of “carryon”, a sublist item of “essential medications” then add the medications that I need to pack. Or I could pack a “car”, “backseat” etc. 

it helps to be visual in not only what you want to pack but how to arrange the packing. 

That would allow me to eliminate paper!
Thanks for reading!! | Really wanted this to work. | List does not display | Items I add to list not showing up. In app contact support button not working. Can’t upload profile picture from phone gallery. | I could add lists but the items I added to each list wouldn’t populate or show. Don’t waste your time downloading this. | I used this for a trip, found easy to use and liked. HOWEVER, now I am trying to use it for a different trip and modify it, and I cannot figure out how to transfer my previous trip into the new one without typing it all again.  Fix this or explain how to do it and it is really great. | It’s and iPad App that does not support landscape orientation… make keyboard entry cumbersome at best. In the Trash Can for me… | I’m Using this for a trip coming up, it super helpful | It would be cool to have categorized suggestions list and also a quantity count per item | They advertise it as if you can share lists with other users. My partner and I both paid for pro only to find that you can just email someone a static list, you can’t interactively share and update lists together. “Sharing lists” actually turns out to be the same thing as if you sent your travel buddy a screenshot of your list. It’s basically useless because of that. Everything else it does you can do for free in a phone note, except those are better because you actually can share and update a phone note together with someone! | Great except it only lets you make lists for 2 trips. I’m giving it three stars because of that and it acts like it can email a list but nothing happens when you try to click to email (buggy?). Perhaps the pro version is better? I was able to add additional travelers but can do nothing else. | Was hoping it would auto populate a basic packing list I could then add to. Also would be a lot more helpful to be able to cross of the lists for every traveler individually as I pack them. That was what I was needing to make sure I don’t forget items for 3 kids. I paid extra to add travelers and they don’t even get their own lists. I feel ripped off. | This app is helpful but ultimately disappointing. I will say it’s nice to be able to make multiple lists under different categories under the same vacation. 
However, once categories are created, you cannot adjust the order they show in. If you select for a list to sow alphabetically, it automatically crushed back after you choose the app.  Also you cannot change the color scheme. I paid to go pro in hopes these things would change, but no such luck. Like the toddler says, this app is useful, but underwhelming and fell short of expectations. | This app doesn’t work well at all | I love that I have the flexibility to create the categories & lists as I feel fit for each trip! I’ve used it for 2 trips with a list for me and another for my dog! I would also like to see the capability of changing the order of my categories once I’ve completed them! 

An improvement I’d like to see is my having access to the app/lists on my iPad and my iPhone!! My phone is convenient as it’s always with me for updating on the go. My iPad is much easier in creating initial list and while packing due to size of screen!!! Maybe a logon that will recognize and share our lists on both?

Thank you!
Marsi | When you open the app and type your name, the first screen that pops up appears to be an add. I made the mistake of clicking g on the “no more adds” thinking that would remove the pop up. Instead it charged my visa (2 x). Again, not sure if it’s designed to be deceptive, but it sure tricked me first thing in the morning. | I downloaded about five packing apps and this was by far the best. I didn’t need a bunch of pre-populated items suggested for me to pack (birth control pills, really?) — I just wanted a clean space where I could make a few categories for the activities I’d be doing on my trip and the items I would need to pack for them & a way to check them off. I love that you can assign yourself or someone else to pack the item and while I haven’t shared a list yet, I know I will as I plan future summer camping trips. I’ve just used the app for one trip so far, but I travel often & I will definitely be paying for the upgrade to show my appreciation! One question I ran into — is it possible to rearrange the order of your categories once you’ve typed them in? I have found that I can alphabetize my items in each category, but haven’t seen a way to move around the categories. It would be a great feature to be able to drag and drop the categories in an order that makes sense to you— for example, if I have a category for each activity I am going to do on an adventure type trip, I would list them in the order they would be happening. (This helps me see what has already been packed for a previous day and what needs to be added for the next.) Thank you!! | I have found the app very useful. I love that I can copy lists from trip to trip and just make minor changes. It has also been useful to share the lists with other travelers. 

I would suggest one improvement. If an item could moved from one category to another, then this app would be awesome. | The title says it all. | I can choose my own categories and add my own stuff, as detailed as “white linen swimsuit cover”, or as simple as “jacket”, as appropriate for that list. Love it! ☺️ | I used to love this app but now that I’m trying to modify travelers in the settings the app crashes everytime!!! | IT CANNOT GET ANY BETTER | Description says you can “add fellow travelers”, which you cannot.
