Looking forward to future updates with new sights to see. | This is so detailed and well worth every cent. Amazing to cure boredom or just relax! | This app is soooo worth the money!! The panoramas are STUNNING!! Since I don't travel anywhere "exciting," this app lets me experience those "exciting" places. The only thing I would love to see in the next update/s is a search engine which allows you to look up the place you want to see!! Other then that, this app is amazing and I recommend it to anyone who wants to see the world!! | Absolute the best app I seen in a long time,I really enjoy watching the different city and I hope y'all do one in New Orleans. | Such a cool app. Really cool to see all the different places around the world. Worth the price and more people should buy it!!! | High quality app experience with clever design and wonderful panoramic imagery. | Seriously amazing app. I get lost in it. | AirPano is unlike any other app I have found.  The 360 degree photos are stunningly clear.  I am looking forward to more video additions to the app.  I also have the Airpano video app of the Russian geysers.  Very nice.  Need some videos of the beautiful cities and other locations. | Love it!!! | I had this app for a few weeks and they never uploaded anything new. You can see all the content in a day or two and then that's it. Better off just browsing google images. | The description makes it sound fantastic, it's a stationary pic, Google earth trumps this by far. Zoom in? Barely. Pretty disappointing, got it for the kids and they were done in a minute with it, the whole app is fully explored within 10 minutes. Even some locations were quite anticlimactic and very random. | This is a really beautiful app.  The photos are really beautiful.  I can hardly wait for other locations and cities to be added. | Visually stunning | Beautiful UI, useful information | A 360 degree view of many stunning destinations. Delightful presentation. | How often do you get beautiful pictures without strings, without payment, with an excellent display.

title: No Man's Land Trip Planner
description:
The No Man's Land Trip Planner app will help you discover all the places you can explore, stay, dine, shop and meet in No Man's Land!  

 • Plan the perfect stay based on your interests, timeframe, location, and social connections
 • View upcoming events and festivals
 • Add events and places to your own customized plan
 • Share events, places, and your custom plan with friends so they can join you in No Man's Land!
releaseNotes: Performance improvements and minor bug fixes.
developer: CANE RIVER NATIONAL HERITAGE AREA, INC.

title: Scenic Motorcycle Navigation
description:
TAKE THE SCENIC ROUTE - Plan, ride, track and share your adventures with the #1 rated motorbike navigation app. 200,000 public routes, 20 million hours ridden, 130 million miles logged. 

GET THERE YOUR WAY - We’ve built a world for motorcyclists, helping you find the best routes with the twistiest turns, for paved touring and unpaved adventures. It’s not the destination that counts. It’s the journey.

FIND THE ROAD - Straight, curvy, paved, dirty - Scenic lets you control your route like no other app. And with thousands of public routes to choose from, there's always road to ride.

TAKE CONTROL - Plan routes by dropping via points and stops. Scenic will show you a route between them. Don't like it? Choose another routing mode, including curvy.

UNLOCK EPIC RIDES - Scenic has a vast database of thousands of beautiful routes, shared and rated by local Scenic users worldwide. Select an area, tap 'Search', and see what comes up. 

GO EXPLORING - Yet another way to get a great route... set the distance, then let Scenic generate a round trip for you in any given direction. Or a curvy route to a destination of your choosing.

GET ORGANISED - Found a great route online? Have some lying around in Basecamp? Whether it’s a Google Maps URL or a GPX, KML, KMZ, GDB, or ITN file, import it into Scenic to keep all your routes in one app that’s built for adventure.

FIND FOCUS - On-screen instructions, turn-by-turn navigation, and customizable detour behavior mean you can focus on the road, not your phone. When you do need to tap in, Scenic is designed to work seamlessly with your touch-enabled gloves, or one of the supported handlebar controllers.

CHOOSE YOUR VIEW - Customize your map, toggling between built-in layers like traffic flow, safety camera alerts, and 3D buildings, as well as a huge list of POIs, including fuel and EV charging stations, motorcycle services, restaurants, hotels, and more!

ONE STEP AHEAD - Dirt road visualization, elevation profiles, speed camera warnings, and traffic visualized on the map keep you prepared for what’s around the corner.

GO OFF GRID - No data/reception? No problem. Scenic’s offline maps mean you can go where others turn back.

 KNOW YOUR RIDE - Scenic not only navigates you, it also logs your location, speed, and elevation - helping you relive every moment, track your progress, and challenge your friends.

SHARE THE ADVENTURE - Leave pictures and comments for other riders in the app, get a personalized web page of your routes and rides, or share your journey straight to social media.  


* Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.

** Scenic has an optional yearly Premium Subscription with a free trial period, that gives you access to Premium Features (see scenic.app/premium for details). The subscription automatically renews after the free trial period, and then every year. The first payment will be charged to your App Store Account at the end of your trial period. It automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged within 24 hours prior to the end of each period. Subscriptions may be managed by you, and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to your Account Settings in the Apple App Store.

Scenic's privacy policy: https://scenic.app/privacy-policy
Scenic's terms of use: https://scenic.app/terms
releaseNotes:
TAKE THE SCENIC ROUTE - Plan, ride, track, and share your adventures with the all-new and improved Scenic 3.5. Added Features:  Safety Cameras, Traffic flow, Construction Zones, Dirt roads, Battery Saver, Map Layers, Navigation+, and many smaller tweaks and improvements.

New in v3.59
- Resume a route directly from CarPlay.
- Zoom buttons are hidden automatically when a handlebar controller is connected.

Bugs fixed in v3.59
- When auto-resume is turned off, tracking stops after selecting another route/destination.
- Continuous recalculation sound at the beginning of a ride when "Go to route" is showing.
- On some CarPlay systems, when unplugging from CarPlay while in navigating mode, the phone goes to the home screen and shows a blank map.
- Sometimes, offline route calculation fails when a waypoint is not exactly on a road.
- Not showing the current road name in the Carplay split screen after disconnecting from and re-connecting to CarPlay again.
- The route color does not change to the dark mode setting when starting navigation, and the navigation appearance is set to always be dark.
- When skipping a waypoint with a handlebar controller, the screen stays in edit mode without an option to close edit mode with the handlebar controller.
- Moving via points in the route timeline (in Power Planner) re-centers the map every time.
- Changes in Speed Based Zoom config do not take effect immediately if changing while navigating.
- Distance to a safety cam is covered by the speed camera icon on some CarPlay displays.
- The "Unpaved Sections" warning doesn’t fit in landscape mode.
- Map thumbnails are generated in map style at that moment, resulting in thumbnails with different styles.
- Performance and stability improvements.
reviews:
I have been using Scenic for 3 years now and it is hands down the best motorcycle navigation and route planner that I have used. Clear turn by turn voice prompts and great route planning options. Highly recommend! | Perfect for motorcycle riding. App is easy to use and very intuitive. Gives you the choice of extra twisty roads or less twisty. Keep up the great work!! | I am using this app for many years. Forget Garmin.
It is easy to use, share and create beatiful rides in a matter of few minutes. While I am enjoying my travels with help of Scenic, my club memebers attending Garmin seminar.  There is no need for seminar if you are using Scenic. Simple, user friendly. Learning curve is very short. Thank you Guido for creating this functional tool for adventure riders. I am using old Iphone-8 with no service just for navigation. And my main phone is in my jacket pocket
No need to spend $600 for nav. unit.
I am happy with this app | I really enjoy this App and how easy it is to use and plan rides | Nice customizable app. I use it for long trips. Easy to use. Works great on both Car Play and on IPhone handlebar mount. | I used to be a fan of scenic, especially it's one time payment options. Ive been using it for years , but after the recent big update, its been very unstable on ipad. It crashes over 50% of the time when I search for a location while in route planning / edit mode. That's just not acceptable. It wouldn't be as bad if there was an auto save option, but there isn't so I lose all my work! I gave it two stars instead of one in memory of when I used to be able to edit routes on ipad. | I have used many different iPhone GPS travel planning apps and guidance apps. They all have some good points and some bad. But so far, scenic looks like it has both great planning capabilities and great for use while on the road as a GPS device. Strongly recommend free version is pretty limited, but I tried it for a few days to see if I liked it and it has all the basics covered but in order to really enjoy this app you’re probably going to have to pay the subscription. So far I think it’s totally worth it and reasonable. | It is a very difficult app to use and is not user friendly in my opinion | Can you move the current year’s folder of rides to the far left instead of having the oldest year to the far left? Thanks! | I was fortunate enough to run into this app a couple years ago when I helped do the commercial for its initial launching. I must say it’s a great motorcycle travel companion app. It’s also great in the car and it’s absolutely fantastic now that it works with CarPlay. | Well designed and easy to use in place of a more expensive dedicated GPS. Some flaws in curvy mode will require careful cleanup of the route planned before usage. Good value for the price. I have used it a lot with maps loaded on phone. | I love this app! I’ve had others in the past that didn’t have all the bugs worked out yet but Scenic is above and beyond better in my opinion. | Continual improvements, thanks! | This app is great and has tremendous upside potential. | Unlike some of the others you can put plenty of waypoints, allows you to take a more scenic route if you want and be able to save your routes and make public or private. Good job | I've tried pretty much all of the apps out there. 
This one isn't perfect but it's soo good. | I like all of the features for different types of routes.  I especially like the planner.  I would of given 5 stars but the app has a real stability problem and frequently shuts down when searching locations. | I used this app last summer, using the credits. I have a Vespa scooter and really enjoy running the not so common roads. So, of course my course selection was “extra curvy”. Each time I tried to use this option, I was always taken off course and a lot of times ended up being right back where I’d already been, in one big loop. I’d try and shut the app down and have it recalculate but it didn’t seem to help. What did work was the typical fast, or short options. I really wish that the curvy and extra curvy worked the entire way to my destinations because I love all of the features.  Using the credits and things not working ideal wasn’t too much of an issue but it’s not something I’d want to spend money on just yet. I will check in after the next update.  It’s so close! | No question—this is the best GPS app for motorbikes out there. I’ve been using it for years and it’s never failed me. 

The user interface is the most intuitive I’ve seen in any motorbike GPS app and the route sharing feature is extremely handy. | The clever target system for placing an exact location for the next stop on a route is outstanding … not being able to export a ‘ GPX ‘ file from my ‘ 2023 IPad Mini 6 ‘ is baffling … hope I can get some help.

PS .. My IPhone exports just fine allowing me to utilize my Garmin XT2 on my motorcycle. | Great app for if your going on twisty roads or if you found some along the way. It’ll show your whole route afterwards. | Excellent ride small portion on a road that is rather rough, but overall a beautiful ride | I was real hopeful that your app would show me scenic routes, curvy road routes this sort of thing, which all motorcyclist crave, but as I outlined my first trip-  it just shows freeway fastest route, which is disappointing. Please add a button for scenic route options, and no freeway option. | Great turn by turn instructions and capable of importing GPX files. I’m liking this new update. | After trying four other motorcycle Apps I decided on Scenic over a year ago.  A very easy App to plan rides and I highly recommend it. | It’s been frustrating at times and a little difficult to learn but it’s worth it. I ride mostly back country routes and secondary highways in Southern Oregon and it’s amazing how detailed and complete the map data is. At times it worked better than a friends Garmin Montana in directing us to our destination. | I’ve looked at a lot of different options for navigation while motorcycling, and while there are a number of apps / devices that do some things well, Scenic is the only one that puts a check in the box next to all of my must-haves: - has to have downloadable maps: Scenic gives you a set amount of credits for downloading maps of desired states, with the ability to purchase more. I live in New England, so I ride a lot of different states, but the allotted amount of credits has been enough to cover all the states I ride in (7 so far). There’s no pulling you in with 1 state and then dinging you for the rest. Also, when maps need updating, that doesn’t go against your credits. Scenic doesn’t have those hidden costs so prevalent today. - has to accept custom maps from other sites: I use Kurviger to really detail my maps, and I love the fact that I can import this directly and simply. Scenic supports a number of formats from a number of different providers. - has to have good, clean interface when riding. The interface is very simple and clean. It’s easy to glance down under way and not get distracted. All in all a lot of great features and good value for the money. The only alternative I can see is a $700 Zumo, which, while nice, is hard to justify when Scenic exists. | Excellent for creating and saving routes. Awesome job by developers. Also works with Apple car play | After having downloaded the state maps I need and getting an update of this I can highly recommend. The route planner has always been top notch but the improved voice prompts and the battery saver mode are really good improvements so that you don’t have to have your phone screen lit all the time. One improvement would be a Lock Screen widget with next turn info or if battery saver could dim the screen until tapped. I’ve tried several of the apps and they aren’t even close to as good as this thing. (Hey Rever I’m looking at you). Keep in mind that it will force you back to waypoints if you miss a turn. You need to “skip” (trash can) the missed waypoint to stop being looped back. It takes a little learning curve but wow it’s great once you get familiar with it! | Excellent ride long day but I will ride this ride again | Allows me to create a route and import or creates a route or records a wander for a route. | I really like the Roundtrip feature. This makes it so much more fun to go for a quick 45 min ride on curvy routes. I just started using Scenic, I’ll write more when I’ve used it more. So far, I like it. 1 month later: Still loving this app. I use it with every ride. What I love almost as much is the quick response from the developer when I have a question or suggestion. | I love the app | This application is slick and accurate, and is my go to application for planning road trips in my Corvette. Although it is featured as a motorcycle app, it’s As useful for planning, automobile trips, that feature scenery and spirited driving. | I keep trying new navigation apps and devices but each time I come back to Scenic it's better than before. The same is true for only a select few of the other navigation apps I use. | I have only used Scenic a few times, so far it’s great. I can see my rides in detail, with top speeds and total time with distance. | Our Porsche group uses Scenic for planning and driving complex mountain routes - and it works great. So easy to share routes. Top tip: use an iPad to plan routes. | Great Navigation App. Took me a few tries to get it the way I like it...different than other Nav Apps I've used. Try, read the help topics and you'll be pleased. | The best app for real riders | When clicking to search the keyboard does not come up.

Also didn't find the "beautiful" route accurate at all and very generic.

Clicking avoid highways lands the same results in Google maps | This is by far the best, easiest to use GPS route planning program on the market. If you're frustrated with Garmin BaseCamp and/or feel intimidated by your inability to use your GPS, give Scenic Motorcycle Navigation a try. I recently purchased a Garmin zumo XT2. It works seemlessly with Scenic Motorcycle Navigation. It's obvious that Garmin is moving away from BaseCamp, as a disclaimer now appears when attempting to use BaseCamp with the XT2, stating that the XT2 is no longer "officially supported." The future is wireless route/data file transfers. You no longer need to drag your laptop and cables along with you on a long trip. I'm not a BaseCamp hater, as many are. I used it for years. Having said that, BaseCamp and cables are yesterday's news. No steep learning curve with Scenic Motorcycle Navigation. The train has left the station. Jump on and start enjoying your GPS vs. hours of endless frustration. | Love the stats during a trip, maybe have more detailed stat sheet on saved trips? Will there ever be weather watch availability? Love the new look. | I’ve used numerous apps over the last 10 years and this gives me the most flexibility and functionality. The only thing I wish it had was integration with Butler maps like other alternatives, but it’s not a big enough necessity for me. 2024 Update. The latest version which is 3.5 is truly amazing. The developers have done announce Stan job, and my recommendation is not even higher. | Great app to use very user friendly even better after the update great job!!! | I never buy any kind of App, that is until I found Scenic. This app works so well. The fact that you can save rides to multiple bikes is great. The stats then can be pulled up for which ever bike you choose. Creating routes is so simple. I like that you can set up unlimited waypoints unlike a well known map app. There are so many other great reasons to use and purchase this App. | I have been using the Scenic app for nearly two years now. The most recent update took me some time to get used to the changes. What I really appreciate is the quality of the maps, which are far better than imaps or google maps. I find where google maps displays the road ends, scenic goes on further with more detail. Adventure riding has improved greatly. Incredible festures! | Using it for few years. Perfect replacement to Garmin gps. I am using it on my old iPhone 8 without cell service. Strictly for navigation. And my main iPhone is in my pocket. My club shares GPX files before the ride. I download file, adjust waypoints , choose to download route or track. Nice screen presentation. Easy to read while riding. Works great with my Sena. Nice job, Guido!!!!! | So bad and slow… I’m faster then on the map… | I have tried nearly every motorcycle routing app out there and Scenic is by far the best. The power planner alone is worth the money. If you have a specific route you want to take it will let you. So many apps try to get this right but they fall short. The maps are updated often and you can download them for areas with no data. The controls are easy to navigate while riding and it integrates into CarPlay for a seamless experience. This app keeps all of the promises the other apps claim to do. I’ve used it in the States and in Ireland. It worked perfectly. If you are a data geek this app will give you everything. Speed, altitude, distance, etc. I love it. | This is only the second app I have ever paid for to use. I usually stay with free version. I am very happy with my purchase! This is a great app, well worth the $25/yr. The app is the best gps I’ve used and I’ve used 5-6 different apps. Really has great features and the developer seems open to suggestions to make it better! Thanks!! 

The more I use the app, the more I love it!

Chris Kruger

title: Skratch - Where I've been
description:
Skratch lets you plan, track and share your travel life with personalized maps. Get started today on the top scratch map and travel inspiration app.

BUILD YOUR MAP:
Mark all the countries, cities, states, regions & provinces you've visited in the world. Skratch helps you automatically build your map in seconds.

CREATE A BUCKET LIST:
Plan and track your travel experiences by marking countries you want to visit in the future

EXPLORE NEW DESTINATIONS:
Don’t know where to go? Get inspired for your next trip with curated lists and easy search

TRACK YOUR TRAVELS:
See your travel stats by world region and share your scratch map with friends

MAKE SMARTER TRAVEL CHOICES:
Get real-time info you need to know before you travel including eSIMs, visa applications, weather insights and more

UPLOAD MEMORIES:
Add photos and videos from the places you’ve been. Skratch detects the location of your content to help you create a timeline of memories from each country you visit

HEY, HOW WAS YOUR HOLIDAY?:
No more fumbling through endless camera rolls. Tap on a country and instantly play your memories timeline on your personalized world map

MAKE THE MAP YOURS:
Customise your map with a range of unique colour packs and map styles

We are building Skratch into the ultimate companion for your travels. Make our day by giving us a 5 star rating and telling your friends :) 

Privacy Policy: https://www.skratch.world/privacy 
Terms of Use: https://www.skratch.world/terms

Any questions? Or feedback? Drop us a message at support@skratch.world and we’ll get back to you asap
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements. We update Skratch regularly to make your experience even better!
reviews:
Hi it’s me Brody again. I forgot to write this in my other review but I also think it would be cool if you could separately mark off the US States that you have been to and they could have different pages about them too. Anyways, just an idea!! Keep up the good work!!!!
From Brody | When I first made an account, it worked but when I exited put of the app, it signed me out. Then, when I tried to log in, it told me there was no account. I will never use this app again. I would rate it a 0 star if I could. | Really good to know where people want to go. By the way what is your favorite place to go. | This app shows "Abkhazia" and "South Osetia" as the independent countries, which is violating of right of sovereign republic of Georgia - these territories of Georgia are recognized only by occupier: Russian federation. | App freezes and won’t let me finish the wizard. It said user name already used but won’t let me edit it. Link in verification email yields error 503 and says email used not registered. What gives ? | This app works great and is visually stunning for tracking visited countries. I do wish they’d add an add-on for tracking visits to national parks to compliment the cities and regions feature. Adding World Heritage Sites would also be great. I’d love to do all my travel tracking right within Skratch! | Would be nice if I could export my map to print or share. | Saint Augustine, Fl is on the map but not selectable as a place. Seriously? The oldest city in the US is not in the list anywhere?

What’s worse. Suggest a city. Crashes the app. | Super Cool App | Doesnt work | the Caribbean is not geographically or culturally “Central America”. Please consider separating the two regions in a future update! | App freezes when trying to create a new account. Top right shows loading icon forever | I’m a huge traveler and have tried apps like Been and others but this one is my favorite. The regions & cities are broken down great to track your travels. Highly recommend | Amazing app! Nice to be able to color in and truly “map” my experience and travels. Very detailed and and if missing any cities, simply send an email and a prompt and polite reply from Skratch follows shortly with wanted cities being added. And to add, most of the apps features are free! But do pay for the great add-ons and support these great creators. | the best app to track visited countries and plan next trips! love it! | I have been using this app to motivate myself to branch out and see more cities etc when I have the chance. Being able to mark specific regions and cities is very useful, and when a city isn’t on the map the developers are quick to add it once it’s been requested. 

I have occasionally had an issue where the app will glitch and mark me as currently being in a country that I’m not in. Unsure if that’s an issue with the app or my phone’s GPS etc though. 

Also, there’s a bit of a visual issue on the “share” maps with places marked as disputed territories— they don’t show up and it makes it seem like you haven’t been there. It’s really noticeable when you’ve been to all the surrounding areas. I understand there might be some sensitive political issues, but perhaps a toggle for “show disputed territories” would be good? | The app is extremely slow and hung during setup. From that point on, the activation flow fails despite following the latest activation emails (link or code), it simply stuck in an endless loop and wouldn’t activate but kept sending me activation emails. Very frustrating experience. Bottom line, I loss all confidence of the app and its ability to handle my personal data. | I like the design.
Most cities big and small are there (but missing 25 of 400 I’ve visited).
Reached out two weeks ago to add a bunch of cities and no reply.
Where you at? | This app promotes Russian state propaganda about Russian occupied territories! It's not an accidental bug, I contacted them and they refuse to update maps to reflect international borders. Abkhazia and Samachablo is Georgia! | Quick response and helpful support! | It defaults it to cities when you have to pay for the cities… they also make it very difficult to have a smooth easy user flow. I’m not sure what they were thinking. I can tell the developers did a great job but the people running the app don’t know what they’re doing. | This app doesn’t work at all. Literally couldn’t get past verifying my email. | It’s okay and tracking where you’ve been. But 7 bucks to mark states is steep. Also, there are some inaccuracies on the map. Israel isn’t mapped correctly, and Palestine is marked as a country, which it’s not. | Would only down load memories if I took it with my new phone and would not let me up loud any other photos | In one of the newer updates they took away your ability to add videos and pictures for each region of the country you live in. All of the videos I had for each state just became for “the United States.” I prefer the former version so I can separate each state- America is a vast country! Other than that, a nice app for recording travels. | An app that asks you to give up your email to use the app, is a useless app. That’s my personal opinion, it’s an app to scratch off countries you visited. So why the email ? And why an email verification method? Just so i get my email rained with spam emails and marketing from other companies and the list goes on. That’s my review. | I’m obsessed with Skratch. I specifically downloaded it because not only you can mark the countries you’ve been to (which is typically what these apps do), but you can check states, regions, and cities! All the specifics you could imagine. And as a frequent traveler and lover, this is something one appreciates because having visited France (when you only went to Paris) is not the same thing, hahaha :) PLUS, I couldn’t find two cities that I’ve been on the map, I wrote an email, and they added them! I love when apps are in continuous improvement, and they show it! Best customer service ever :) plus, Ryan wrote a nice email notifying me that they added these cities for me!! | There are too many cities missing, yet those cities appear on the Map itself. I don’t understand why we can’t just select cities straight from the map anyway. Would be much faster than searching for them in many instances as well. | I love this!! Just a few edits: 
- would love to be able to track percentage of US states done. 
- would love to be able to track and mark national parks (as well as percentages)
- lots of cities missing, but just to name a few: Stowe, Vermont; Breckinridge, Colorado; Bayeux, France; many others. | Why no IPad version ?? Nearly everyone who has an IPad travels with it. You could make so much more use of the large screen .
Will it still come ???? | I just downloaded this app and think it looks amazing! I hope as the app continues to develop that more articles arise that allow you to learn not just about countries on the explore page but specific cities as well. It’s a tall order but as content continues to get added that allows you to explore more, it’s easier to justify the cost of the paid additions that allow you to mark regions and cities! Really enjoying this so far. Also I’d suggest that we still be able to hit the explore button for every country even if we didn’t mark it as want to visit. Great app! | it would be a great app if you didn’t have to pay to add regions and cities. i would rather have ads. | I have been thoroughly enjoying Skratch. I love the idea of being able to pin the cities and towns you’ve been to, and the app does all this (plus providing excellent information about countries as well as any travel restriction information) with only a few things that could be improved.

First, when you start to pin many cities on your map, then you zoom out to a full country views, the pins start to take over the whole map (even with them clustering together). For example, if you zoom out entirely on the United States, the clusters are larger than many US states (each cluster is about the size of Wyoming, if not bigger). Thus, if you have several clusters in different parts of the US, it can overwhelm the map pretty quickly. If there is an option to decrease the size of your pins/clusters so even if there are dozens on your map, it doesn’t overwhelm the background map itself, that would be great.

Second, Skratch provided over 18,000 cities and towns you can pin to your map. It seems like a lot; however, it doesn’t work well in certain places around the world. Cities only appear in the search results if they have a certain population, and if you are trying to pin towns you’ve visited in Alaska for instance, very few will appear. There was a popular website a year ago or so that went by the name “iafisher”, and on that site, any town would appear in the search, regardless of size. Even if the town had a population of 10 (like many small towns in Alaska - Diomede is one of many, for instance), if it was a proper census-designated place, it would show up in the search.

If these two features get tweaked, this app would easily be a 5-star app in my opinion. It has such a nice design, doesn’t feel “outdated”, and overall is an excellent travel companion. Keep it up, Skratch team! You have a great app on your hands! | If you can’t use the app without providing email or phone then all they want is your information. Immediate delete. | I just downloaded the app and paid for all access … honestly just a waste of money. They have VERY limited cities you can pin. You can see them on the map but if it’s not on the apps “list of cities” there is no way to pin. Shouldn’t there be a way to add a city ?? Or if it’s on the actual map… it should be available to pin. | Everything is great without any delay and very user-friendly. Best of all, Taiwan is recognized as its own. Valid. | A free app which doesn’t shove ads down your throat. At least not yet. | Me gusto lo fácil que está de usar y su formato!!
Solo faltaría que se pudieran incluir ciudades y regiones que visite!! | Had made my map and registered but when I go to come back and add more I hit log in and it never works. So basically it’s pointless | This is a MUST HAVE app if you’re a frequent traveler or digital nomad! You can easily see what countries are open for travel as well as track and view where you’ve been and lived.

Well done!! Highly recommend | Cost too much to get the features | Really makes you want to travel more. I wish they had kept the feature where you could mark which states you have lived in. | I have been wanting to create this app for a long time. Kinda sad it already exists now, but very happy to be able to use it. | Love the app but it would be so much better if I could friend people and look at their photos etc | This app is not only incredibly buggy, but also selling our personal data to 3rd party companies. Deleted the app immediately after detecting the data breach. | Update:

The developers responded, engaged in respectful and helpful dialogue, and we figured out the source of the miscommunication regarding the in-app purchase.  If you scroll to the bottom of the listing on the App Store, it does in fact state there are
In-app purchases. However, there isn’t a “flag” under the “Get” button that shows there are In-App Purchases as there are with many other apps. As I am based in the domestic US and not traveling internationally at this time, the free version isn’t as useful (country only).  Again - I misunderstood the app’s features and fee structure.  The developer was extremely responsive and even offered to send me a promo code to used the full features for free to ensure I could use the app and all its features and make up for the miscommunication .  I declined - the developers are running a business and deserve to be paid for their labor.  I just misunderstood the apps features and wasn’t aware there was a paid version when I downloaded it.  I will keep using the free version for now, dream about international travel using the countries, and when I can afford it I’ll be paying for the full features.  Can’t say enough about the incredible customer service and willingness of the developers to engage with app users.  Support them by purchasing the full version if you can afford it!  And if you can’t afford it at this time, use the free version app anyways and dream about international adventures and mark countries you’d like to visit someday.  

Just downloaded this app based on reviews online and in App Store.  Logged in and started trying to add places I’ve been and places I’d like to visit.  Imagine my surprise when I was prompted that if I wanted to select anything beyond the United States a a whole I would have to pay and was prompted with multiple tiers of payment options.  I thought perhaps I’d missed something and went back to the App Store.  Nope - nothing in the App Store about in app purchases.  I don’t appreciate misleading advertising.  While I might or might not have been willing to pay a small fee for full functionality, the fact that it appears to be intentionally hidden in an effort to get more people to download the app and then maybe they will pay anyway....nah I don’t respect that and don’t trust a company who operates with that nonsense. | I can’t even get into the app why why do I need a phone number or email! | Downloaded because others said it supported states. Apparently a new upgrade to the app makes it so you now have to pay for these. It’s not clear when you try to add them either it just keeps going back to another screen and ask you for power ups. | you have to pay if you go somewhere unless you check the app while you’re there. stupid. don’t download. | I’m from Georgia Tbilisi and your map is wrong. 20% of our country is occupied by Russia !!! Abkhazia and south Ossetia is Georgia!!!

title: Road Trip! State Trivia, Games
description:
Road Trip! Are you going on a road trip and want something to keep you entertained in the car? This is the perfect app for you!

State Trivia - Try out trivia from all 50 U.S. states.
License Plate Spotting - How many different state license plates can you spot?
Know Your Passenger - Take quizzes with your fellow passenger(s) to learn about each other and keep yourselves entertained.
License Plate Bingo - Look for different letters in license plates to complete a bingo board.
Road Sign Bingo - Looks for different road signs to complete a bingo board.
General Trivia - Over 700 trivia questions from a variety of different categories.
Name That Song - Try to guess which song is playing!
Conversation Starters - Too much silence? Find an endless amount of topics and questions to ask.

Trip Planner - Add destinations, bookmark places to visit, and save links for later.
Navigation - Enter your trip destination to see the current weather and get quick links for directions.
Gas Tracker - Keep track of how much you're spending on gas and track where you filled up.
Weather - See the weather for your destination.
Connect Apple Music or Spotify to see your currently playing songs.

----

Road Trip! uses optional auto-renewing subscriptions to provide additional features like removing ads, unlocking all games, and planning your trip.

Payment will be charged to your Apple ID account at the confirmation of purchase. Subscription automatically renews unless it is canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can manage and cancel your subscriptions by going to your account settings in the App Store after purchase.

Terms of Use: https://halfpeeled.com/roadtrip/tos
Privacy Policy: https://halfpeeled.com/roadtrip/privacy
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and updates
reviews: I love this app it had great ideas on places to go, great ways to track where you have been, great games/entertainment, amazing, family, trivia, and great attractions. | Fun way to have fun on a road trip but for little kids lookingbon their parents phone to play, not a good app. Some if the things are not family friendly on specific games. | We r driving up the east coast and having so much fun using this app!  Well worth the $ | Had some pretty entertaining things to do to keep us busy!

title: CityMaps2Go – Offline Maps
description:
CityMaps2Go is the ultimate offline map for travelers, mountain biking, and hiking enthusiasts who want to be prepared wherever they go.

Join the millions of users worldwide who trust CityMaps2Go!

What others say about CityMaps2Go:
"Essential app for travelers", Time Magazine
"One of the best offline maps apps", WSJ
"Maps without racking up roaming costs", Macworld

And here's why millions of travelers and outdoor enthusiasts love CityMaps2Go:
▶ OPTIMIZED FOR OUTDOOR: CityMaps2Go includes detailed maps of remote areas and national parks. CityMaps2Go offers terrain maps with footpaths and contour lines online as well as offline.

▶ IN-DEPTH CONTENT: Unlike other offline map apps, CityMaps2Go features photos as well as tips and comprehensive, detailed info for millions of places.

▶ WORLDWIDE COVERAGE: CityMaps2Go covers the whole world. More than 150 countries, 60000 destinations, and 50 million places!!

▶ WORKS OFFLINE: CityMaps2Go works online and offline. Saving you from connectivity problems in national parks and remote areas and data roaming charges in foreign countries. 

▶ PLAN TRIPS & TOURS: Plan tours with lists. Remember and save all the places you would like to visit. Create lists and have your travel ideas ready when you need them.

▶ DETAILED MAPS: Explore your saves on a detailed worldwide map. Navigate streets, footpaths, and bikeways wherever you are.

▶ SHARE WITH FRIENDS: Share your travel plans with your friends. Planning your trips or hike with others made easy with CityMaps2Go.

▶ SYNC BETWEEN ALL YOUR DEVICES: Create an user account and login from any of your devices.
__________________________________________________

A note on battery life:
We've spent years developing and improving the location technology that powers CityMaps2Go, making it extremely power efficient. But, as with all apps of this type, please note that continued use of GPS running in the background can significantly decrease battery life.

We'd love to hear what it is you like about CityMaps2Go and how we can improve it for you. Drop us an email at support@ulmon.com . Enjoy your travels and exciting outdoor tours … and don't forget to send us a postcard.
releaseNotes: We added "Sign in with Apple" as authentication method and fixed some bugs!
