title: Roads by Porsche
description:
With the ROADS route planner, you can find the most beautiful route for your next ride. Create a winding and scenic route between two or more locations with just a few clicks. ROADS is provided by Porsche and is available free of charge to anyone who loves driving. 

Unlike conventional navigation solutions, ROADS focuses on discovering particularly attractive routes. Our unique route intelligence takes into account speed, curves and elevation as well as the real local road and environmental conditions. It also adapts to your individual driving preferences. This works both on in front your own doorstep and almost anywhere in the world. 

With the integrated GPS navigation from Mapbox, the route can be driven directly with ROADS. And thanks to Apple CarPlay, it can be used in the onboard system of your compatible vehicle at any time. 

Top features
- Create individual routes with up to 50 stops and test them directly on the phone before setting off thanks to the 3D preview
- Use the circuit generator to quickly and easily create trips based on your available driving time and the desired direction
- Import existing tours from Google Maps without detours
- Share your routes with the ROADS community and retain full control over who gets access to your routes
- Find interesting rides and exciting POIs in your immediate vicinity
- Create public or private groups and experience ROADS together with the global community of passionate drivers
- Drive directly in ROADS or export the route as GPX for use in navigation systems of your choice

ROADS means less time planning and more time driving. Try it out, download the app without obligation and become part of the ROADS community now. 

Your help is needed! 
We have developed ROADS to give you a more intense driving experience every day. In order to continue to develop the app in the best possible way in the future, we ask for your feedback. For ideas, tips, questions and anything else, please use the ""Feedback"" option in the app, send our team an email at roadsbyporsche-production@porsche.de or address your concerns in the ""Welcome to ROADS"" group.

We have also stored the most frequently asked questions and answers directly in the app. 

You can find more information at roads.porsche.com
releaseNotes: This version includes various minor bugfixes.
reviews:
Routinely the GPS seems to completely drop and roads loses track of where I am.  More than once I'd be coming up to an intersection and realize that roads had just stopped paying attention to where I was.  So I'd go through the intersection, get pulled over, then the route on roads would show me some place that I was supposed to turn a while back, but doesn't give me the directions to get back to where the turn is... What is up with that?  Every other navigation app redirects you when you get off course... It's very frustrating. | I would like to continue using the app, as it did set up a decent route, but I wish it would allow deviations from the designed route. We were having a great drive, and found a fun looking road so decided to take a turn the app had not created. Once we deviated, the app wanted us to turn back and continue from the last point where we had deviated the app has created. That created a frustrating moment, and environment, so we ended up turning off the app. Earlier on that same drive, we stopped for gas, and exited the parking lot at a different exit that we entered, so the app would not continue with the route until we turned back and exited from the entrance we entered the gas station. Not a fun moment. I removed the app from my phone, as every time I considered using it, I realized I wanted to be able to stop to see the sights along the way, and the app would ultimately just be a distraction from the fun because of the issues. Sorry | Why can’t I record a course you used to be able to on an earlier version? it’s pretty useless if you can’t. | The current version (3.2.161) still has trouble rerouting if you miss part of a route or don’t pass through the start point. Another feature that would be great to have is an easy option to drive a route in reverse.

Edit: Rerouting is still broken in 3.2.244 and even worse now it it wants to route detours through parking lots and adjacent driveways. After trying to use it again I ended up needing to switch to a different nav app 1/4 of the way through a 300 mi drive so I’m deleting a star from my original review. | I finally found a free Saturday and called up the Roads app to find a fun drive up to Bear Mountain State Park. Waze called for a 55 min drive, so I was encouraged when Roads predicted a 90 min journey. Northern NJ has some amazing, spirited roads so I eagerly set out to follow the route. 

However, right away, I noticed odd guidance through 25 mph zones. The app directed me through a parking lot, then returned me to continue on my current road, so I ignored its detour through the lot and continued on, yet the app repeatedly urged me to turn around and go back through the lot. I stopped and restarted the route to get back on track, but again, all I saw was slow drives through light after light. 

After 90 minutes of barely exceeding 40 mph at the top speed, I frustratedly deleted the app and used Waze. 15 min later, I reached my destination and used Waze to return home on the Pallisades Pkwy, a terrific road with speed and scenery that I sought from the beginning. Porsche has a LOT of work to do to get me to try this again. | This app is very confusing much like most tech from PCA…not user-friendly whatsoever and not intuitive | Devs listen up, I have some real feedback for you. I like the premise, I like the UI, and I like how it allows you to cultivate a route around specific points. The 3D route preview is awesome.

The auto route generator is a nice feature, but it struggles to keep people away from roads with lots of traffic lights. I live right on the front range in Colorado, and half of my route is always thru some metro area with lots of lights, while the other half is perfect mountain roads. I could solve this with a route involving custom points, but it’d be nice for more personalization with the auto route generator directly, like an option to avoid traffic lights.

My biggest pet peeve, though, is not being able to do a route in reverse. Or if that feature is possible, it seems hidden. I need to warm my car’s engine oil up by driving more slowly, which takes some time, and I don’t want to spend this time driving the exciting straight part of a route just because that was generated at the route’s beginning. Some routes are better driven in the reverse order from how they’re generated. A simple toggle to reverse the route direction would fix this problem immediately.

Also, this only happened once, so I don’t know if this is 100% accurate, but my phone lost cell service and it seemingly caused the app to stop updating my location. If true, that’s a major issue. “No cell service” does not mean “No GPS signal”, and the app should attempt to dead reckon my location using GPS if my cell signal is lost. In my experience, the app just freezes and stops moving your little marker along the route, which is pointless for any route where there’s a cell dead zone. This could have just been the app freezing for some other reason, but for me, it happened at the exact moment my cell service went out. I had to switch to Apple Maps just to get home, since I was driving and I couldn’t safely mess with ROADS. Also, I was frustrated and didn’t want to.

One last nitpick I have is that the app color scheme follows your iPhone’s color scheme, with no option to just select dark or light. I want the ROADS app to be dark all the time, but I don’t want the same for my iPhone. It’s annoying that these are tied together, this always annoys me when apps force this. I don’t like the way the CarPlay app looks in white when it’s on a massive screen surrounded by a black car interior, as it’s way too much contrast and it just makes everything look bad. I shouldn’t have to change my phone’s overall color theme to dark just to make ROADS follow the dark theme — This should just be an option in the app.

Fix these very simple issues and I will update my review to reflect five stars. As of right now, the app is just decent. | Uses your location to give you rides near your area.  It has a cool preplay function where you can actually see the route traced out on a map from a semi satellite style view before you take it, very cool. 

Trying to find a route now to take, will report back after I’ve given it its trial run. | I love the idea. A little buggy. How is there still not an Android app? | App asks me to review new legal terms and conditions but gets stuck there. I can’t use the app anymore. | It’s not particularly intuitive. It would be good if you could see the steps of the route early in the process so you could better decide if you wanted to save it. | Awful!! | Helped me find backroads in my small town | I’ve been looking for something like for ever | Good idea, but then I realized I can’t be connected to apple car play, listening my music. That’s crazy and a huge negative of the app. | This app is very well made and easy to use. The routes are great and the customizability is a huge plus. | Very difficult for me to use. I need a tutorial | The app provides some much needed content. Most issues I found while using the app relate to the user experience. I spent a lot of time liking routes near me I’d like to drive only to realize later that there was no way to see the routes I liked. I can circumvent this by bookmarking the route but there’s no direct bookmark button like there is for liking. There is an extra step of going into the menu to bookmark a route so maybe make this it’s own button in the future or make liked routes accessible? I can’t be the only person to complain about this | Takes a while to figure this app out, it’s not that easy,there’s things that I want to do that it won’t let me.like check out route directions while in guidance mode. I guess there must be another way to do that. Eventually I’m sure I’ll figure it out. | This app has potential for sure, but it’s missing a critical feature. As expected, the app sometimes routes you down some crazy roads and when you get there, you want to avoid them. Case and point, it somehow wanted to route me through a school parking lot with massive speed bumps. No problem, you just turn on another road and go on, but this is where the app misses the critical feature of simply rerouting you and going in. If you miss a turn or choose to not turn somewhere, the app does not reroute and insists you go back to where it wanted you to turn originally, even if by now you may be back in the route that was planned. Would love to see that included in the future to give more flexibility if missing a turn or choosing to not use a specified section of road. | Very good | ai routes are completely broken - if i follow any route for 5 minutes it randomly makes me uturn and thinks that we’re at the end of the route already. carplay is also extremely buggy. there should be a way to transfer the route to a different navigation app like google maps. any way to fix this navigation issue? | Most of the routes are ridiculously far, but whenever I decide to travel, this will come in useful. Perhaps not a daily drive app if you commute, but definitely an app to have just in case.

Edit: Tried the route generator following Drive -> Create Route -> and setting desired distance. This solved my proximity issue! Great app, definitely worth downloading! | Everything is fine now | Driving!! This app puts emphasis on the driving and not the in app features and only focuses on what matters. | nothing more to say as real as i can get. does everything i want it to and has a great intuitive feel to the app. | When it works, the app is great for finding new routes to drive and ride. However, it has its bugs like sometimes not letting you log in, or right now, it says it needs an update even though there isn’t one available on the App Store. | Great concept but about half the suggested results have some odd routings through residential neighborhoods and boring connections between fun bits, completely ignoring backroads connectors. | Been waiting for something like this | This is the app I didn’t know I needed. I had been scrounging FB groups for routes in my area and saving them in Google Maps. That wasn’t really working well. This app starts with the assumption that I want a scenic route, and am willing to spend more time for the sheer joy of the road. I am just getting started on the app, but am loving it so far! | I submitted a route under the username -Bruce when Roads first came out, I see that now with the latest revision of Roads, the original route is gone and replaced with an alternate route. It appears that this change is because MapBox is missing the road that my route was on:
Wabasha County 11 (MN).
 I added a note to the route to explain that this route was on County 11 but I am guessing I am not the only driver whose cherished route was obliterated. 
Please fix this, Mapbox needs include all paved public roads in order to achieve its intended use. | driving down a straight road it repeats to stay/proceed on the road as if i’m not actually on the road | The app needs work. It feels more like an early beta release at best. Frustrating as can be to adjust volume. Constant reminders of alternate routes is confusing. No way to remove checkpoint on user created routes. Won’t let you bypass any checkpoints (even when the route has checkpoints on private property) so it just creates constant loops to get you to a place you shouldn’t go. | cool idea, needs more revisions | Pretty great for planning routes pretty awful for staying on them | when i heard about this app i was so exited!
until i used it for a day, the navigation system is horrible, and the routes are okay i guess, but i was looking forward to this and honestly i was kinda disappointed. | Fairly nice routes, navigation is good but looks a tad older than wayze. Good navigation for long drives though! | Love it | Great App with a great concept, but could use some improvements. | Overall the app is amazing and it made my morning commute significantly more fun lol | Found some great roads in the towns around me super sick app | Even though Porsche makes great cars, this app is so confusing and wonky that it's ultimately unusable. Trying to create custom routes is impossible and all the auto-generated routes in my area are basically a 30 minute commute through every straight and busy road there is. Great concept but needs major work. | 911 owner and software engineer here. On a rare day off I used this to try a local route. The app is utterly incapable of detecting the start of the route and just wants me to u-turn back to it, rather than seeing that I’m near it and beginning the route. And on that note, forget about picking up a route partway into it, that doesn’t work either. Great idea, poor execution. | I feel like it couldve taken me on a better route, even if its shorter, i went on a 30 minute drive and it took me around the same loop 5-6 times | Loving it so far! One feature I would add is the ability to search areas for routes. I’m planning a road trip and would like to see what’s around to plan some fun driving ahead of time. | This app is so much fun thank you to the amazing designers and developers at Porsche for making this concept come to life this app just took me on a hour road trip that I have never been on before by my house and I thought that was impossible because I have lived here awhile and driven what I thought to be every road in my area but Porsche created a route that include parts where I could get some speed parts where there where elevation changes and parts that involved turns this was my first time using the app and can confidently say it will not be my last I want to see what this app has to offer | It took us in circles through all residential neighborhoods full of stop signs, speed limit never went over 25 mph. Cannot use apple car play, how dangerous to have to use your phone while driving. | I like it. So fun riding with the boys at night!!! | This App Is Cool! | Please add CarPlay to this

title: calimoto Motorcycle Navigation
description:
Join over 3 million users and start your journey with calimoto! Trip planning, tracking mode, navigation, tour analysis, and recommendations — all in one app.

Winding country roads, nature, and pure freedom! Thanks to our unique twisty roads algorithm and specialized motorbike map, you’ll always find the best route! Can’t be bothered to spend ages minutely planning your trip? No worries! With our Round Trip Planner, you can plan, save, and hit the road in just 3 steps.

Top 5 calimoto features: 

#1 TRIP PLANNER — Plan directly on the map, both in the app and on the web
#2 TURN-BY-TURN VOICE NAVIGATION — with Caution Point alerts 
#3 THOUSANDS OF TRIP RECOMMENDATIONS — Benefit from other bikers’ experiences 
#4 TRIP TRACKING — Hop on your bike and off you go 
#5 ANALYZE AND SHARE TRIPS — Extensive personal statistics and diagrams

#1 TRIP PLANNER WITH SPECIALIZED MOTORCYCLE MAP

Create your own personalized trip with unlimited Via Points directly on the map. There, you'll immediately see where exciting and twisty country roads await you. For maximum fun on your ride, combine up to four routing profiles within one trip. Round it off by integrating POIs such as gas stations, mountain passes, biker meetups, or sightseeing directly into your route. Thanks to the terrain and satellite map, you always have the ideal view for your route planning.

#2 TURN-BY-TURN VOICE NAVIGATION

Thanks to our voice announcements, you’ll never stray from the path and will be warned about caution points (e.g. speed cameras) during navigation.

#3 THOUSANDS OF TRIP RECOMMENDATIONS

Let yourself be inspired by other calimoto users' experiences and discover trips both near you and worldwide. With the filter, you can also display only the rides that truly interest you!

#4 TRIP TRACKING 

Activate tracking mode ride off without any planning. Mark highlights you’ve discovered on your ride to find them again later.

#5 ANALYZE & SHARE TRIPS 

After each trip, we’ll show you the key data on speed, altitude, acceleration, and lean angle. Also upload photos, rate your trip, and save it in your personal ride catalog. 
Become part of the calimoto community and share your best rides in the trip recommendations, via Facebook or WhatsApp, so that others can also share in your experiences.

ADVANTAGES WITH THE CALIMOTO PROFILE 

Receive monthly and yearly statistics about the kilometers you’ve traveled, altitude reached, the highest lean angles, and much more. Effortlessly sync your trips between all your devices and our web Trip Planner. Also, easily add your bike to your personal garage!

Download calimoto now. We’ll help you find the best routes and discover new ones in your area.

CALIMOTO PREMIUM 

Become a Premium member and get access to an extended range of features such as worldwide offline maps, navigation, speed limits, terrain and satellite view, an additional routing profile, caution point warnings, lean angle and acceleration analysis.

General Terms & Conditions: https://calimoto.com/en/information/terms-of-use

Privacy Policy: https://calimoto.com/en/information/privacy-policy
releaseNotes:
- Welkom Nederland: calimoto is now also available in Dutch!
- We've added new languages: calimoto is now also available in Czech and Portuguese. Ahoj Česko! Bem-vindo Português!
- Crashes / bugs fixed
reviews:
After trying a handful of competitors to this app, I was turned onto this one and have been using it ever since. By far the best app to plan routes. Just choose a direction, the approximate distance you want to travel, and to find the twistiest roads and your off! App is also great at tracking non planned routes. | Used it to ride from Ohio to Florida, roads thru Kentucky were fantastic, it’s just kinda expensive if you don’t ride much | Loved it but to pay 80!! is too much now it’s deleted from the phone | I used this app back in 2022 you could gps and track rides for free, now you cannot even use gps at all without buying a year of premium. Worthless app without gps or any of the features that are locked behind a paywall | This app was great when it was free. I could count on Calimeter scores for twistiness in the 20s for every planned ride, sometimes in the 30s and this was just using the free winding option. Now I paid for it and can’t get any scores above 12? All my routes are simple direct routes. It won’t give me anything fun even on twisty. I wish I hadn’t paid. Completely disappointed that it can’t deliver what it says it can. | This is a Great app but unfortunately they changed some stuff and now they charge you for things that use to be Free. | A navigation app that you have to pay to use navigation even without the extra features now…
Used it sporadically for a couple of years given the many flaws (weird UX, can’t search for a business name, doesn't update road changes/closures, etc), but as a free app it was OK. 
Cancelling my account and deleting it, as there other similar free options nowadays (even Google maps using the “no main roads” feature gives you a similar result with all the ease and functionality lacking in Calimoto). | Used to be good. Now basic features are locked behind a paywall. Not a usable app anymore. | App works great, easy to plan rides | At 60 bucks per year, this app is too expensive and doesn’t offer a lot more than other similar apps that cost a lot less, have a one time fee, or are free. Not worth the money. May be that is why in my area there is not much rides. And I live in what could be the capital of motorcycling in the country. | Very cool app makes riding way more interesting. | Downloaded the app won’t let me get past my biker nickname. Keeps saying I have spaces. Tried many times gave up on it. I will go another route but thank you | At first when I started to use Calimoto back in 2018 I wasn’t a huge fan. The idea was brilliant but the app was clunky and if you missed a turn the app would freak out and not reroute. I’ve kept tabs on it after the updates and over the past few months it’s blown me away. Reroutes are no longer an issue and it finds a the twisty roads like a king. I just came back from a 2 hour drive that a calimoto driver recommended and it was one of the best drives of my life. Highly recommend this and can’t wait for CarPlay. | Why no waterfall search? | I paid for a 1 year subscription to use this app on my old iPhone 6 since mounting a new iPhone to a motorbike destroys the camera. 

The app won’t give me access to the premium features even though I have 10 months of subscription available. 

I’ve contacted their support but they can’t help and keep asking me to do the same thing which doesn’t work. 

Now I have to use the free version and I can’t get my money back. | I tried a few different apps and always come back to this one. Love the way it works. One thing I would like to see is Apple Watch support showing GPS turn based arrows on the watch display. This would put it over the top!  Another would be to show the upcoming street name on the phone at least when approaching a turn. | First off the it doesn’t cost 59.99 like advertised. They charge 75. No response to emails or questions. The super twisty option creates no difference over the curve option. so unless you are riding out of your state or over the 65 max miles don’t upgrade. attempting to put in destination is clunky and confusing at times at best. you get used to it but you definitely have to use a combination of Google Maps to get the actual street address for GPS coordinates to punch in your destination. you cannot use for example a business name or a state park name. Only negatives I’ve found so far but only time I will be renewing is when I take my bike out of state again. | This app is very good and better for my purposes than it’s competitors. I primarily just upload existing GPX routes. The app does not have the functionality to reverse a route however. I really hope they add it in the future but until they do 4/5 stars. I’ll happily update once they do. | Will give 5 stars when we can use on our bike informant screen .. hope this comes quick | My first trip planning after I paid $60 subscription and already I see a MAJOR flaw in the algorithms. I live in south Florida and wanted to go up the famous A1A beach/coast route. I wanted curvy route and the app took me through US1 instead of the route I want. So I tried the non curved and got I95, a major interstate. Then I tried google map and google gave me EXACTLY the route I needed. And didn’t need to pay $60. | The app takes me to areas that don’t have cell service and it’s not able to complete the ride. Inevitably, it says “rerouting” then repeats “no internet” forever. 

Routing needs to be done on my phone using downloaded maps. | Have to pay premium $$ for anything out of my state. | Not easy to use. Can’t plan trip with exact addresses. | It’s an app with a great premise. You put in a destination and they will show you the twistiest path there. It doesn’t do it that well in my opinion and what’s worse is that they have now locked down all features to subscription only access. 

I get it, you need a have revenue to make a product work. But without subscribing to their plan they have crippled the functionality to such a degree that that app is basically unusable. Locked down to one state, no round trip access, enter a destination and it won’t give you the “twisty” route. 

They have some weird roads marked as twisty, like a highway on-ramp. Then, there are plenty of great roads near me that don’t even blip on their twisty map. 

Honestly you are better with Google Maps and checking “avoid tolls” and “avoid highways” if you are planning a trip. Or better yet, just go ride without the phone and get lost, find some new roads! | New layout is horrid. New users will likely be confused and not be able to locate/discover great things with the app. Maybe it’s horrible modern day interface design based on theory instead of what normal people want. The old layout was superior and more user friendly . | I absolutely hate the new update. It’s too chunky. When wanting to move via points around instead of seeing 5 at a time now you can only see 2. | This app is absolute garbage. It is slow to find directions. It often tells me the wrong turn and makes me do u-turns. There are no street names, no lights or stop signs. I tried a tour someone else had done and it was the same. Going to try for a refund. Buyer beware | You guys killed this app!  I don’t own a bike yet (hopefully soon) but use it for driving in my car.  Works amazing, i’ve tried a couple other apps to generate routes.  This app is packed with so so many useful features, i’m still finding out awesome things you can do with it.  The round trip planner is my favorite part, especially because you can set the compass direction (for me always west towards mountains).  Keep up the great work, premium is absolutely worth it but a monthly option would be good to have for me, I don’t use it in the winter so paying for the whole year is annoying. | Just finished first ride using this app! Love the features so far | I tried searching for “black canyon road”, of which there are multiple locations. There were NO search results. How is this any better than Apple Maps, which, too, is useless. | Horrible search results. Does not find “places” nearly as well as other maps. | Have discovered more new roads with this app than the previous ones combined.  I also think the premium membership is reasonably priced and totally worth it for Super Twisty mode alone. | I tried everything to get turn by turn navigation to work over Bluetooth but nothing worked. Pretty disappointing on what could have been a cool app. | Route creation is complicated by not being able not use the map to add points. A route going north on I-5 and it jumps on/off just to get a bit of off highway riding. | App is great for finding routes and tracking your ride, however,If you are trying to find a business to be routed to, it can’t find them. Other than finding addresses, the search function is pretty weak. | Just wish I could pay for premium features ala carte. Just want to buy states and try extra twisty. Don’t need the every state. And 65 a year is too much for me to buy with a taste. | Got me across 4 states for a move on a motorcycle and had a great support experience afterward. | The search for addresses is pretty broken, the gos instructions aren’t great, and I had to turn off the audio because it Kept messing up my music. | Great algorithms for fun roads. Intuitive to use on the fly/ by phone to plan trip. Estimates for turns are a little off, but on the early side so at least still very usable. | Finds the best roads anywhere.  Just pick a direction, level of desired turns, and it works great.  For me that means hours of roads that are semi-turn with speeds between 35-55 mph.  Not sure how it finds these roads in such and endless fashion, but I am very happy it does. | This app is a huge piece of steaming dung!  I know of and have ridden several great rides in this huge country of ours and when I go to build them in this crap app more times than not it tells me it cannot find the road!  WHAT!  I’ve been on that road, I’ve enjoyed the twists and turns of that road and a biker ride app cannot find it!  What crap the app is!  I want my money back and you can keep this crap.  Couple of examples: Laughlin NV to Kingman NV, app says no road!  BULL!  I’ve driven it!  I look for a specific address, the crap app cannot find it. What the people built it and then hide it, come on crap app, get real. Super let down.  A bike app that can’t find a twisty road?  Crap app! | I want to love this app, it’s a great idea and looks very good.  I am having several issues with it though. 
1.  Don’t count on the app to reliably track your ride.  Most of the time I will look down to my black iPhone screen because the app has crashed.  When I reopen the app, it says recovery, and draws a straight line between where it crashes and where I reopen it.   

2. Navigation prompts do not line up to the map at all.   I hear turn left in 100 feet,  nothing but a cornfield for 2 or 3 miles.  Just to look down at the map and it did not have a turn designated at that point.

3. Other apps similar have friend functionality, challenges, and have built a better social experience in their app.  

I have not paid for the premium yet because anyone who would pay for an app when the “demo” or “free” version is this buggy. | I actually use these routes for scenic drives in my car. As such, I really wish they’d add Apple CarPlay support. Other than that, it’s an amazing app. | Finally an app that can suggest a really good route and lets you fine tune the route with waypoints to do it the way I want to go! | Gives you nice riding areas in your local area. If you want travel outside that area you have to $50 yr which is way too much. Deleted that app. | Love this app so far. Couple short rides. I love the explore option I’m just creating a random route the the location you’re at. I really enjoy the way you can build routes even within the app, very simple and picks good scenic routes. I wish you could search for locations like in other map apps & drop a pin, but that’s minor. I can’t wait to test out the off-line maps option, which if it works will be worth the premium price tag. More to follow. | Discovered this after a move.  Didn’t have to wait to find out all the best local routes.  Calimoto had them all.  Easy to create and explore new routes.  Love the ability to adjust curve level by route.  Insanely good app built by riders. | I purchased this for full price on android not knowing that it’s not account based. It’s app specific so my android money was wasted. The company told me to bring both phones with me if I want to still use it. 

I’ll find a better alternative that doesn’t charge $370 a year if you want to pay monthly. Enjoy my money from android. Not giving you guys anymore.

You charge $7 a week unless you pay in full which I did on the other platform. If you charged $4.99 a month none of this would happen. I’ve already found an alternative app That is cheaper than you guys and looks more visually appealing | So far I have found the route planning pretty easy and I like the navigation! 

The only problem I have and it’s a deal breaker is that it won’t let me select level 3 roads, which in my area are Forest service 3 digit roads that may be dirt or gravel.. so when I know I want to link a section together on my adventure bike it will not allow me to select the road and auto snaps point to a longer more maintained route. 

I wish there was an option to be able to select any road you want. | Gives great route suggestions.  I especially like the round trip capability!  So flexible, you can tweak the route to customize to taste.
And then, during the ride, great turn by turn navigation!
The tracking is also a great feature, to create a route!
Very impressed with the Calimoto app!

title: Travelmath - trip calculator
description:
Planning a trip?  Let us do the math!

Type in two locations and quickly calculate the driving distance, flight time, closest airport to your destination,  cost of driving, and more.

"calculates your travel time so you don't miss your flights" - LifeHacker

"offers the option for calculating air miles" - USA Today

"whoever invented Travelmath, I love you!" - Drew Barrymore

With one simple app, you can get quick answers:
+ Driving Distance between cities
+ Flight Distance between airports
+ Closest Airport to any city
+ Nonstop Direct Flights to your destination
+ Time Difference and international time changes
+ Driving Time to measure the length of a road trip
+ Flight Times to see how long you'll be flying
+ Airlines flying to any city or serving any airport
+ Cost of Driving to plan your budget for gas or petrol
+ Stopping Points for a long road trip to find a hotel
+ Halfway Point between two cities
+ Surrounding Cities to explore the local area

Still not sure?  Try the website for free at Travelmath.com to test out the features, then download this free app to keep it on your phone or tablet.
releaseNotes:
This app has been updated by Apple to display the Apple Watch app icon.

Fixed input issues on some devices like the iPad Mini. Version 1.2 also adds new features like adjustable fuel efficiency and gas price, and a map of the route.
reviews:
First, you must enter MPG and gas price in order to have Driving miles calculate.  Otherwise, only flying miles calculate, which is just not the best option to default to in my opinion.  Under the gear (preferences), there really should be a preferred method of transportation.

Calculations are pretty quick, and accurate, but no indication of route being used to calculate the mileage.  So, you have to break up your trip in smaller junks to get mileage for your intended route. Which really takes so d time and planning.

Second, selecting an entry to re-type a different location (city) is next to impossible.  I have to click at the end and the click delete multiple times to remove an entry so I can enter a different location.

It’s not a great app, but it does the job. | The app defaults to flying miles with no option for switching to driving. Please fix this. | I loved this app so much until recently. I always counted on it and it was priceless to me . Until I put in a location and wanted to see how far to my destination and all it shows is via flying. Some locations to a particular destination will work however, others only show via flying and the bar across the top only shows flying. You have no option to choose driving like I used to . I did delete app and reinstalled but the same problem. Ugh | The app no longer shows distance in miles - only inflight - totally useless now. | Hurry up! | I have been using Travel Math since I had my RV. Recently, Travel Math only calculates travel distance by plane without giving the option to compute my driving distance. If the app. Developers can fix this bug it would be greatly appreciated. | I also have been using this app for a long time and all of a sudden, it just uses flying. We drive all the time and want the driving choice back! | This app is good when it gives you the driving distance but  most of the time all it gives you is flying distance. This needs to be fixed. | I have used the Travel Math website for years to find the nearest airports to a city, and the app was similar.  Now you have to put in 2 locations which makes it more difficult. | First off I’ve been using this app for a few years now for truck driving. It usually works well. However, recently I’ve been noticing of the app automatically selecting flying miles to with no option to switch to driving miles. Not good! Example: picking up freight in Rockford IL and heading to Bonduruant, IA. 
The app automatically showed “flying” miles and there was no indication of driving mile calculation. I’m finding this happening more and more with this app.
I need “drive”miles calculated.
Please fix this or add an option to select  flying or driving. | This app would be great if it didn’t constantly revert to flying mode! This makes it useless for me | This app is now useless to me without driving distances. Thanks for removing. | This app has become useless to me.
I’m traveling 400 miles and it want to give me the flight distance. Who is it to decide I’m flying when I’m actually driving. I can’t find driving distance anymore. There needs to be a section in settings to decide between driving or flying | I have used this app very often and it has helped to provide me information to plan my trips. Mostly, I drive therefore I’m more interested in getting driving distances not flight distances, however very recently I discovered that in many instances the app shows only flight distances which surprised me that the ability to see driving distances is no longer available. I will be happy if this is reviewed and brought back. Thank you. | It can’t seem to find Fort Worth Texas or Arlington Texas Both in the same area code | Don’t get this stupid app which is designed for idiots. I used it but it very seldom worked, so I deleted it. | This app functions like a single use calculator.  It does not retain any information.  For example if you enter the trip information and click back, the fields are empty.  Also, you can’t share the details of the calculated expense and the app does not store the results of prior calculations. | Can’t enter precise locations using addresses or neighborhood names. Fine if you’re going from one city to another, but I need to calculate mileage based on location within my city. Not sure why this wasn’t anticipated. | It doesn’t load properly just sits and spins and when entering location all you get is error codes. | I’m not showing any costs for flight option. Did something change? | This app could be a lot better as most other people say. I searched for the distance between Budapest, Hungary to Kiev, Ukraine. For flights it said that the only direct flights are on Wizz Air. That is correct but Ukraine International Airlines has direct flights from Budapest to Kiev. Wizz Air uses Kiev-Zhuliany Airport while Ukraine International Airlines uses Boryspil Airport. 

Why does it show Wizz Air but not Ukraine International Airlines? I know it’s the same with most other flight routes you could input. | In my opinion, Two changes would make this app perfect.

1. There should be an option to use “my current location” as the starting point.

2. In calculating fuel required, the app forces one to use whole numbers for the vehicle’s MPG. It would be more accurate if fuel mileage could be entered to one decimal point.

If the developer is reading these reviews, please consider these suggested changes. | No longer pulls up location where you are. What’s up with that. All settings are correct. | I love this app! I agree it needs a little bit of work. I can’t yet my location to work.  But I use it all the time when I’m on a road trip. | I do a lot of road trips and often need to calculate more than one location at a time.  A “save trip” feature would be very helpful.  That way I wouldn’t need to keep putting in information as travel plans are changed. | I no longer get the location I am presently at to show up automatically on the “From” line. As good as this app was, it is now useless. What happened?????? | I’m having an issue with the app determining my location all of a sudden. 
This is something that just started about three days ago. I’ve uninstalled the app and downloaded it back to my phone. I’ve also reset my network settings on my phone trying to troubleshoot the issue but it still persists. Is this an ongoing issue that you guys are working on or has the app crashed or something? | No nonsense, simple app. Very nice. No advertisements. | Great idea on the surface to get a snapshot shot of long distance commute, however my travel always include tolls an estimate of that cost will be great. Needs that improvement | Please, bring this app, to the status of the online site and you will be the best. Right now, you are just another app, that's taking up space. Please, go back to the drawing board and redo this app. Thank you!!! | This app, as others have mentioned, lacks the online calculators that make TravelMath so helpful. If these calculators were added to the app, this would be a truly useful app; but until they are added, it's nothing that any other map or travel app doesn't already have.  I like the calculator online of cost to fly versus drive, and the ability there to change the factors, such as number of people traveling or how many miles per gallon your car gets.  These would be really useful on this app.  Hopefully there will be some updates soon! | Doesn't even give halfway point like the photo shows. Don't bother. No options other than from, to, miles, travel time and the map. It DOES give an estimate of gas cost which WAS helpful!!!  Keep working on it. | As a frequent traveler this is one of my essential tools. | It is a good app but could be a lot better!! I gave it two stars because it has somethings that could make it excellent in my opinion!! One is that it does not save an address. It always wants to go to your location even if you turn the locator off. Therefore if you are moving to another state say, it is a repeat process of, this is the address where I work, how far is it from this point "A" to this house at point "B"!!! Small changes and I would rate this app a five star' | Doesn't take into account SPEED. JET STREAM. for example D.C. to Paris is going to be a longer flight than Paris to D.C. | No halfway calculation like it shows on the app description. | This app has no option to add the vehicle make and model so it can calculate the correct fuel consumption there for the estimated value of your trip is not correct if they were to add the option of the vehicle make model and year that would give you a more accurate estimate of what you fuel consumption would be | Would be nice if it allowed the speed to be modified. I'll just pull up the Calculater I guess. | Helped me out a lot with my trip planning | Good app to have to calculate distance and cost of driving. However, it does not have the other calculations available online such as cost to fly or drive. | Starting point about 375+ miles off. Won't let me reset. Useless | Perfect for the traveler who drives and likes to map out distances and reservations ahead of time. | I love this app.. It's really good if your thinking about taking a road trip somewhere and you'll know how much it'll cost to go. | I like the idea and the app, but it isn't fully useful to me yet. How about, in settings, you add a flight line like the ability to set speed? Puddle jumpers aren't  flying at 600mph so being able to set a realistic flight speed like 130 or 160 would help make app more usable. Yes, simple math but if you have to do it by hand, why use an app at all?

I do like how it picks the closet airport to my destination. I added a star just for that. | When I try to put in the city where I was traveling to it would not allow me to put in any city it doesn't work don't get it | No ability to set gas price, miles per gallon, or anything but the starting and ending points. It costs way more than $108.00 to drive a suburban from Seattle to Sacramento. | I like this app a lot!  It is a great quick way to get a round about idea of the distance to where you want to travel.  As far as gas expense, I don't think any app could pin point exact amounts, given traffic, speed etc.  Love this app!!! | Unless you Car gets 25mpg. | What more do people want?? USE YOUR GPS idiots if you want more info. I use it for motorcycle trips for mileage between cities between states, it does what it's made to do, does it great. Love It. | Can't change MPG calculation, would be nice if that could be customized on next update.

title: Transit – Trip Planner
description:
CG Transit offers offline trip planning in public transport systems of more than 20 U.S. and Canadian cities and European trains.

Just pick your departure and destination point and get a list of suggested routes including all the transfers and scheduled departure/arrival times sorted by the time of departure. You can then view detailed information of the routes, display them on the map etc. 

Key features:
• Fast offline searching
• Search routes by map
• Advanced search parameters - changing the date and time, adding "via" stations, choosing transport modes, etc.
• Favorite routes
• Push notifications of schedule updates and their immediate download

Available timetables:
• Selected transit authorities in the United States: New York (subway, buses, trains), Chicago, Los Angeles, Houston, Washington, San Francisco, Dallas, Denver, Minneapolis, Portland, Honolulu, Boston, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh
• Selected transit authorities in Canada: Toronto, Ottawa, Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver, Quebec, Winnipeg
• Train timetables in Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Poland, Benelux, Austria, the Czech and Slovak Republic, Portugal, Switzerland, Hungary, Nordic and Balkan countries
• Selected public transport, bus and train timetables in the Czech and Slovak Republic

U.S. and Canadian cities – free basic features (offline searching, search routes by map), paid premium features (more details, routes and stops searching, no advertisement)
European schedules - an annual license fee (one month to try out all the timetables for free)

Feedback, requests? Please email us at ios@cgtransit.com

Before I set my alarm, all I need to do is change the arrival day & time, and the app will tell me what time the subway leaves, when I will get uptown, how soon I have to be at the bus, and when I will arrive at work, with various options on routes and times on either side of my desired arrival time. title: Oahu GPS Audio Tour Guide
description:
Change the way you see Hawaii with Shaka Guide. You’ll get the comfort of a guided tour with the freedom to explore at your own pace. The app features six GPS audio tours of the island. Each tour visits popular attractions, beaches, hikes, scenic spots, and cultural sites. 

Along the way you’ll hear stories about the places you’re visiting, get important travel tips and listen to Hawaiian music. All tours are made locally, in Hawaii.

You’ll get hours of audio narration that plays automatically as your drive or walk. 

The app works completely offline. This means that even in remote parts of the island without wifi or data, we’ll still get you where you need to go! Shaka Guide tours never expire - use them more than once or break them up into multiple days. 

Change the way you see Hawaii with Shaka Guide! Check out the Oahu tours below. 

BUY THE ISLAND BUNDLE, GET ALL 6 OAHU TOURS 
When you buy the island bundle you’ll get ALL SIX Oahu tours for more than half off the retail price. 

GRAND CIRCLE ISLAND TOUR,  6 hours, 23 stops 
Popular Stops: 
* Oahu’s North Shore 
* Waimea Bay 
* Sunset Beach
* Haleiwa 
* Shark’s Cove 

EAST OAHU SHORELINE DRIVE, 6 hours, 19 stops
Popular Stops: 
* Kailua Beach 
* Lanikai Beach 
* Ho’omaluhia Botanical Garden 
* Diamond Head Crater & Hike 
* Hanauma Bay 
 
HONOLULU’S BACKYARD RAINFOREST TOUR, 3 hours, 11 stops 
Popular Stops: 
* Tantalus Lookout 
* National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific 
* Chinatown 
* Manoa Falls
* Lyon Arboretum 

LEGENDARY NORTH SHORE LOOP, 6 hours, 24 stops
Popular Stops: 
* Dole Plantation 
* Kawela Bay 
* Haleiwa 
* Oahu’s North Shore
* Kahuku Shrimp Trucks & Food Trucks

HEART OF WAIKIKI WALKING TOUR, 1 hours
Popular Stops: 
* Waikiki Beach 
* International Marketplace 
* The Royal Hawaiian Hotel 

HISTORIC DOWNTOWN HONOLULU WALKING TOUR, 1 hours 
Popular Stops: 
* Iolani Palace Grounds 
* Kawaiaha’o Church
* Honolulu Hale

Check out a complete list of stops for each tour in the app! 

WHAT CUSTOMERS ARE SAYING 
- “Great way to see Oahu!”
- “Your own private bus tour!”
- “Forget pouring through guidebooks!”
- “Shaka won't steer you wrong!!”
- “Wonderful customer support”
- “Worth every penny!”

DOWNLOADING THE TOURS
It’s important that you download the tours (preferably in wifi) before you go. Make sure the tour is completely downloaded and you’ll have no problem using the tours offline. 

BATTERY USAGE
The app uses your GPS only when necessary. Please remember that continual use of your GPS can dramatically deplete your battery. Be sure to pack a car charger for your tour.  

IPAD NOTICE
You can use an iPad to take the tour, however, wifi-only iPads without GPS capability will not work. 

ABOUT SHAKA GUIDE
At Shaka Guide our goal is to connect people with places. We love Hawaii. Not just for its beauty, but also for its rich history and culture. We believe that every destination has a story and we want to tell it. In Hawaii, we have over 20 audio tours that do just that - share the stories of the islands.

title: Travel Packing List & Planner
description:
Travel Planner And Itinerary Maker To Organize Trip Plans:
The TripTrop travel planner application is the perfect travel app for the traveler looking to create a customized trip plan with ease. 
With a comprehensive guide to destinations around the world with a travel itinerary maker and a trip planner that makes booking airfare and accommodations a breeze, TripTrop travel app has everything you need to take your vacation to the next level. Whether you're a backpacker looking to explore new places on a budget or a vacation planner looking for the perfect all-inclusive getaway, TripTrop travel planner has you covered.



Always On Maps: The TripTrop trip planner makes it easy to plan your next vacation. You can add all of the places that you want and connect them on a map so that they are easier for you when traveling around town or taking an adventure by car! The best part? It’s free with no advertisements in sight, making this travel planner both budget-friendly as well as reliable.



Offline Travel Planner: The TripTrop travel planner application helps you make the most of your holidays by automatically saving all those pesky "to-do" list items online. ideal for road trips and international vacations, because there is no signal where you are going!



Stay Organized While Traveling: Say goodbye to messy spreadsheets and complicated trip plans. Connect your Gmail and create a detailed itinerary with our itinerary maker travel app, in minutes. Create detailed itineraries by adding start (and end) times—perfect for keeping track of tickets and reservations.


Planning ahead never felt better than now with this amazing new tool
TripTrop is the best road trip planner for driving trips. Plan your route on a map to save time, and see estimated travel times between places that fit in one day without extending too far past 2 hours of driving per day (or whatever amount suits) - all easily accessible from within Trip Trop’s travel planner interface! 



TripTrop is the best alternative to Wanderlog Trip Planner, TripIt Travel Planner, Passporter, CheckMyTrip Travel Itinerary, Google Travel, Roadtrippers Trip Planner, Monnuage Mes voyages, Sygic Travel Guide de Voyage, and Visit A City. 

Terms of use: https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/


Download now!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes
reviews: I’m really excited about this app and what it offers! Finally, everything I need to plan my trips, all in one place. The user interface is as amazing as the user experience this app provides. Can’t wait to see more features!

title: The Global Key - Trip Planner
description:
The Global Key is the ultimate trip planner & curator of experiences for dreamers and travelers who want to take a city by storm and experience the best it has to offer. We are a global lifestyle and luxury travel guide designed to give you information about and access to exceptional restaurants, bars, clubs, hotels, luxury retreats and more, in cities all around the world.

The Global Key invites you to access exclusive, exciting travel destinations and experiences all around the world using our vacation planner. The list of luxury retreats, nightlife bars and cafes’, spas and restaurants is up to date and inclusive of the best places a city has to offer. 
 
Unlock the keys to the world through our:
 
TRAVEL ITINERARY - If you’re planning to visit a city, what better way of creating your personalised travel itinerary than by letting us do the job for you? Simply contact us and give us all your details and we will plan and schedule your entire trip for you. We promise to curate a lucrative itinerary that would not only take you to every dream destination but would also be absolutely perfect and suited to your interests. 
 
DESTINATION TRAVEL GUIDES - Finding a list of prime hotels, restaurants, nightlife bars and spas has never been easier. We have personally visited each place featured on our travel planner and have curated a city wise list. Our verified spots and locations meet the highest standards in terms of quality to ensure that you are content at the end of your stay. 


We want you to explore each city through our detailed city guide curated with the most up to date information about the best places to stay and visit. These tour guides are a collection of honest reviews and suggestions with details like the best time and day to visit, what to order, what to wear etc along with the basic contact details. We have also taken out time to put together beautiful photos of each place so that you can get a teaser of the new hotels, bars and popular venues in these cities on our vacation planner itself. We are a curator of experiences and we leave no stone unturned to make it worth your while.
 
MAKE VIP BOOKINGS - If you’re a part of The Global Key family, getting into the finest clubs and bars is a piece of cake. To be able to get in without any hassle, just drop in an email and we will ensure that you not only have a VIP booking under your name but also have the most exclusive, special and unique experience. 
 
Download The Global Key today, revolutionise the way you travel and unlock your boundaries with new, exceptional travel experiences. Once you’ve traveled with The Global Key, you’ll never want to travel any other way! 
 
Try for free or subscribe at $2.99/month or $49.99/year.

title: Voiaje : Group Trip Planner

FOR TRAVEL AGENTS AND TRAVELING TEAMS

FEEDBACK
For all comments, question and feedback, please contact us at : info@voiaje.com

title: EaseMyTrip Flight, Hotel, Bus
description:
Plan your next extravagant journey seamlessly with EaseMyTrip, India’s fastest-growing travel
app with over 20 million users. Discover the world of unparalleled travel solutions with us at
unbeatable prices in just a few clicks Whether you're looking to book flight tickets, hotels,
holiday packages, buses, cabs, cruises, or trains, you can book them all instantly in just a few
minutes at your convenience.

The EaseMyTrip app also features some of the most fantastic deals and discounts to satisfy
your wanderlust seamlessly. You can even enjoy effortless flight booking procedures,
exceptional fares, access to top lodging facilities for hotel bookings, finely-created tour
packages, round-the-clock assistance, advanced technologies and customer-personalised
facilities. One more thing, with the EaseMyTrip travel app you can unlock the NO CONVENIENCE
FEE* offers flight ticket bookings to turn their dream journey into reality.

So, don’t hold back- Download the EaseMyTrip app now to seize surprising discounts, and embark on mesmerising adventures like never before.

OUR EXCLUSIVE SERVICES

Flight Bookings

- Search, compare and book domestic and international flights at the lowest airfares.
- Enjoy special offers and discounts on one-way and round-trip flights
- Pay No Convenience Fee* on flight bookings

Our Top Domestic Airline Partners: Air India, Vistara, Jet Airways, SpiceJet, IndiGo, GoAir, Air Costa,
AirAsia and Indian Airlines.

International Airline Partners: Air Arabia, British Airways, Cathay Pacific, Delta Airlines, Etihad
Airlines, Emirates, Gulf Air, Air France, Lufthansa Airlines, Singapore Airlines, Thai Airways, Qatar
Airways, Kuwait Airways and many more.

Hotel Bookings

Bus Bookings

Holiday Packages

Train Bookings

Convenience Fee*

Cab Bookings

Cruise

Gift Cards

*Terms & Conditions Apply

title: Money Tracker+ Expense Manager
description:
• Apple “New Year, New You” Favorite 
• Apple App Store Staff Favorite

Lumen Trails lets you take notes, make lists and keep track of other things in your life such as time, workouts, expenses, calories, food, weight, sleep or anything else you can think of, even where you've parked your car. Thousands of people use it every day, and they love it because it truly makes a difference in their lives. 

“I've been using Lumen Trails for 6 months and continue to love it. One of my most sticky and useful apps ever on my phone.” – David D'Souza

The beauty of Lumen Trails is that you can track absolutely anything. There are tons of other apps that allow you to track one or two things, for example, calories and weight. But what if you decide to track something else? Say, how many cigarettes you smoke as you try to quit, your eating habits or even net worth? Lumen Trails is the app for that! 

Instead of having one app for your to-do lists, one for tracking expenses, another one for tracking your weight, you can declutter your home screen and just have one app that does it all. 

Designed exclusively for the iPhone, iPod touch, and iPad, Lumen Trails is incredibly powerful, easy to use, and looks beautiful on the Retina Display. It can even backup your data automatically to Google Drive, sync with iCloud, and is fully accessible with Apple VoiceOver in 8 languages. There's nothing that comes even close to it. And to top it all, your data is not locked on your iPhone. You can export it to Excel or Google Docs.

So what's truly important to you right now? Your Health? Fitness? Finances? Productivity? 

Track it and get things done!

:: Have a Question? 

We are here to help. Email us at support@lumenspark.com, or find us on Twitter @lumentrails.
releaseNotes: Fixes and improvements based on your feedback.
reviews:
All my notes are locked behind a paywall after updating the app! Avoid updating. Literally turned to ransomware. Shall complain to Apple.

Update will block this app access and force you to download a new Daily Tracker app OR you must pay a yearly subscription of $40. | Deleting App | Perfect in every way ! | Initially, I didn't "get" how useful this app truly was because of its deceptive simplicity...but the more I use it, the more it is everything I've hoped for! I’m not sure how the updated paid version would be of more help given the way I’ve been using the former version, but as is Lumen Trails is indispensable. | Excellent App. | Downloaded this game to check it out, somehow it subscribed me for an entire year making me pay 9.99 and I didn’t ok that. So just be careful! | I like this app and have used it for various and changing purposes. I like that there are templates so I don’t have to re-create the wheel for commonly tracked habits (like exercise) but I also like the flexibility to create my own trackers and chose options like yes/no or 1-10, etc | Love this app for keeping track of important information for my business and other things. 

Easy to customize and been using it for years. 

Thanks devs! | I love being able to make lists and attach pictures.  For Christmas we make lists for the kids and can text them to grandma and grandpa with all the details.  It makes things really smooth and easy for the holidays! | I have been using Money Tracker for just over 4 years now. I use it mainly for my stock trading.
I also use it for Shopping lists, reflections and  
Todo lists.
Well worth the download! | I was looking for a simple way to keep a journal. I haven't explore all possibilities but 
I wish I could open it on a browser and safe and download the content so I can archive it. I wish it was something like Evernote where you can store it and if you change phones you don’t loose the data. | Nothing like how the app was advertised. Very disappointed. | This is the most user friendly tracking app ever. | Not free | This app is a bit fuddy-duddy, and has not been updated in a long time. However, it gets the job done, albeit with some very confusing nonfunctional buttons and limited, counterintuitive entry methods.  I am trying to use the "bedtime" template to track my rise time each morning. However when I tap the "Add current time" to the journal entry field, this does not update the time field in the upper right-hand corner. The user is forced to manually click and type in the time.  Otherwise, the time will not show up on the monthly calendar view for tracking purposes.  Unfortunately, the task of manually entering a time presents new challenges and limitations.  For example, if I type in 500, this gets interpreted as minutes, converted to hh:mm format and shows up as "8:20". Or I would need to type "7" ":" "0" "3", to get 7 hours, 3 minutes.  There is no way to indicate a.m. or p.m. for these entries, which I suppose is not crucial, however it would be nice.  After all, it is possible to get a.m. and p.m. in the journal entries, so why not in the main data entry field in the upper right-hand corner?  The plus and minus buttons do not serve any function in this template, which is confusing.  When I press them, my data entry gets deleted and replaced by a "+" or a "-".  It is a steep learning curve for such a simple app, and the functionality is still lacking in many ways.  It is a promising app because of its versatility – it is a great idea to have an app that can track just about anything.  However it needs some re-tweaking of the user interface, as well as some serious rethinking about the various ways in which people would want to use an all-purpose tracking app. | See review title | 😍💀🏡 | This is the app I use most. Almost infinitely flexible - you can use this to track just about anything. It's impressively stable, and the sync and backup options are great. | I'm an entrepreneur and I use this to track my daily/weekly income and expenses. It's easy and intuitive. Sometimes it gets weird when you try to edit. But other than that, I love this app! | Overall recommended 👍👍👍

Other thought...  initially no ad then a few months ago saw ads so I stop using it.  I just looked again seemed no ad.

My advise price it reasonable so sell in volume, ad thingy is a big turn off. | I use this app pretty much every day to keep myself organized. Love the password feature for sensitive info too. | Downloaded the app to find that it has the same features as free apps, although you have to pay $10/year for this. Now trying to cancel it, there's no explanation on how to and there's no where to find how to cancel it.
I now have to email the company to cancel my subscription that i had to agree for before i even tried out the app. | I really like this app, but there are a few suggestions I have that would really increase my enjoyment of it. 

1) For recurring tasks, I wish there was a way to set a custom schedule. For instance, I have tasks I need to do on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, but the closest option I can get for scheduling is Every Two Days, which doesn't work with our weeks having an odd number of days. I also wish there was a way to filter my view to only show tasks due those particular days, and the ability to have a link note for each task, for instance to open an Evernote note with more details. (I've been using Fantastical somewhat successfully for this, but would like to pull these goal-oriented tasks into a more trackable arena.)

2) It's petty, and I know they're very proud of the icon, but I just don't like it. It looks very outdated next to the other app icons on my screen, to the point that I'm almost embarrassed to have it on my front Home page, and indeed I cringe every time I see it there. I just wish it was more modern or conceptual or something, rather than just being the footprints. 

3) Also concerning the icon, I wish there was an option to change the color of it in Settings rather than having to download another version of the app, which makes me nervous about retaining all the info I've plugged into my current version (even tho I do have it synced with iCloud).

4) The icons for the included list templates are nice, but I'd like to have an option for customizing the icons for lists I create. As it stands now, the icons for my lists based on templates give me a nice visual indication of what it is, but my created from scratch lists are generic and visually difficult to differentiate. 

Otherwise, it's a really versatile app for any number of things, and the more I mess around with it the more useful I find it to be! | The old version is great, but I for one HATE ads & subscriptions even worse! I would have bought a new version without ads, but now I won't buy anything by the developer. Looking for good replacement, please advise here to help others! | DO NOT UPDATE. Update has suddenly reverted to visible ads on a PAID IOS app, and changed the terms to a $2/month subscription to turn them off. Egregious behavior on the part of the developers and little diffferent than the extorting malware that holds your data hostage and exposes it to ad network security issues. Shame on you! | Congratulations Lumen Spark. You now rank as the most unethical company I have experienced in the Apple Store. You have destroyed this app, and any good will you may have had previous to this sabotage. | La verdad se merece un CERO bien grande.

La aplicación en si no es mala, pero la empresa, con todo respeto es de lo peor que yo he visto. 

En su momento yo obtuve la aplicación que costaba $19,99 use una promoción y no pagué ese monto, pero desde que sacaron las versiones nuevas, las que cobran un importe mensual, han venido desmejorado la aplicación (en mi opinión la han reducido), y hoy me encuentro con que le hicieron otro cambio, le metieron publicidad, y resulta qué hay que pagar $1,99 por mes para quitarla, me parece muy poco profesional, muy poco ético y muy desleal. En su momento ganaron cuando uno compro la app y ahora quieren ganar de nuevo pero no con una mejora. 

En mi caso buscaré otra aplicación qué hay muchas y mejores 

Saludos | Introducing monthly fees for a previously paid (and expensively paid) app is a fiasco. A so-called developer should DEVELOP a different NEW product, and establish such scheme for its new creation, not steal the one already sold and try to make people re-pay for it. Shame on Lumen Trails. | You used an update to put ads in an app I had already paid for? And then you want to charge a monthly fee to get rid of them. 
Why would I trust you with any more money? Very sleazy practice. | [Edited from 5 stars to 1 star due to adds in a paid app: the apps aren't cheap - $19.99, but now you also have to pay a monthly subscription of $1.99 a month to remove adds. I've used this app for years and am extremely upset at these unethical shenanigans - let old users skip your updates, or grandfather us in to not have to pay an indefinite monthly fee - totally unacceptable. I will be looking for alternatives.]

Lumen Trails: Most Versatile App
Lumen Trails' limits are your imagination, you can create all kinds of:
1. Checklists (groceries, projects, to do)
2. Tracking (time, expenses, budgets)
3. Notes (journaling, personal inventories of books, CDs, collections, virtual smash books)

You can insert reminders, pictures and sound files into any of the above. Back it up on the cloud, PIN protect the app, transfer data wirelessly to a computer or Google drive.

There's likely more that I haven't done yet, too.

I picked the one with the app icon color I liked the best; this is one of very few apps worth a hefty price, but know that each one seems to do all the same things - they just highlight or give examples of budgeting, time tracking, etc. | I purchased this app in past. The update now gives me ads and wants a monthly payment. Like the app but not enough to pay 2 bucks a month. | By far the best app i have ever used very detailed and simple
LOVE IT!! | Gives enough flexibility to track almost anything. | On my iPhone 4S, there's great delay when writing long words. | 🙏🏻👍🙌🙏🏻👍🙌 | The app is very flexivle. | Seems pretty good so far. I'm still working out the details on how to use it correctly. | Lumen Trails is a great app for multitasking. I really enjoy using it to keep my busy life on track! | While this did say there were in-app purchases, this only allowed me 7 entries for free. To do anything beyond that I had to purchase the app. I thought I would get a little more  use out of the "free portion" so beware that this isn't really a free app - it's more like a free trial. I thought it was a little challenging to figure out but I think I was just getting to know it better when I couldn't use it any further. | Lumen Trails is a great app. Keeps my life on the right path, organizing my hectic day to day schedule. Highly recommended!! | Very useful. | Out of the list apps this has been useful, efficient, and fun to use! Keep it up. | I've downloaded all of the applications and noticed at the bottom of the list on the left that you could unlock all categories for $4.99. I expected that to not only unlock all of the categories in all of the applications, but combine them all into one. Yeah, guess not. Thanks for the waste of five dollars. | Lumen trails is an amazing organizational app. I was looking for a simple solution for a budget on my phone. I expected to find something that would be a good stopgap until I was able to get to my computer. I was blown away by the complete solution that lumen trails offered. Highly recommend. | I've been needing this in my life for along time. | The simplicity of the app is one of it's best features. It's user friendly, and easy to input as well as find date. Makes life easier! | I have a deep connection with this app. It helped me path my way to success. And let me manage my time better. | Though it appears, at first, rudimentary, it's pretty useful and uncomplicated. I've found it very much grows on me as I use it more and more. | It is fairly simple but they do a great job of placing analytical information behind the simplicity for when needed. I hope they expand the financial aspects in future updates but it's already a fairly powerful tool. Great job! | So did I win the iPad Air?

title: RV Campgrounds: Camping & Park
description:
Find and book your ideal campsite in the United States, Canada, or the European Union. Transform your road trip into a thrilling adventure. Our goal is to build the ultimate campground locator & RV GPS app. We want to make RVing safer, more affordable, and more enjoyable.

TENT SITES, RV SITES, CABINS, AND GLAMPING ARE ALL AVAILABLE FOR BOOKING
• Use the app to find last-minute campsites and RV sites in your area, or plan to reserve the best campgrounds and cabins.
• Check out real-time camping availability in popular national parks such as Yosemite, Zion, the Great Smoky Mountains, and Yellowstone, as well as destinations ranging from Hawaii to the Hudson Valley.
• Campground locator: Search for campgrounds based on pricing, location, group size, pet friendliness, restrooms, showers, campfires, wifi, and more.

Our application is the ultimate RV trip planner companion. Our campground locator contains over 18,800 campgrounds, RV parks, RV resorts, the best campsites, free places to park over night.
Find millions of locations to visit, such as local diners and quirky roadside attractions, as well as picturesque sites, national parks, and motels. Use our pre-made tour guides to get ideas for some of the most interesting and once-in-a-lifetime itineraries you should visit at least once. You're never more than five minutes away from something fantastic!

No need to get an extra expensive navigation device or download another GPS application, our app is designed to navigate you to the destination. Our app has a built-in function of a GPS tracker with turn-to-turn navigation.

You may filter for only highly rated campgrounds and sort by number of reviews to find which ones are the most popular. Find campgrounds by kind, such as National Parks, State Parks, KOA campgrounds, BLM campgrounds, or even Big Rig friendly campgrounds. Look for campgrounds that provide Good Sam, Passport America, or AAA discounts.

Want to make your trip on a low budget or even roam for free? We are covering that too! Welcome to boondockers!
Find overnight parking locations:
- Search for Walmarts, Casinos, and Rest Areas that allow overnight RV parking
- Helpful tools and reviews from other boondockers, making boondoocking pleasurable as never before


CONTACT & DETAILS
Please send any feedback or suggestions to info@mobisharksdev.com

Terms of Use(EULA)— https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
Privacy Policy — https://www.mobisharksdev.com/privacy_policy

title: Mark Off: Visual Calendar
description:
Welcome to MARK OFF: VISUAL CALENDAR, the ultimate tool to organize your life, track your habits and visualize your progress like never before!
MARK OFF allows you to create 10 different types of calendars:

1. STREAK: Cultivate positive habits with streak tracking and insightful statistics. Customize day types, colors, and image creation to stay motivated and focused. You are not limited to tracking only daily habits - "neutral" days are added to separate bad days from the normal days without an activity. 


2. TRAVEL: Log your adventures, visualize visited countries, and plan future trips effortlessly. Customize travel destinations and track visas for seamless travel planning. Add locations of visited cities and places and see them on one map. Create your own Custom Countries with a picture you want, which allows you to fit the calendar to your needs, i.e. show trips in the Cities or States 

3. ACTIVITY: Monitor activities, moods, sports, symptoms and more with customizable image creation and detailed progress tracking. Enhance productivity and well-being with personalized insights. 


4. DEADLINE: Stay organized and never miss a deadline again with intuitive deadline tracking. Monitor days before and after important dates to stay ahead of your tasks. Now for each deadline you could specify a name and a color. 

5. EMOJI: Express your daily moods and activities with emojis, creating unique images for each day. Track progress effortlessly and add multiple emojis to capture every moment. 

6. WORK: Streamline work schedules, projects, and time off with customizable work types and schedules. Easily manage multiple projects and stay organized with manual entry options. You could have several schedules in parallel, i.e. to see when you and your partner are both free.  

7. PROJECTS: Effectively manage projects with customizable periods and visual tracking directly on the calendar. Stay on top of deadlines and milestones with ease. 

8. LIFE: Gain a holistic view of your life journey, track important moments, and visualize life stages effortlessly. Reflect on your past experiences and plan for the future with clarity. This calendar is inspired by WaitButWhy blog post "Your Life in Weeks” - Each square on calendar represents one week of your life 

9. PHOTO: Enjoy daily surprises with random photos or create a personalized photo calendar with your favorite snapshots. Add a personal touch to each day and cherish memories with ease. 

10. BASIC: Keep it simple with a traditional calendar where you can draw pictures for each day. Express your creativity and add personal touches to your calendar effortlessly.

Other Features:
- Fully Customizable Widgets: Access your calendars directly from your home screen with customizable widgets. Personalize colors, fonts and additional info for a tailored experience.
- Custom Images: Create and add custom images to any date with a long tap, enhancing your calendar with personal touches and memories.
- PDF reports, i.e. monthly/yearly reports with a total number of days you spent in each country, which is useful for tax and legal purposes - Notes: Add notes to any date to remember important things
- Export and Import: Seamlessly export and import calendars and widgets from the app settings for convenience and flexibility.
- iCloud sync and local backups: Access your calendars from different devices

Make Every Day Count:
Mark Off empowers you to organize your life, track your progress, and turn your goals into achievements. Download now and start making the most of each day!
I hope that MARK OFF will brighten up your waiting time and help you improve your habits. 
I would love to know about your success stories or ideas about the app, just write me an email from the app Settings
releaseNotes:
- new medium size widgets - quarterly (3 months) and weekly options added
- other improvements and bug fixes
