title: ONE to Ride
description:
METRO is the Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County, serving the Houston, Texas region with safe, clean, reliable, accessible and friendly public transportation services.

The ONE to Ride regional transit app is a personalized navigation tool that allows you to plan and manage your trip on Local bus, Park & Ride bus, METRORail or METRORapid. It requires a cellular network or wireless connection.

By allowing the app to access your location, you’ll see:
• Nearby bus, rail and METRORapid routes
• Real-time arrival estimates for nearby buses and METRORapid vehicles
• Scheduled arrival times for nearby trains

You can plan your trip by tapping an icon in the upper right corner of the screen.

The app’s unique My Stop technology then connects with thousands of beacons in the METRO service area to deliver notifications or pulse vibrations when you’re approaching your:
• Starting bus stop, METRORail or METRORapid platform
• Transfer point (if applicable)
• Destination bus stop, METRORail or METRORapid platform


Just plan your trip and watch or listen to your phone to monitor progress.

For further assistance, please contact METRO Customer Service at 713-635-4000 or visit our website at RideMETRO.org
releaseNotes:
- The app has a new name
- Updated menu with Houston Metro resources
- Fare card store locations
- Bus stops outside the route are now clickable
- Ability to plan trips in the "Arrive By" mode
developer: Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County

title: Paris Travel Guide and Map
description:
Offline Maps and much more! Discover new places and insider tips. Collect, save and organize them as you like. And have the best trip ever!
 
With us, traveling got easier and even more fun. Here’s what you get – the shortest possible version:
 
• Free offline maps – no roaming, no hustle
• Insider tips and places to discover
• Multifunctional lists to plan and organize your trip
 
We let you discover new places, beautiful spots and insider tips at the touch of a button. Collect your personal best-of and save it for later. You will experience your best journeys yet with detailed offline maps and in-depth travel content on your mobile travel companion.
 
And here’s why 5+ million travelers love our apps:
  
CLEAR AND CONCISE MAPS
Never get lost again. See your location on the map via GPS, no internet connection is required. Find streets, addresses or attractions and get pointed in the walking direction.
 
IN-DEPTH TRAVEL CONTENT
You’ll never have to buy another guide book. Our Guides features pictures as well as comprehensive and up-to-date information is available for thousands of places and attractions.
 
SEARCH AND DISCOVER
Search a specific place by name or browse by categories like restaurants, architecture, hotels, shops, bars, etc.
 
PLAN TRIPS AND CUSTOMIZE MAPS
Book the hotel for your next city tour right within the app. Remember and save all the places you would like to visit. Create new or individual ones. Mark them with different colors or add notes to them. 
 
SAVE ROAMING FEES
Maps and guide content are stored on directly your device so you can access them at any time even without an internet connection. An internet connection is of course required for initial downloading of data or booking hotels.

BACKUP AND SYNC
Create a user account and login from any of your iOS devices. So all your personal content is right where you want it to be.
releaseNotes: We added "Sign in with Apple" as authentication method and fixed some bugs!
reviews:

Most recent trip last week, the map went blank. All saved places still there but no streets or saved stars show up in the screen. Is anyone else experiencing this and would someone please help me troubleshoot this? | We really appreciated this app as a handy tool on our trip to Paris and highly recommend it to others for their journeys! | Nice app. It would nice if I could share or export this to my wife’s phone AND when I have a category.. for example… “Markets”, when I click on the map to locate that market, the map only show the markets I have saved and not all the other point of interests I’ve saved in other categories. | I used to love this app, but now… The search function is terrible, and the Metro map outdated. It doesn’t even list the RER C line, which is kind of a big deal. And if you search for “notre” or  “notre dame”, you get no results. Need to type “notre-dame” to find anything. No longer my go-to app for Paris. | This App has helped us present our vaccination status while traveling throughout Europe. The convenience of having the entire family in just a couple of swipes. Although it’s good to have your original record as backups (never had to use) this is the recognized solution while traveling in many places throughout Western Europe. | I found this app for my second, and his first trip to one of the most beautiful places in the world. As I did my research, I bookmarked all the landmarks, restaurants, cafes, gardens, hidden passages and patisseries that looked interesting, with notes and links to the review or menu. It was so helpful as we wandered the city, to look at the app to find, “hey, we’re just around the corner from…” I told so many people about it. 

Now, 2 years later, as we plan another trip, it seems buggy. The map keeps disappearing. I go to see a location I pinned, and nothing. I uninstalled the app and readdded it and it worked for a while, but is broken again. We leave in a week. We also learn to move on Metro, train  and bus. To the different cafes,  restaurants | The map feature was awesome! | My whole week in Paris depends on it! | Above | User Friendky Detailed , Easy , Accurate. | This app is going to save my time in my next trips. I’m preparing my route and planning every day to use when I’m there. Thank you! | Outstanding resource as we navigated Paris without data. | We used this app CONSTANTLY to find all the sites, shops, record stores and parks we wanted to see. Very easy to use and no bugs found yet! AAA+ | The app really helped me find my way around. | Best App for travel. I’m able to navigate to wherever I want to go and don’t have to use my expensive data plan. | Great app | I relied on this during my trip to Paris and it helped me to successfully navigate the city.  Thanks! | Great | This is an easy to use app that works well. Definitely top notch. | Helps locate and highlight all the places we want to see! | Loved the app!!! It was so easy to use. While in Paris it worked amazing!! We were able to find our way around Paris with no trouble at all!!! | Very helpful for getting around Paris | I live the Maps2Go App for offline use and the good source of hotels and restaurants.  It would be better if you could add a search feature using the Map instead of just getting a list. | Thanks for the great map! | I loved this app for years. It has all of Paris, not just the tourist parts. But somewhere in the last update, it seems to have added pop up ads, even though it’s an app I bought. My phone screen is small as it is, and I’m very disappointed the ads are now permanently on the map. | Back in the day, you carried a little red map book to get around Paris. Now, you just whip out this app and you’re unlost. Nostalgia is good, but knowing where you’re going is better. | Uses are many and it’s free. Maps,subway map. Prior version seemed easier to search places and addresses but it’s my go to downloadable map with flagged locals I choose before traveling. | Download to be used offline and never get lost.   Nice to have the metro included. | Ease of use ! | Easy to use & addictive in a good way | Had a wonderful experience and terrific food. Nice and great service. | Love this app | I travel with a smartphone and an iPad. When I have network connection, it is very useful to have a precise map already loaded. | I do t know his we could have got through Paris without this app!!!  Both in planning before hand and finding and going while in Paris, this app was essential to finding and learning about the many wonderful things Paris has to offer. | If you don't pay don't bother | This app consistently fails to download offlline content. So the number one reason you would want to use this app is also the number one reason it doesn't work. It's a good start but that needs to be fixed. | Paris, FR used for anniversary trip in June 2017. Very helpful for locating streets as we moved about in Paris for 2 weeks. | Used this app in Paris, it worked very good offline what helped me to find my location in the city easily. I like the option that I could find any sightsee being offline :) thanks | This app gives you the ability to locate where you are and where you need to go with a simple touch of the finger. It also tells you where the Metro is located and what cafes and restaurants and monuments are nearby. Indispensable! | If you are going to visit Paris (and surrounding areas) then you need this app! 
So basically, you get a map that looks a lot like Google Maps. It's complete with locations, road names, and even the entire metro system which was extremely useful for me! 
You are also able to create a "list" of restaurants, attractions, custom locations, etc, and save it all so that you know exactly where you're going in advanced. 
My ONLY problem with this app is that it won't show you turn by turn directions which shouldn't be an issue if you're good with directions.
It also gives you recommendations of places to check out based on categories you can choose from like night clubs, shopping, the best food, and stuff like that. 
All in all, I heavily relied on this app during my week in Paris (It was literally my bible) and I couldn't have been happier with how it turned out. It didn't drain my battery either! Thank you to the creators, I truly love this app. 

PS: if you ever get lost, your smart phone should still show your gps location on the maps app even without service. It should be easy to use this app once you find yourself. 
Also, the metros will take you to almost every landmark in Paris with minimal walking so I'd invest in a "carnet" of 10 tickets at the metro. | Super nice I can plan my future trip to Paris. It’s super cool that you can make lists and notes I really like it.

I recommend this app if you want to go to Paris someday. | Going to apple or google maps part needs to be online. If you use the show map, gps works to show your current position and help get to your destination. | We downloaded everything ahead of time and I was able to tour around Paris without WiFi. I wish every major city has such a tool. | Excellent Paris app tres non | I have used it several times on trips to Paris and it works like a charm!  Map and destinations all in the same place!  5 stars.  It would great to have more colors than are presently available for destinations in the lists. | This made my trip to Paris way easier to navigate.

title: pebblar
description:
Pebblar is the most advanced and intuitive itinerary planning app available.
Plan your own unique itinerary as detailed as you’d like.
The only itinerary planning application with real-time collaboration capability.

Are you using Word or Excel to plan itineraries?
Are you looking for a tool to map customized events and addresses?
Is data privacy important to you?
If so, Pebblar is the best travel itinerary maker for you.

From putting together a trip wishlist to creating a detailed itinerary; from pre-trip planning to on-trip access – all done in one place.
Plan any kind of travel itinerary – vacations, work trips, solo travel or group trips.
Pebblar’s real-time collaboration capability provides you and your co-travellers with a fun and in-person-like collaboration experience. All edits auto-saved and centralized removing version-control risks.

BEFORE THE TRIP
From trip ideas to a day-by-day itinerary, you can now map out and organise everything on a single map view, and we will show you the travel times and auto-fill the details for each place of interest.
You can create custom ideas and add your own notes & photos, so it is a complete and personalised itinerary
You can add friends, family or colleagues as trip buddies and plan together, in real-time!

ON THE TRIP
Access and edit your itinerary anywhere you go.
Complete-offline access.
AR-enabled meaning we will literally show you the way to your itinerary places.
Get live direction for driving and walking.

---
Pebblar Subscription:
Subscriptions are available either unlimited time access per itinerary or unlimited access paid monthly.
Pricing options: 
1. US$10 per itinerary; or
2. US$9.95 per month (unlimited number of itineraries).
Your payment will be charged to your iTunes account at confirmation of purchase. Monthly subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the subscription period. You can manage your subscription and auto-renewal in Account Settings after purchase. Any unused portion of a free trial period, will be forfeited when the user purchases the monthly subscription.

---
Terms of Use: https://pebblar.com/terms_of_use.html
Privacy Policy: https://pebblar.com/privacy_policy.html
releaseNotes:
What's new :
- Bugs fixed.
reviews:
Pebblar is my second-favorite app in this category. It does a lot of things right, and I especially like its ability to collect brainstorming ideas and then add them to a final itinerary. 

The interface is a bit cluttered and confusing, however, and the app doesn’t quite handle all the fundamentals as well as some competitors. The app has also crashed on me several times, and produces audio feedback for every button click, which can’t be turned off and quickly becomes annoying. The web interface is better than the app in almost every way. | Used this to plan our trip, super helpful specially if you are going to a lot of places you’re not familiar with.  It helps you group them together. | If you have used google map trip planning feature, this is the plus version of it! 
Easy to use and digest travel info, and they are always rolling out new features! | There was a major glitch that occurred on the app causing me to be unable to use it for the first day of my roadtrip I had planned (and paid for). Nan was very helpful in making sure the problem was resolved in a timely, professional manner. The glitch did screw up the first day of my trip, but now that it’s fixed, the app works perfectly and I am happy to continue to use it! | Pebblar is a great no-frills app for travel planning. It calculates mileage between stops, lets you pick your method of travel, input hotels, dining, and points of interest from a database (and I didn’t run across anything that WASN’T in the database). Has a great expenses breakdown chart feature. You can download all your trip data in case you lose mobile service while on your trip. And you can purchase a one-time trip so you don’t have to pay for an expensive yearly subscription like with other travel apps — this is great if you only travel once a year like I do. There is also a companion web app. My favorite feature on the web app is the “print” function, which sounds odd, but it spits out a PDF containing everything under the sun! Maps, daily routes, daily lists, overall itineraries… so great. Developer is extremely responsive to questions and feedback. I’m very glad I found this app for planning my summer road trip. | The app loads to a screen that tells me there are two kinds of tabs in the app. I cannot click out of this screen and get to the app itself. This is literally all it is. | So the concept is great but the app itself is kinda buggy. The UI has panels with instructions that don’t go away. I’ve been using it to plan a 10 Roadtrip. It would be nice if it functioned more like a regular calendar with the map on a separate panel like it set out to do. Also on the computer you can reorder the route much easier. | They’ve thought of almost everything! I just started using it for a weekend birthday trip coming up and am looking forward to using it for my upcoming 22 day trip to London and Paris. Absolutely love the expense tracking, check lists, and document uploading. Is there a notebook or journal area so you can write about the fun things you did or take notes, or is that just in the reservation/note section of each event? | This app and the desktop version are awesome overall however a few things could be majorly improved. On the desktop app, there is no option to sort your big list of activities that show up on the left side of the screen for each city. It would be nice if you could sort by date, or type of activity (I.e food vs attraction). It would also be nice if there were more options to filter the map, again based on type of activity, I.e. all the restaurants saved. You can assign color labels but there’s nothing then that you can do interactively with these labels other than see them pop up on your map. It’s also not easy to shuffle around your itinerary, I.e. if I want to move all my June 4th activities to June 5th, I have to individually click a new date for each activity on the left side panel, which is especially difficult because, again, you cannot sort this panel by date. 

Still overall highly recommend but needs lots of improvement! | It’s written towards the end of the description that it needs subscription. I downloaded and started editing my trip. The interface is good, looks modern and simplistic. Too bad I can’t use any of it unless I pay money. Though it’s not entirely developers fault, wish Apple marked Apps that require subscription separately. | As I was trying to plan a trip I noticed that it wasn’t letting me add more cities to my trip (I’ve only have added two so far). | I have planned my last two international trips using Pebblar and have been thoroughly impressed. I will never plan another trip without Pebblar and will certainly never go back to using Google map stars again! The app is under continuous improvements and the dev team were super helpful to get me back on the go. The option to collaborate is another great feature to help plan your next trip with coworkers and friends alike. Do yourself a favor and try Pebblar!

title: Road Trip Guide by Fotospot
description:
Fotospot is your ultimate road trip companion! Explore well over 11,000 handpicked, photo-worthy tourist attractions across all 50 United States (plus D.C.). Discover amazing waterfalls, enormous roadside attractions like donuts (and one bagel), one-of-a-kind museums, film locations from your favorite movies and TV shows, world-class street art, scenic and historic locations, plus countless other spots featuring the wild, the wonderful, and the just plain weird. 

No internet? No problem! With 19 offline guides, Fotospot has you covered, even in internet dead zones like national parks, deserts, and remote locations. Say what?! You read that right, you can access our photos, content, maps, and even check-in (and get points!) with no internet connection! And the best part? They’re now all included for FREE with your initial download. Available offline guides include:

National Park Guides: 
Arches 
Badlands 
Bryce Canyon 
Death Valley 
Glacier 
Grand Canyon 
Grand Teton 
Great Smoky Mountains 
Joshua Tree 
Rocky Mountain 
Sequoia & Kings Canyon 
Yellowstone 
Yosemite 
Zion 

Hawaii Guides: 
Big Island 
Kauai 
Maui 
Oahu 

Road Trip Guides: 
Pacific Coast Highway 

Get ready for Road Trip Trivia, adding a thrilling twist to your journey. With 800+ multiple choice questions, every mile becomes a chance to showcase your smarts, ignite discussions, and revel in those “a-ha" moments. 

But Wait, There’s More. Fotospot also lets you suggest new spots, add photos and comments, check in to existing attractions, save attractions so you can visit them later, follow your friends' adventures, compete on the leaderboard, and get FREE stuff!

One time purchase. We don't have any in-app purchases, subscriptions, or regional restrictions in our app. For a simple one-time download fee, all 10,000+ of our curated Fotospots covering all 50 states (plus D.C.) can be yours for life. Additionally, you’ll get access to ALL of our offline guides including all the Hawaiian Islands, Joshua Tree, Pacific Coast Highway, Yellowstone, and Zion at no additional cost!

Leave no trace. When visiting any attraction (in our app or not) please be responsible and leave it exactly how you found it. Take only photos and leave only footprints. To learn more please visit LNT.org

Happy exploring, 
The Fotospot Team 

#fotospotapp
#fotospotting
releaseNotes:
UI updates and performance improvements
Updated API declarations
reviews:
I love this app so much! I do a lot of travelling for work and this helps keep it interesting when I have to go to new locations. I'm also pretty excited about all the guides being free now as well. | The concept is great for this app but it’s super buggy. You can work around a few of the bugs but not all. I will continue using it and hopefully it will get some updates. | the app gives nothing worth the initial price, and then asks money for spots in national parks available for no fee.  save your money, don’t feed scoundrels, they breed flies and other pests like themselves. | Love ForoSpot! None of the lame drama of social media sites and tons of great sites I’d never have discovered without it.  Highly recommended! | I just found this app. We are more than half way through our road trip. I found some amazing spots in towns like St Charles MO. And fascinating abandoned buildings. Throughout Kansas. I wish I could alert more people. And I wish this app would let me add a spot. If I can add one I haven’t figured that out. | This app is absolutely phenomenal! After retirement, I spend a lot of time doing road, trips and photography. This app has everything you need to help you see the United States, and all the great things that are there! | I have been using FotoSpot for awhile and I am pleased to report that I have no intention of discontinuing its use or reverting to using travel books and magazines. FotoSpot has explored thousands of tourist attractions in all 50 States, including locations such as the “The Cursed Stone Couch” in Pennsylvania (where I live), which I had never heard of, but I found extremely interesting. Wherever you may be, you can check for attractions that are close by simply tapping the “Nearby” button in the app or, if you prefer, tapping on the map icon for a view of your location where you can zoom in and choose “show Fotospots in this area.” Clicking on any visible mini-camera will tell you where it’s located. Clicking again will display a picture of the attraction and a detailed explanation. While on the screen, you have the option to save that location for later or, if you’re already there, add a photo for other users to view. On this screen, you can click on the “Been Here” button or the ”Check-In” feature, which will gain you points. Did I forget to mention points? With the points you collect from visiting sites, you can trade in for FotoSpot “swag.” Now that is cool - an app that gives back! | I’m here in CT exploring the state and there are so many amazing waterfalls that are missing from here. I wish there was a way to submit locations. | Makes the long boring road trips a little more interesting! | I like how this app is almost a no-brained—it simply uses your location to pinpoint nearby landmarks. You can tap each Fotospot that comes shows up on the map, and decide which ones are worth your time. It’s also interactive; it gives you that social media feel because you can submit your own photos to help fellow travelers out. | As a travel novice, I tend to rely on other travelers to know where to go. This app is made for me to not just post my experiences and photos but guide my path through others. Great job! | As a photography enthusiast, I’m always looking for new places off the beaten path to go visit and snap photos. This app is extremely useful for that and saves me a lot of time narrowing down where my next adventure will be. | I absolutely love this app! I’m obsessed with it. Who knew there were so many cool places around me? I can’t wait to log more!!! | Very nice 👍 | You had me at larger-than-life, novelty-sized Muffler men! This has been a gem as I explore the country - so many cool, off-the-beaten-path attractions. | Wish this app was available for other phones not just iPhones. I was telling friends of mine about it and they can’t download the app. 

Other than that I love it! | All I can do is move around a map. Can you add a text search option? | Explore and get some air!
Don’t stay locked up wearing a mask!
Get some fresh air and sunlight! | Urban explorer here and I have used Fotospot constantly for the last year or so and I am never disappointed. I love finding stuff off the beaten path or abandoned and I appreciate all of the people who make Fotospot what it is! You guys are the best. 

Check us out! @urbanexplorersusa | Using an iPhone app on an iPad sometimes works but in this case it is disappointing. | It popped up saying “Enable location” I hit okay and it won’t do anything so I can’t even get into the app. I tried to re-download it & everything but it still won’t work. I keep hitting the button and nothing changes. | I travel all over the country for work, and have been doing so for many years. I thought I knew all of the cool and quirky things to see in most cities, until I found this app. Not only can you find unique spots to check out, but you can earn points when checking in or uploading a picture. You can redeem the points for some pretty cool, comfortable, and unique shirts….and a hat with the company logo on it is also an option. Another cool feature is the content can be provided by the community/users of the app. I really enjoy being able to contribute to such a fun platform.  Keep up the good work Fotospot! | Some very interesting places. Get out & see Texas. No other place like it. | This sight is really good place to find unusual out of the way spots to visit! | The app can’t even be used unless you turn your location on.  It should be allowed to search places without having to turn on my location | Wish I could add places. | I’ve tried all three methods of registering for an account multiple times and it keeps giving me an error that I need to try again later. Very frustrating and needs to be fixed. | I just got it . So far I like it. I have a ton of pictures I would like to post but I am not at the location. I like posting after I leave a location,  for safety reasons. I wish that was an option with this app, or maybe I haven’t learned it yet. | I just switched from iOS to android and I just figured it out that this app is not available on Google store. 
I really loved this app. | This app allows you to find interesting (and many time odd!), beautiful, fun and unique destinations all over the country! You get to collect points for free Merch (very cool stuff) and compete against friends. I travel a lot for work and it makes going to new places fun! I highly recommend this app! I have been to 47 states but now have to revisit them all to see the “Fotospots”!!!! | I was looking for cool local things to do and this app has it all!!! Great pictures, directions and historic value given also

Will even use in my own city | If you value your privacy, don’t use this app!  I found my photography posted on the app’s Facebook page.  So, they are monitoring your input & taking what they want.  As soon as it was posted, I found that I was suddenly being followed by someone that I have no desire to know.  Your privacy goes out the window with this developer.  Be careful. | Where has this been all my life? If you need help figuring out what to do this weekend, or want to explore spots that really express a city or state’s unique character, look no further. | As a dad, it helps to have this guide to some fun locations no matter where we are at to explore with the kids. We’ve already shot some really cool photos 👍🏼 | Hi I love this app! Especially because I’m from Sf and everyone always asks me where to go take photos! How can I add a tourist spot that’s not shown? Is it possible! Anyways great job guys! I will share with everyone I know! 👊🏽👍😎 | Pretty cool App I love you so much | i was so excited for this app i was gonna start saving all these cute ventures right away !! then i went to hit the save button the app requests i make an account, then when i try to adjust the age no numbers pop up or months leaving me at ten years old and unable to use the app because you have to be thirteen. i would love to be able to put my correct age into the thing so i can use the app but it won’t allow for it !! | Just downloaded this app and it isn’t letting me confirm my age. I get to the profile section and fill out my name and email, right when I try to confirm age, it won’t let me add my bday. The months and dates are not appearing on the scroll as well as the year. Deleted the app and tried again. Same thing. Bummer. I wanted to try the app out. | Much potential here but they need to do a lot more to make this app more than what it is. 

1st - needs way more spots listed, it is fine to get user added spots but the developers need to go into certain areas and add more popular spots. There is no reason for some of these major hot spots and destinations like the outerbanks to have one or two items, developers, do the work and add spots. And you need to make it much easier to find and add a spot for the user added spots. Very convoluted. Give users bonus points for adding spots and you might get more people doing it. 

2nd - not enough participants on this ap to show more photos and give feedback. Most spots only have one photo. And just not enough spots or incentives to make people use the app. 

3rd - make an option to select multiple photos at a time and choose photo albums from your phone. The ap is very slow and I don’t want to add one at a time. This makes people less likely to bother adding more or any at all. 

4th - let people leave reviews/feedback about the location/site or star value rating on if worth visiting or not. | I really like the idea of this app. I think it’s cool that it lets you know hidden gems that are near you. A big problem I have with it is when you try to check in. You can be at a location and it constantly says you aren’t close enough. I think you need to broaden the check in to at least 5 miles around the cite. A lot of the cites don’t have great reception so you should be able to check in when you can. There is no benefit in lying so it would just be nice to still be able to post it. I tried to add a site but it didn’t end up letting me put the state and it didn’t save. So that seemed like a glitch too. | that app is so awesome!!! not only is it addicting due to the points system they implemented, it is also so cool to see what is “tour worthy” around you. I accidentally spent the whole day driving to new places, hiking, taking photos, and exploring my state. I highly recommend !! I am excited for my new road trip, so I can show off this app to my friends. | I live in Los Angeles and love exploring all these unique attractions. I think the heart stairs are my favorite. This app rocks!  \m/ (> <) \m/ | So may cool spots to explore! | Fun fun fun !!!!! | I love love love this app! It’s my go to app when I’m going on a road trip and when I’m just traveling to a new city! There’s so many places around me that I had no clue existed! Love that you can check in and save places as favorites! Such an amazing app! | Can’t get passed location sharing page. I click ok and it just sits there. Want to use. | You guys are so close to having a near perfect app. So many people are giving you the answer on how to fix it too. NOT being able to look around and view spots separate from your current location is a huge miss. When people travel, they want to plan ahead. It’s so simple! Additionally, international locations outside of the US would be amazing too. | Downloaded this app after seeing its ad on instagram. It is cool that I can see photo worthy spots nearby where I am. However, I want to see other cities as well for planning my future trips. Main list view is always set to my current location - I cannot change it to somewhere else. I am able to manually change to another city with the map view, but every time I click on a photo worth spot then go to prior screen hoping to see other spots, it resets my map view back to my current location.

Hopefully the developer can make an update to this app. Or if I am using incorrectly and there is this function already, please advise. Thanks! | Love this app so far but there are lots of errors.  Places misnamed,  wrong locations of supposed photo.  Within a 10 mile radius of where I live there are at least 5 errors. Still a really cool app and it deserves 5 stars when they can fix these accuracy issues. | . Sưl//

title: Trip Planner - NSW Transport
description:
Whether you're old enough to remember MX newspapers on trains, or new to Sydney, this app is designed to make horrific commutes slightly less so! Simple trip planning for all modes of travel, up-to-date train network alerts, stored favourite trips - everything you need to get to and from work and play hassle-free...for free. The only thing this app can't do is cancel trackwork or prevent people playing music loudly enough that you can hear it in spite of their headphones!

Trip Planner
• Train, Metro, Bus, Ferry, Light Rail, Foot
• Mixed-mode planner
• Take the same route often? Save your favourite Trips
• Simple, easy to use interface

Trackwork and Service Alerts
• If you use public transport in Sydney, chances are you know how useful these will be!
• Service alerts by journey
• Know in advance if you need to make a detour or avoid a particular line due to trackwork

Subscribe to Trip Planner and get:
• Exactly the same app, but with a feeling of mutual appreciation between us
• No ads, ever!
• All for the low, low price of bugger all, which is Australian for $1/month

Please note that while we make our best effort to ensure timetable accuracy, we cannot guarantee the accuracy or completeness of those provided. 

If you purchase a subscription, payment will be charged to your iTunes account. Your subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current subscription period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current subscription period. Automatic renewals will cost the same price you were originally charged for the subscription. You can turn off auto-renewal at any time by going to your Account Settings on the App Store after purchase.

Terms of Service: https://jerrycan.co/metro/terms.html

title: Madrid Travel Guide and Map
description:
Offline Maps and much more! Discover new places and insider tips. Collect, save and organize them as you like. And have the best trip ever!
 
With us, traveling got easier and even more fun. Here’s what you get – the shortest possible version:
 
• Free offline maps – no roaming, no hustle
• Insider tips and places to discover
• Multifunctional lists to plan and organize your trip
 
We let you discover new places, beautiful spots and insider tips at the touch of a button. Collect your personal best-of and save it for later. You will experience your best journeys yet with detailed offline maps and in-depth travel content on your mobile travel companion.
 
And here’s why 5+ million travelers love our apps:
  
CLEAR AND CONCISE MAPS
Never get lost again. See your location on the map via GPS, no internet connection is required. Find streets, addresses or attractions and get pointed in the walking direction.
 
IN-DEPTH TRAVEL CONTENT
You’ll never have to buy another guide book. Our Guides features pictures as well as comprehensive and up-to-date information is available for thousands of places and attractions.
 
SEARCH AND DISCOVER
Search a specific place by name or browse by categories like restaurants, architecture, bars, hotels, shops, etc.
 
PLAN TRIPS AND CUSTOMIZE MAPS
Book the hotel for your next city tour right within the app. Remember and save all the places you would like to visit. Create new or individual ones. Mark them with different colors or add notes to them. 
 
SHARE WITH FRIENDS
Create your own reviews and ratings of your favorite places. Share these tips and recommendations with friends and other travelers.
 
SAVE ROAMING FEES
Maps and guide content are stored on directly your device so you can access them at any time even without an internet connection. An internet connection is of course required for initial downloading of data or booking hotels.

BACKUP AND SYNC
Create a user account and login from any of your iOS devices. So all your personal content is right where you want it to be.
releaseNotes: We added "Sign in with Apple" as authentication method and fixed some bugs!
reviews:
You need to updated more frequently but Thankyou some of the stuff you put in is very helpful       Thankyou | Excellent tool to keep a first time tourist in Madrid on track. | Very nice app guiding you through Madrid | Me gusto mucho esta app | Es una app súper buena, me ayudo mucho cuando fui a Europa porque desde antes ubiqué los lugares que quería visitar y poder seleccionar un hotel cercano | Make sure you download maps and Wikipedia data. GPS works very well offline and you can access information on places and sites as you go- just like a mini travel guide | I originally gave this a 5 star review but am demoting it to one star. It worked perfectly and as expected for a day then erased half of my stars on the map even though they were still saved in my favorite places. Locations were also inaccurate. I realized I could download google maps, so for the remainder of my trip I used that. | I always use Ulmon when going to new cities because everything is there at your fingertips. Madrid is no exception. Only thing missing is a metro map.... | Nothing better to get information about places, maps, restaurants and atractions | And I love this guide. It helps me find different places so get to know the city better. | great | Go and download this app. You won't regret it! | Go-to map for Madrid! This my guide for getting everywhere in the twisty grid that's called Madrid. A wonderful offline guide. 100 stars! | When traveling first thing I look for is if this app has a map for the city or place am going to. And so far it always has the map and offline and integrated with the GPS. 
The bonus - list of museum, restaurants, tourist spots, etc | Loved using this app during my trip to Rome. Found it helpful and very user friendly. Experience was so good I now look out for other Ulmon city travel guides whenever I travel! | Excelente aplicación de mapas sin tener que estar conectado a Internet, permite acceder a él y más aún ver en qué lugar de esta sin tener que ocupar la conexión a internet, triangula con antenas de celulares y no se utiliza el roaming. | This map has been so incredibly helpful during my vacation. I can't believe how useful it is throughout the day, yet uses NO DATA, because it works through gps to track your location. Awesome app!! | Usually don't rate apps but after a trip to Europe using this offline maps, I can asure you, this app will make your trip easier and you won't miss any important spot in the city. I used London, Paris, Amsterdam, Berlin, Prague, Vienna, Venice, Rome, Florence, Barcelona, Madrid and Lisbon! In Budapest I felt lost because they don't have a map for this city but Google also doesn't have a map for Budapest offline. 
I'll put 6 stars but I can't so 5 it's the closest. One more thing, all this is for FREE! And this is not all, also you can download the information about the historic places in the city and then you can get the info offline. 
You have to try it!! | Great app, very helpfull | Excellent app for exploring Madrid - offline!  Full of great suggestions and site information!  GPS capability prevented me from going down the wrong road many times!  No option to select your walking path, which would have made this app even better!! | I visited Madrid and this map came very handy on several occasions. I was able to look up places even when I was off the network since it gave me the option of downloading points of interest when I first opened the app. | I went for a 16 day Europe trip and this maps literally saved my vacation experience. I highly recommend this maps! Be aware that sometimes you have to use common sense by searching for the Metro Stations. Enjoy! Highly recommended! | I love this app. I am able to imput different markers for places that are of interest to me, once I select the location I can later refer to it, which is better than having a paper map. | Traveling around for a few days in Madrid the offline map worked great using GPS and saving on 3G/LTE connection fees. Roads, names, and sites were very accurate.  Some restaurants changed, etc... But all maps have those issues. | Works OK. Very useful cause u don't need internet | This is our first time here and it has been a big help. We have wifi at the hotel but no data plan. We research, make a to-do list and pin the places on the map, and our day goes smoother. :) Wishlist: make metro stops more visible on map.

title: Lisbon Travel Guide and Map
description:
Offline Maps and much more! Discover new places and insider tips. Collect, save and organize them as you like. And have the best trip ever!
 
With us, traveling got easier and even more fun. Here’s what you get – the shortest possible version:
 
• Free offline maps – no roaming, no hustle
• Multifunctional lists to plan and organize your trip
• Insider tips and places to discover
 
We let you discover new places, beautiful spots and insider tips at the touch of a button. Collect your personal best-of and save it for later. You will experience your best journeys yet with detailed offline maps and in-depth travel content on your mobile travel companion.
 
And here’s why 5+ million travelers love our apps:
  
CLEAR AND CONCISE MAPS
Never get lost again. See your location on the map via GPS, no internet connection is required. Find streets, addresses or attractions and get pointed in the walking direction.
 
IN-DEPTH TRAVEL CONTENT
You’ll never have to buy another guide book. Our Guides features pictures as well as comprehensive and up-to-date information is available for thousands of places and attractions.
 
SEARCH AND DISCOVER
Search a specific place by name or browse by categories like restaurants, architecture, shops, bars, hotels, etc.
 
PLAN TRIPS AND CUSTOMIZE MAPS
Book the hotel for your next city tour right within the app. Remember and save all the places you would like to visit. Create new or individual ones. Mark them with different colors or add notes to them. 
 
SHARE WITH FRIENDS
Create your own reviews and ratings of your favorite places. Share these tips and recommendations with friends and other travelers.
 
SAVE ROAMING FEES
Maps and guide content are stored on directly your device so you can access them at any time even without an internet connection. An internet connection is of course required for initial downloading of data or booking hotels.

BACKUP AND SYNC
Create a user account and login from any of your iOS devices. So all your personal content is right where you want it to be.
releaseNotes: We added "Sign in with Apple" as authentication method and fixed some bugs!
reviews:
Drop this app asap! The one star is as low as I could go on the fly. | I have been using this application for a few years now I have traveled several places in Europe I’ve been to Jordan, Israel and cities in the United States and it is always accurate and easy to navigate. The zoom capability is second to none. It appears to use cell tower to accurately pinpoint your position and thus there is no need for internet or live data, but it works with it as well.  
Love this app!!!!!!!! | I have used this app and recommended to others to use while traveling in unfamiliar Countries. Your own personal Guide! | Very useful | Excellent way to research your trip and get ideas on what to see , visit and where to eat | My wife and I are planning a trip to Lisbon and love this app. I like the ability to write notes for each attraction, restaurant, etc. this way we can store what other peoples liked and disliked then use it for our own good | Easy and simple. Informative | Love the offline map. | I always use Ulmon maps when planning and visiting cities in Europe. They are the best! | Very helpful - save all the places you want to go and navigate without needing to buy data. Only suggestion is I wish it also pulled in info from Yelp. | This free app has been awesome. When I have wifi, I research places I want to go in Lisbon and drop stars on them. Then I use the map offline to get there - or when we're wandering a new area, I check it to see if any of my wish list places are close by. Strongly recommend! | Having been using since 2014 and it's accuracy has not failed in settings as diverse as Quito, Ecuador to Lisbon to Madrid to San Francisco and New York City.  Do not travel without it. | Excelent, mainly because to have the map offline is a lifesaver. My only regret is that you can't trace a route between two points, for instance, from my hotel to The Tower of Belem in Lisbon. | Works offline so you can search locations anywhere. I used this exclusively while touring Lisbon, Belem, and Sintra. Forget the paper tourist maps, this is all you need. | This is not the app for people who want to know what to see. It's for people who want to know what's near them. 
If you want an app with a list of museums or other sights, you can do much better. | I have used Ulmon apps for a few years now and I have found them to be very comprehensive. | Más que recomendable para los viajeros. | Usually don't rate apps but after a trip to Europe using this offline maps, I can asure you, this app will make your trip easier and you won't miss any important spot in the city. I used London, Paris, Amsterdam, Berlin, Prague, Vienna, Venice, Rome, Florence, Barcelona, Madrid and Lisbon! In Budapest I felt lost because they don't have a map for this city but Google also doesn't have a map for Budapest offline. 
I'll put 6 stars but I can't so 5 it's the closest. One more thing, all this is for FREE! And this is not all, also you can download the information about the historic places in the city and then you can get the info offline. 
You have to try it!! | What I was looking for was a map that shows both my current position (using GPS) as well as the locations of all the attractions I selected, so I could figure out the best path to see them all.  The fact that it can do this offline is a big plus, so I won't be gobbling up my precious data usage when I'm in Europe. | This App was a game changer for me in Lisbon. It can be used without any wifi access and shows your current position. It works so well is bulletproof. It is way better than having a paper map of the streets. Every city should have this App!!! | Visiting a city where you don't have internet access? With this app you will not get lost, without having to flash those old fashioned paper maps that advertise your status as clueless tourist... I'm impressed by the level of detail and the search function. Incredibly useful. | Great app, you don't even need cellular data | I could not enjoy Lisbon as much as I did without this app. | Very useful when traveling without data on your phone bc of the ability to use it offline | I will be traveling to Lisbon Portugal and this is just what needed. | Nice app, nice price; but crashing during use on iPhone 5s and iPad mini (map is ok, tapping a hostel or a bar ok, tapping for a detail - and crash). :( It is an alpha version, you can not use it while walking in the city.
