title: Road Trip Planner™
description:
Place pins on a worldwide map for each location you want to visit, then see your route. Enter trip details for each location and create a complete trip itinerary.  Multiple sample files are available, including an informative Route 66 sample file.
You can demo this app by downloading our free RTP Viewer app.  RPT Viewer is virtually identical to this app except with RTP Viewer you can’t save your edits.

Road Trip Planner does not require any subscription and respects your privacy by not collecting any of your data.

MAP PINS HOLD WHAT YOU NEED. Each pin shows:

- arrival date & time
- departure date & time
- travel time to this location
- time spent at this location
- name of pin (such as John’s house)
- address of pin
- notes and images
- custom pin color and icon
- URL for related information
- weather reports
- transport type (driving or walking)
- Internet Search results
- list of activities (lodging, sights to see, etc.)
- choose between multiple routes (if available)
- view driving distance between pins, driving time, fuel cost, travel advisories, turn-by-turn driving directions
- Export pin data to your calendar.

EACH PIN CAN HAVE MANY ACTIVITIES. For each activity you can record:

- name of activity
- activity date, time and duration
- cost
- phone
- FAX
- address
- URL
- email address
- confirmation number
- notes
- picture

There are two types of pins. Route Pins are used to create the route. POI Pins mark points of interest on the map.

Choose between Apple Maps or OpenStreet Maps.  Cache non-Apple maps to disk for offline use.  See the settings and Help for more info.

For air and rail routes a straight line can be displayed between pins. 

Add, remove or rearrange the pins in any order you wish. Routes and pins can be sent to Apple Maps. 

Import and export GPX data files.

Each trip can be saved as a separate document. Perfect for anyone who wants to maintain a record of past trips.

VIEW YOUR TRIP ON YOUR MAC with our Road Trip Planner app available from the Mac App Store.
Send location data to Road Trip Planner directly from any of our location-savvy apps.

THE ITINERARY HOLDS ALL OF THE DETAILS. Share it and take it with you.
- print the itinerary or share it easily
- includes a map image with pins and routes, activities for each Route Pin, costs for each activity, total fuel cost, total trip cost, information for Points of Interest Pins, and driving instructions.

USE THE TO-DO CHECKLIST. Make sure you don’t forget anything.

We respond quickly to suggestions and questions in our forum. 
PLEASE CONTACT US IF YOU HAVE A QUESTION OR AN ISSUE. We promise we'll respond as quickly as we can.

For more info visit the Road Trip Planner web site at https://roadtripplanner.modesittsoftware.com

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE PURCHASING:
The mapping and routing functionality Road Trip Planner uses is based upon Apple’s maps technology.  If Apple Maps cannot find a route between map pins, then neither can Road Trip Planner.  Please test the area you wish to travel using Apple’s Maps app to ensure that the area can be routed.  If it cannot be routed, please submit the issue to Apple.  If Apple Maps cannot perform routing in the area you wish to travel then neither can Road Trip Planner.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and interface enhancements.
reviews:
Very handy. Makes planning a trip simple and organized. | In the past, I have always used my desktop computer for planning road trips. However, the software is old and the maps are out of date. One particular feature I used is the ability to enter my fuel capacity and fuel usage and have the software provide me with a maximum travel point. This was extremely helpful in determining where to stop for fuel/hotels. This software only allow you to enter your fuel use not your fuel capacity- not if any value. | Great trip planning tool!  Easy to use and maps everything for you.  Make a test trip to learn things. Simply put, every trip, starts here! | After spending hours online working with various map sites to plan a trip and getting nowhere…this is quick and easy to use, and provides you the info you need for a road trip. Thank you. | The more I use this apps the better it gets!   It took a while to figure out all the little tricks, but was well worth the time investment.  There are lots of little hidden features that are simply gosh darn fun.  You can change icons, flag little diversions and add notes, such as distances and time.   Then… holy cow… I stumbled across the itinerary feature which does all the time and distance calculations for me, along with directions.   I can even switch mapping backgrounds.   So much fun to imagine upcoming adventures! | I just paid $4.99 for a app and I can not figure it out!!!! | I bought the app for my desktop and iPhone and after using it for 14 months would recommend the program to anyone who wants to create a detailed itinerary. It helps to have an iCloud account to save files. | Who the HECK in their RIGHT mind creates apps for iPad, iPhone and Mac that do NOT sync data between them???  It makes this and the developers other apps nothing but PAPERWEIGHTS.  Not ONLY that but the developer REFUSES to give you a way to contact him.  Talk about a fringing waste of my time and money.  NOT happy at all!!!!! | I'm setting up my trip routes through the western US and Alaska, this app makes it easier to plan and manage my routes than anything else that I have tried.  And, it's inexpensive.  I'm using it on MacBook Pro and iPad Pro. | Got the app to go on a road trip out west but was hard to figure out on a regular basis | Don’t get me wrong, this is a great app, I love what it does and is my best travel companion, but I’m giving it only three stars for its two major flaws. 
1.- The Apple maps version it uses is SOOOO outdated that there are roads and places that don’t even show, so you’ll have to guess their location with the help of Google maps.
2.- The inability to auto backup to iCloud, like so many other apps out there do, is frustrating If you want to have your route in several devices.

I usually set up my route on my iPad, which has a larger screen and it’s easier to work on, and then just guide myself with my phone while on the road, but is kind of frustrating that every time I make a change I have to MANUALLY upload to iCloud or email myself the new route. 

So if for any reason I forget to send my updated map to the cloud, I’m screwed on the road the next day. If you add something last minute to your map, you’ll have to manually backup again or keep on emailing yourself. | Just bought this I am trying to create a route to bring a new R/V home to make sure it is RV friendly ... 45 minutes later still struggling (I am very IT literate) | No instructions. Editing is very clumsy. I will probably delete this - its just so much clutter on my screen. | I’ve been a big fan of the Ultimate Campground app for years. I’ve had this app but haven’t tried any real world work before. The only useful thing it does is draw a pretty line on a map.
How do I change the departure date?
The itinerary should have a compressed view (location,travel time, miles) next pin, with the option for turn-by-turn display. Some instruction would be nice. | Works great for my purposes, ( here’s the but) BUT can the pins be color coded? I would like to mark when I’ve been to destinations via color code.
      I’m pretty good about remembering where I’ve been but my coworkers might not. | I was looking for an app that would allow me to plan a cross-country trip. This app is perfect for what I needed. Although it is a complex app, I have found it to be very intuitive to use. I’m enjoying the planning features and having fun planning my trip! | Many RV apps out there, not many straight forward - easy to use to plot your trip. Evaluate for your own use but I recommend this for all newbies like myself. | Worst money spent | Itinerary settings can not be found. Not enough instruction on how to modify itinerary function. Not impressed. | This is great app, well done, full of features, all one would needed is included.  Got app last summer, 2020, for trip with kids to explore western US.  Worked great, mapped it all month in advance, and followed path between points, worked perfectly.
Great features, cloud save, export pert of trip or whole trip to navigation software, I use waze and works great with this app, users provided suggestions, maps.  There are many maps to download from community, which is great to start and customize to your needs.
Great companion is MAC OS app, for planing on big screen.
excellent app. | I use it for work to create routes and they left some user features out. Merging trips would be nice. Creating user favorites locations.
A easy location naming feature and also an easy copy and paste feature would be nice. | It doesn’t look like you can change the route pin order without redoing the whole route | Do I really have to purchase this app for my Mac as well as purchase it for my phone? | It used to be much better. Now it keeps adding random extra pins whenever I am using the app. I’ll be placing one pin and it creates another or I’ll be moving the map and it just creates another. | I have planned several trips with various stops along the way. Using this information I can calculate what my fuel and lodging expenses will be. | App opens up and you are facing a map with symbols below. Symbols appear to mean plan, map out etc. but do not respond. No tutorial or directions easily accesible and I just paid 5 bucks for something I am likely to delete. Bummer. | Impossible to navigate to campgrounds unless you also buy additional apps. | I paid for the premium app but it isn’t showing up on my phone. How do I get the icon?? | My family took a road trip from Minnesota to Oregon last summer. We were able to plan every amazing stop, estimate how long it would take and were able to enjoy much more than if we hadn’t planned (Yellowstone, Mount Rushmore, etc!)

Robust options are available. The desired location can be “pinned” and then edited to change the name, the pin image (e.g. forest, food, scenery) among other things.  You can add images, activities, costs etc. Adding pictures was a great way to get the kids excited!  The route can be adjusted, however, not always to the way you would like to go, although rare (same with every other map app). 

The directions were great. It estimates your time to the location (which is adjustable by driving speed!) and then allows you to input the length of time at that location. This feature was great as we adjusted our trip because of bad calculations on my part! 

There are also “POI” which are places you might want to check out, but don’t want it calculated into your itinerary. This helped me narrow down what we could actually do, and keep ideas in my back pocket if we found the time. 

The only gripe I have is that it isn’t the most intuitive layout. There is a learning curve, but once you get it, it’s amazing. 

Worth every penny. | This app can do far more than I have yet discovered & it’s ability to share information with other travel planning apps is terrific. However, many functions, like changing the order of waypoints or adding waypoints in the middle of the route or several other functions are not intuitive or all that easy to use. Buy the tool - it does a lot. But be prepared to stumble & get frustrated along the way. 

The developer says they follow common iOS procedures, but that assumes the average user knows those procedures. The developer has responded to me telling me about several support tools & tutorials that can be accessed by users. While I appreciate the fact that there is help available, I just wish it’s were not so difficult to find. I oversee software development projects, so I am not a novice. Yet I hate having to play with something I pay for & hope I can figure it out or stumble over help functions. Hence the 4-star rating. | Almost impossible to use, doesn’t display RV Parks on route. Very frustrating! | Frustrating | After paying for the app I learn it doesn’t work on the iPhone Apple map. Grrrr

To the developer- I did the tutorial and it didn’t work. I got my info from other reviews. Thanks for your response. | This is perfect for my RV traveling and planning. Not to mention that the author is responding quickly and regularly. Updates are thoughtful and well tested. | I wanted a route planner for my car club. I wanted to create nice driving roads and put them in order of the best route. After finding RTP I built a nice route and opened the POI up in Google maps and was able to get guided directions. Great job. The fact that I can get estimated times of each route makes deciding so much better. I can decide if I want the 2 hour tour or the 3 hour tour.  
One drawback is that GoogleMaps will only allow me to make routes with 25 or less POIs. But after thinking about it I think that’s ok,  meaning that all I need to do is create another route where the other left off at 25.  This way I can divide routes up or start on a different route anytime. 
I know there’s a ton more that this app can do, I’ve only scratched the surface. Adding pictures or saving as a GPX file to open in a standalone GPS unit. (Not sure why unless my phone loses signal or whatever). But there looks like a lot more that this can do.  I’ll eventually experiment and see.
Someone mentioned the lack of ease when exporting from the  iOS app to Mac app. Maybe the developer can add an option that when you save to iCloud that it auto saves it for all apps.  But I really don’t want that.i want to know what version I’m loading or saving, I’ll just rename different versions. 
That’s all I got now | Bought the app and whatever location I’m trying to add it says error can’t load..... spent money for nothing | I found the RTP app a great planning tool for two recent road trips! | I used this app for my 13,000 mile trip across the USA.  I loved it. | Bought this app to plan a big road trip. No real instructions given and I am not willing to keep trying things to see what they do. Others seem to have more patience than I. Also seems to be geared to those with RV’s.  Should be simple. | Difficult to use, does not help plan stops, streets and trips this not. So I put a start in TN, stop in WY, could not add way points, on the route, wants to place them on end.  Lacks Forrest service  roads until at such a close scale to be unusable. | Have to put waypoints every 10mi to keep trip on the parkway. Otherwise it won't let me choose it as a route option. | It will not let me create a route I want my money back this is the dumbest app I've ever seen | Wish I could use this app between my iPad Pro and iPhone 10X tho... | I just bought the Mac and iOS apps. I already covered the lack of real iCloud syncing in my Mac App Store review, so I won’t cover it here other than to say moving trips between iPhone, iPad and the Mac is a pain.

RTP definitely does what it claims (meaning it will let you effectively plan a road trip), but the workflows to do it are downright painful. For example, these are the steps to add a route pin: 1) tap the + icon. A new menu appears. 2) tap “New Route Pin” (why isn’t there an edit mode where these are two separate icons?!) A new menu appears. (Not kidding!) 3) choose “Address” (again, why aren’t obscure options like “from Contacts” hidden under a long-press?!) 4) Finally on a search screen, type “smithsonian”. 5) from the list, tap “Smithsonian National Air & Space Museum”. 6) watch in amazement AS A ROUTE PIN IS ADDED THAT DOESN’T INCLUDE THE NAME OF THE PLACE YOU JUST SEARCHED FOR! No joke. It adds a pin with a title that is the address!

So now, let’s say you just want to change the name of that pin. Ready? 1) tap the pin. 2) tap the callout that appears for the pin. 3) tap the icon in the toolbar that looks like a pushpin 4) tap the words that say “Edit Pin Name”. 5) in the tiny dialog window that appears, edit the name. 6) tap the “OK” button. Why you can’t just tap on the title and edit it directly on the information screen that opens when you tap the callout is beyond me...

The app may have a lot of functionality, but as I’ve demonstrated above, the workflows are PAINFUL. Common tasks should not require so many taps. There should be separate icons for adding a route pin and a POI pin. Uncommon options should be hidden behind long-presses, not in a menu I have to choose from EVERY TIME.

I was hoping that native iOS/Mac apps would be better, but it looks like I’ll be sticking with the Furkot web site (which is fantastic, but only on the web) for my trip planning. | I just want to pick up an ap and have it start to produce results.
A tutorial is offered but also not a flowing help.
KP | Created pin but can’t get route from location to pin | The good: it’s pay-once. It uses Apple Maps data, which is actually decent and improving all the time. Trip plans are entirely private too. It will make a printable itinerary that might be useful. The distinction between POIs and waypoints is useful.  Very helpfully it can export pins to Apple or Google Maps.

The meh: POIs names should be automatically chosen with more smarts or be editable. Picking a POI of Arches national park shouldn’t say Moab, UT, for instance. You can annotate it in a small caption underneath.

The bad: it’s impossible to collaborate on plans. This alone forces us to not use the app. It only supports exporting and importing a trip document file. While you can export it to iCloud and share from the Files app, the other people only get a copy of the file, and they don’t access the same file live as others may make changes.

Furthermore it has bugs around reimporting an exported file, because it can’t handle files with the same name. The imported file doesn’t show up in its file list reliably. 

This is probably great for a one-person planned trip but there’s no ability to collaborate. Tossing a file back and forth would be very tedious and prone to errors. | The UI is not intuitive. It’s fine once you get used to it but it takes more clicks than necessary. I built up a number of waypoints on my iPad and then went on my trip to find they weren’t sync’d to my iPhone and they weren’t there to be imported. So in the end I worked on the app but didn’t actually get any benefit out of it. | Purchased this app it is Very difficult to navigate, very poor instruction . A total waste of money. Tried to get refund but it’s not permit with this app. | I can figure out how to plan a trip?!?? What is file’? How do you create a file? Is a file your buzz word for road trip?

title: Packing List : Trip Planner
description:
Packing List : Trip Planner is an app that helps travelers prepare for their trips without forgetting important things. If you always have a hard time packing for your trips, you are always stuck, and don’t know what to have in your suitcase; this app is your assistance. Get the list of things to pack according to your destination and the weather. Traveling has never been more convenient!

Going on a business trip, camping, or vacation, this app’s features provide you with packing checklists according to your activities. If you are visiting a place for the first time, the app is the travel guide you need. Get recommendations of interesting things to do at your destination. Save yourself the stress and hassle of endless thoughts of what to pack for your trip.

Go on a beach trip, hiking, or winter vacation without forgetting a thing! Get a detailed checklist based on your length of stay, so you don’t have to worry about inadequate supplies during your trip. Plan your next trip with this app and you do not have to worry about forgetting important things. Travel with every important item in your suitcase and never be stranded when you download this app.

Features:
Pack your suitcase without forgetting anything
Activities to engage in for different destinations
Nearby attractions to spice up your visit
Notifications for weather data and checklist
Calculate the distance of your destination
reviews:

It gives me an error message every time. Am I doing something wrong? | I downloaded this app for simple list of essential items, clothing, and toiletries to check off when packing for a trip. 

But you can’t even get past the weather to do anything else. So if it can’t find the weather report for specific dates or location, it won’t even let you enter the basic items you need to pack. | I recently downloaded this app. It won’t let me get past the initial screen due to not being able to load the weather. A rather useless app | This app is a fantastic trip planning tool. It covers everything from packing essentials to local recommendations. It's user-friendly and has made my travel preparations a breeze. | This app has become indispensable for my travels. It ensures I never forget any essentials and offers great suggestions for things to do. It's a reliable and user-friendly travel companion. | As someone who enjoys outdoor adventures, Packing List has become my go-to app. Whether I'm going camping, hiking, or biking, the app provides me with tailored packing suggestions based on the type of activity and duration of my trip. It saves me time and ensures I have all the necessary gear for a memorable adventure. | It covers all the essentials and provides additional suggestions based on the destination and weather conditions. I appreciate how it considers every aspect of my journey, ensuring I have a smooth and well-prepared travel experience. | I used to be the queen of forgetting things when traveling, but Packing List has saved me countless times. It's like having a personal checklist tailored to my needs. From toiletries to travel documents, it ensures I have everything I need for a stress-free trip. | The app's intuitive design and pre-made checklists make packing a breeze. It's convenient to have everything organized in one place, and I can easily customize the lists based on my preferences and specific trip requirements. | It ensures I don't overlook anything crucial and even suggests interesting things to do at my destination. It has made my trips more enjoyable and stress-free. Highly recommend! | As someone who travels frequently, this app has simplified my packing process. It saves me time by generating customized packing lists based on my trip details. No more last-minute packing panic! | I used to stress about packing for trips, but this app has eliminated that anxiety. It covers all the essentials and even suggests items I wouldn't have thought of. I'm always prepared now! | This app has revolutionized the way I pack for my trips. It provides customized packing lists based on my destination and the weather, ensuring that I never forget anything important. It's like having a personal assistant guiding me through the process. Highly recommended! | It not only helps me pack efficiently but also provides valuable recommendations for things to do at my destination. It's like having a personal travel guide in my pocket. I highly recommend it. | The app provides detailed checklists and even considers the length of stay, so I never run out of supplies. It's a reliable travel companion that I can't imagine traveling without. | Finally, an app that takes the stress out of packing! Whether I'm going on a business trip or a vacation, Packing List has all the checklists I need. It even considers the weather and destination. | I used to forget essential items every time I traveled, but not anymore. This app has been a game changer for me. It covers all the bases and ensures I have everything I need for a smooth trip. Thank you!

title: TripGo
description:
The only app that lets you compare and even combine any (really any!) transport mode like train, bus, taxi, ferry, tram, your own or share car & bike, motorcycle or ride share. TripGo makes it super easy to get from A to B on time with any transport mix. Well ok, we don't do hover boards :)

Our award-winning app puts the multi & mixed modal transport future in your hands right now, when other apps are still only dreaming of it.

Personalize your trips by picking your route preferences. Never be late again by syncing TripGo with your agenda and getting exact departure times.

With TripGo you can schedule your ride, check your fare & timetable, bus and train tickets, transportation directions and get live service alerts.

TripGo delivers results in real-time: Up-to-the minute information on predicted departure/arrival times, GPS locations, navigation and service alerts make for accurate trip planning - TripGo keeps you up to date and on time.

We've also partnered with the cool kids at what3words so you can use three word addresses for your trips.

WHAT USERS SAY
"A must have app!"
"I can't thank you enough for this app!"
"You have improved my life, can't rave enough!"
"Should be 6 stars"
"Awesome love it"
"Life saving app. One of my favorites! Keep up the good work!"

"The really nice thing is that TripGo doesn’t lock you in to one transport mode or preference. You can choose the most efficient, fastest, or cheapest route." - Planetsave

WHAT YOU GET
+ Real-time information for public transport (live map): tap on stops and stations to see real-time schedules. Click on a route to see positions of the vehicle, live on the map.
+ Door-to-door options for easy comparison on price, time and environmental impact
+ Automatically plans trips between home, work and events in your calendar
+ Today Widget for instant trip results
+ Apple Watch with instant trip results and access to your favourites
+ Public transport timetables
+ Reminders: add a reminder to your trip to get notified when to leave
+ Pricing for public transport, taxis, tolls and car parks

COUNTRIES & CITIES TRIPGO COVERS

+ Australia
+ Argentina
+ Austria
+ Belgium
+ Brazil
+ Canada
+ Chile
+ Czechia
+ Denmark
+ Estonia
+ Finland
+ France
+ Germany
+ Hungary
+ Ireland
+ Israel
+ Italy
+ Latvia
+ Mexico
+ Netherlands
+ New Zealand
+ Norway
+ Poland
+ Portugal
+ Russia
+ Slovenia
+ Spain
+ Sweden
+ Switzerland
+ United Kingdom
+ United States
+ Vietnam

We actually reply your mails, so drop us a message with your feedback via support@skedgo.com.
releaseNotes:
New:
- Adds indicator to public transport services that allow taking your bicycle on-board
- Adds locations of water bubblers in Darwin, NT

Fixed:
- Don't attempt to geocode "Current Location" or "Location"
- Fix "Transport" mode gettting squashed when planning for trips in other timezones
reviews:
This app has a poor algorithm that switches from, for example, bicycle preference to car preference.
In addition, when you click on the route (a bike path) the app rolls over to Apple maps’ best car route.
A stinker unless they fix these basic flaws. | ...does everything it says it does very well. It gets my 5th star when it adds a Watch app! | This app is a very easy way to determine the best route to use. It gives many options and is very convenient. | Tripgo makes getting to my exact location a breeze since I can use 3 word addresses! | This app is a true life saver | Makes a city so much easier to use. In Sydney it has access to real-time bus locations which makes the schedule super accurate. Well done | Use this app instead of looking at bus schedules makes traveling easier. Very accurate | I moved to Long Island and don't have a car. TripGi is a saver. Thanks God | This app has been really great and easy for me to use! I just moved to a new city and have been using this app to figure out the best way to get from point A to point B. Accurate, except for delayed bus schedules but not off by too much usually! | This app is not easy to use on my iPad. The stop it gave me had the incorrect train stop. Wrong address. Will remove this app | Great app | If you want a transit app that can incorporate your calendar agenda, this is the one. Great multi-modal options that features real time data for those cities with public transit agencies that provide it. | See how to get where you need to on all types of transport (all combinations!) plus estimate traffic based on day/time.  No other map apps needed | It will move to 5* when the walking times are more consistent with map times. Seriously it's really good and if I could only have one transport app, it would be TripGo. Thanks for your service. | Definitely one of the best apps ive used for getting to or from any where using whatever type of transpo my little heart desires..... But seriously this is the only app I use to get around besides uber or lyft. | OMG!  actually USES my calendar to tell me it’s time to leave!  never have to enter another trip again! | It's been such an amazing help with my travels! All I could suggest is being more accurate with exact times, maybe if the buses have gps, asking them for access to it! Other than that very helpful in what buses to take and sometimes timing is right! | Can't load it. Can't update it  can't delete it. Sloppy programming !!! | Ties into Maps, works fast, is accurate. Really nothing more could be asked. Really glad I found it. | Pretty Useful.. | Hot stop was a much better application it gave you a number of transportation alternatives trip go seems offer one route only this is not good | I checked out your app for help at routing my commutes to various places. I ride my bike whenever possible and your results for bike commutes rarely used easily accessible trails.  Why would I ride on the roads and risk getting hit by the droves of driving texters when I could be on a cement path along a creek or through the woods. This needs a lot of work. I don't care what other bells and whistles you have if you can't find a safe route. | I think I've tried them all. This has the most intuitive UI, saves ten of your most recent locations, compares fuel/carbon impact (& time) btw driving, walking, cycling, and transit.

Best yet, if you give it permission, it checks your calendar and alerts you to leave now to catch your bus. | People seem to make a big deal out of Citymapper, but I think that I prefer this app. It looks great on the iPad, and more importantly, it does a really great job of providing multiple routes representing different transportation modes, including mixed modes (e.g., bike and train), with lots of information for each mode, e.g., public transportation schedules and bike sharing locations.

I hope this app gets the exposure that it deserves. | which is pretty good given the complexity of Sydney transport. Most routes work well and use it regularly to get to meetings and events. Very responsive customer service. | Really great app experience. I easily found ways to communicate inside the app when having issues - great work | This app made traveling the city a breeze.  On the long nights where I may have gotten lost or confused, this app got me back home before it was too late.  It also allowed me to see what I wanted to see, when I wanted to see it.  I strongly recommend this app. | It was very beautiful app but this update messed up everything, text doesn't show properly, no fare showing... showing It looks now like some kindergarten student built it. FAILED! Although thank you that you didn't messed it up during my out of town trip... | BEST TRAVELING APP!!❤️❤️❤️ | I really the idea behind this app, but there are parts that need some work. (I'm using from Denver, CO). The calendar integration/agenda is frustrating to use, and seems to glitch every time I try to schedule multiple events. It tells me that events won't fit, even though there's no reason for them not to. I really do like the concept behind this app, and if these glitches were fixed I'd give it five stars easily! | We use this everyday in Sydney. Easy to use and gets us where we need to go. | I have been using it to plan a visit to San Francisco and its wonderful | Overall, the app does exactly as it's supposed to do. I use it almost every day. However, the fare prices are totally wrong for Chicago. It cost $2.25 to take the L, $2 to take the bus, and .25¢ to transfer between stops. Fix this and allow me to access addresses through my contacts and you're golden! | I am really happy with this app 95% of the time. Sometimes the priorities of which modes of transport should be used gets hosed a bit, but I love the concept and execution just gets better and better.

It takes a bit of getting used to, but there is a lot to the app and it can do a lot of figuring out for you. The only tough part is when you want to override its suggestions it is tough to get your new choice to stick. | Great app, love the integration, but outdated bus info makes it useless to me. 
My observations:
1. The changes in routes and scheduled that took place in December 2014 are not taken care of, which means that suggested trips might give wrong schedules and routs.
2. The fare is $1.75, not $1.50
3. The trips don't show route numbers, for instance, instead of showing "Bus 167", the only info given is "local" bus. 
Bottom line: fix the problems, your app is a great idea and would help a lot of people when the info is corrected. | Great app. Occasionally it locks up, but 90% of the time it's a dream. | Good app with complete information about transportation. Great to have personalised settings and great to be free! | The app integrates all modes of transportation. For example, in San Francisco, it shows routes using CalTrain, BART, Muni and buses. Most apps are specific to one provider. This one does it all, including walking routes, bicycle and taxi in addition to public transportation. Love it! | And now with the ability to customize preferences and to view the estimated CO2 emissions for each option | TripGo is an excellent app. It's interface is intuitive and how it presents available modes and the possible routes is easily understandable. | Since I ride the bus a lot I thought this app would be great! So you can imagine how tired I'm after spending over 4 hours! | I just started taking the bus and downloaded 5 apps to help. Trip go was the best. title: Countdown App - Remainders
description:
Count down to all your important events and tasks with Remainders, the ultimate countdown app for vacations, birthdays, holidays, concerts, anniversaries, and more! With Remainders, you can easily track and count down to all your events, create a todo list, take notes, and easily share with family, friends, and colleagues in real-time.

Countdowns
Count down and keep track of the remaining time until your next event with ease. You won't miss a single second with Remainders.

2 Widgets in 3 Sizes
Stay on top of your upcoming events without even opening the app by adding widgets to your home or lock screen. Use the Remainders widget to display specific events countdowns or use the Up Next widget to automatically display your upcoming events.

App Intents for Shortcuts
Create all kinds of app integrations with support for app intents and the iOS Shortcuts app. Create events from calendar events, create birthday countdowns from your contacts birthdays, and more!

Repeating Events
Set repeating events with reminders to keep track of important recurring events like birthdays and anniversaries. Backdate your recurring event to see how many times it’s happened.

Push Notifications
Enable push notifications for your countdowns so you never miss an event. 

Todo Lists
Add todos and track your progress toward your next event using the built-in task list. Create a checklist to track tasks like packing lists for vacations, camping trips, birthdays, shopping, travel, and projects. Mark todos and tasks complete so you always remember important items for your events.

Notes
Take quick notes to remember important details about your upcoming event. You'll always remember the important details.

Real-Time Sharing
Share upcoming events with friends, family, and colleagues and keep everyone in sync with real-time collaboration. If a task is completed, people you share with see it completed in real-time. Update a note and everyone sees the changes instantly. Keep everyone in the loop with a shared countdown.

Optimized for iPadOS
Enjoy a fully optimized experience for your iPad. Multitasking, Split View, keyboard shortcuts, and cursor support. Keep multiple devices in sync with iCloud sync.

Device Sync
Keep all your devices in sync to access your countdowns, tasks, todos, notes, and sharing across all your favorite devices.  

Do more than count down to your next event with Remainders.
releaseNotes:
v1.7 Updates
- Added a delightful countdown animation to the event detail view
- Fixed some bugs related to restoring purchases and unlocking Remainders Plus features
reviews:
Cannot have countdown widgets with free version | The developers are quick to respond to feedback/inquiries!

I chose this app because they do not use any personal info | I love this app. You can share the event with others and collaborate in real time with them. It’s great for creating a packing list so you don’t forget anything!!! | I love that this app allows me to share countdowns with other people and collaborate with them. It also has tasks for countdowns. Before I had one app to countdown and another app to remind me of things to pack. Would be great if you could assign tasks to people you are sharing the event with. | I like the simple countdowns and widgets and sharing features. | The shared events are great. My husband and I use the app for counting down to our upcoming vacations. Great for keeping track of the packing list and any to-do’s we might have before our trip.

I wish there was calendar integration. | I recently downloaded the Remainders app and couldn’t be more pleased. The app is easy to use and makes is so convenient to stay on top of things. I love that I can create countdowns for myself and set the time and date for them appear. It’s a great way to stay organized and be sure I don’t lose track of things. The app has a sleek design and the interface is smooth and intuitive. I highly recommend this app to anyone looking for a simple yet effective way to stay organized.

title: Travi: travel like locals
description:
Clever planning with local insights! Thanks to many local contributors you will find the best spots to visit at the best time of the day. Every itinerary is created to meet your personal preferences, whether you are artsy, outdoorsy, vegan, or have a sweet tooth, Travi has the perfect itinerary for you.

LOCAL INSIGHTS
We curate and source our activity and food options from our local friends, so you can enjoy the best and the true local experience.  

PERSONALIZED ITINERARIES
At Travi, we understand that everyone is different, and trip plans should reflect that. 
When creating your itinerary we carefully analyze your preferences so the trip plan suits your personal travel habits. 

FOLLOW ALONG IN DAILY CALENDAR VIEW
The calendar view makes it easy to have an overview of your daily activities. The map view allows you to easily navigate to each location. We allocate activities during the best time of the day and the most convenient travel route.

EXPLORE 60,000+ ACTIVITIES AND FOOD OPTIONS
Before even creating an itinerary you can explore what our destinations can offer in terms of awesome vistas, museums, parks, and more. You can then bookmark your favorite spots and add it later to your trip!

DISCOVER NEIGHBORHOOD NEARBY
Rediscover the stories of your neighborhood or neighborhoods nearby with additional historical context, cute coffee shops, and other hidden gems.
AVAILABLE OFFLINE
Access to the internet all the time isn’t easy, that’s why Travi can be used offline too. 

SHARE WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY
Traveling with a group? Share your itinerary with your family and friends, so they can see what you have planned for the trip.

STAY IN TOUCH!
We would love to hear from our travelers. 
Follow us on social media and visit our website for new feature updates, new destination releases and more.
Instagram @travi.travelapp
Facebook @travi.travelapp 
Twitter @travitravelapp
Website www.travi.world
Contact us support@travi.world 

Privacy policy: https://www.travi.world/privacy-policy
releaseNotes:
1. Solved a bug where profile picture was not being saved 
2. Added ability to add travel companions to your itinerary
3. Get profile picture directly from Google and Facebook login
reviews:
I downloaded this App, it is not user friendly, when I contacted customer service, no reply. Now they are spamming my inbox. Still no reply. | Thought it was a free planner, but free version is limited. Not many options for planning trip 😕 | When it comes to travel planning there are so many different places to go, no pun intended.  With Travi I feel like I can visually represent travel in time and place.  It’s a one stop place for finding activities and visually representing it in the day.  The app has been improving and I look forward to the continued development. | I like to book trips last minute. This app is perfect for planning them, taking the hassle out and keeping everything organized. 

It is not only user friendly and but also spot on with its suggestions! | I love the UI and design on this app. It takes seconds to generate a trip itinerary and they are always on point with the things I like to do when I travel! Recommended | All this apps like TripScout and similar say they are trip planner, but they are not, they just give you some places where to go or eat. This one actually is a travel planner. I used to go to NYC last week and it created a great itinerary (I made only a couple of adjustments) for 4 days stay in the city. Will definitely use it again in the future. I also hope to see more cities supported, since I am planning a trip outside the US and this one only has US cities. | I really like that there are so many tool tips for the cities. That really helped me plan my trips (when COVID is over...)!

However, I wish there could be something that allow me to explore the neighborhood, that would be so great! I’m looking forward to more features in the future! | Travi offers a very interesting trip planning process where by it schedules everything out for you automatically. 

The UI is very clean and sleek. Hope to be a able to try this out after the pandemic. | I enjoyed how easy this app made it to plan for a trip, given its integration with google calendars I was instantly able to create an itinerary for my trip to Miami. Additionally the activities planned were diverse enough so that I’m not in museums all day! The itinerary takes into consideration travel time and optimized for great places to eat without deviating to far from the attractions! | Awesome travel organizer with a social aspect! Simple, fluid, and beautiful UI. | Every time when I was surfing on Instagram, I was wondering that where these cool place are at. Travi is cool tool to help me easily saving the place for coming travel planning. Not only site seeing, but also the restaurants, secret night view spot, hidden artist performance bar or street, I can have the clue and inspiration from people or friends shred on Travi for my next trip. I will be also happy to share what I explored in the corner of the world as well. | I was starting the process of planning my next group trip, so started the email chain but instead this time I thought there must be an app that can do some of this work for me—Travi does! As soon as I put in my location and dates it started planning for me. The features are easy to use, informative and reduce the time I spent looking for activities.

title: Packing List - Travel Planner
description:
Don't forget any more important luggage and create or plan your next holiday trip much more structured with our Packing List! 

Download this app to plan your next trip much easier. It can be a business trip with a small suitcase or your next big holiday with lots of luggage or bag. 

Packing List helps you save a lot of time when creating your todo lists by suggesting things to take with you on your trip. So you will never forget anything when packing your suitcase!

* INTELLIGENT
The packing list is based on your destination, trip dates and more.

* WEATHER
See immediately how the weather is at your destination!

* Forecast
See the weather information average of your desired month

title: Traveler Buddy - Trip Planner
description:
TravellerBuddy is an innovative, time-saving and easy-to-use trip planner app. 

You can get one stop travel checklist for check flight status, flight delay, flight cancellations, local weather, currency exchange, customs regulations, visa requirements, passport validity, packing list and expense management
You can navigate easily to places such as hotel address with travel map even offline.
Our goal is to save time and provide paperless, stress-free travel for every traveler. 
You will get the following benefits. 

#1 Travel paperless
• Easy access your travel itineraries and its travel checklist on well-arranged trip card
• Have secure, PIN-protected access to digital copies of important travel documents

#2 Make your travel plans smoothly
• Create your trip checker automatically by simply forwarding all your booking emails (e.g. flight, hotel, restaurant) to trips@travelerbuddy.com 
• Manually edit and additional travel plans and its details, notes, and attachment

#3 Check flight status and save time
Always stay informed yourself before your trip about:
• Required passport validity and necessary visa requirements
• Health risks and necessary vaccinations
• Customs regulations

See at a glance:
• Validity of your passport and visa
• national weather forecast for all destinations
• Currency exchange rates between home and local currency
• Time difference between country of residence and travel destination, including world time zone

Receive promptly:
• Notifications about next step in your journey
• Alerts about possible flight information (e.g. flight delays, flight arrivals)
• Reminder for flight check-in and departure
• Ground navigation support with map to next destination (e.g. hotel)
• Information assistance to fill immigration forms 

#4 Manage your travel plan expenses swiftly
• Receive automatically generated, editable expense reports from booking emails, add expenses by uploading photos or files and edit them easily

#5 Protect your business travel and personal data
• Your data is encrypted and safe with us
• PIN code protected personal profile

#6 Access via easy-to-use, secure one stop Solution
• Your road trip planner is always updated in real-time
• You can access relevant information both online and offline 

Plan your trip and get important notifications in all in one travel app.

----------------------------------

Terms of use: https://www.travelerbuddy.com/term

If you choose to purchase a subscription, payment will be charged to your iTunes account, and your account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period of the selected subscription tier. Auto-renewal may be turned off at any time by going to your settings in the iTunes Store after purchase. Traveler Buddy subscription cost: $17.99 USD for 1 year or $1.99 for 1 month. Prices are in U.S. dollars, may vary in countries other than the U.S. and are subject to change without notice. No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during the active subscription period. If a subscription is cancelled or has ended, all features which are not part of the free initial packs will become locked again. Re-subscribing will restore access to all features including their data.
releaseNotes:
Passkey Login
UX/UI improvements
Bug fixes and performance improvements
reviews:
Best travel app! | This is the best application I have found for keeping all my travel itineraries together in one place. | The only thing I am missing with this app, I wish I could set up personal trip. If I’m going to visit a friend in Texas, driving my own car, I can’t properly plan the trip using the app. Other than that; I love it. | I Believe that Travelerbuddy is going to be one of the Best Travel Apps out there especially for Business. It just needs some more fine tuning “under the hood” and a tweak here and there, and they will Be
On their way to being The Best Travel app out there so far. Here’s why. They get Travel! The layout is superb for the “card” approach they use for your various itinerary categories, i.e train, shuttle, airlines, hotel etc. But, I did find that the card would not always reflect accurately the information that it was supposed to. Hence the need for some tweaking. I did find it Very Helpful however that they have Excellent Very Responsive Customer Service to rectify whatever issue that needs to be addressed. I Love the Fact of how the app has the capacity to tell especially international travelers what they will need for customs, vaccinations, etc. I don’t know of Any More out there that do that! So that aspect alone makes them fairly competitive in my opinion. There were some issues in their accurate interpreting of appropriate  information that I sent over via email. For the most part it was accurate, but not all the way across the board. So, with this said you can see where they need some tweaking. But, overall my experience with the app and company has been very pleasing. Especially since there was an issue with the billing (I upgraded to the Biz Level) and to compensate for their challenges to that, they decided to give me a Whole Year Subscription for Free !! So, that Definitely made my day and then some :) And I have also had the astute pleasure too by corresponding directly with Juerg Founding Partner/CEO and Diana who is an Excellent CSR Department Head. My “Hats Off” to them both for their courteous efficient and very professional demeanor in their handling of my issues. So in conclusion as I said in the beginning, I Believe Travelerbuddy Will Be One if not THE Best Travel Apps Out There Moving Forward !! We just need to Expect the Best from them as they complete their tweaking. For once they do.....The SKY is the Limit for Them !! !! JohnNY Lamb aka The Believing BillionAire 87) Making The Empire State Building The Most Beautiful HOTEL in The World !! !! PS I Presently Continue to use TravelerBuddy for I BELIEVE in them and their Potential to be the VERY BEST Travel App Out There.........BAR NONE !! !! Plus, I Can’t Take My Eyes Off Their Awesome RED Origami Bird !! One of the BEST Company Logos I Have Ever Seen !! !! I Believe You Will See It On The Empire State Building HOTEL FLYING HIGH Not Too Far Down The Road 87) | Great app for organizing your travel plans. Just needs a widget for notification center and an apple watch app. | I originally was impressed by TravelerBuddy because it was able to "read" an email confirmation from a B&B which none of the other travel organizer app such as Worldmate, Tripit or Kayak were able to. But it was the last time it was "great". Since, It has not been able to read/ record a car service I booked in London, my hertz car reservations for Manchester, etc. On car reservations, It only shows when to pick up the car, not when to return it. Kayak (free) apart from that B&B email had recorded every reservation I emailed it perfectly. This app at $12 is too expensive to be performing so poorly. 
The extra star is for being able to read that B&B email. | Not long after trying this app out and signing up for an account, you'll be spammed by the creator. They don't properly comply with CANSPAM in that they simply tell you at the bottom of the email that to opt out of the spam, "Log in to TravelerBuddy change notification settings". Well I did that, and I can't find a means to opt out anywhere.

Making matters worse, the UI is clunky and confusing. Virtually every feature requires you to subscribe. But given how spammy they are and sneaky at hiding any way to unsubscribe, I wouldn't give them a dime. Save yourself the time and find something better.

title: Road trips plan your trip
description:
Road trips plant your trip is a handy application that provides travelers with various useful features to make their trip planning and packing easier. 
With this app, users can save their trip history and estimate their remaining expenses.

Main Features:
- Save the history of past trips 
- Estimate the remaining expenses for a trip.

Subscription auto-renew at the end of subscription period, unless cancelled 24-hours in advance prior to the end of the current period. Per Apple policy, no cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during active subscription period. Once purchased, refunds will not be provided for any unused portion of the term.

title: Trabee Pocket - Travel Budget
description:
Manage your expenses easily with Trabee Pocket!

It's designed for travelers to help organize and track their expenses.               
See at a glance how much you've already spent and what is available.


■ Trabee Pocket:

Helps you manage your money efficiently during your travels so you can focus on your trip without wasting too much time managing your finances.

It's fast and easy to enter expenses. Just enter the amount you paid and save it. You can easily see how much money you've spent and how much you have left.

See how much you've spent and how much money you have left today at a glance. Knowing how much money you have left can help you avoid overspending and feel more comfortable spending.


■ Key Features:
∙ Automatic currency conversion (shows the amount in your home currency)
∙ Easily record expenses with the calculator
∙ Separate cash/card expenses
∙ Attach photos and brief memos to expenses
∙ Categorize expenses (food, shopping, sightseeing, transportation, lodging)
∙ View expenses by date
∙ Set a budget
∙ Record income
∙ Total expenses displayed in your home currency
∙ Offline support
∙ Server synchronization
∙ Backup/Restore


■ Pro Upgrade Features:
∙ Multi-currency support
∙ Customize categories (icons, colors, order)
∙ Expense usage rate and pie chart by category
∙ Export to PDF, CSV files
∙ Daily expense total displayed in your home currency on the "All" screen.
releaseNotes:
∙ If you encounter any issues, please do not delete the app and instead contact us at support@trabee.co.kr 
∙ We have fixed some minor bugs.
reviews:
Someone showed me this app recently on my trip I’ve been using this app to track my spending for my 6 month trip and I absolutely love it! The only things that could be added to make this app PERFECT would be:

2. Customizable categories (for example being able to add more categories like visas, laundry, groceries etc) rather than all of that being bundled into ETC and not really knowing how much you’re spending on which. | 그런데 이벤트마다 사진을 한장씩만 올리수 있는게 아쉽네요 그거 빼곤 좋습니다 | I can’t print or send photos of my receipts | Being able to record asap the expenses on the smartphone allows one to track. I wish I could get my money back. I love that you can export it to Excel. In addition the aesthetic is minimal! Thank you for the great app. | The app no function!! | Have been using for a few days. Can get feedback from developer. | I actually have loved using this app, but I switched phones and there is absolutely no way that I can find to reset or retrieve my password. | I love this app and use it when I go overseas.  Since upgrading to IOS14, it tries to open, but can’t.  Please help! | 여행 갈 때 마다 꼭 사용하던 앱인데 오늘 쓰려고 보니 열리지 않네요ㅠㅠ 업데이트가 되길 기다리겠습니다 ㅎㅎ | I’ve tried contacting support several times and I never get a reply. Easy to set budget amounts and add expenses in whatever currency! Love that I’ll be able to see what I’m spending in usd as I’m entering expenses in yen! Rated a four for now until I get back from the trip and know how useful it winds up being on my trip. | Very happy with app for sorting and keeping travel expenses between me and my partner. No problems until I got a new phone and cannot remember my password; there’s no option to “forgot my password.” There is an exclamation point in the top right of the log-in screen but nothing happens when I click on it. Help! | 어학연수중이라 너무 유용하게 잘 쓰고 있는데

월별로 지출내역 볼수있었으면 좋겠어요 ㅠㅠ

감사합니다 수고하세요 | 어플에서 사람인원만큼 나누는 기능도 있으면 더 좋을듯 | 앱 정말 좋습니다!

이러한 부분들을 설정에서 선택 할 수 있으면 좋겠네요! | 이 어플을 쓰면서 처음으로 여행경비 관리를 했습니다. 사진과 함께 올릴 수 있어서 나중에 돌아와서 뭘 샀는지 정확히 알 수 있고 이것 또한 추억이 되는 거 같아 좋은 거 같아요!

Just used it on a travel to Florida, and it really helped us to keep track of our expenses, especially when you are dealing only with cash.
The only things that I would recommend for an upgrade are:

You can log your expenses very easily and even add photos or notes to each line itsm. There is one issue though- the app doesn't do anything  when you try to change your trip dates. A work around is to simply create a new trip,
which can be bothersome for ppl who are traveling around flexible days. Also, the app doesn't allow you to set separate budgets for cash vs card. | This is incredibly awesome | I tried many diferent apps to manage my budget for my trips. This app has the best interface, very simple and usefull to organize by day your spents. First time I gave 5 stars to an app. | Although its limited functional options, if you would like to keep up and track down your expense record this app would be worthy to try. | Easy and simple to use 👍🏻 | Thanks for a fantastic app. Just to let you know that Bills could be either outstanding or settled. 

It will be really good if I could see the bills which I already made payment after the travel to my credit card company. | I lost everything after updating the app. You must be kidding me. | Please add to can be manage multi countries and multi currencies in one trip.
Please add more icon in categories.
Please can be reorder list in trip date.

Do the best... | 일본 여행 계획중이라 이걸로 예산 짜면서 하나하나 숫자 넣는 중인데요. 한국 원이란 일본 엔이랑 같이 병행해서 기입을 하면 합계가 자동으로 변환이 되서 총액이 나와야 하는데, 그냥 같은 단위로 인식이 되서 더해버립니다. 예를들면 예산을 천원+천엔 으로 기입하면 총합은 약 천원+9천7백원= 만7백원이 나와야 하는데. 그냥 천원+천엔 단위 무시하고 합해서 2천원이라고 통계가 잡힙니다. 이거 진짜 기본적인건데 확인 좀 부탁드릴께요. | This app is what i want. I can quick create a note for what i already expense from my trip budget | This app has quite everything a traveler needs. | I've been using this app while on vacation and after the update it doesn't load! Crashes as soon as I click on it. I wish it would work again cuz I filled it in for five days already. | The app is not bad. Here are a few things I wish were here. 
- the ability to convert all budget and expenses into one money type. I bought airline tickets in USD and spent EUR in country. I don't want to see separate budgets for each currency. 
- convert the expense from the currency type I used into my budget currency type. Doing this automatically and tracking both. 
- I'm in the middle of a trip and can't see the pie chart. 
- keep expenses I type in under the "other" category in the "other" category. Now it moves all line items to the current day. In here it would be good to see things I paid for ahead of time like air and train travel. | 지금까지 여행 후 수동으로 경비 계산하던걸 많이 도움받게 되어 정말 기쁩니다. 

몇 가지 아쉬움이 있어 적어봅니다. 

목적지를 나라만 선택할 수 있는데 지명, 장소를 선택할 수 있음 좋겠습니다. 국내여행뿐 아니라 해외여행시에도 도움이 될 것 같습니다. 항목별로 옵션제공도 좋을 것 같구요. 디테일하게 정리할 때는 어느 장소에서 얼마나 사용했는지 적을때도 있어서요. 

한 날에 여러건 발생할 때 시간을 적어 정렬할 수 있으면 좋겠습니다. 꼭 시간을 적지 않더라도 수동정렬은 있으면 좋겠습니다. 

데이터 백업, 공유기능 필요합니다. 여행경비 입력해서 여러명과 공유하는 경우가 있어서요. 1/n 할때도 있구요. 공유하는 데이터는 이쁘게 보여지면 좋겠습니다. 
MemoZy에서 이메일로 보내는 정도만 되면 만족하겠네요. 

사진은 바꿀 수 있는지 모르겠습니다. 

좀 더 사용해보고 마저 적겠습니다. | As far as I can see, this is simply for listing expenses. There is no way to create a report by category.  Not especially useful, when the same could be done with a a pen & paper. | I'm pretty impressed with this so far.  Note that the in-app purchase gives you unlimited additional days, not just 1.  To the other reviewer: you can edit an entry by swiping to the right. | Once you've logged an item it doesn't allow you to go back and make changes. This is an egregious oversight. I want a refund! | One negative is that the app lacks a password | I like its interface, simple and easy to understand (both design and usage). Though it is for travel, maybe I can use it daily life, by naming its name as month.
It is easy to add daily expense and can sort by categories. So far I really like it!

But there is a typo in app, it's '앱 평가하기', not '앱 평가히기'^^

title: MapoScope Fast Route Planner
description:
Creates the quickest delivery routes, saving you hours each day

Maposcope Delivery Route Planner (Batch Geocode) automates delivery planning and delivery routes and creates fastest routes in seconds with driving direction

Maposcope - Multi Stop Route Planner optimizes your delivery routes so that you end up working up to 30% faster, saving you hour a day!

Route Optimization up to 500 stops

Route planner automates delivery planning, delivery routes and creates best routes in seconds with driving direction

A handful of useful functions for every delivery driver in our route planner:
- You can Deliver up to 30% faster 
- Scan address
- PDF reports with your route planner details
- Support for time window, priority and visit time 
- You can drag'n'drop markers on the map 
- Unlimited maps and daily route optimization 
- Send ETAs to your clients 
- Setup stop’s delivery time window (service time) 
- Easily check visit time 
- Route finder with driving directions between the cities of your choice 
- Driving route finder free up to 10 stops 
- The exact GPS location will help you deliver your shipments faster 
- Our Route Planner creates the quickest delivery routes for your multi stop route 
- Route planner can find fastest route between your deliveries in just few clicks
- Realtime Traffic Updates

Maposcope will determine the order of visited stops, show you when you will reach a specific location and how long the route will take between specific stops. You can plan your start time and start location, mark the priorities of the stops so that you can deliver the package or visit the urgent points first (ASAP). You can plot a route and routing app will find fastest delivery route with estmiated arrival times.
Set start location and start time, list of stops and we will find best route avoiding the disruptions on the route. Set service time, visit time and priority for each address multiple location.

The route along with the time spent at the locations can be saved in a PDF report, saved to your disk or sent to your boss or client. Calculated Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) will inform you (and your customers) of the time it takes for the products to arrive at the destination. 

GPS route tracking and progress monitoring with built-in reports. Our Route Planner will allow you to place multiple stops from a file (our batch geocoding superb technology), you can save addresses in Excel or csv files and upload it quickly to the map. 

You can easily move points around the map by simply holding down a pin and dragging it to another location. 

Easy plan delivery routes optimization with multiple locations. 

Delivery route optimization algorithm in your pocket

This Gps navigation for delivery vans, cars or even bikes is an excellent navigation app with easy to use GPS tracker.


The app is now available as auto-renewable subscription but there is also free plan.

We offer in-app purchases for PRO license, which allows you to optimize routes up to 500 stops.

Maposcope Route Planner PRO is available as three auto-renewable subscriptions:
- $9.99 USD per month
- $74.99 USD per year

Price may vary by location.

The amount will be charged to your iTunes account and will vary by plan and country. You’ll see the total price before completing payment.

Maposcope Route Planner PRO subscriptions purchased in-app renew monthly. To avoid renewal, you must turn off auto-renew at least 24 hours before your subscription ends.

You can turn off auto-renew at any time from your iTunes account settings.

Privacy Policy and Terms of Use
https://maposcope.com/privacy-policy/
https://maposcope.com/terms-of-service/

- scan spreadsheet added

title: GuideAlong | GPS Audio Tours
description:
Upgrade your road trip adventures with our location-based audio tours. It’s just like having a tour guide in your car™.

HOW IT WORKS

We’ll guide you to the all the best things to see and do, and suggest side-trips and local tips, so you don’t miss a thing.

Listen to fun and informative stories about the history, geology, hikes, animals, local peoples and highlights along the routes.

Commentary plays automatically as you drive, based on your location and direction. You have the freedom to travel at your own pace.

Tour offline with GPS. No need for cell service or WiFi signal while touring. Everything is downloaded to your device for easy, offline use. 

Visit our website www.GuideAlong.com to see a complete list of tour route maps, sample commentary, more travel tips & suggested itineraries.

KEY FEATURES
 - Autoplays as you drive, based on your location and direction
 - Works offline with GPS, no cellular service, WiFi signal or data required while touring
 - Play your own music in background
 - Listen to commentary before and after you travel

Trip Planning
 Suggested Itineraries
 Highlights
 Travel Tips

TOURS (we keep adding more tours!) Bundles of tour available and offer great value

US

HAWAII
 Maui including Road to Hana
 Oahu
 Kauai
 Big Island, Hawaii

 Acadia National Park
 Arches and Canyonlands National Parks
 Beartooth Highway
 Big Sur PCH Hwy1
 Black Hills, Mount Rushmore and Badlands National Park
 Blue Ridge Parkway 
 Bryce Canyon & Zion National Park
 Capitol Reef National Park
