 Death Valley
 Glacier National Park including Many Glacier
 Grand Canyon National Park South Rim
 Great Smoky Mountains National Park
 Joshua Tree National Park
 Kancamagus Scenic Byway
 Keweenaw - Copper Country
 Kings Canyon National Park
 Lake Tahoe
 Lake Superior North Shore Hwy 61
 Las Vegas - Grand Canyon West, Hoover Dam & Red Rock Canyon
 Mesa Verde National Park
 Miami, Key West & The Florida Keys
 Michigan Lakeshore M22 & Sleeping Bear Dunes
 Olympic National Park
 Oregon Coast
 Outer Banks
 Rocky Mountain National Park, Colorado
 Sedona
 Sequoia National Park
 Vermont Scenic Byway 100
 Yellowstone  and Grand Teton National Parks
 Yosemite National Park
 Zion & Bryce Canyon National Park

CANADA

Canadian Rockies National Parks
 Banff, Lake Louise, Moraine Lake & Yoho National Park
 Icefields Parkway
 Jasper
 
 Drumheller
 Waterton National Park and Alberta Southwest
 Vancouver
 Whistler
 Niagara Falls

AUSTRALIA
 Great Ocean Road

PRICING
Each tour is a one time purchase. No time limits. Use as many times as you like. No monthly subscription. 

REVIEWS
“PERFECT! We would have missed or skipped SO much! DON’T HESITATE and make the purchase ASAP!!”
“Personal Tour - Worth more than every $”
“This app was amazing for us. We saw so much more than we would have without it.”
“Great Value I was leery about purchasing the app. Boy was I wrong.”

NOTES
Using location service GPS increases battery usage - we highly recommend taking DC car charger versus simply plugging into the vehicle’s USB port
releaseNotes:
NEW TOURS:
Death Valley, Sequoia and Kings Canyon, Needles District to Arches and Canyonlands Tour.  
Added push notifications to receive alerts for new tour releases.  There's a lot of new tours being launched Spring 2024 so opt-in!
reviews:
This guide for Maui gave us great suggestions so we didn’t need to do too much planning beforehand, especially on Road to Hana! Cell service was spotty so having this guide tell you when to turn was a life saver. Lots of great historical facts about the location included as you drive too. I have so many new fun facts | We are so grateful we found these tours. We loved the stories, the history and the tips were very helpful. We will look for more tours on future trips. | Excellent!  Interesting, informative & impressive.  So glad we got this app! Directions were spot on & the facts given about the route & attractions were superb.  We will be looking to use this in the future whenever we travel.  Thanks for making our vacation more enjoyable. | Awesome experience using this app and very informative | Initial log-in was a bit confusing but the help desk and support person was quick with a response and had us on way in no time. The system was very accurate and perfectly sync’s with gps and map functions. Interesting and entertaining commentary that we enjoyed and used throughout our week on the Outer Banks. | Took the classic road to Hana tour a couple days ago and we really enjoyed the narrator’s stories and history of Hawaii. The one gripe I had is that there is no way you could do all of his suggested stops with the suggested time limits and still make it to the seven pools and back before sundown!

We left at 8 am and only took two of the non must-do turn offs and were careful about not spending too much time at our stops. The narrator gave timing updates throughout the trip and we lined up with what he described as “making good time”. We even skipped the black sand beach on the way there (had a 3-6 pm reservation). We also tended to drive well above the speed limit, more on par with what the locals were driving at as we felt comfortable around the sharp turns and narrow roads. We made it to the seven pools by 3.  Done with the hikes (we were basically trail running) in an hour and a half or so. Got to the black sand beach at 5:55 and were denied entry. Sundown was 6:45 so we were driving in pitch black on the way back which was.. harrowing to say the least!

Again, it’s a great app for the most part but the suggested times spent at each of the places are definitely off. You need to be very quick at your stops or even skip some of the must-dos to be out and back before sundown! | So very glad I bought this app as it made our Kaua’i visit so much more satisfying.  Really loved the stories and history told.  The narrator was a welcome guest in the car and has the perfect voice for this job.  Have become a huge fan and telling everyone about this app. | The app and your worked great.  Make sure to download your trip in advance when you have access to WiFi.  We found it best to run the app through the Bluetooth connection in our rental car.  Make sure you have a fully charged device and a charging cable handy.  A power bank would also be a good extra to have along.  The app synced perfectly with our location.  The directions were spot on and the narrator provides excellent information about the history and culture of the area.  This allowed us to go at our own pace.  We will definitely be using this app for future trips! | We used the Guide Along series for The Big Island of Hawaii. All 4 of us really enjoyed the information and we learned a lot that we would not have known otherwise. We also stopped at some beautiful views we would not have known about. Well worth it. | I figured we had nothing to lose by investing a small amount of money to get a little local history while driving up 61. From the outset, we were hooked! We would have missed so much had it not been for our guidealong. The narration is pleasant and engaging, and not overly intrusive, and filled with good information and tips to enjoy the trip. We took the whole route from Duluth to the Canadian border. Without our guide, it would be pleasant, but perhaps tiring. With our guide, it was pleasant and invigorating. And we saw so much that we would have missed!

we enjoyed it so much that we looked for other tours on their website to see if there was something we could take advantage of. Great price and best investment of our vacation! | Used the app on the Big Island of Hawaii and in Sedona,AZ. Love that we can get great info and suggestions for places off the beaten path. Loved that we didn't need to get on a tour bus and could go at our own pace.   Enjoyed the friendly voice. Thank you. | The app made our road trip Hana Hi so much more enjoyable. It told us where every water fall was, how far off the road also if it was going to be a muddy walk. Where to turn off for the best banana bread.
 I loved it so much we purchased another tour of the Oregon coast. | We’ve nicknamed our narrator “Ward” (after Ward Clever) because he’s the perfect mix of knowledge and Dad humor. We’ve been using the app since its former name and it’s our go-to for every NP visit. | Glad we stumbled upon his App for your trip to Oahu.  We opted to do our own driving tour rather than a mega bus that costed over $100. The app was simple to use and joined us along the route to get started.  It gave us driving directions and options along with great information along the way.  I even found new places I was unaware of having lived here many years ago.  Don’t hesitate, get the app and be assured you’ll have a great time. | I liked the first couple of tours so much I bought them all! He’s like an old friend now that joins on road trips. I enjoy the directions he gives and the interesting details. I just listen to music and when he has something to say the volume automatically lowers and he lets me know something about the area we’re in. When he’s done the music volume automatically goes back. Worth the money! | We went to Maui on vaca and we purchased this app to do the road to Hana! This was so much better in my opinion then doing a guided tour. We drove at our leisure, stopped at our leisure and used the app for all of our adventures while here!!! Highly recommend and will definitely look into this when we take any other vacations! | The ability to go at our own pace, pick which spots we had already pre-selected and visit new spots was amazing. The history and stories are on par with tour operators that we would have paid at least a couple of hundred dollars and still not gotten the full perspective. This is well worth it!  Wish Europe and Japan were on the list for this app. | We first learned about GyPSy the former name for Guide Along about 3-4 yrs ago. A friend recommended we use it for Rocky Mountain National Park. As we had limited time it was perfect - as is the case for all of the tours. We did not waste time on some stops and took extra time in the must see sights. The stories and history of the parks or routes are informative and help make the drives much more interesting. Gotta get em all. Locals told me after I posted photos along the PCH and Big Sur how did you find out about ‘that’. They said I’ve lived here my whole life and didn’t know about that!  That’s the power of Guide Along! | Great job once again. We enjoyed the informative and helpful commentary. | My brother suggested we get your App. We thoroughly enjoyed it and it helped us decide what and for me, what not to do. The history was great and explains the language and how to pronounce names, was awesome. I’m still practicing. I even used some of your narrative info in a local trivia night! If you don’t have it available, please come to WNY and do one of your guides. We are rich with history but a lot of people aren’t aware. | I’ve been using this app when it was called Gypsy. We use every time we travel. This recent excursion was a cruise to the Big Island. We rented a car through Turo and used the app, the 2 other couples we were with had never heard of the app and were blown over on the knowledge, humor and ease of the use of the app. 

Only issue, while touring we ran into others from the ship. Our friends were very enthusiastic when talking to them about the wealth of information they were learning from this app and told them to start using it.  So I tried to share the app on the fly so they could download - to use on their return trip to the ship. No luck. | We bought the Road 2 Hana and it was great!! It directed us to all the keys sights and gave us suggestions for other cool things to see. The narration was very well written and you are given a lot of extra history that was very interesting. Will use this app for many more tours!! | We have learned so many interesting “tidbits” traveling with GyPSy guide. Even when we drive through places we have visited many times, we have been pleased with the added insight the tour provides. Well worth the purchase. | I recommend the GuideAlong app almost everyday: Facebook groups, strangers in national parks. This app has enhanced our travel immensely! I’d give 10 stars if I could. | We should have bought a bundle. Great directions, highlights and history. We won't do a park without it! | I cannot say enough awesome things about this app. It has changed so many of our family trips for the better, and we even plan our trips around available audio tours now (on our last trip to Smoky Mountains, we decided to add on Blue Ridge Parkway because of GuideAlong). 

Our entire family (including teenagers!) loves the audio tours. We learn so much more than we would trying to read about these places in a guidebook, and our kids actually pay attention and engaged on long road trips. We’ve now purchased Grand Tetons and Yellowstone, Utah Mighty Five, Smoky Mountains, Blue Ridge Parkway, Acadia, and more. 

My kids refer to the narrator as “Sir Appleton Gypsy” (they came up with that during our first tour when the App was GyPSy Guide) and share facts by starting “Sir Appleton said…” I can’t wait to use this on our future road trips and highly highly recommend it. | This is the BEST app ever!!!!! Personal guided tour with tons of history, facts and humor. We LOVE this app!!!!! | This app made our recent trip to Death Valley a wonderful adventure! We would not have been as comfortable driving around the valley floor without this app, which tracked where we were and gave us clear instructions all along the way. Add to that the entertaining stories of the history of the areas, and it brought it all to life for us. You cannot miss!! | When you travel to a new place to experience an area this app is a perfect way to make it so memorable.   We decide to go see an area of the country and when we get there we don’t know where to go or how to start    Now we use this app and it creates a perfect experience for us.   We don’t have to do our own research because this app does it for us.  Wish I could give it 6 stars | Loved the narratives that were always in sync with our drive. We used Arches Park & Bryce Canyon.  Both gave us great info about how formations occurred, why some got their names. We really enjoyed the app | We found this guide while touring the northwest and were amazed. Depending upon the direction of travel the guide one will hear different stories that are fact filled and entertaining as you approach an object of interest. | We absolutely benefited from listening to the tour!  He mentioned spots that we would not have stopped at but were incredible!   Also the tour at volcano national park enabled us to see all of the hot spots in a quick and informative way!!!   Thank you so much!!! | I can’t fully explain how great I think this app is. My husband and I are visiting as many National Parks as we can and touring a park with a GuideAlong tour makes it so much more fun and informative. From geology, history, flora and fauna to which bathrooms are better and which view spots are worth stopping at. We named the friendly guide voice “Uncle Harry” and he is a must have for the ride. | Like having your own personal tour guide in the car with you without taking up a seat.
We call the narrator “Harold”. We took a tour out West in 4 RVs with our kids and we all loved Harold. | I bought Utah mighty 5 , it’s like having our own private guide . I will recommend it to everyone !!! | Excellent, well-detailed and informative guide to the Smokies. Surely would have missed some high points without utilizing this app. 
First discovered Guide Along on a trip to Yellowstone and the Grand Tetons. It proved to be an invaluable tool, especially due to the massive size of these two parks.
Also, the narrator’s voice is soothing and calm, adding to the serenity of areas visited.
Definitely a worthwhile investment! | Amazing addition to our camping hiking experience. | We have used GuideAlong tours since they began. We love them and we named the narrator, Carl. We love him and his humor. 
Thank you for the great tours and highlights of all the area we travel through!! | Just used this for their Sedona tour. The tech worked great and the tour was very informative.  Really great for getting to go at your own pace. I look forward to using it again for other tours. | This is the second time we have used a guide along and it did not disappoint. I really love the stories and the parking hints this App suggests. It is like we had our own personal tour guide in our car. We are not sure if he gave us a name at the beginning but we called him “Bob”! I would definitely use this again! | This is one of our favorite apps. It’s entertaining as well as informative. I hope you keep adding new areas. We do a lot of traveling and it’s so great to get all this information. Plus the gentleman is entertaining he has found his calling. We tried these Route 11 potato chips he talked about and now we are hooked. We. Take his recommendation on hikes and things to see. We are in love with this app. Add more places please | My daughter and I really enjoyed the audio tour as we drove to the park and inside! Learned lots and continued all the way back to Flagstaff too. Definitely worth the price. | We’ve used the App for several tours (and several more planned).  We love it!   Informative, accurate and a little corney humor to top it off!   Get this App! | We thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour!  It was so easy to use.  The app knows where you are on the road and proactively tells you where to stop to hit the highlights in each area along the route.  And it was informative and interesting!  In fact it was much more interesting than the $140 each we paid for a tour guide in Hilo!  I highly recommend! | We used this app when we went to Rocky Mountain, Grand Tetons, Yellowstone, BlackHills, Mount Rushmore, Badlands, Capitol Reef, Glacier, Grand Canyon (South and North)Great Smoky,Zion,Bryce Canyon, Arches, Canyonlands and Arcadia National Parks.  Every time we use this app, it expands on what we are seeing and what is up ahead.  We also can plan our days better with the Trip Planner section.  We have used this app for over 5 years, and have not been letdown once.  It is like having your own tour guide in the car with you.  Thank you, thank your.
Jerry and Debbi Zimmerman | But this is the one app I will recommend to anyone to buy. We paid for the Utah Mighty 5 package and we learned so much about each park’s history and geology. Genuinely looked forward to each snippet and can’t imagine traveling without this app now. | We used the Guide for Oahu Hawaii. Street names are a total mystery on how to say the Hawaiian names. This guide helps us say the words. Great directions on when to turn and which lane to be in advance. Lots of history as you drive along. Loved it, I think you will be pleased with the purchase and the price is super reasonable for what service you get. | I can not recommend GuideAlong enough. We just completed the Utah Mighty Five Parks and I can’t imagine the experience without the App. It provides great park info, history, fun facts and alerts you to Must See areas. 
While at Arches we stopped to take pictures at a famous landmark and another couple were there doing the same. We took pictures for each other (vs selfies) and we recommended the App. They just smiled and said, “ Yep…we using it and wouldn’t travel without it.” | We used this app for Yellowstone, Grand Tetons, Grand Canyon and Sedona. It is a must have for your trip. We learned so much and it help guide us on the must dos for each place we visited. It is easy to use, quality is excellent and clear that the narrator understands the areas. We will use for all our trips. Highly recommend!! | Took the app along for a tour of Arches, Canyonlands, Capitol Reef, Bryce, and Zion and was very pleased with all the information!  Headed to Death Valley next and already purchased the tour. Liked that we could upgrade to the package mid-way through once we knew we liked it. Will definitely be using more tours in the future!

title: PackPoint Travel Packing List
description:
As Featured On The App Store's "Best New Apps", The Washington Post, BBC, LA Times, Lifehacker, Fast Company's Co.DESIGN, and The Next Web.
"A Travel App That Practically Packs Your Bags For You"

Never Forget Your ______ Again!

PackPoint is an intelligent packing app and packing list builder for serious travelers. PackPoint will tell you what you need to pack based on length of travel, weather at your destination, and any activities planned during your trip.

Punch in the city you're traveling to, the departure date, and the number of nights you'll be staying there.

PRO TIPS:
- Tap and hold to re-order packing list items
- Select "hide checked items" for a minimal packing list as you pack.
- Check out the Customize menu within PackPoint for Premium features
- Swipe left to remove an item from your packing list
- Tap the "+" sign to change quantities for each packing list item
- Check off "Repeat Basics" if you're willing to repeat wearing basics like shirts and pants
- Check off "Laundry" if you will have access to laundry facilities

PackPoint will build a packing list for you that takes into account:
- Business or Leisure travel
- Activities you plan on doing
- What you need for an international trip
- Warm weather clothes
- Cold weather clothes
- An umbrella if the forecast calls for rain

Have a packing app feature request, or feedback? E-mail info@packpnt.com or visit https://ideas.packpnt.com
Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/packpoint
Follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/packpnt @packpnt
releaseNotes: Fixed startup crash for iOS 17
reviews:
It gave me the info i needed, because im sooooo tired, and i need this vacation! | I’ve been using this app for years before all my trips.

Absolutely nothing fancy at all but very reliable.

I generate a list, delete everything that doesn’t apply, and start packing. | It makes you choose male or female with no opt out. Even ignoring that its basically unusable from trans folks, you're a packing app you don't need to know that. Besides what if you're planning what to pack for the entire family. Not really relevant, and weirdly personal. No thanks. | Options galor | Products very helpful on getting organized and not forgetting the essential that you need. | V. Helpful | app super utile a non dimenticare nulla e sapere sempre che tempo farà nel nostro prossimo viaggio sicuramente la consiglio molto!!!! | Happy it works for others.  I paid for premium based on reviews, but was only able to complete very basic functions, was unable to add activities.  It’s okay, it was worth a try, but it’s just not for me. | Helps you pack and think of everything | The first thing you’re supposed to put is the city. The city I was traveling to would not populate and it would not let me move on from there. Disappointed. | Easy way to organize what to pack so you don’t forget anything. | I think I don’t need much or pack much but I always need more than I anticipated. It helpful to have a packing list - otherwise something is left behind. | I have packing anxiety and I avoid trips because packing stresses me out to the point of a mental breakdown 😆 I wish I was joking, but alas I am not… so I’ve been using this for about 5 minutes and have high hopes that I can pack without crying and thinking about canceling last minute. | I use PackPoint for all of my trip no matter if it is a weekend getaway or longer vacation.  It helps me get all of my thoughts regarding packing organized and make it an easier task. | Great program.  Makes my packing easy!!  Love it. | My friend just turned me onto this app and I’m obsessed! So simple, and customizable. SUPER user friendly! | This app is amazing! I have always been known as an over packer, and this app helps me make sure that I don’t over pack. It also lets me know what I should pack. I love that I can put in where I am going, when I am going, and how long I am staying for my VC. This app is awesome! I definitely recommend getting it. This app, I think, can be used by any age group, whether it is younger, teenagers, young adults, mid adults, and even elders can use this. This app has saved me from over packing. So, I rate this app, 5 stars! 5️⃣⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ | This app really helped organize our packing for our trip. Highly recommended | Uses the weather and activities to build a packing list | Where in the world and for how long? Use this and Timeshifter all the time. | This app is a life saver! | Very helpful | Upgraded to the paid version, but still would like additional customization options. Would love to be able to hide categories I’m never going to use (motorcycling, hiking, business formal, etc.) and have the ability to adjust the order of items in a list and the order of the categories within the list. | As someone who packs for 14 days for a weekend trip, I needed this like you wouldn’t believe. It’s a lot better than me trying to put notes in my phone for sure. On the way to the airport with one whole different bag than what I started with! | I can’t find a way to contact customer support through the app, so unfortunately, I’m having to write it in a review with hopes that somebody who can help me reads it. I’ve got premium of this app, and I’ve tried to connect it to Tripit. Because I use a Google sign in for Tripit there is no way to connect the two apps as it only has login and password as options, not the Google logo. I have to go through full site, but the apps won’t connect if I go that way. I only got Tripit, because of this app, and I really don’t want to enter all my trip information again | It is too easy to accidentally delete items on the list. All you have to do is touch them and it’s gone. So if you don’t know what you touched then you have to go through the list and try to think of it again. | Developers have been unresponsive to multiple emails | I create activities for each of the types of trips I take. I keep many of my toiletries and electronics permanently packed, but it gives me reassurance to compare my ready-to-go carryon with my lists. | Such a great app so helpful for packing ❤️ | Love it, very helpful | Love using this app to pack! It uses the weather and you’re activities to create the lists.  Reminded me of items I would have forgotten like hats and other specifics. | PackPoint is a great app. It helps me make sure I have everything I need it’s almost like a shopping list for packing. You can edit it easily add things and it really just make sure you have everything you want for your trip. It also check the weather so if you’re going to a rainy place, for example, it make sure that you have the option to pack rain gear. | I love it I don’t have to think or take the risk to forget some thing | Ok this app is literally a life saver. I am going to Hawaii soon and I had no idea where to start packing. GET THIS APP ITS SO SLAY | There you have it. You deserve it. | Most acceptable one I can find in the App Store for now but lacking some basic features.  I wish I can sort or alphabetize the list, edit the master, to begin with.  And why can I type in wherever I am going? For example, no San Jose, CA? Only San Francisco. | Yet another Packing List app where I’m required to put in my destination. I just want to make a list and use it for future trips. I don’t seem to be able to do this with this app. | Pack list is simple, clean and easy to use .
It’s a great memory aid for packing . | Great starting point when preparing a trip. Saves me from racking my brain to think of the obvious | I use this app every time I travel. It is much better than my memory! | The subject line says it all. It’s simple easy to use. Not bloated with too many features. It’s exactly what I need. | I had my own list however this is much easier. | I’ve been using this app pretty contentedly for years, but this week discovered that NYC somehow doesn’t come up as a possible destination? | Wedding in Sarajevo? Check.
Motorcycle riding thru West Virginia? Check.
This packing app that calculates based on weather and activities is simple, accurate and thorough. Oddly leaves off shoes (!) though. | I bought the premium version to sync my trip from TripIt so I did not have to re-enter all of my activities that were already in TripIt and could plan according to each day and activity. All it does is sync the dates of your trip which you can enter yourself on the free version. The premium version is a waste of time and money. | Suggests things I would have forgotten | Such a great way to help remember essential packing items. | Use it for every trip | Very helpful | Super helpful! Packing is overwhelming and this app keeps my mind organized! Love it

title: MapXplorer: GPS, Radar, Route
description:
MapXplorer: GPS, Radar, Route App is the offline map app designed to make your journeys stress-free and efficient. With powerful features like offline map, radar, and route expertise, getting to your destination has never been easier.

Key Features:

▶Offline Maps: Download maps for your favorite destinations and access them without an internet connection. Say goodbye to data usage worries and stay on track even in remote areas. The offline search feature of Ways - Offline Map App ensures you never miss out on essential places during your balad travels. 

▶Radar: Stay aware of your surroundings with the powerful radar feature of Mapping - mph tracker app. Discover nearby points of interest, essential amenities, and never miss out on exciting places while you're on the move.

▶Route Expert: Our GPS app let you navigate your journeys with accuracy. Our route expertise ensures you take the most efficient and time-saving paths, avoiding traffic waves and detours by speed up.With the Smart Route Expert, you don’t need navigation no longer!

▶Points of Interest: Discover exciting places nearby or at your destination. Our Route Expert - Police app provides detailed information to enhance your travel experience.

▶Reliable and Secure: We prioritize your data security and privacy. Your location information is used only for route planning purposes, giving you peace of mind during your travels.

▶User-Friendly Interface: Our gos intuitive interface simplifies smart route planner. Effortlessly search for locations, save favorite spots, and enjoy smooth panning and zooming for a detailed view of the maps just like a navigation.

Direct your trail route with confidence using Wayz Offline Map Driving app. Experience the power of offline maps, cop radar, and route expertise right at your fingertips. Start exploring the world hassle-free and make the most of your neshan journeys. 

Get Traffic Route Maps & GPS Maprika now and enjoy offline mapping, anytime, anywhere!

While the core app experience remains free, subscribing opens the door to a plethora of exclusive features and benefits. To take full advantage of advanced tools, personalized insights, and a seamless ad-free experience, subscribe now!

Your subscription automatically renews, ensuring you never miss a moment of enhanced app usage. However, you have the flexibility to manage your subscription settings and turn off auto-renewal at any time from your account preferences.

title: Action Tour Guide - GPS Tours
description:
Every day, thousands of people travel across America, asking, "What is there to do here?" Well, here's the answer for everyone looking for things to do at their own pace and time at their favorite destinations. Action Tour Guide offers over 150+ self-guided driving and walking tours across America and beyond, ensuring memorable experiences without the crowds. 

Why choose us? 

Your Adventure, No Strings Attached: Experience pure freedom on your journeys, ideal for the solo travel planner looking for an untethered exploration experience. Savor each moment, from sunsets to historical revelations, without the rush.

Narration That Breathes Life: Our app becomes your personal narrator. From the vibrant scenes of Hawaii to the exclusive world of Hollywood's famous, such as Taylor Swift's home, our guide offers a simple yet informative experience.

Offline Ready: Planning a self-driven adventure or a leisurely city walk? Download your chosen stories beforehand. We're your trusted guide, even when your GPS waves goodbye.  

Stories, Not Just Stats: Why did the brave stand their ground at Gettysburg? What secrets do the terrains of Yellowstone hold? With us, you don’t just visit- you experience, understand, and connect.

A Guide You Can Trust: Recognition from platforms like Thrillist and WBZ underscores the credibility of our app among global explorers. And when the Newport Mansions gave us the Laurel Award for Technology, we knew our love for storytelling was resonating.

Something for everyone: Catering to all types of explorers, our app suggests nearby hotel options for each tour and provides easy access to RV and car rental services, ensuring a seamless travel experience.

TOURS ACROSS AMERICA AND BEYOND
Featuring over 150 different tours, Action Tour Guide offers fun, informative tours from coast to coast and even overseas!

1. Battlefields: Where history didn't just happen; it battled its way through.

Gettysburg
Yorktown Battlefield
Antietam National Battlefield
Battle of Lexington & Concord
Shiloh Battlefield
...and more

2. Historic Walks: Strolling through the pages of time, one cobblestone at a time.

Charleston
Freedom Trail
Salem Witch Trials
Colonial Williamsburg
Historic Philadelphia
Washington DC Monuments
...and more

3. Summer Favorites: Sizzling spots that make summer sum-more fun!

Martha's Vineyard
Cape Cod and Provincetown
Cape Ann
Newport
Portland
...and more

4. Fall Foliage: Our tours bring stories as rich and comforting as grandma's fall recipes.

Kancamagus Highway
Shenandoah NP
Acadia
Bar Harbor
Blue Ridge Parkway
...and more

5. Tourist Cities: Skyscrapers, street food, and stories that city lights tell after dark.

Hollywood
Providence
Austin
Houston
Savannah
...and more

6. National Parks: Natural wonders, wild tales. Mother Nature spilled all her secrets here.

Grand Canyon
Yellowstone
Joshua
Badlands
Rocky Mountain
Hawaii Volcanoes
Sequoia & Kings Canyon
Mt Lemmon
...and more

7. Scenic Drives: Milestones, not just miles. Buckle up for road-tripping revelations!

Big Sur
17 Mile Drive
Million Dollar Highway
Road to Hana
Pacific Coastal Highway
Shenandoah
...and more

8. Overseas Adventures: Get a "world" of experiences without jet lag! Wander globally with our tales from afar.

Iceland
Cancun (Mayan Ruins)
San Juan
Iceland
Bangkok

9. Bundles & More: Where trips meet thrift and adventures come in twos (or threes, or fours...)! Get more journeys, more stories, and more bang for your buck.

New Tours: Dive into our latest offerings, such as the serene Road to Hana, the majestic La Sal Mountains, the historic Vicksburg Battlefield, the vibrant city of Santa Fe, and the picturesque Big Sky region. Each tour is crafted to provide unique insights and unforgettable experiences. 

Enhance your journey with our Action+ subscription, offering unlimited access to all our tours. Plan your trip efficiently with Action Tour Guide's trip planner for personalized, memorable, and cost-effective explorations.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes
reviews:
My husband and I used this on our honeymoon in Kauai! We really learned a lot about what was around us as well as the islands history and culture. We did both Kauai tours enjoyed stopping at a few spots that we definitely wouldn’t have found without it! Great experience! | We were only in Miami for a very short time and some of my travel companions were 70 years old, making it hard to walk or bike long distances to see the whole city.  This driving tour was perfect. It allowed us to see lots of neighborhoods and get a good feel of the full scope of Miami. We went to South Beach, Little Havana, Brickell, and a few other neighborhoods.  The app was really impressive and easy to use.  The guide gave directions on which way to turn (though some turns are quick!! Keep an eye on the app’s path to predict the route yourself instead of just waiting for the narrator). As we drove into certain locations, it triggered an audio segment to play and give us some history of the area.  The guide was easy to listen to and understand. He spoke clearly and the volume was perfect.  I personally wanted a little more content at each stop because I am a nerd, but my travel companions didn't mind the minute or two pauses in between stops.  It give us time to talk to one another without missing content. I absolutely plan to purchase one of these in every city I’m in.  Highly recommend! | We thoroughly enjoyed the Cape Cod tour, learned new things and visit hidden gems we’d never been to before! | This app made our desire for self guided exploration that much more enjoyable.  We loved the valuable facts and information.  Also appreciated the bonus and the various start options.  Highly recommend | We only had one day in Lake Tahoe so we took this driving tour to get a feel for the place. It was wonderful! The sights were amazing and the tour was chocked full of information about the area. There was no way we could have discovered all of this on our own.  Instead of feeling like we missed out by only having one day, we felt like we had a deep and full experience. I can’t recommend this tour enough! Thanks so much!! | It was very handy and gave a lot of information. The instructions were very clear and easy to follow. Highly recommend. | We really enjoyed the Austin tour. It was a just-right mix of a driving tour and walking around to see cool things tour. The audio stories were insightful and interesting. We’ll definitely use this tour next time we are in a new city. | This was great! | We only had half a day on Sunday but went back on Friday and was able to pick up where we left off. Took a break for lunch then finished our tour. It was great to go at our own pace. | Booked for April. 
Arrived early , waited over an hour.
Tour doesn’t run until May 
Refunded my money. 
Need to fix their website ! | Informative. Tech support is non english speaker. | Excellent | The sound and visuals were good. We were able to track our location which was very helpful to track our progress. It was very hot at the site so we were able to rest in the shade. We listened to it again later which was helpful too because younger kids with us was a distraction on the tour … | So glad we found this for Bryce Canyon and Zion.  Made tour way more interesting.  Thank you!!! | The app was perfect. The GPS is perfect as it triggers the narrator at the perfect spot to enjoy the view and information. Really impressed ! | We loved this tour!! The amount of information was great and the way it could be paused so we could take it all in at our leisure. | We loved it! Super easy to use.  Full of fun facts n great knowledge! | Viola was wonderful! We loved her family stories and her knowledge of the canyon. Especially appreciated the insights about the Navajo culture. Left feeling enriched and blessed to know her.  Would highly recommend her as an outstanding tour guide. | The tour hit some interesting points, however I’d encourage advertising stopping more frequently and going deeper into subjects even if that makes for a longer tour. | Good information regarding sites on the tour. | This was helpful and very informative as soon as we finally got the audio to work. Maybe user error?
But if this is going to be a “tour guide” then please use correct pronunciation. Some of it is so bad it’s insulting. When visitors are hearing this and do not know what is correct, they too will think that’s how it is said. We used the Mt. Lemmon tour, please fix it. Thank you. | If you’re in LA, have a car, and want to spend 3-4 hours sight seeing some celebrity homes, this is the best way to do it! The navigation and audio was super convienient and informative. It’s like we had a tour guide in our car! I would say just make sure you have a good driver that can focus on driving. I drove for my family and still found the tour very worth it. | Enjoyed being able to put our earbuds in and walk at our pace through the series of stops. Able to take our time at the places of extra interest and didn’t have to get delayed by other peoples questions. | It was awesome to have the tour know where we were and show us the battlefields. It made the whole trip worthwhile. Great experience. | Took a minute to figure things out but that was 90% me. The app worked well in conjunction with the auto tour signs posted along the route in Gettysburg. Narrative was great and not overly long.  Works best if you don’t drive too fast. | Love the program, but I can’t seem to close it. It burns my battery and never closes. | The tour said 2-4 hours. You can easily make it last much longer than that. The insight given through the prompts was accurate and concise. It was really easy to follow the driving directions too | We wanted something to do that was low key after being in town a few days. This was the perfect tour for us. Our son is 18 months old and slept through most of the trip and allowed us to enjoy the interesting commentary and history of the audio track. The GPS feature makes it quite easy to keep on task since it keeps track of your location and provides facts, history, other interesting information based on your current location. Highly recommend this tour if at Lake Tahoe, especially if you have little ones that can use an excuse to get an extended nap. | Our tour as we drive along the Million $$ Highway was great! There were a couple of spots that we never would’ve known about if it hadn’t been for this tour! I’ll be a repeat customer! | We enjoyed the tour very much and appreciated all the information and history provided by the app. The GPS and narration matches up perfectly. Don’t miss the lighthouse at the end. A very well thought out software. | Buyer beware…not every picture on the app matches with the address. So double check with Google of needed. Also, know that Taylor swift has armed guards at her house so don’t stop just drive past or they yell at you to keep moving. | It was a wonderful concept whne it worked right. It took a while to get it to automatically pop up and I had to close the app and restart it a couple of times. The map did not populate to the Apple Maps like it says. It was some cool informations, but it only went one stretch if the island and then stopped. It didn’t take us to the other half where the bluffs are. We were left to figure that out with no audio. For the information there is, I don’t know that it was worth the money. We were left at the end going, “is that it?” | It was crazy to see the endless sand dunes and learn about the area’s past. We took a hike on Alkali Flat trail(not flat at all), it’s just under 5 miles round trip. What’s even more interesting is that this tour also goes along the path and it is very well organized. There is signage but sometimes get knocked down by the wind. Also there is zero shade so just be aware! Nice hike though!! Highly recommended! | Was hesitant to do this but gave it a shot and glad I did. The guide narrative not only gives great history but also provides information on each pullout/area, trails, difficulty, & duration. It was an extremely windy day and this guide really helped us decide which stops would give us the most benefit and helped us decide which to skip to stay out of the wind. Highly recommend, good price/value. | This app is great because they have so many tours and they are bundled together for a good deal. But when it comes to the app design and user interface it is less polished than pretty much all of the competition. 
Overall I would recommend the app but reluctantly because it desperately needs a design overhaul. | We purchased the Palm Springs city tour of the architecture. Pros - informative and showed attractions we were not aware of and had been her 5-6 times. Very informative. Things that kept me from giving a 5 star rating. The narration need to be shorter and more frequent. The day we used the tour was relatively high traffic and long gaps making us wonder if we were off tour. Only one direction. There is a long ride to thousand palms and you come back to do other optional tours. Narration in both directions is the same and thus instructions are backwards. I had to start at the visitor center - would prefer being able to jump on anywhere. We have used Guide Along in National Parks for some time. These tours are overlapping but many are not on Guide along and would prefer gos narration tours. | L I’mau 9 | We enjoyed this tour! Very informative. Only suggestion would be the ability to display it on cars GPS. Highly recommend! | They did a good job orienting us to Ek Balam. It certainly enhanced our experience for a very reasonable price! Try it you’ll like it! | Very helpful with information and direction. We learned a lot with this tour. | Action’s Guided Tour of the 17 Mile Drive from Monterey to Carmel was GREAT ! | Second time we did a tour, even though we had been to Newport several times, information on the tour was fresh. | Love this app. It was easy to follow. Couldn’t remember if the tour guide introduced himself or not so we just referred to him as Howie. Howie gave us lots of educational tidbits about Hawaii and it’s history along our drive. He gave us quite a few places to stop at if we felt like it. We got to see places we would have missed if we were just driving around on our own. This is our second time using a driving tour guide and we loved it! | I’m not much of a reviewer… All 3 of us in our group bought the Mayan Ruins tour bundle which allowed us to wonder around at mostly our own pace. We also didn’t have to worry about obtaining a tour guide at each site. I didn’t even know that would be a thing since it’s unlike how National Parks in the US operate. I though the information presented was about the right amount to prevent overload but get the proper sense for each place. I hope to review some of it as I show my pictures to my husband who stayed home. Only 4 instead of 5 because sometimes the map navigation was hard to orient to what I was seeing - mainly this was at Coba, and the number 9 stop at Chichen Itza crashed the app and wouldn’t play. Otherwise terrific! | While we have used the National Parks tours and loved them, the Kauai tour doesn’t sync the map with the story!  At an intersection we had no idea whether to go right or left. After 10 frustrating minutes, we just cancelled the tour. Very disappointing!!! | I stumbled onto this tour on the internet and I am so glad I did!  My daughter, grandson and I are visiting Nags Head NC for the weekend for the first time.  This tour was easy and fun and had something for each of us! We even brought the dog along and he was able to visit all of the outdoor points.  We were able to do this at our leisure and learned so much about the Outer Banks.  And we got to see lighthouses up close!! | We enjoyed the tour. It could have had more locations, such as more Mid-Century Modern homes, even if they weren’t celebrities. | App is easy to use
Great information 
Very convenient | So glad we took this opportunity…culture, history, geography, music.  We rented a car so this app actually saved us a lot of money since we didn’t have the high cost of bus tours!  Even though we are not experts with technology we did it! | I’ve driven this road for years, learned interesting tidbits I never knew. Kept the trip interesting. Good for any age.

title: BART (Official)
description:
The official Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) app has arrived. It’s the easiest way to plan your trip and get accurate real time train departures with data straight from BART, along with official service alerts.


The BART app offers exclusive features for hassle free travel for daily commuters, infrequent users and tourists alike:
-Plan your entire end to end trip with BART’s exclusive Trip Planner giving you the fastest route from your starting point to your destination using BART and multiple modes of transportation, including connecting transit, biking, walking and driving.
-Step by step navigation with personalized preferences and saved favorite stations and trips.
-Real time departures and schedule timetable.
-Customized in-app notifications about BART service and announcements.
-Contactless in-app Daily Fee parking payment 
-Service disruption information linked to your trip itinerary.
-Report a Biohazard that needs addressing and access our BART Watch App for reporting crimes.
-Escalator and Elevator advisories.
-Fleet of the Future train tracker.
-Cancelled trip notices.
-Easily see the last train of the evening by station when you’re planning your night out or your trip home from the airport.
-Station information (including if it offers a parking lot and secured bike parking).
-Seamless connection to bart.gov and BARTable for deals, events, and fun.
-It’s ad free; who wants to be distracted when looking how far away your train is?


BART is working on future features of the app to enhance your BART experience... Tell us about the features you want.
releaseNotes:
Thanks for using the BART (official) app! This release includes enhancements and bug fixes, including: 
Added an option for riders to manually select a station for the Tap and Go parking when location service is not available.  
Display credit card expiration date for user to differentiate between new versus old card.  
Included a BART Watch link under the 'More' section for easy access.  
Enhanced the display of advisory icon offering a clue to the rider when there is an advisory.   

We hope these updates improve your experience with the app. If you have any feedback or encounter any issues, please do not hesitate to let us know. Thanks for riding BART!
developer: San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit District
reviews:
It really should be a much more simple. | When you select a station to see its times, it resets to 12th St in Oakland if you minimize (unfocus?) the app | I am a user that wants to see the map (show where trains are running in real time (if its hard let me click on the station i want to see). I really dont enjoy having to scroll through lists of station names (which i sometimes forget) - i never forget where i want to go on a map. this would be that much easier/faster to navigate. | Love the real time departure information! It is very accurate. It would be great to see alerts on the same screen somehow. How can we understand an issue that will impact us shortly? | Get charged $20 to pay $3.30 in parking. No refund mechanism. I’d rather just have my card linked instead of having this ewallet set up | How about a real time fully functional paying for fare system and dump Clipper. | Schedule says earliest departure from Walnut Creek at 4:52am but plan trip will not display it . | Unable to book Parking for Hercules bus station, option is not present on app, but when try to book from the web, can see the Hercules city option. Please fix the App, dropdown options | Pero necesitan más seguridad en la tarde y en la noche | Once Bart started running only the new trains, it was a breath of fresh air. Trains were on time or only 1-2 min late. Now with the weather trains are running 10 min behind schedule. This is unacceptable. Passengers rely on the trains to arrive in time. If they have to move slower, then leave earlier. | There are too many Bart delays, police activities etc. Bart trains are filthy | Delay not communicated to riders | This app is amazing. There is a few changes I would make to the trip planner to improve it.

 I would start by adding in the option to be able to filter out specific transit agencies from plans (based upon cost effectiveness, personal preferences and/or shortest travel times).

Then, I would also add in the route list and length to each segment of a journey (like Google does) because it helps riders make sure they won’t miss their stop (especially during their first trip on that route).

And finally, I would eventually add in the ability to make the trip planner save the directions in the “notes” section of the calendar event you’re adding instead of adding everything to the title of the event, because that doesn’t actually help if you need to refer back to it for help while you’re between stations (like San Bruno to South San Francisco) and have no internet.

Make these changes for the future, and I’d use this app instead of Google for all of my BART based Transit trips! | Been trying to cancel parking reservations for the last 24 hours!! What’s going on? | Usually public sector apps are horrendous because they cheap out on development, this one actually does what it’s supposed to do | Within the app, I see inconsistent departure times between the home and plan trip tab. It was frustrating to plan a trip and then to see my train is ACTUALLY leaving much earlier than in the plan trip section (assuming the home tab is more accurate). 

Arrival times vary from 0-2 minutes between what is shown on my app and what is displayed on the screen at stations. | Really like paying with my clipper card. It is very convenient.

Thank you | App is very inaccurate. It was telling me to get off in one station and take some buses to get to the destination 1.5 hours later.
I’ve checked Google Maps and it’s showed me there is still a train from another station. Saved me 1.4hours to get to my destination.
Bart app - annoying | Fast and convenient, easy to transfer | Currently it is impossible to enter and find stations by name in the trip planning list . “Powell” does not find the Powell station. | The parking feature works whenever it pleases, and never when I needed. I wish I could give this app negative stars. | Helps me time manage better | BART should increase security in their parking. I often see broken car windows and my car was broken into at Antioch station.

title: Steller: Plan & Book Trips
description:
Steller is a travel planning app that makes finding the best things to do easy and planning your next trip stress fee. 


PLAN YOUR NEXT TRIP
Our trip builder combines AI and the power of the human experience to help you create the perfect trip. Hidden gems, the hottest spots on Instagram, the must sees – you can find, explore, and book them all in the Steller app. 

SEARCH ANY DESTINATION ON EARTH
Search and find travel videos and recommendations for any destination. Whether you’re looking for travel recommendations you can trust in San Diego or Kathmandu — you’ll find them on Steller. 

BE INSPIRED BY A GLOBAL COMMUNITY OF TRAVELERS
Want to explore a new destination, but don’t know anyone who has been there? Each destination on Steller has videos from real travelers allowing you to see it from different perspectives.


BOOK UNIQUE EXPERIENCES & FAVORITES 
Whether you’re looking for a unique experience or the most popular attractions you can book it in minutes on Steller.

FIND YOUR TRAVEL FAM
Connect with people like you who love to travel and explore the way you do. 


THE MAP YOU’VE BEEN WAITING FOR
Zoom in on the Steller map to find something to do nearby. Map locations are infused with videos from real travelers giving you a sneak peek before you go. 


SWIPE UP FOR DETAILS
Wondering where a travel video is located? Swipe up to find the location, Google directions, and details about a place right inside Steller.


SAVE YOUR FAVORITES
Have a trip coming up? Save all your favorite recommendations, videos, places to stay, and things to eat to a trip. 

SHARE YOUR OWN VIDEOS
Took a trip and want to share about it? Ate at a restaurant that slaps? Had an experience you can’t keep to yourself? Upload a quick video and show the community.


BOOK A STAY
Places to stay at every price point. You may even discover some unique stays you won’t see anywhere else.


TRAVEL WITH CONFIDENCE
Reviews you can trust combined with videos from other travelers and the creators you love, means you’ll know what to expect before you go. Steller gives you all the information you need to feel confident in your travel choices.


USE THE MAP
If you’re looking for somewhere to eat or something to do right where you’re at — use the map on Steller to find something close by.


Terms of service — https://steller.co/terms


Privacy Policy — https://steller.co/privacy


Have feedback? Contact us at https://steller.co/contact
releaseNotes: Introducing Trips, our new trip planner to help you find the best places for your next trip. Explore thousands of trip recommendations shared by real travelers.

title: TripBFF - Solo Travel Friends
description:
Are you tired of exploring the world alone? Do you crave the company of like-minded travelers who share your passion for adventure? Look no further than TripBFF, an app designed to connect you with travel friends, unlock exciting experiences, and create memories that will last a lifetime.

TripBFF is not just another travel app—it's your gateway to a community of solo travelers who are ready to embark on incredible journeys with you. Whether you're a solo traveler seeking friendships or looking to expand your circle, TripBFF has you covered.

With TripBFF, finding travel friends has never been easier. Simply create a profile highlighting your interests, travel preferences, and destination wishlist, and let the app's powerful algorithm do the rest. Discover fellow adventurers who share your wanderlust, connect with them, and embark on amazing trips together. Whether you're backpacking through Southeast Asia or exploring the cultural treasures of Europe, TripBFF helps you build genuine connections with like-minded individuals.

But that's not all—TripBFF is filled with travel tips and insights. Browse through lots of user-generated content, including travel guides, packing hacks, and insider recommendations. From hidden gems off the beaten path to must-try local cuisine, TripBFF's community is here to help you make the most of your adventures.

Planning to study abroad or embark on a work exchange program? With our interests feature, TripBFF is the perfect platform to connect with fellow travelers experiencing the same thing from around the world. Coordinate travel plans, share tips on navigating new cities, and form study groups or networking circles to maximize your international experience.

Stay connected with your travel friends and make group chats to discuss itineraries, share exciting updates, or coordinate meetups. The possibilities are endless when you have a global network of travel buddies at your fingertips.

Don't let the fear of solo travel hold you back. Download TripBFF today and unlock a world of incredible adventures, unforgettable experiences, and lifelong friendships. Travel is better with friends, and TripBFF is here to make your journey extraordinary.

TripBFF subscription: TripBFF Pro & TripBFF Pro +.

TripBFF Pro plans:

Monthly: $4.99
Annual: $39.99

TripBFF Pro+ plans:

Monthly: $6.99
Annual: $55.99

Payments and Renewal:

Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.
Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period.
You can manage or turn off auto-renew in your Account settings at any time after purchase
No cancellation of the current subscription is allowed during the active period and we are not liable for the cost of your subscription if your account is banned due to violating our terms and service.
Terms of use: https://tripbff.com/terms
Privacy policy: https://tripbff.com/privacy
releaseNotes:
TRIPPY: AI itinerary builder & more

POSTS FEED: See posts from countries & interests you follow

NEW POSTS: Add titles & photos to your posts

TRAVEL STATS WRAPPED: Share your travel stats with ease

PLANS FOR YOU: Get custom plans selected for you

BUG FIXES: Fixed major sign-in with Apple bug & others causing app crashes

UI & PERFORMANCE: Enhanced performance and UI

SAFETY: Enhanced safety features to make traveling safer than ever

title: Countdown - Pretty Progress
description:
Track time with beautiful countdown and count up widgets on your Home Screen and Lock Screen. Get the results you want by adding beautiful ALWAYS ON motivational timers to the device you use every day.

On your wrist? On your Mac? Pretty Progress works there, too.

Our objective is to support you achieve your goals.

We beautifully track your goals so you don’t have to. What better place to remind yourself of the things that matter than the devices you use every day?

Your life goals, your three-day fasting, how long you have been without drinking or smoking, when your newborn comes to life, the deadline of your PhD or your mother's birthday...

No matter what your goal is. Pretty Progress gives you beautiful countdowns to customise and track them all:

- Count up & down towards a specific date or with a timer
- Repeat periodically and create recurrent events
- Show the percentage of completion, how much time is left or how much time has past (time since). In years, months, weeks, days... or a combination of them
- Beautiful and unique designs. 6 different templates to customise and add to your Home Screen, Lock Screen, Stand By (iOS 17), and Watch complications
- Customise colours, icons, layout, fonts, size... and every little aspect of the countdown at any time. Create your own personal Home Screen and Watch Face
- A dashboard to visualise all the timers created and understand your deadlines, goals, achievements, or recurrent tasks
- Notifications: 1 week and 1 day before, and at the end of your countdown, and every day, week, month or year after your habit streak
- A library to get inspired and create widgets easily
- 3 different sizes for the Home Screen widgets: small, medium, and large
- All Lock Screen widgets localisations available
- All complication sizes for Watch Faces supported
- Dark mode support
- iCloud synchronization. Sync your countdowns on your iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, and Mac (Silicon) automatically
- Family sharing enabled for the PRO purchase

WHAT CAN YOU TRACK?
- Fasting
- Time sober
- Time without smoking
- Time without sex
- Countdown to Christmas
- Days until your mother's birthday
- Countdown to your next holidays
- Days until your project release deadline
- Days left until your next trip
- Percentage of your gym routine complete
- Days left until your wedding anniversary
- Days until retirement
- Days until your financial independence
- Percentage of the year, month, week...
- Days left until your kombucha is fermented
- How many days you have left on your vacations
- Countdown to taxes submission
- Days until your new child comes into the world
- Countdown to that important exam
- Days until your graduation
- Percentage of the academic year left
- Days until Superbowl
- Your life and death countdown
- My love countdown
- Streak of days of habits
- Daily, weekly and monthly tasks
- Time until your new job


WE WOULD LOVE YOUR FEEDBACK:
We love to improve, so any feedback is always welcome!
For any question, issue, suggestion or anything you want to say, contact at: hi@prettyprogress.app

=======================

The free version of Pretty Progress includes four custom countdown widgets with two designs, the default daily, weekly, monthly and yearly progress and some customisation options.

If you purchase Pretty Progress PRO, the payment will be charged to your iTunes account. If you purchase a monthly or yearly subscription, your account will automatically be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current subscription period unless you disable auto-renew. You can turn off auto-renewal at any time by going to your Account Settings on the App Store after purchase.

=======================

Terms of Service: https://prettyprogress.app/terms-of-service
Privacy Policy: https://prettyprogress.app/privacy-policy
releaseNotes:
- Bug fixes and UX improvements

We'd love your feedback! Please, feel free to contact us at any time with issues or suggestions at hi@prettyprogress.app

title: Distance Tool
description:
Distance Tool allows for quick and easy calculations to find distances between points on a map, including area calculations for non-overlapping polygons drawn. Includes metric (meters, kilometers) and imperial units (yards, miles, feet for altitude) for distances. Co-ordinates can either be displayed in decimal or degrees, meters and seconds.

Useful for mapping fields in agriculture, plots of land/home boundaries, or for general interest in distances and areas!

Functionality to drop a point at your current location (GPS or otherwise), and to email the results. Tap briefly to drop points anywhere on the map.

Share your drawing (shape) by email, which includes a file that can be opened on any device with Distance Tool.

Allows the standard map views of standard, satellite and hybrid.

Supports quick altitude calculation without data connectivity. Find out how high up you are! Or see the altitude of ANY point (requires data).

Freehand draw: Draw any shape on the map to quickly calculate area.

Follow Mode: Calculate distance or areas simply by moving!

Subscription terms:
- The subscription auto-renews at the end of each term.
- Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase.
- The subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.
- Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period.
- You may manage your subscription and turn off auto-renewal by going to your Account Settings after purchase.

Privacy policy and Terms of Use: https://applorium.com/privacy-distance-tool

title: EV Companion
description:
• Locations: Nearby restaurants, coffee, and other amenities. Personalized real-time availability, compatibility, and pricing & access information for 300+ networks based on YOUR specific EV
• Trips: Groundbreaking AI finds charging stops along your route based on your preferences (including charging networks), weather, and traffic conditions
• Vehicles: Select your EV to see charging compatibility and plan trips in seconds
• Community: Leave & view feedback on any charging location
• Tesla: Account integration to view your vehicle’s current ranges and charging status, and adjust max range and remote climate! Your vehicle’s current ranges are automatically input when trip planning. Plan those long-distance hauls much easier than in the Tesla itself!
• Directions: via Apple Maps, Google Maps, Waze or Send to your Tesla

Best of all: it's personalized for whichever EV or PHEV that YOU drive. Select your vehicle from our extensive list including:
• Tesla - Roadster, Model S, Model 3, Model X, Model Y
• Abarth - 500e
