Very misleading. | They pay to come up first for various apps that represent charging networks. You can’t even get into  app until you agree to a subscription (that they’re hoping you forget to cancel).

The app does nothing but give you info on chargers around you. You can’t use it to pay for the network you probably intended to download the app for.

It’s intentionally misleading and they lock you into a sub booted you can even get in to see what it’s really about.

AVOID | Thought I’d give it a try. But first trip I tried to plan crashed the app! | I realllllly don’t like when developers con users into subscriptions. It makes it an unusable app if I can’t even try the free version at all before deciding if I want to test out premium features. Deleting immediately. Make it so I can use the app at all without having to try a “one free week” subscription, maybe I’ll give you another chance. Otherwise… scam. Run away. | Can’t complain | Signed up, registered, free trial. App won’t load/connect. Just spins in circle on LTE or WiFi. At Desert Marriot Palm Springs. Be better. | Can’t even get beyond their nag screen demanding I subscribe to see what is in the app. I’m not subscribing just to see if the app works better than the reviews seem to show. | Do not use this app. Asks for $39.99 a year subscription and did not work with FPL charge stations.  Scam app. Don’t be fooled. | Be sure to note, that despite the fact this app will pop-up whenever you search for any vendors charge payment app, it does not perform anything other than allow for charging station searching and their details. A tad frustrating, especially when it immediately prompts for subscription fee and all you want is to pay for a charge. | Don’t get fooled into thinking this app does anything.  The first thing it charges membership then you get nothing for it.
Links to your Apple account so I am now expecting a flood of spam! | I tried to use it for a weekend rental and kept crashing , did not work. Worse thing ever . It will charge you after a week and there is no easy way to cancel it. Steer away from this app, shame I cannot use 0 stars. | I been charged $39 for a full year and I can not even open the app I would be nice to have my money refunded .
You can now make your own conclusions about this app | I love this app. It gives me confidence to travel knowing that I can chart my trip and charge at the right intervals to get to where I am going. I have never found myself stranded. I love it! | This seems like a work in progress app. It may have some great potential but it’s not user friendly right now. I need to call the 1888 number on the charger to get it working. I could not figure out how to use this app. | You can use its features for free in applications like Chargepoint, Bluedot, and PlugShare. | Seems to favor electrify america. It won’t allow you to override their suggestions for better options you found on your own. Would be nice to adjust the scenario based on own findings. Maybe these apps get kickbacks sending you to more expensive networks rather than free charging provide by some municipalities for example. | The interface is nice but the routing algorithm doesn’t seem to work very well | App always crashes whenever planning a trip to see optimal charge stops along the way. This app has great potential if they can fix the stability. | App keeps crashing with in the middle of trying to generate my route. | I like the idea the problem with the app is truthfully this app shouldn’t have been release yet with all these bugs first time downloading the app reading what the app has to offer it sound interesting thinking to my self this app is something I definitely would need since I drive a short range ev n would need to app to plan routes for long distance should I ever need to but the first time trying to plan a route trying to see how the app function to find that at 22% the app crashed I reopened the app and tired again I was hopeful to see it reach 26% before it crashed again now imagine someone not testing the app just assuming it works 100% of the time to put themselves in that position where the app would have to work or then could be stranded | Unable to even start the app, just goes to a dark screen and stays there. Using an iPhone 13 Pro Max on iOS 15.5 (19F77). | Very difficult to use. Not intuitive and no instructions. Not worth the cost. | I drive a 2012 Chevy volt and from what I can tell it looks like this app dose not support my car. Since it’s a hybrid I understand that’s it’s not your normal EV, but having support for the Volt and other hybrids would be great to have! App looks promising, just could use a few more cars. | ZionA | Let’s be honest here - the routing is a joke. Bakersfield to Costa Mesa, CA. This app suggests that I drive passed Superchargers along the usual route and go all the way to San Gabriel to charge. LOL. I feel sorry for anyone that is relying on this app. 😞 | It crashed on me after leaving the review of the station.
Map is very slow and doesn't update itself. Those huge icons on the map cover too much area and hard to see them because some are transparent. Pictures of stations are faked and confusing. | This is my go to app for finding places to plug in my Nissan leaf. I rarely found outdated information | Just used for a cross country road trip. The route planning was quick and easy and it was great to easily check what was nearby each charger so I could make the most of each stop. | Used my car’s data. Love that feature. Makes the calculations more accurate | Every time I open the app and tap on a charging station near me it just closes and it’s at a 100% rate. Would like to see fixed otherwise I’d rather find a different app. | Great app! | Excellent app filling a gap that automakers haven’t addressed. A terrific aid to route planning and great ease of mind.

title: Wa­nder
description:
Find your happy place™. Book a Wander with inspiring views, hotel-grade amenities, modern workstations, top-tier cleaning and 24/7 concierge service. It’s a vacation home, but better.


Wander is different because we operate 100% of the homes on our platform – combining the quality of a luxury hotel with the comfort of a private vacation home. Whether you’re embarking on a family vacation, planning a getaway with friends, yearning for a workcation, or organizing a company offsite, there is a Wander for every occasion. 

Your best trip ever is just a few taps away. Download the Wander app for these guarantees – always:

100% Wander operated
We’ll never pass you off to a stranger. All of the properties on our platform are operated by us and managed to the highest standards to create an experience guests love.

Hand-picked quality
We’ll never not look like the pictures. We select homes in the most beautiful places and pour our hearts into making them magical so you can leave your stress at the door.

Hotel-grade amenities
We’ll never leave you with nothing to do. From workstations with super fast WiFi to fitness centers, pools, and saunas, every Wander comes with state-of-the-art amenities.

Smart home experience
We’ll never let you feel disconnected. From opening the door to adjusting the lights to turning on the fireplace, total home control is at your fingertips through the Wander app.

Top-tier cleaning
We’ll never leave you with a dirty house or a to-do list. Our cleaning teams are meticulous about quality and we won’t give you a list of chores when you check out.

Transparent pricing
We’ll never surprise you with hidden fees. With Wander, we believe in transparency – so you will see costs broken out and know exactly what you’re paying for. 

24/7 Wander Concierge
We’ll never leave you on read. Our text-based concierge is always available to make your trip special – from activity recommendations to restaurant reservations and more.

Let’s go places together!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements.
reviews:
Love the wander app. Great app, very easy to use and great properties! Customer service and concierge respond extremely fast and aim to please | Hands down the best of the best, cream of the crop! Wander has by far exceeded everything you could Imagine! The attention to details, customer service and properties are nothing short of exceptional!! They’ve thought of everything! If there is a Wander property available where I am traveling, I will ONLY use them!! Do hesitate for one second to book your stay at a Wander property! | Stayed at Wander Anchor Bay. Experienced the most amazing coastal views I had ever seen in my life with beautiful sunsets every evening. Even though we didn’t have to we decided to visit Cooks Beach, Pebble Beach and Gualala Point Regional Park which had an incredible coastal trail perfect for an easy hike with awesome views. | Finally we booked a mini getaway and I’m super excited. Wanders properties are absolutely stunning with that being said our trip isn’t until June so I will definitely write a follow up but as of now my experience has been awesome, the Wander team concierge are incredible. They are so helpful. Everyone has been so patient with all my questions . sending me links to grocery grocery stores, sending me links to private chefs, sending me links to the restaurants in the area. So far it’s 5 star experience.. thank you team wander … can’t wait for our getaway .. stay tuned.  Catrina | This is truly a fabulous house, and in the most sensational location. We spent four blissful nights here, enjoying the stunning scenery through the floor-to-ceiling windows, and all the open-plan delights of a truly gorgeous house. Recently built, out of very high quality materials, awesome heating/cooling system, fabulous fireplace, ultra-comfortable beds, limitless towels etc. The outside spaces are equally well thought out, and we absolutely loved the (stainless steel - why aren’t they all made this way?) hot tub, from where we could look over the mountains and forests while sipping a glass of wine. It is very secluded, and private, but not isolated. It is on a privately owned hillside of what must be several hundred acres and 1500’ of elevation gain from bottom to top, and the other homes are also large and immaculate. All beautifully cared for. And accessible only through a secure gate at the entrance to the domaine. The Wander team were fantastic and helpful and made our stay so stress-free. I would not hesitate to recommend this place - and them. And we will most definitely be back here, and are already looking at our next Wander booking! | He stayed at this house recently and the house is spectacular. The pictures accurately describe what it looks like. It has an incredible outdoor space with large, heated pool, outdoor kitchen, and dining area. Our only issue was that when we arrived it was not clean. Fortunately, we complained to Wander and they had someone come over the next day and clean the house and gave us a one night credit, which is indicative of good customer service. There is a little difficulty in getting in touch with a live person, as everything is at based, but I will certainly give them another shot as the home was beautiful and their response to our issue was timely and adequately compensated us for having a less clean house.  the only other suggestion I would make is to have linen napkins and champagne glasses at your homes as a lot of people use these things when staying at an upscale property | What an absolutely stunning home with luxurious amenities and million dollar views of the mountains The home has absolute privacy and seclusion It was spotless when we arrived The wander team is amazing and checked in on us daily We went skiing at Telluride mountain with the ski lift only a mile drive into town and spent our evenings in the hot tub Spent a fair bit of time dining and shopping in Telluride which was amazing | My wife and I decided to try Wander this year for our annual anniversary trip. It was amazing!! The house in Cape Charles, VA was everything advertised and more! It was so nice and comfortable. Or house manager, Roz went above and beyond to make it extra special by having flowers in the house prior to our arrival! Thank you, Roz! Wander is a new take on the house rental experience. My wife said it was like one of the other guys with a concierge’s service. We recommend Wander whole heartedly! | Booked one of their homes for my dad’s recent 70th birthday and it was perfect. Takes all of the pain that Airbnb has (cleaning tasks, inconsistent quality, argumentative hosts) out of the picture | The Wander experience from start to finish is amazing. It’s one thing to have amazing properties scattered around so if the most beautiful places in the US but then to have a single app to manage your reservation and all the functions of the home, the Tesla and more, is the future! Its simply amazing and our goal is to stay at every single Wander property and we can’t wait! 🥰 | Wander “gets it”! What everyone wants and needs in a vacation home! Luxury but comfort, beauty but convenient and openness but privacy! We found it all in this Big Sur Coast house! Actually when I found Wander on-line, booking with them ANYWHERE was my mission, the city/state was secondary. My traveling group of two other couples agreed— let’s go to a WANDER property, just pick one! Can’t wait for our next Wander gathering, wherever it is! | We stayed at the Yosemite property- mind blowing house integrated into a stream. Amenities were perfect: desks, gym, Tesla. The Wander team responded with over the top enthusiasm to iron out my small nits. 13/10, already planning my next excuse to travel to one of their properties! | We stayed at Wander Big Sur (San Simeon) recently and will definitely be going back. The views of the Pacific are unbeatable—imagine hearing the crashing waves and seeing an endless ocean view as you cook dinner, eat dinner, lounge before a fire (either indoors or on the deck), relax in the hot tub, or as you rollover in bed first thing in the morning. It was the perfect reset for our family (3 kids under 14 and a dog) going into 2024 with ample space for solitude but also plenty of opportunity to huddle together (theatre, poker). Kudos to the concierge for quick responses to all our questions. | I recently celebrated my birthday at Wander Anchor Cove and it exceeded all my expectations. The house layout was perfect for families, with top-notch amenities that kept the kids entertained throughout our stay. The views from the property were breathtaking, adding a special touch to our celebration. Truly an amazing place for memorable occasions | My family stayed at the St. George Island property and everything was fabulous! We did have one issue on the property but Wander was on top of the issue immediately to make things right! I would book with Wander again and again. | Amazing quality hospitality concept! Was in few houses and both incredible! Prices are high but reasonable. | I recently had the pleasure of staying at a Wander Yosemite Falls, and it was nothing short of amazing. The house we stayed in was massive, modern, and beautifully clean, exceeding all our expectations.

What truly stood out was the exceptional response time to our questions. Wander's team was available around the clock, making us feel valued and cared for throughout our trip.

Wander's unique model of owning and maintaining their properties ensures top-notch quality. Despite the grandeur of the house, the price was surprisingly affordable. We couldn't believe the incredible value we received for our stay.

If you're seeking a luxurious and magical vacation, Wander is the perfect choice. Our experience was a dream come true, and we can't wait to book with them again. Five stars all the way! | Wander Bandon Beach is an incredible home. The best we have ever vacationed in. Just a couple of short months after our visit, we are going back for a month, with a short stay in the Wander Orford Cliffs home. The views were incredible, the house was warm and cozy, and it was just an amazing experience. We could not wait to book it again. | I really enjoyed staying at the Lake Tahoe Wander. It was packed with amenities, well equipped and taken care of. Also the tesla with the snow tires came in handy. Can’t wait to go and try another one. | Stayed at Wander Anchor Bay to do a week of remote working. The property was absolutely stunning - Wander has an amazing curated collection of locations where you can settle in. 

Wander is a WFH dream, where your stay is accompanied with beefy desk setups and fast wifi, while also providing you with concierge service via the App. The complimentary Tesla was also an awesome offering. 

Even if not working, I’d still use Wander to book my next vaccation. It’s a preferred alternative to AirBnB for when you’re looking for a more upscale experience at interesting, unique, and beautiful properties. | Fantastic property.  We loved every minute of our stay.  The house and yard were incredible.  The instructions were on point and the welcoming music as we walked in the front door was a very nice touch. | Wander has executed their mission flawlessly. We booked the Joshua Tree house for a joint birthday party and it was by far the best travel experience we’ve ever had as a group. From the moment we arrived, everything was seamless, intuitive, and anything we could have possibly needed was there. 

We were welcomed with calming music playing through out the house, AC blasting, a lovely handwritten note and flowers, delicious, healthy snacks, tons of drinks, special medicinal teas, and a beautiful Nespresso machine with endless espresso pods to choose from. Every room had a gorgeous bathroom filled with top of the line body and hair care and anything you might need during your stay (wooden combs, the famous Dyson hairdryer, razors, loofas, sewing kits, etc). I could list out an infinite amount of gorgeous, thoughtful details of this house but it would take all day. We literally didn’t want to leave the property because there was so much to enjoy!

With other rental companies, you feel like you’re being watched or have a list of chores while you’re there, “do’s and don’ts” of the house, the WiFi doesn’t work or the hot tub won’t turn on - none of that was the case with Wander. The BEST part of it all was knowing when check out arrived, we didn’t have a list of chores or responsibilities. THIS is what vacation looks like. Simply put: we absolutely loved every second of our stay and are already planning our next Wander trip - hoping to book every location.

Thank you for everything Wander, you’ve perfected what it means to be a fantastic host! | Had a family reunion of 18 people in early June 2023 and stayed at Wander’s beautiful Surfside Beach property in South Carolina.  The house was amazing, second only to the outstanding customer service Wander provided.  What made it amazing was the combination of multiple living areas—particularly the outside decks—incredibly versatile and comfortable kitchen, smart-home technology (loved the Sonos system!) and the private pool and private walkway right onto the beach.  The location is also first-rate:  easy walkability to several good restaurants and bars in Surfside (or use the provided six-person golf cart).  My family members really liked the house and location and would welcome a return visit anytime.  Based on our terrific experience at Surfside, we are also looking at other Wander properties for potential trips.  Thanks, Wander! | We recently stayed at the Wander property in St George Island, FL and could not have enjoyed it any more.  The smart home was easy to navigate and the house came fully equipped with all of our kitchen needs.  The golf cart access helped with small errands to the stores on the island and the Tesla helped with trips to apalachicola for shopping and dining out. The house was located right on the beach, which allowed my elderly mother to be able to sit on the deck outside and watch her kids and grandkids play on the beach and in the pool.   The only complaint I would have is there is no access for handicap people. There are 20 steep stairs to climb to enter the property but other than that, the house is great.  The beds were comfortable and the linens were super soft.  We plan on rebooking this house again for next year!  Thanks Wander! 
Claire McK from Nashville, TN | Second time at Wander Palomar Mountain, and it was still breathtaking. 

The space is the most amazing place I’ve ever stayed at, impeccably clean and beautiful designed. Staying above the clouds, you’ll feel like you’re waking up in heaven every morning. 

The app was very helpful and useful, providing thorough instruction and giving you the ability to control the lights, blinds, temp, and music. 

Wish I could celebrate every special occasion at a Wander! | We love the Yucca Valley/ Joshua Tree area and heard about Wander.com through our Financial Advisor. Loved the concept, location and availability. The price was appropriate for the size of the property. However, as prior owners of a vacation rental I’m a stickler to details. The initial impression of a steep driveway with what appeared to be rain washout making it a difficult climb. Fortunately we had a large SUV but smaller low vehicles couldn’t make it up without scraping the bottom of their vehicles. Not a great first impression. The instructions were very helpful and entry went smoothly. The house layout was very comfortable. The decor easy on the eyes. I used one work station without problems. The gym/sauna (in the garage) left something to be desired. It seemed like a last minute change. The garage door code to the gym didn’t work (a small detail). Several lightbulbs were burnt out (another detail) The large exterior doors were a bit sticky and took some alignment to close properly. Alas, the main door lock looked so out of style with the theme of the house. We didn’t need to use the Tesla, but had to move it to repair an issue with our vehicle. It had a rather large dent on the passenger side and soon discovered it had a rather significant windshield crack. Probably not safe to drive on the road. The rest of the house was actually very nice. The kitchen very functional and well equipped. The TV’s worked as they should. The exterior lighting and landscaping were lovely. The pool could be warmer for me but clean. I did have to net it twice a day as it was fly and other bug season. No big deal. The spa worked perfectly. Our beagle loved it. Alas, the only annoying thing we’re the 2 lower neighbors who flew political flags that we had to see coming in and leaving. I avoid politics and vacation and I felt these were flown deliberately to annoy visitors as they didn’t like a short term rental next door. C’est la vie! So for me so much are in the small details that indicate the property is maintained carefully. Though, overall our stay was very good. | Imagine a super fancy treehouse with a Nespresso machine, high thread count sheets, a tech set up to please any Silicon Valley explorer (but easy to use even if you aren’t), and you have The Glass House. The show stoppers: forest on one side, dramatic ocean cliff views on the other. Best view ever, and we’ve stayed at some amazing view venues. Better still, an amazing state park is walking distance. The town is - um - closed a LOT so be prepared for that. You basically never want to leave once you arrive anyway so there’s that. Our dog wanted to stay forever 🐶❤️ | The house in Myrtle Beach, SC is beautiful but so many annoyances mainly due to the tech not working properly.  We were having to chat with the concierge the entirety of the stay.  Took us an hour to get the app working properly to actually register that we were staying at the house upon arrival.  That night we discovered we had no hot water, come to find out, the gas tanks were completely empty.   Couldn’t cook on gas stove, grill or have hot water until late the next day.  Elevator- might as well not have one as that was a mechanical nightmare.  Golf cart wouldn’t start even after following directions- apparently there was a hidden switch to turn. Rooms lacked regular supplies- no pillow cases on beds, missing bath mats, towels, body wash.  Most of the tech perks toted in the bedrooms didn’t even work.  Trash bins were filled to the brim and overflowing when we arrived.  We had a great time but definitely lots of oversight by whoever prepared the house.  Needs better onsite management to make sure tech is working properly and everything is stocked appropriately.  For what you’re paying, I didn’t anticipate us having so many issues.  Not sure if I’d do another wander. | We just returned from Wander Ponte Vedra, it was exceptional. Best described as a Vacation in a Box. From start to finish Wander took care of everything. 
No more standing in the Rental Car line like a chump…there is a Tesla waiting for you in the garage. 
Car seat and crib set up at the house and ready to go. 
Beach toys and surf boards. 
8Sleep beds. 
The list goes on and on…

Wander is truly what I’ve been looking for when it comes to vacation rentals. It takes the guess work out of the variability that comes with Airbnb and Vrbo. This is an exceptional home paired with exceptional service and support. 

Will absolutely return to this property. And other Wanders soon. | Stayed at Hudson Valley. Some bugs w the booking/app and shared pricing that I hope get worked out. Need more properties in northeast! MA, ME, CT and VT are waiting | This review covers the booking experience and interaction with the concierge for a planned trip to St. George Island in the fall. 

The in app booking process was very simple and was able to easily split the booking with two other families. The concierge was very helpful with answering our questions since we will also have a couple toddlers and children in the home during the stay. They were also able to help us set up a private chef for dinner and great ideas for activities in the area. 

We’re very excited for the trip and fully expect it to be a wonderful vacation experience! | The SGI property was amazing.  Shelby our property manager went above and beyond.  Absolutely fantastic.  Can’t wait to stay again! | Much promise in the concept. Hope it expands and gets through the growing/startup phase. | The app is awesome! A few broken links within the app but it really works perfectly otherwise. We had such an amazing stay, our only improvement would have been a slightly later check in and later check out!

The house was absolutely stunning and the property was mouth dropping. 5 stars all around! | This is way too overpriced. I get it’s a beach house, but $1,600 a night is too much. | A group of friends and I needed a ski trip escape and we stayed the beautiful new Vail property that is close to Cascade Village. We had a minor hiccup with the fire place not working but we were able to resolve it all in app, which was awesome! The ability to book nice modern properties and have everything available via an app is something I wish all hotels had! | The properties are wonderful but the technology behind the booking is terrible. | We really enjoyed our stay at the Gualala property. The home and property exceeded our expectations and the concierge for check in and questions was really helpful and responsive. 
The amenities including the very well stocked kitchen, high end appliances (dyson hair dryer for example) and the use of the Tesla made the experience feel very exclusive and luxurious. 
The 5 acre ocean front property with ocean views from every room, the fireplaces, the projector television and decor made the stay even better. 
We walked the property and there are so many points along the walkways to stop and enjoy a different view. They even had a giant chess board, hammock, and Adirondack chairs to enjoy. 
Highly recommend! | Had an opportunity to stay at the Tahoe house line up with an amazing storm. 

App worked well for booking and smart home use, concierge team was responsive and communicated clearly. 

Home experience was great, beds were  comfortable, house was in a great location. Sauna was nice but nothing will beat the hot tub during a blizzard! | I absolutely loved my stay at a Wander - the whole experience was incredible and tech-powered. I would definitely go back! | I would like to thank all of the Wander staff from housekeeping to Executives for making my first stay absolutely WONDERFUL! My stay was at the Asheville Meadows, where there description says a country setting but city convenience, and that is 100% true!! The open concept layout with the ability to control everything from my phone was so nice! The 24/7 concierge was so helpful answering whatever question I had, to make my stay a lot more stress free. Lastly, the TESLA! The Tesla just made this trip even more breathtaking. Perfect for cruising through the windy roads and the Blue Ridge Parkway! This is the best vacation rental I have ever stayed in and will DEFINITELY be booking another! I am so honored to be Wander Member and I look forward to the next Wander! | Fine app! Incredible property! Seem less exit/entry and very relaxing. Only comparable experience is a 5 star hotel with a very attentive concierge, this is one to watch | Far exceeded our expectations in terms of the view, architecture, customer support, connected smart home and can’t forget the Tesla that comes with the house. Definitely a quiet, luxurious getaway. Highly recommend. | I was willing to try it. But this app doesn’t even let me sign in with my Apple ID. It just displays the spinning wheel. Waste of time. | I’ve had the pleasure of staying at both the Tahoe house and Anchor Bay house, and both stays far exceeded my expectations!  

The locations, prime time!  Smart house, amazing!  Houses are impeccable, modern, outfitted with amazing work stations and well stocked with everything (and I mean everything) you could possibly need!  I was nervous cooking in the house as in other experiences I needed to pack so many things, but not at a Wander house!  They have absolutely everything to make cooking a breeze!  If you ever find yourself at Wander Anchor Bay and are a golfer, I highly recommend golfing at the sea links course, Sea Ranch! It was amazing, we golfed 2 days straight (would have been 3 if we went earlier in the trip!).  This course is also listed on the “things to do” wander sends to you before your trip.  I cannot say enough wonderful things about my stays, with Anchor Bay being my absolute favorite so far!  I walked in to music playing and a jaw-dropping sunset from every window in the house, what more can you ask for!  

If I could go to a wander house every weekend, I’d be there!  Amazing company, impeccable team and concierge, I can’t wait to stay at another Wander house soon! | Had an incredible stay at Orford Cliffs with a seamless booking through the app! the concierge was extremely helpful and made getting into the house and the Tesla easier than I could have ever expected | My friends and I absolutely loved Wander Hudson valley. It was a dream come true to live in such a place even if it was for a little while. Everything was top notch and the concierge was always on point. Cant wait to go to the next Wander adventure!! | We had the stay of a lifetime at their Asheville location. Amazing views and the perfect modernized home made for an incredibly relaxing vacation on the hillside. | They have like 7 properties to choose from all over the states. What’s worse is the pricing does not show up until you are about 10 clicks into the booking process and in my case the page kept spinning and I never saw the final prices due to some bugs in the app 

Beautiful properties , insufficient inventory and buggy app | My company hosted a team retreat at Wander Bandon Dunes and the experience was incredible! The design of the house and views of the ocean are absolutely breathtakingly. We even had a private chef on site cooking all of our meals, the whole experience was absolutely magical!

title: FlightHub - Find Cheap Flights
description:
Travel confidently when you plan, book, and manage your plans with FlightHub. We take the hassle out of trip management by bringing you the best deals on flights, hotels, and car rentals. With all-in-one pricing, no hidden fees, and no extra charges, you can plan and book seamlessly knowing you’re paying the best price with no surprise fees. Discover Canada's fastest growing online travel company when you download the FlightHub app today!
‌
Find cheap flights, hotels, and car rental deals – all in one. FlightHub compares flight itineraries from over 400 airlines, instantly giving you the best deals to dream destinations worldwide. Arrive at your destination without worrying about your accommodation with over 900,00 hotels, condos, and apartments for you to choose from. Need to get around? Choose a car rental location in over 170 countries from some of the top companies including Avis, Enterprise, and Hertz.

Control your trip directly in FlightHub for worry-free itinerary management. Make changes to your booking, add travel insurance, download invoices, or simply gain more information – it’s all possible. With FlightHub you can plan, book, and travel with 24/7 customer support for all your needs before, during, and after your trip.

Book your next vacation confidently with the help of FlightHub. Get the best of flight, hotel, and car rental reservations when you download now.

FlightHub Features

Cheap Flights in a Just a Few Taps
- Discover deals from top airlines for your domestic and international travel
- We negotiate with the most popular carriers so you can save on your next vacation
- Travel the world knowing you’re getting the most bang for your buck when booking on FlightHub

Hotels & Car Rentals Made Easy
- Find the right accommodation with over 900,000 options worldwide
- Hotel, apartment, or something in between – FlightHub has you covered
- Find countless options and deals on cars for your next destination
- Get around like a local at over 170 destinations

Manage Your Trip
- FlightHub lets you view all the details of your itinerary – from flight information to hotel info and car reservations
- Change your booking, add to your trip, and keep up to date with schedule changes and alerts
- Get customer support when needed most with 24/7 availability

Download FlightHub today for the ultimate all-in-one platform for searching, booking, and managing your next dream vacation.

Privacy Policy: https://www.flighthub.com/privacy-policy-ca-en
releaseNotes: We've made some exciting changes to our app in order to make your experience as smooth as possible. The latest update includes some minor bug fixes.
reviews:
I set up a particular flight to track. I want a notice when the price drops. I also want economy, but not basic economy. It tells me three times a day that it’s time to book, but the price is steady, not dropped. And will not give me the different economy options, only the restricted one where I can’t pick seats in advance. It offers me to filter but the filter doesn’t take. I had to stop notifications-this app is not helpful in any way. | I love this app it’s very easy and convenient to book. | I really like how you can get on and search very fast and the results are amazing. Keep up the good work , this my first time catching a plane and this was the first site that won’t confusing honestly very honestly | FlightHub was more than $100 cheaper than the airline. Thank you. | Not sure what’s going on but the app do not work for me anymore, no matter what date I search for a flight nothing happens And there is no where to get support for the app | Horrible experience with this company. I always buy tickets with edreams and never had any issue. This time I wanted to try flighthub because of all the good reviews. This app gave me an option to transfer from Canada, which apparently needs a transit visa, without any warning. I found out by luck one day before my flight and had to pay twice as much as my original ticket to change the flight. Checked three other websites and no other website shows you flight options where you need visa for transit. How is the customer supposed to know this??? Unbelievable. | Service is horrible. They never get back to you | Best prices, ease to navigate | best prices | I want my refund | Easy peasy!;)! | My flight was canceled by the airline, and flight hub only gave me back money for the flight there. I honestly feel like I got scammed. Never using again. | I downloaded over than 15 apps to do my books and this is the application fastest and easiest ion all of them, thank you FlightHub | First time I’m flying with this airline I loved the price as I’m in need of a good price m | 10 | I booked a flight from San Francisco to Manila and my connecting flight was cancelled. I never received an email from the airline or Flighthub about the cancellation, so I didn’t learn about it until the day before my flight. I had no choice but to pay their $35 fee to refund my ticket and it’ll take 12-18 weeks to process it. Never using Flighthub again and I suggest you don’t either. 👎 | I bought a ticket in this company in December 2019, due to the pandemic my mother could not travel in April 2020, FligthHub said that he would return the money in a voucher twice and 5 months have passed and I have not received anything!  I bought the ticket with the Kayak app, I spoke with FligthHub on three occasions telling me that there was no problem and they would give me the voucher, liars!  they never gave me anything!  I do not understand how companies like kayaking can have you!  I am completely disappointed! | I wish there was an 800 number to give more details about the insurance or a brief description that is more detailed without having to click here and there to find it | Awesome | Booking was painless! | I booked a flight for a friend. Within 15 minutes dates changed but I could not modify my dates. I booked a 2nd flight figuring it was within 24 hours I’d just cancel the first. Yeah...no. The site would not let me cancel. I spend 30 minutes on hold to be told I had to call flight hub. Why the hell is just flys number on flight hubs site. I call flight hub to get the exact same menu option and stale hold music but for a hour this time. $75 to cancel. I have to pay this before getting credited. Cannot take it out of my credit. No thanks. Never again. Enjoy the $75 it’ll be the last. | I have a health condition that requires I sit in the front of the plane with extra room - so I have to purchase first class, but I want to find the least expensive option. I tried to search for a first class ticket REPEATEDLY! which IS an option they SUPPOSEDLY offer! But EVERY single search result was filled with economy flights. So, it was impossible to find the least expensive first class ticket. Then when I tried to “filter” the results I found there wasn’t an option to filter for first class ONLY to list it at the beginning of the search - which OBVIOUSLY does NO good! 

The search function in this app is worthless! Save yourself time and choose one of the MANY other travel app options! | Would give zero Stars if I could. I entered my dates and made the reservation. It was no cheaper than other sites. I double-checked and confirmed the reservation. Got my itinerary and they had me leaving a day late. Mistake on their end, they still charged me cancellation fee of $75. Never using this service again. | I have an account, I have an itinerary. What I don’t have is access to my account to through the app. The login screen flashes a lot and I cannot login. | Cheapest compared to others. Thank you FlightHub! | I’m 40 and scared! Lol 
So far so good! The booking was extremely simple. This is the cheapest out there I’ve looked at. Let’s hope the rest my experience is the same. Please don’t make me the next character in Alanis Morissette! 😳 | I have consistently found them to be cheaper than other sites!  They encourage me to travel more often! | Flight Hub App FAST AND EASY to USE!!! Exceptional prices!!! Thank you!!! | DO NOT USE THIS APP!  REVIEWS ARE FAKE!  They stole my Money and tried to tell me I couldn’t book a flight. Took the money out of my account and the tried to charge my account an additional 4 times for an even higher amount than what my flight was worth.  This is more like a criminal enterprise than a booking service. DO NOT USE FLIGHTHUB! | Gave me options to find the cheapest and even fastest flights to my destination by the date and how much it would be if I extended my dates, and booking was simple too... 👍🏾 | Saved me $100 | Fast and easy | I love to book flights here | Best App I have ever used to book flight tickets.
So easy to use! I really like it! | I hate shopping around for the best price, but I hate paying more than I have to even more. Flight hub made finding the best price so easy and quickly too! If my actual travel experience goes as well as booking the flight, I not only will be thrilled, but I will be a convert for life! | This has been my BEST experience ever ordering a plane ticket. One less thing to worry about. | I’m from nyc and every 3 weeks I always book a flight here to visit my girlfriend in Toronto & it’s so easy! Just select the flights I want ahead of time and there’s no problem! | I just booked the same exact flight on AA - cancelled it and saved $50 on this app! ❤️❤️ | This is my first time using this app I love it fast and essay | Fast and easy. Who could ask more? | They don’t speak much English. they aren’t clear on what your needs are so they just claim they they understand you. They were supposed to reserve my seat, meal and baggage check. They didn’t and I got charged for it. The airline had to give me a full refund BUT flighthub used their own credit card to pay for my reservation. Now flighthub gets the refund and I dont! OMG! IM STILL going through red tape to get my fee back! DONT TRUST THIS APP! | If you book the wrong date and you call right away they will make sure to confirm the flight while they put in hold to make sure that they can charge you cancelation fee. Technology is aware of time FlightHub, it will confirm the seconds that I called and the seconds that you put me in hold to take the time to make sure that the flight was confirmed. I know you did it because I have the confirmation when you clicked it.  You are bad people! | Took some looking into but I think we got the best deal on the Internet. Fingers crossed! | Easy to use plenty of flight options and price is as says | Was stranded for the holidays until I found this app | I’m a avid traveler so I’m always seeking the best deals! This is my new go to app! Some of the best deals on the planet are right here! Thank you Flighf hub 

QD x | You have to stay on hold for long periods to deal with any questions.  Changes to the itinerary weren’t even sent and I only found out about them when I called to confirm times of flights. Last minute flight change notifications were cryptic and you couldn’t even tell what had changed. Would never book with them again!!!!! | FlightHub gets you the best flights! | The price shown says taxes and fees included when you do a search but when you go check out it will show a completely different price. I just tried to book a ticket advertised at $998 but when I went to checkout the price per passenger was $1348. I called customer care to ask and they told me they don’t even have that deal in their system. I thought I was getting a deal but back to the drawing board. So frustrating! | Flighthub has become my go to flight station for all flights within and outside USA. Their prices are affordable and my experience has remained splendid thus far!

title: RV Parky - Parks & Campgrounds
description:
Trip Planner + Find over 30,000 listings of RV parks, campgrounds, rest areas, Walmarts, Camping Worlds, Cabella's, Cracker Barrels, and Truck Stops in USA, Canada, and Mexico.  

RV Parky is an RV Park directory built by a full time RVer to help fellow RVers on the road.  

Get information, view pictures, and get directions to where you are headed to next.

https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
https://www.rvparky.com/terms_of_service
releaseNotes: Fixed bug that prevented adding notes to trip stops
reviews:
This is my fav app. The only complaint is prices are 1-2 years old and some websites are not functioning or else misleading. Now that they upgraded it’s not my fav. I click on an crackle barrel icon blurry pop and I can’t click to open! | This is the best app I have located for putting in a long distance and having the software put in stops for you. I’m planning a long trip from Texas to Alaska and I want to average 400 miles a day. The app is good for that, however, if you inadvertently put a stop in the wrong order, the only way I’ve been able to figure out how to move it is to log into the app via a browser.  In my quest for trying to figure out how to fix that  problem, I’ve discovered that there is absolutely zero support for this product. They offer no help options and when you want to manage your subscription, you’re taken to an Apple page. So it has some good features. I can’t give it more than a three because of these other problems. | This began as a great app. I even bought into the annual $19.99 plan. My bank account was debited in August 2023 and now we are ready to go on our trips that we had logged into this app and everything is gone. Three years of travel, notes, places, and all my account information is gone. They took their money, but have not resolved this issue. They have zero contact information. If you’re going to pay for a travel app, pick a different one. | My friend is planning a westward trip this summer. Your app is great for one person planning. I have found that the only place I can open this trip is from his emails to me. I cannot save this in my own app. This is very inconvenient for me. We both have the pro version. | We travel six to seven months a year and average five days at any location. We make our summer plans in February for those months of travel. My concern is that I do not see yearly updates on prices per night. We try to stay within a budget so price is most important. I promise I will do a better job of reviews this year! We sure do get in some substandard locations! Thanks! 😎 | This used to be a useful free app for logging trips and calculating fuel expenses.  It still serves those purposes but now you pay a premium for it.  The app is a little antiquated to be charging so buyer be warned | I use RVParky on my Mac Air and iphone so it is all around easy.  Using the phone while traveling and yet the larger Mac screen for planning.  I love the storage feature to go back and look at old trips as well and the ease of exploring new trips. | I have been FT since 2019 and Love this app. Great value for the price. For something that works this great and ease of use it is worth it to me. | I love this app so much!! I’ve referred it to many friends and family!! I’m wondering why now I have to have a paid account to save my locations. In the past I’ve easily done this and didn’t have to pay. Now disappointed. | Love the app use it a lot.  Ever since the last update on iOS my app stopped working.  Deleted and tried reinstalling still no luck.  Where do I find help?? | Used to be a great app. Now there’s a forced upgrade to the “pro” version to make more than a 3 stop trip plan. App just became useless unless you buy the PRO version. | I always use this great app to find suitable places to stop. | I’m loving the new updates… fixed some of those things I found irritating such as not being able to lock dates down. Also, loved the split distance function!. Can we print hard copy yet? | I have used this app for the last three years. It was basic at first but they have added great features to the product. We find it very easy to use. You can print your itinerary or send it on to family and friends. As you’re planning your trip and have specific dates to hit locations you can lock them in. The app then tells you how many days you have to meet that date. We used this app for our 7 month travel. Just love it. Thank you for all the new features! | When I upgraded and paid for the yearly subscription it gave me a whole new identifier and now I have no way to continue on a previous trip I had already started. There should be a way to merge accounts. | After being introduced to this app a few years ago, I have used it for multiple day trips without the RV, family camping trips and I’m currently on my 3rd cross country road trip and using this app constantly!!

As if the sheer usefulness wasn’t enough, they have great customer service!! On this trip I was having trouble reading road names on the map. (The eyes are aging lol). Zooming in made the image bigger but not the words. I submitted feedback within the app expecting no response but hoping it would get to developers and they’d consider it. In less than 1.5 hours Lenny emailed me about it! After me sending screen shots to clarify the issue, he send a link with directions to address it. The issue was with Apple Maps, not this app, but he still made sure to help me!

Helpful on shorter trips, RVParky really shines on longer road trips!  Especially when driving out west, where exits can be few and far between, it’s important to know not only where service is available, but also if that service is accessible to a large vehicle!!! We sometimes stop an hour earlier than we “have” to, simply because with this app we can see that the gas station “just a few more miles down the road” does not have an rv friendly layout. 

Plus, there are so many variables when you’re on a long road trip. Things like picking up a nail in your tire that has to be repaired or interstate being closed due to bad wreck so you have to detour and lose several hours of your planned drive time. It’s easy to determine a new destination for the night. Beautiful fall weather? Search places that you can park for free and boondock, then hit the road early in the morning to make up for lost time.  Been driving through the Mohave in July? Find a park with full hookups for shower and AC where you can wake up to a beautiful view of Lake Mead. 

At home, I use it to help scout campgrounds for our family trips or find a good gas station with access appropriate for the RV while on said trips. 

For Day trips, I can find multiples options for a gas stop based on distance, rest stops for potty breaks, etc. 

Whether it’s planning ahead by months, or by hours, this app has been amazing to help us find what we need, when and where we need it!!! | Loved this app, however no longer works with my iPhone. I have uninstalled and installed no luck! It comes up but cannot tap and open any campground. Have to look at other apps🥲 | I don’t know what happened but a very nice app is now totally crap and no one is there in magical computer land to help or fix. At this point i would recommend NOT USING RV PARKY until they figure out customer service and support when they totally screw up a very nice app | This review is posted 06-24-2023.

This WAS the greatest travel app of all time. I recommended it to everyone I met for travel planning. Earlier this year the developers started charging $20 for an annual subscription (no annoying ads, which the app never had before). I gladly paid as the app was worth the price. 

BOY, HAVE THINGS CHANGED! The app is now very unresponsive when trying to add overnight stays or plot stops along a route. Sites are visible on the map, but one cannot add them to a route. This is not a filter setting, it is a flaw in the newly updated app. Very disappointed. | I’ve used this app 3yrs but recently ads have appeared, which I understand and have tolerated as that is great way for developer to earn $$. However, now developer locked app features and warned (with big red ugly banner located at top of each trip) that app will not work for more than 3 stops in addition to ads for non-payers. WTH. I would gladly pay a one time fee to eliminate ads like other apps offer, but it’s irritating developer is severely locking down the app, therefore forcing people to upgrade if more than 3 stops are needed. What a hassle to limit to 3 stops on trip! That might work for weekend warriors but probably not for longer trips. In addition, there is NO way to save trips and notes as PDF. The only option is to log into website (not app) and PRINT to a printer. How many RVers travel with a printer? AND you may only pay the fee on the website, not through the app via Apple. That is so developer can avoid the fee Apple charges for in app subscriptions. Really disappointing. | They have made a change of trips with more than three stops. Have to be with a paid membership. I already had a long trip set up. When I went to modify that trip, it said I had to pay, but I couldn’t figure out how to pay. Extremely frustrated. | I like the app but most prices are outdated so it’s hard to make a decision when choosing affordable campgrounds. Otherwise nice app. Would be nicer if they added disperse and boondocks | Have used this app for years and love it!  Recently, it was locked down to 5 stops and now it’s locked down to 3 stops for non-members.  Ads have increased too. Checked the app for membership and costs and nothing to be found. This was a 5 star app and now a one star app.  Please reconsider this change!!! 3-5 stops is ridiculous for an RV’er. | I have been an RV Parky use her for a couple of years as I travel in an RV a lot. I have recommended RV parky to many people. Recently, my parky limits me to three stops and tells me I need to update my subscription to a paid account. I have no problem doing this however, there is no option on my account that allows me to update and pay, any suggestions on how to do this? | Please fix it so you can get in to the “review” section to leave a review even if the “name” of the location is extra long.   On places with a long name, you can’t scroll down enough to type or copy and paste into the review area.   Please fix!!   I try to leave reviews for every place but I’m hindered by this issue.  I’ve tried looking for an email address to send a screen print of the issue. | I have searched everywhere on how to pay for a membership. Nothing has it on any site. Can someone send me a link to it please. Thank you | I used to love this app but it appears someone has bought it and added restrictions and a bunch of ads. | I’ve had this app for several years, and it used to be a great app to research and plan RV trips! Recently they added ads (which is fine), but now have switched to locking down the app even further and hiding all the necessary features behind a pay wall.

I’m all for app developers making money through ads or premium subscriptions that grant you BONUS features, not lock down necessary features that are integral to using the app in the first place. 

Locking features like over 5 stops per trip to only be for paid users makes the app pretty much unusable for free (ad supporting) users. | Twice yesterday, app took us to low bridges. Had to unhook and turn around. Parameters are in. Unacceptable. | It was a good app but no more.  I read the reviews before thinking of upgrading. I get adding advertising to support the app infrastructure and develop(s). But now you are tracking all its user data too. Your approach to upgrading this app is callous to the faithfully dedicated users.  With that said goodbye. Apps are like fashion…they come and they go. | This is our “go to” navigation source for planning our trips. Hasn’t failed us yet! The one minor flaw is that it seems to be missing a lot of campgrounds—especially national and state parks—but over time, it seems like this is less and less true as more get added. We really rely on the reviews and links. Makes planning super easy! | I have been using RV Parking for years.  Today, I can’t update a current trip without “upgrading” my membership; code for pay for the app!  There is no mention of this upgrade anywhere when you update or anything!  How about a heads up and some consideration for those who have been recommending RV Parky to friends and RV Parks?  I am so disappointed and will need to consider a new planning app. | I’ve used this app for 3 years to plan RV trips. I was reviewing my upcoming trip and noticed an announcement in red at the top: “ Due to increased costs of running RV parky, trips are limited to 5 stops for non members.Upgrade acct via website. Members will have unlimited trips”. (paraphrased)
This must be new, within the last few weeks??  Curious if I will lose my trip since it’s always been free to use in the past? | RV Parky has been our primary tool on our iPhones and ipad to find overnight stops since what seems like forever. After updating the app last week, we have been inundated with pop up ads. What happened? Never had this before. The apps are now deleted from our phones | Being a full timer in the RV life, this was one of my most used apps. I can count on it for information on nearby, RV parks, Walmart, and other places where RVs can park. Now, since I updated, there are annoying ads that pop up on every campground that I look for information on. I have never, and will never, go running off to a store, and buy some thing that I see on a pop-up ad. They are intrusive and a total waste of money and time. Shame on you RV Parky for sticking these annoying ads in what was one of the best apps in the App Store. | Loved this app, have not used in 4 months. Now when I go into the map I can not tap on a camp ground and have a preview come up??? Have to go into a list and it lists the campgrounds in the area???? Do not like this at all😡 | I have used 5 other RVing apps, and only one compares favorably with RV Parky, and that one requires a yearly subscription. We are traveling with our 25’ travel trailer several months at a time now that we are retired, and RV Parky has been our primary “go to” app to plan and organize our trips. Thank you for an easy to use yet sophisticated RVing app. | What have you gone and done with the app? I can’t even get things to pull up, it’s so unresponsive to my fingers touching on sites and the map in general. It used to work great. I could lightly touch a tiny sign on the map and it would open it even when I couldn’t see the site. Now, even repeatedly over and over touching on a place won’t open, won’t do anything. And the map itself won’t stretch out half the time, pretty much  ignores basically anything my hands do. I’m so disappointed, I use this as I travel all over. I’m on an iPhone. Please try to get your iPhone app system so it works again. :( I’m so grouchy about this. | Lots of great features not offered by my other RV apps. This one is very different. Can often find RV parks not in the other apps. To be able to find places to stay along a predetermined route is a plus. Hope this one doesn't go away! | I seriously love this app. My husband and I are RV travelers, and spent a couple of years traveling through all 50 states and all but the two northern-most Canadian provinces and territories. I plan our trips with this app. I don’t mind adding in sightseeing stops or RV campgrounds I find elsewhere via addresses. 

I do, however, mind that the map is not locked with north at the top of the screen. I use the app in my iPhone and iPad, and it’s frustrating that the slightest touch sends the map spinning. It’s a glitch that irritates me every time I use the app, and with over 45K miles under our tires, I use it all the time! Can this be fixed?  

Also, can National Parks with campgrounds be added? They appear on the map, but are not hyperlinked to add to the list of stops. | Keep going back to RV Trip Wizard because of 2 very annoying misses with this app. 1) Can't search for parks by name. You have to find the city, search for the city and then find the campground in a list or on the map. 2) When creating a trip you cannot lock the dates when planning campsites so if you reserve site for a set of dates the dates keep moving around when you can any other date, change the start date or even add other stops. As much as we recommend this on our channel, @VanTrekkingLifestyle, we just can't recommend it any longer with these key omissions that make planning even harder than just doing it on a calendar.  It's close to being perfect.  Why not add the features even if there's a fee to get them? | This app is an essential tool when traveling. | I traveled 3 months, 10,000 USA miles using this app to plan my stops for sleeping. Walmart and Cracker Barrrels all the way in my 24’ class C. I’d be lost without it. The reviews were invaluable. | The reviews are helpful but trip planning with this is too much. Tap in a field to type and no keyboard appears iPhone 11 | Many of the reviews on the app are at least a year old. I’ve been able to submit two reviews but I can’t submit any more on my iPhone. I have been able to submit on my computer but that isn’t convenient. It would be great if this was fixed and the reviews were more convenient.
Otherwise, the app has been very easy to use and helpful in planning our route. | Started rving in 2018 and downloaded this app from a recommendation. It was good for us  new comers with no experience. But 4 years later its really old reviews and out of date information it has become untrustworthy. Reviews from 5 years ago do not help. The system is easy to use, that’s why I keep the app, but I would use it more if the old info was deleted. Sounds like a refresh is needed. | This app is very helpful planning trips. Just be aware that this app or any of the other camping apps don’t have all the campground listed. Some of the website links for booking are outdated or broken. While the app works well for the most part, it could use some updating or refreshing. | After the latest update you can’t type in a location in the “add a stop” dialog box on iOS. | Update really messed things up on my phone. It’s like it is zoomed in way to big. Can’t tell anything about the locations | I can’t seem to get this app to show up on my screen. I have to go into the App Store each time and open it from there. I don’t know why this is happening.

title: Rail Ninja: Train Tickets
description:
Meet Rail Ninja - your go-to app for booking train tickets.

Embark on your journey with Rail Ninja, boasting an extensive network of over 25,000 routes spanning across 50+ countries. Gain access to real-time timetables and availability, ensuring you're always on track with your travel plans, no matter which railway you choose.


INTUITIVE INTERFACE
Navigating Rail Ninja is effortless. Enter your date, departure, and destination in the rail planner to access the best travel options instantly. See the whole up-to-date schedule including the train time, classes, and prices at a glance.

CLASS SELECTION MADE SIMPLE
Rail Ninja offers you a visual insight into every class. Dive into detailed information on available trains, including videos and photos, empowering you to pick the ideal class for your trip.

SEAMLESS BOOKING EXPERIENCE
With the Rail Ninja train app, booking your train tickets is a breeze. Choose from a wide array of payment methods – over 20 global and local options. Enjoy the flexibility of straightforward modification policies and rest assured with official tickets from 78+ carriers.

CONVENIENT TRAVEL COMPANION
Your tickets (or railcards) are always within reach, even offline, providing hassle-free access whenever you need them. Plus, experience the peace of mind of 24/7 real human in-trip support, ensuring your journey is smooth and worry-free.

TRUSTED BY MILLIONS OF TRAVELERS
Rail Ninja isn't just a travel app; it's a community of over 2.5 million happy customers worldwide. Join the ranks of satisfied global travelers who've found convenience, reliability, and exceptional service through Rail Ninja.

What’s available in the Rail Ninja app:

- Search for tickets across 25k+ destinations
- Buy tickets directly from your phone
- Convenient payment methods: Apple Pay, Visa/Master Card
- Notifications about ticket status and changes
- Search history for tickets with an easy booking option
- Offline mode tickets are always at hand
- Various currencies, choose the currency you want to pay in
reviews:
Very convenient for travelers. | I was directed to this app from the Korean Railways website, only to find out after my purchase, that the same ticket would have cost me 33% less elsewhere! (50$ instead of 75$) They have a non refundable 15$ service fee, be aware! Take your time before booking and look around on other sites/apps! | Very easy to see different train options and times. | This app was wonderful to easily make my plans for my upcoming trip. The only issue I ran into was the app would not accept my 2 VISA credit cards the first 4 times I tried!  But hang in there….the fifth time was the charm. | A smooth and satisfying experience.  Thank-you. | Service fees are as much as the ticket. | I paid $69 for a train ticket and when I got the ticket it said the cost of the ticket was $28.50! They also put me on a different train than I requested which extended the journey by 2 hours on a route that was much less scenic! I reached out to customer service and they told me “ the price I paid included a markup, and premiums on top of the original ticket price, which includes fees, credit card fees, exchange fees, and ticketing service fees. If I would have bought the ticket through the official app I would have been able to buy 3 tickets for the same price! This company is a total ripoff and I highly recommend people double check all their options before buying tickets! | Used the app on our latest trip to Italy to book trains to and from Rome and Naples. This part worked perfectly but we also booked rail from Rome to FCO airport which has not worked so well. Ninja booked the tickets to the airport but the tickets we download from their APP indicated the that leg of the is not a legal ticket to use on the train and we have to go to a different vendors app to get the actual ticket. The problem is that the Trenitalia app (and their website) does not recognize the ninja ticket code as being in the system. The number ninja provide for Trenitalia is 6 digits and we could not figure out how to call that number for help. I wrote Ninja customer service asking for help and I submitted a customer case, but after 4 days we still had not heard any thing back from Rail Ninja customer support. We ended up going to to the Trenitalia office at the local train station and after about an hour of investigations they agreed we paid for a ticket but could not find it in their system. We now have hand written tickets to go from Rome to FCO airport. But no real guarantee that they work for us on Easter Sunday. A little Customer Service on Rail Ninja would have gone a long way to help make this a relaxing vacation. So I really can’t recommend this app for that reason. It’s easy to use and seems to work, mostly, but if something doesn’t work they don’t easy to stand behind their product. | Good stuff | couldn’t download QR code.  then i found ticket prices on two other travel apps for $65.00. less | Do not use this app!
It is sponsored on google because they upcharge all tickets by 50% and price gouge Americans not familiar with European train systems. 
Go directly to the rail site and book there. 
I saved 50% off my norway tickets by cancelling my railninja ones and booking directly thru the rail site EVEN AFTER INCURRING the ridiculous rail ninja cancellation fees. 
If you try and cancel they only refund 80%. | l decided to use Rail Ninja back on 11/30/23 to use a central ticket purchasing platform for my colleagues and I only to get nothing but headaches!

According to Rail Ninja website they are a premier "the easiest way to book train tickets", which has NOT been the case!
