❤️❤️🎶🎶🎉 | I haven’t gone on my trip yet so that (I hope) should be great. However, this app really doesn’t work very well. Too many dead ends that won’t allow you to go back to the main page. There is no way to edit previously entered information. It’s really too frustrating to use. | It’s nice to have this ap , knowing what you’re doing from day today and your flight schedules it’s so useful! | Good company | We recently retired and have a bucket list of adventures to check off. We looked at Perú, for Machu Picchu, through Exoticca and Ecuador for the Galápagos came up also. Since we were flying all that way for one why not do both. The trip was amazing and flawless on Exottica’s part. Excellent guides, who were passionate about their country, in every area that we visited. Met other travelers who were on the same tour, who had booked previous trips with Exoticca, that gave us information on other places to visit. We would defined book through Exoticca again!

Thank You Exoticca
Dennis and Margaret | We just finished a tour of Brazil, Argentina and Chile.  Enjoyed the stunning beauty of south America including Iguazú fall and Patagonia National Parks.  We enjoyed the flexibility of time of transportation and flexible in site seeing arrangement.  Our flight in to Rio was late and had to stay in Bogota for a day, the airline arranged hotel and ride back to airport with meals covered.  As we have a flexible day im Rio so we were rearranged the city tour for the next day.  We enjoyed the trip very much! | Very nice locations, great food and Rita Chaves was an excellent guide! Very knowledgeable and always went above and beyond. | Overall a great experience!  However a few things I would have changed.  On St Patrick’s Day, a viewing of a parade would have been perfect.  We saw the Cliffs that morning and were supposed to go to into limerick.  We skipped all together.  So disappointed that we missed festivities on one of Irelands most popular days.  Second, In cork I would like the option to go to Blarney for an up charge.  We stayed in Corks city centre for 3 hours and nothing to do.  Those 3 hours could have been viewing Blarney Castle.
Other than that the tour was great!  Tour guide Stephen was personable and our bus driver Jerry was amazing also! | Excellent vacation. Jam packed! But the tour guide John was the best!! Can’t wait to find my next adventure! | They have kept my trip money!!! | We just completed a 10 day trip to Ethiopia, 
It was amazing.   We were a little worried  about safety but it was needless.  The trip was well planned and  great.  Ethiopia touched our hearts and stirred our souls.  The stone churches in Lalibela were awe inspiring and a must see in your life.  The castles in Gondar and the tribes in Omo valley were 
fascinating.  Be prepare for heat in the south. Our tour guide, Chris, was the best guide we have had. His passion and understanding for the country was  great. He made the trip wonderful.  Everything went smoothly and everyone was friendly and accommodating.  We didn’t want to leave!  We did take an extra day and did a city tour of Addis Ababa.  It was also great. Don’t miss this cosmopolitan and interesting city.  Make sure to visit the museum.   Lucy is there!  It was a absolutely fantastic tour and time.  Go to Ethiopia, you won’t regret it! | It was purely amazing and our tour guide Maria was so knowledgeable and flexible. Our driver Pedro was also very incredible. I would certainly use exotica again! | I just completed the 9-10 day Ancient Eternal Cities tour and it was magnificent!
As well as getting to know a wonderful small group of new people who where phenomenal, our tour would not have been as amazing, if it were not for our tour guide - Tabata. 

Tabata managed a large group of 30 different personalities with ease. She makes it look easy but I know it is not. The city of Rome, the Vatican and the Basilica were just stunning!

It was a lifetime experience I will never forget!!
Thank you Tabata!! You are the best!! | I will spend the rest of my life riding bad reviews for this company. They did not warn me that not having a visa to enter Vietnam, was tantamount to canceling the trip. I flew my own way to Chicago only to be nine entry into Vietnam and I had to fly back home. I wasted $5000 of my hard earn money for nothing. I will never forgive them for this as they say it was my fault. I’m sorry I have watched other comments and I’ve seen it. Lots of people have had the same problem, I saw one gentleman that his middle name was spelled wrong, and he was not allowed entry. There was no credit offered no way to get my money back. It was just too bad. This is a terrible company. Do not book a trip with them. | I had to cancel my trip due to a broken hip. When my trip was booked last year I was assured that I would either receive a 100% refund or the amount paid would be held for another planned trip. To my surprise, that is not what is going to happen and Exoticca gets to keep my money. Sorry doesn’t cut it when you work hard to save money to spend in your retirement. I will NEVER book with this company again. It only took over 1 1/2 hours on hold before I could finally speak to someone. Think really hard before you book with this company. Apparently you cannot trust the agents that book your trip because I always pay extra for insurance that didn’t appear on my reservation. My mistake for not double checking. I gave the agent the benefit of the doubt that he was competent. | Estamos encantados con todo , los hoteles, los sitios que visitamos , los guías y la transportación. Exoticca cumplió con todo lo ofrecido, GRACIAS! Volveremos muy pronto a España, nos encanta! | First time using a travel agency type, so did not know what to expect, my coworker who travels a lot was skeptical, but it all worked out, a few things I would have changed, the tour guides were  good but one was not, speaking English, trying to communicate what we were seeing etc…, there was another couple that had a private guide and he spoke English and was very well versed in the culture, we had time by ourselves and with others in the group.We really enjoyed the trip and would use exotica again | Had a wonderful experienced with this company. Everything was well planned, information and direction was super helpful. Tour guide was good but some may need a little more training. Our tour guide was sweet but they tend to rush us. Great experienced overall. Would definitely book again. Until again…kanpai! | We recently did Portugal trip with Exottica, we started our trip with open mind not really knowing what to expect. Exottica team did such an organized trip that they set themselves a class apart from day one. From organized pick up from airport to hotel and the pick ups everyday was outstanding, our tour guide was so well informed- Eduardo santo- he kept the entire trip lively giving us valuable information about the place and engaging us in meaningful conversation and making us feel comfortable the entire trip . Every location we stopped was well thought of and planned. We also had ample time to explore the place on our own. Overall an excellent experience and I would recommend !! | We loved the country, but feel the experience would have better having a tour coordinator with our group of 5. Many things may have been out of control due the busy season , like being able to have someone meet us daily to go over for example the length of the transportation, what to expect and assistance with restaurant choices. Even though we did not speak Spanish, most of the time we did well, but made sure our small group was together | It was our 1st experience through exoticca and this was beyond our expectations. Tour guide Mr. Kadir was excellent. Awesome!!! | I would not recommend this agency to any body.  I used them for Peru trip and it was awful.   Unfortunately I made another trip with them and I can not cancel with them.   I would not recommend any body use them.   Their customer service and the tour was awful. | Vivian Nguyen was tremendous. She was a great communicator. Her contacts for transportation, guides and hotels were second to none.  
She was easy to communicate with. Always patient and caring. 
We look forward to another trip that she would be the travel agent. | This is the worst trip I have ever had!!!! Over 75 bug bites, 90 hours on a bus, 21 hours of actual tour, no air conditioning in hotels, over heating on a tour, incomplete and false descriptions in your brochure and having to pee in bushes!!!!!!  Horrendous road conditions and a bus with a loud buzzing to torture you the hole ride.  I am leaving here totally distraught.  I will be contacting you when I return. | This trip is one of the most memorable. We were the only couple that booked the date Jan 28 2024 for a 10 day trip thru travelzoo.  The hotels exoticca booked for us from Rome, Florence and Venice were comfortable and clean. The drivers assigned to pick us up to our destinations are all professionals and friendly.  Our tour leader Manny was very knowledgeable and attentive to all our needs. We have learned a lot from her.  The tour guides assigned from the colosseum, the Vatican, Florence and Venice are all exceptional. It was such a wonderful and memorable experience we will treasure for life.  For being so happy with the service I already convinced my sister and her husband from Seattle to book the same trip for November. They already confirmed their booking. We have another trip booked with you for Portugal this November as well. We are so excited and we are looking forward  to travel with your agency. Thank you so much for making our travel very memorable and exciting. | Basic city tours provided by Exotica were good overall. However, the guides were not fluent in the English language. Another fact to note was that individuals had to book many extra excursions to fill their day to enjoy each country. The additional excursions were much more expensive bought from Exotic then if you buy them through the tour guide directly. A big drawback for Exotica was that we were on our own the entire time. Their was No welcome meeting, gathering or dinner to introduce us to our guide or give us an introduction to the country. We met other Exotic travelers on different tours and some were in our hotel and others were at different hotels. It would be nice if we traveled as a group and stayed at the same hotel(s) since we did travel on most of the tours together. We spent at least one hour before each tour picking up passengers from other hotels  and in Argentina the bus driver/ guide( Exotica)  would not drop us off back at the hotel where we were picked up but had 3 dedicated drop off stops where people would have to take a taxi back to their hotel. | The trip was wonderful.Exotica your is great ! | Needs more details like flight numbers, detailed hotel information, visa costs etc | Our 10-day tour throughout Morocco was a truly magical adventure.  Our primary guide was like one of the family and other guides in 3 different cities provided great insight into culture and local manufacturing crafts.  The night in tents at edge of the Sahara was an event to climax majesty of the tour. | We had an amazing honeymoon to Peru through Exoticca! Our tour guides, drivers, hotels, etc were amazing and all very helpful.  We would 100 percent book through Exoticca for our next trip! | This is the 1st time I went to a guided tour trip. My experience was mixed.
It all depends on your luck, who is your coordinator, who is the tour guide.
The tour coordinator is very young. I think he is trying to do his best, however his best is far from adequate. We landed at Cario before 5pm, but did not get a room until 9pm. We arrived the hotel after 7pm, may be 7:30pm? We were asked to wait at the lobby. After long wait, I went to take a look. I found the coordinator was talking on the phone with 3 passports in hand. I asked him please work on getting us a room. We had been on the road for more than 30 hours at this point. There were total 3 people in this group, 2 were over 70. I followed the coordinator to go the counter. I would not leave him until I have the room key. The hotel staff started to take information, then he left. I thought he was going to take our key. No, he disappeared for some 20 minutes before returning. So we waited more than a hour to get a room. 
Next morning, we were in a 3 people group to see the pyramids. We did not take the optional tour in the afternoon. The next day the 3 people group went to Alexandria. At this time, the tour guide has developed a good relationship with the one who went to optional tour with him the previous day. They were in deep conversation constantly. I was not sure if the discussion was related to the tour or something else. I did not hear much from the guide, besides the places listed in the itinerary, we did not pass anywhere. I felt I did not see Alexandria besides a few places which are not that interesting comparing to other places I visited later. At this moment, I seriously doubt about the value of such tours.
The following day the 3 people group joined a large group of 21 people. This was the best thing happened to me for this trip. The tour guide Emil was fantastic. He was able to take care all 24 people. He was so knowledgeable. He taught us a lot of more than the description one can find online. As I was a late addition, often I did not know when he said as I told you at Cario. Emil was willing to repeat some to me in details. Emil added a 30 minutes discussion about culture of the Egypt on his own time. He was so passionate about letting us to know Egypt. One solo guest suffered injury during the trip, Emil attended him. I purchased optional tour. He arranged credit card payment. 
I wanted to take part the optional tour with him at Cario. But it was impossible with my coordinator. With my coordinator, everything has to be cash. I had WhatUp text messages with him to ensure I can pay credit card. At Cario, he brought me to a ATM. It was impossible to communicate with him in a normal manner.
For Emil, I gave 6 stars. For the portion with my coordinator, 2 stars, thanks for putting me in that unforgettable 4-day  cruise with Emil, otherwise it would be 1 star. So it averaged to 4 stars. 
At Cario, I walked into the same place where Emil was leading the other group. I could not pull myself back not to get near to listen his talk. I was asked to stay with my guide. I understand. Seeing my new friends in the other group absorbed in Emil’ talk, I knew how much I missed. They had a 20 minutes long talk with Emil. My guide led us walking through the place. 
So, it depends on your luck. | This was my first trip to Egypt with Exotica 12/06-12/14. The guides who picked us up at the airport did not offer to discuss what we saw as we drove to our first Hotel. We had to initiate an open end question in order for them to interact. Reason for 4 stars. Nevertheless, our tour guide Elia was very educated, professional and patient and we enjoyed all his tours. | We were in the dark about most information during our trip- and had to rely on others to be in the right spot at the right time.    We stayed in some crappy hotels.   Will never use your company again. | I just got back from Italy. We went to Rome, Florence and Venice. The hotel in Rome was kind of far from everything and was a three star hotel. The hotel in Florence was also three stars. The hotel in Venice was a four star hotel. It was across from the train station to Venice. They all provided breakfast in the mornings, which was very nice. The trip was organized and we had lots to do. We had different guides who knew much about what they were showing us and it was enjoyable. in Rome we had to take a taxi a lot. It would’ve been nicer if there was a shuttle or a bus to take us places. Altogether, we had so much fun and I would take another trip with the company again. The price was reasonable too. | Great communication throughout the journey. Enjoyed very much. Looking to takeoff to more destinations. | This entire packaged vacation was AMAZING! Maria our tour guide was simply the best! I am more than happy that we chose Exoticca to travel with, they went above our expectations. We will definitely be booking again! | Our guided trip through Portugal was better than we expected. Our guide Eduardo was exceptional, with knowledge beyond our expectations. It was a wonderful experience. Great accommodations, comfortable bus tour, lots to see and do. I highly recommend this trip. Eduardo, thank you for a wonderful guided tour. Excellent. | Fabulous itinerary, country , guide and group! 
I can’t say enough good things about my first Exoticca trip! AO | It’s my first time traveling with exotica ..seriously  you can trust this company ,was amazing trip!thanks exotica | We just returned from the trip from Madrid to Barcelona. Our accommodations and tours were very good. Our guides were knowledgeable and friendly. Octavio was our guide for 4 days, and we enjoyed our time with him. 
My feelings of the trip are mixed. We saw many things we likely would not have found on our own. However, I feel we were over scheduled with not enough time to see things or shop along the way. We were hurried along to stay on time. For example, when we were in Valencia at the biggest market in all of Europe, we were given 20 minutes to shop. There were many more hours spent on the bus than I expected, and meals at truck stop sort of places along the way. Also, considering the many hours on the bus, there was no bathroom facility on the bus. 
While the brochure mentioned we would arrive at a town with time to shop or check out restaurants, it was too late when we got there to see or do anything. 
The value of the trip was very good and well worth what we paid. More free time or opportunities to take a break during a tour would have made the trip more enjoyable. | We had a wonderful time, hotels were good, staff was great, the guides - Andre, was excellent, he joined on 11/9 due to personal reasons but Exxotica arranged two different guides , 11/7 was Matthew and 11/8 we had a Nunu both were great people, knowledgeable, friendly people! 
We learned the Portuguese culture, life style!
Only problem we had with the Portugal airline, they were very strict with their luggage policy, this is a international travel, at least one bag they should give free for check in , if not free then should charge minimum of $50. Their charge was 117 one way, this was ridiculous and taking advantage of the travelers! 
We would recommend others certainly also we would consider Exoticca for ourselves in future | My first time booking with Exotica and I can not wait to book with them again. Our tour guide, Tiago was amazing to say the least. 
Hotels were nice and clean. THANK YOU!!!!! | Our first time booking with Exoticca & it did not disappoint. It was super well organized we got to experience the best of Italy & we will forever be thankful for such a wonderful experience our guide was also so wonderful on recommending local spots to enjoy delicious food. 
Thank you for setting the bar for our future trips, will be definitely recommend to all my friends & family. | This has been by far the worse trip I’ve taken with any tour company. The hotels were terrible and sub standard and flights were below economy. Do yourself a favor and Don’t use Exottica.

title: AmiGo Travel: Tips & Guides
description:
AmiGo is a curated recommendations app from a community of like-minded people and tastemakers. Our app provides on-demand inspiration and helps you discover, plan and enjoy experiences that are uniquely tailored to you. The ultimate source for travel recommendations from people you trust. Enhance how you explore the world with AmiGo.

TASTEMAKERS – get insider tips from AmiGo’s trusted partners, including 50+ photographers, stylists, travel writers, & more.

INSPIRATION – get inspired with original AmiGo editorial content and news, including cool hotel openings, hot spot restaurants, & more.

NEARBY RECS – explore places near you for a last-minute reservation or activity.

QUICKLY RECOMMEND – catalog your favorite places in your travel diary and journal, and share them with friends and other AmiGo users.

MAP – view top recs in cities like Paris, NYC, and London on an interactive map.

EXPLORE – search and find recs for where to go, what to eat, where to stay, & more.

CONNECT – follow friends and other AmiGos to discover the best recs and coolest spots.

INVITE – share your 5 invites with friends who you always go to for recs!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and improvements.
reviews:
The best app for exploring a new city, country, or even discovering local gems. I’ve had the app for about a year now; planned several day trips and international jaunts with it by my side. Of course, always check the area a new place is in, do your due diligence, but this app saves countless hours and because it is curated I have had maybe only one failed rec. It is still a little glitchy at times, but like wine, that will get better with age.  No matter if you are travelling near or far, trust, you need AmiGo in your life. | Thought I’d try it out but really unusable. It’s slow and not well made as many things don’t even work, I’m on an iPhone 15 pro. Deleted. | 10/10 | Such an easy and effective app! I love it! I use it when I’m at home or when I travel. It’s so helpful to find the best places to stay, eat, see and shop! So thoughtful and intuitive! Love the ratings and comments! This is a must application for anyone who loves to travel and explore the world with honest genuine advice from friends and family and influencers | Love this for showing me recs I actually trust to be similar to my own taste and rendered nicely visually vs Yelp. Would dock a star since the UX/UI is challenging sometimes and things are slow to load which is a nuisance, but won’t because am too loyal to the app and think it’s just an early set of bugs they’ll fix. | I love this App. It’s a Godsend in travel planning!  So easy to use and such a breath of information on restaurants hotels and area attractions!  A must download for any traveler! | An absolute must-have ! AmiGo is such an amazing app for trusted recs all over the world, and I love how I can keep track of all the places I've been and find inspiration for future trips - even for local spots near me! | The best travel app!! | This app is incredibly helpful. It helps you plan any trip in advance but the excellent map feature enables you to also make plans on the go. I have used in several countries and the recommendations have been consistently excellent. Very reliable. Download this app now!!! | I absolutely love using Amigo when I travel. It has the best recommendations and is super easy to use. I love having my recommended restaurants, shops, museums, etc all in one place. I plan to use this app for all of my future trips!!!! | Such a great app. I use it to plan all my trips now. So many great recommendations | I love using this app to save and plan all my travel!! Highly recommend! | This app is a must-have for anyone who loves travel, food & exploring - my trusted source for on-the-go | I don’t know if it’s my phone or the app but I’ve had this app for eight hours and it’s been very frustrating, not very user friendly and lacking a lot of basic destinations or venues. I’ve even found some pretty lame spelling mistakes. I guess because it was invite only I thought it would be top tier. It has not been this far and my time is too precious to waste on slow, less than optimal apps. Disappointed. | Good concept but the app itself is pretty bad to the point that it’s unusable at this stage. It’s very slow and the filters don’t work at all. The locations are sometimes inaccurate. I was going to use it for a recent trip but I eventually gave up on it due it’s usability issues. | Amigo is so useful! Love how easy it is to share and receive recommendations. 

I’ve found some really cool, under the radar places because of it. | I love this app so far! It’s really fun to use and to add your own recommendations of your favorite spots. I like using it to make wish lists for my future travels too. This app feels that it is just people who love to travel, leaving honest reviews and recommendations. It’s like asking your friends for their travel recs, but everything (and everywhere) is all in one spot. | Love it. Just wish it ran faster as the load time on browse and photo upload is a bit pesky. | Intuitive and easy to use! Im loving iit 😍 | I love that the recs come from my network or from people that know about the place I’m traveling to. | Coool App!! Useful💪💪 | Great app to share great locations around the world!! | F | Exciting to have a great app with  wonderful suggestions and various  places to experience. 
Congratulations! | I use a lot of apps and do heavy research and planning before traveling, and this app saves me soooo much time and saves me from reading through random reviews from people I don’t know that have different tastes and lifestyles than I do. Finally the app i’ve been waiting for! | I have been waiiiiting for an app like this!  I always forget the great places I go when I travel and this makes it SO easy to log and share it! Also it alllows me to get recs from my friends with great taste, not the randos on Yelp/TripAdvisor!

title: been: track visited countries
description:
Keep track of all the amazing places you've been and share your adventures with friends using Been There! This custom map of the world allows you to mark all the countries and places you've visited.

Perfect for the wanderlust, Been There makes it easy to keep track of your travel bucket list and see your travel statistics. Plus, you can use the app to learn about new places and get inspiration for your next adventure.

With Been There, you can:
- Create your own personal travel map
- Mark all the places you've been to
- Keep track of your travel bucket list progress
- Share your map with friends on social media and compare your travels

Don't let your adventures go unrecorded - download Been There today and start marking all the amazing places you've been!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements
reviews: This is quite disappointing that I can add one of my favorite places and a major landmass | The one-time paid option doesn’t give you anything that it promised. The city lists are so poorly made that it doesn’t distinguish cities with the same name, very annoying. | I prefer using an app before  I’m  asked to evaluate it.

title: Chargeway
description:
Download Chargeway, the most user friendly EV charging station locator and trip planner! 

Chargeway makes EV charging easy for everyone. Simply choose any electric vehicle (EV) and Chargeway customizes your EV charging experience making it easy to see where you can charge, where you can go, and how long charging will take.

Chargeway has a unique and simple way to navigate charging options using colors for plug types and numbers for power levels. Red stations are for Tesla/NACS plugs, green stations are for J1772/CSS plugs, and blue stations are for CHAdeMO plugs. Numbers at each station pin and for each vehicle show the max power level for each can charge. Levels 1 and 2 are for AC charging and levels 3 through 7 are for DC fast charging.

Designed with drivers in mind Chargeway simplifies the EV charging experience for every driver, everywhere. Chargeway’s station map covers all of North America including networks such as Tesla, Electrify America, EVgo, Shell Recharge, Blink, EVConnect, Chargepoint, Flo, Volta, Rivian, 7Charge, Circle K, EVCS, Ivy, OpConnect, Petro Canada, and many more. Chargeway features include:

Station Map:
- Plug specific color-coding so you know which stations match your car (Green, Blue or Red)
- Power levels 1 through 7 show your vehicle and stations max charging speed
- Charge time estimation for every station and charger based on your vehicles battery level
- Real-time availability for chargers (Available, in use and offline status)
- Automatic station location map filtering for the vehicles you choose
- Easy to adjust filters for station power levels and networks you want to use
- View and add reviews and photos at stations you visit
- Report problems directly to network customer service teams 
- See shops and restaurants near a station that you can enjoy while you charge
- One-click directions to help you get to any station location

EV Trip Planner:
- Chargeway plots the fastest route and charging station locations for your trip
- Set the outside temperature and your desired speed for accurate planning
- Add multiple stops between your starting point and destination for custom routes
- Charging times for every stop are estimated to help you plan your trip
- Select "All Stations" on planned trips to view every charging option along your route
- If a certain route doesn’t have enough stations Chargeway will let you know so you can choose another route

Vehicle Info:
- Select your EVs color and choose a name to customize your experience
- Adjust your EVs battery level and desired charge limit to estimate charging times at every station
- Plug type and battery specifications for every vehicle
- Add multiple vehicles to your account at any time

Chargeway works for every EV on the road in North America including Tesla Model 3, Tesla Model Y, Tesla Model S and Tesla Model X; Kia EV6, Hyundai Ioniq 5, Ford Mustang Mach-E, Ford F-150 Lightning, Chevrolet Bolt, VW ID.4, Nissan LEAF, BMW i4, BMW iX, Audi e-tron vehicles, Porsche Taycan, Rivian R1T, Rivian R1S, Polestar, and many more EVs available today.

No matter where you live or your lifestyle Chargeway helps you enjoy EV charging for both every day driving as well as EV road trips. Download Chargeway to discover the simplified EV charging experience!

---

Chargeway Plus
• Connect your vehicle for a convenient experience with Chargeway
• Real-time battery status
• Start & Stop charging*
• Instant charge time estimates
• Real-time charging status

* Charge control is available on select makes and models of vehicle.

---

Terms of Service: https://www.chargeway.net/terms-of-service/
Privacy Policy: https://www.chargeway.net/privacy-policy/
releaseNotes: - Added support for connected vehicle features.
reviews:
On my way back from Austin to Dallas, I typically stop in Waco to charge. All the chargers were broken, and thanks to this app I was able to find a ton of chargers around me that I didn’t even know existed. Chargeway literally saved me in a moment when I didn’t even know what to do. Thanks chargeway! | Hands down the best charging app available right now. The user interface is easy to navigate, they’re always keeping charging station locations/data updated, and do a much better job at explaining charging levels than the other apps. This is truly the new standard in charging apps. | Love the new design of the Chargeway app - Selecting my car with a beautiful image and all the site location photos are helpful. 

I don’t think the route planning works very well, however. It takes forever to load and several times, I’ve mapped a route with 1 charging stop when I really needed 2 or more. Drivers rarely go at a consistent speed, and I’m not sure if this app accounts for elevation change or other variables yet that impact driving range. 

I love the attempt at a numbering system, but it kinda feels like a new language instead of communicating in miles per kWh or miles per hour. Also, I see many drivers look for the highest number charger when their EVs can’t accept more than 50 kW! A faster charge isn’t always better. It needs to fit the car and intended visit time. | A very simple number system and my go to app to find charging stations. | I had used most of the EV charging apps and just tried Chargeway.  Chargeway is the best EV charging app that I have used and the user interface is excellent. It’s much easier to quickly find EV charging stations with specific capabilities. | I find the trip planning in this app to be easier to use than others I have tried | Better trip planner than most other apps. Very similar to what you find in the Tesla main display and mobile app.  Tells you the stops and about how long you will be stationary charging.  You can enter starting battery charge, AVG driving speed and temp to try and get a more accurate estimate.  Will start using this instead of PlugShare for planning purposes. | Best of all apps I went through all very easy in app navigate... This a Google search of chargers | I used to be able to flip the trip to see my soc when after arriving to my destination to see what my soc is before heading back. Bring this feature back. Why did you take it away? Dumb. | After I told the app I drove a Tesla model Y it would not show me any of the other charging stations, only Tesla. However, I have a J1772 adapter and it will not give me the option to use those plugs or stations. | So I’m shockingly surprised just how accurate this app is. I took a 853 miles road trip using this app. It showed all the stop points to charge and the time it would take to charge. A simple click on your next charge point show you your arrival SOC and how long to charge. To my surprise it was extremely accurate for my 2020 Kia Niro EV. Routing to the next charge point you could choose Apple, Google or Waze map. I simple love this app. Tesla, Ford and Rivian has great trip planners in their vehicle. If your vehicle don’t have one you can definitely use Chargeway as your next trip planner.  It’s simply layed and very easy to use. I highly recommend this app. It’s also great to use around town as well. You can’t go wrong with this. If you don’t have ABRP premium this is the app to use. Bravo team Chargeway. Very well done. Very well done!!!! | I have 9 EV charging apps on my phone because each app is excellent at one or more aspects of the experience but no one app is good at all aspects. In my opinion, an excellent app has to:
1) show me the eligible chargers at my current location and display how long/fast the charging will be at each unit. Also display which units are being currently used. 2) plan several routes of a trip, show the best charging options along each route and again delineate how long/fast I’ll be charging at each station then let me choose which route works best for me. 2a) understand that the best EV route is not always the google maps route. 3) Show amenities, food, activities, shopping around the EV charger where time can be occupied while charging. 4) offer user reviews of the charging station. This app comes close but doesn’t perform 2 very well. On a trip a recently took, one of the stops it recommended for all three routes recommended I charge for 4.5 hours. I don’t do these trips often but no way am I turning an 8 hour trip to one of 12+. So I use another app to plan my route and this one for other things. | There were 4 stations at 51st Ave & Bell. Two had power lights on and two did not. None of the chargers worked. We spent 30 min trying to get them to turn on using the app :/ | Whenever I need to plan a road trip or I’m in a new city, this is hands down the easiest and simplest app to use for charging. | Much easier to quickly see what stations are faster than others. App just needs more users so that there are more reviews of the stations within it. | I was disappointed when I downloaded the app only to discover that unless your electric vehicle is in their preexisting list, the trip planner doesn’t work. | Every time a plan a trip the app keeps pulling in charge stations I don’t want to use.  This needs fixing.  If I choose EA network only as an example, a trip should only show EA!   But every time I do this other stations pop in to my trip which are right next to the one I want.  Very frustrating.  Other things work really well but needs help. Also would love to be able to adjust the % of battery at end of a trip to higher % making you change longer at last station as many destinations in small towns have no chargers and only a level 1 plug at most.  A few tweaks this app could be perfectly! | Best EV charger finder out there. | To add a vehicle you need to register. Why do you need my phone number to do so? And when I only put my name and zip code I get the “random” error message “Error - CustomMethodExpection”??? | Easy and robust. The trip planning feature is excellent in identifying charging stations with your car’s compatible chargers. And clicking on the station lets you know speed and number of chargers, as well as amenities in the area. The app also provides the soc on arrival and departure from the station. Their customer support is second to none. I recently contacted them via their app, and rec’d a response the same day. I was contacted by a rep who gave me one-on-one tutoring on using the app. As someone who is not very techy, this was extremely helpful. I am taking my first long road trip with my EV in a few weeks, and will do so with much more confidence. The Chargeway Team is committed to standing out as the gold standard EV app. | As always developers have good ideas but they failed executing them or maybe not putting much work after they release their app.
In this case the app has multiple inaccuracies like charging station max speed. Dispenser rated 350kwh when in fact they are 150… Finally on my phone iPhone 14 pro, the trip planner is stuck in a loop. There are so many EV app available out there. If you go the extra mile to create one. Please make sure it add value or at least it works. Otherwise you are not helpful to the EV community. | After playing with several this is by far the most useful charging app I have used.  Better coverage than others and let’s you take into account your make, model, speed, and temp. Results for road trips so far have been accurate. | Looks good on my iPhone, although I haven’t had time yet to really test it. But since it opens with a blank screen on my Bolt EUV, it’s not very useful for a travel app.

Update after the developer response. Changed from 2 stars to 4. Apparently, they didn’t read what I wrote. I said it was blank in Car Play. Not just no chargers. No map, no nothing.

Anyway, I tried again a few days later and it seemed to work OK as far as displaying information. I haven’t had a chance to try it yet on a trip. | The 1-6 charging system is confusing. Chargers are already identified as L1-L3 and have a kwh rating. Using Chargeways own proprietary system to label charging speeds pointlessly obscures the information and terminology that would be used anywhere else. | This app/company captures *way* too much private information - read their privacy policy (which strangely has not been updated since 2018).    

They don’t need 95% of the info they capture to provide what this app provides - so what are they planning to do with all that private info? 

There are several alternative products which provide the same info and services without requiring this much private info.

 “ We collect personal information that you provide to us such as name, address, vehicle information, VIN and contact information.”

  “ The personal information we collect can include the following: Name and Contact Data.  We collect your first and last name, email address, postal zip code, phone number and other similar data.”  

“ If you use our Apps, we may also collect the following information:  Geo-location Information.We may request access or permission to track location-based information from your mobile device, either continuously or while you are using our mobile application to provide location-based services. If you wish to chage our access or permissions, you may do so in your device’s settings. Mobile Device Data.We may automatically collect device information, operating system, version information and IP address.”

 “ We may obtain information about you from other sources, such as public databases, joint marketing partners, as well as from other third parties.  Examples of the information we receive from other sources include: social media profile information, marketing leads and search results and links, including paid listings.”

  “We may share your information with our affiliates, in which case we will require those affiliates to honor this privacy policy. Affiliates include our parent company and any subsidiaries, joint venture partners or other companies that we control or that are under common control with us.” | Downloaded and tried to open the app but can’t get past the animated start screen. Deleted app/reinstalled but get same results. | Looks useful but missing CCS1 adapter chargers. | If traveling for extended distances across state lines, this app is perfect for planning your trip to ensure you know when and where to stop to charge your vehicle.  This app gives you the peace of mind required to ensure your EV vehicle is left stranded with a charge.  

I have used others and found Chargeway to be the most reliable. | I recently purchased a used LEAF that I absolutely love. As a shorter range EV it is great for traveling around my metro area. Although I don’t often use public charging stations when I do Chargeway is the first app I open to see all my available options for electric fuel. | I created an account, saved my car, but the app can’t seem to remember it every time I open it. I have to re-program it constantly. | Their goal is to make charging easier - by obscuring the underlying details and incorrectly classifying what your vehicle can and cannot use. For example, it might say you are a “4” max despite being able to get the best charge at a “5.” That will cost you time and money. Worse yet - YOU CAN CHANGE WHAT THE NUMBERS MEAN. From a simplified universal system to completely meaningless in 3 seconds. Beyond the basic premise, it’s not a good app. Crashes a lot, mediocre design, super basic features, no real integration with the vehicle itself, no understanding of actual charging curves. It pretends to know your vehicle, but really doesn’t. | I really like the design philosophy and trip planning capabilities - far superior to the many other apps I have used for this purpose including ABRP, charger network specific and network aggregation apps, and the in-built apps on our Mach-e, Kia Niro EV and previous Chevy Bolts.

Would be great to see the following features for the smartphone app (I'm using the iOS version):

Support for multiple vehicles for a single user account (an everyday need for multiple EV households where drivers can switch between vehicles).

Saving planned routes on the app - they disappear if the app is closed.

Add additional waypoints for route planning - only a few are currently enabled and for our planned full r/t tour of the west coast for example, it's not enough for optimal route planning. 

Customization of vehicle charger default configurations. Sure we're J1772/CCS in both of our vehicles but also carry a TeslaTap for charging at Tesla destination chargers too (thanks Elon!). It would be ideal if non-supercharger Tesla AC chargers could be considered as compatible with our J1772 cars and appear coded in green like the J1772/CCS stations do.

Getting the charger status information to work on the apo - that's important for basic functionality.

And then the moonshot involving some API heavy lifting on the backend - I actually really like the Mach-e in-built nav system interface and display (aside from its dreadful route planning and inaccurate charger location information) and prefer it to Google Maps, Waze etc running through CarPlay. In general I'm seeing a big improvement in the quality of in-built Nav in general across several car companies. So would it be too much to ask to be able to upload the route plan to the in-built nav system? I know that's a lot to ask but...

Thanks! | Smooth and filters information to help plan routes. Used to drive from FL to NYC and perfected this to several other route planners | I can’t get past the start screen… keeps crashing when I try to enter my phone number. Also, why do you need our phone number?! I get enough spam texts/calls already. | Requires an account with your Phone number to use any of its features, even just to look at the map to see local chargers. No thanks, I’ll stay with PlugShare. | when you open the app it shows 0 charging stations even though i live in a city and they’re everywhere. i have connection and tried refreshing the app, nothing. i don’t understand the point or how they have so many good reviews. | Sorry guys, got to give you a poor rating because you don’t seem to offer a way to create an account without handing over my phone number. Give me an alternative and I’ll try this app again. | After downloading every single EV charging app in the store I came across this. This one includes all the networks, and makes it clear and easy to see what level chargers are where and doesn’t only show certain networks. | Maybe this app works, maybe it doesn’t. I downloaded it to enter the information for my car to see how it worked, yet I am unable to do anything specific to my vehicle without providing my name, phone number, and zip code. I understand how this information could legitimately be helpful to the app if I decided to keep it and wanted to save my information, but I can’t get to the point where I would be comfortable providing it with my phone number if I can’t try the app. 

This app looks promising, but spam calls are far too irritating to risk giving my number to an app that I am not yet familiar with. I may give it a try again someday if this requirement is changed. | This app wants all of your information before it will do anything for you. Plug share let’s you get on with no hassle. A better route planner is the way to go if you want to plot a trip. | Doesn’t let you see details about the stations.  Pick what type of adapters you have.   

Lets not hide the details of the type of plugs. 

I was recommended this app for finding hotels that have charging.   Just adding my cars to it and it’s making me feel like the developers think we are too stupid to understand the inputs our cars can accept.   

Sure add a filter for people that don’t want details, but don’t treat us all like morons. | I enjoy the app so far. My favorite feature is the estimated time at an EV station. But there are still some things I’d like to see tweaked before it becomes my main charging app. First, where you can move the circle to divie up between miles needed vs. miles remaining, I'd like to be able to tap on the "322 mi" the middle of the circle to switch from miles to energy/percentage. Second, the filter still doesn't fully work. In the filter section, If I only enable the ChargePoint Network and the DC adapter (Blue 3 and up), the map results still show stations that are only AC (Green 1/2)

 And to add another for finer points to my filter critique, I've realized that the filter is only adhered to when the "My current vehicle" filter is on. For ex.: If you just have AC (Green) adapters enabled, it still displays all level (Green/Blue/Red) charging stations. But if I filter with AC & My current vehicle, then it correctly just shows the Green & Red. Same scenario goes with Blue vs. Blue&Red. And noticed that any of the filter line colors and numbers become highlighted ONLY when My current vehicle is chosen as a filter. Please fix this!

Edit: Thanks to Matt for giving me a ring, personally, and further explaining how to JUST get AC adapter map results or JUST DC adapter map results. I also appreciate you taking down some of my small app feedback. I'll be using the app more often and I'm looking forward to having the ability to see either Miles or Energy in the Timer Section! | Great app, I would give it 5 stars but it only lets you navigate to 4 stops including your starting location and destination which means you can really only choose two charging locations. Sad. | I am new to the EV world. And I did not know how much goes into planning a trip with an EV. I downloaded Chargeway to play and plan random trips. The color codes (red for Tesla) made it super easy to find charging stations along the route, and green for other chargers with the adapter (something that the Tesla does not find). So far I planned trips to Lake Tahoe, the Grand Canyon and an excursion through the State of Oregon. I would recommend Chargeway to anyone that is new to the EV community or thinking about joining. Great App! | Just downloaded from the App Store but I can’t register. | No thanks. App is useless unless you give them your phone number. | Really nice app for locating chargers. I can't wait to see the ability to submit reviews in the app for sites and it would be neat if the app sees I am by “Charger XYZ” and that there are two cars plugged in there and those owners use the app too if I could message asking how long they might be or if I see they are full to let them know I was unplugging them. Just a way to communicate that wouldn’t share phone or email and just would let you “see” vehicles at the same charge site as you. I love the way it labels chargers simply with a colour and number. Some non-network stations are not yet in here but if people submit missing ones this app can be very complete. | So, let’s be real. This app is fantastic. With that being said. They need to get accurate pricing on this app related to each charging station. Overall, this is probably the best charging station app. It accommodates all the vendors and can teach anyone about EVs. Thanks for your work on this! And on another note. James Mast is one of the best people in the world. Give this app a chance! Woot woot! | 100% better than Plugshare. Try it. | I’m not a fan of having to handover personal information just to use the app

title: Photo Map - Travel Tracker
description:
-- LET YOUR PHOTOS TELL THE STORY --
You've been to a lot of places and taken a lot of pictures. Photo Map uses your photo library to tell the story of the places you've visited and the adventures you've had.

-- REDISCOVER YOUR FAVORITE TRIPS --
Photo Map automatically scans your Photo Library to find photos from each of your trips. Rediscover your epic journeys and weekend escapes by state, country, province, or territory.

-- HIGHLIGHT YOUR FAVORITE MEMORIES --
Highlight your favorite photo from each trip or stop on your journey. Frame each photo in the unmistakable outline of the place it was taken.

-- SHARE YOUR STORY WITH CUSTOMIZABLE MAPS --
Your photos tell the perfect story of your journey. Tell the world where you went and what you did by sharing an image of your map.

-- FIND INSPIRATION AND FILL OUT YOUR MAP --
There's hundreds of places to visit, and you're just getting started. Find the inspiration you need to book your next adventure!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes & Improvements
reviews:
Hollywood | While I overall love this app, it’s missing the majority of the island countries in the Caribbean. is there a plan to remedy that? | It scans you recent photos for location and you can’t just select from you photos yourself. The scanning will take ages if you have lots of pictures in your camera roll. I actually could never get it to entirely load even on fast WiFi and letting it sit for 30+ min. Why can’t it just not scan the photos and allow us to select what we want? Or have that as an option? I already knew what photos I wanted to use for each location I don’t want help selecting them! Plus my location is not on for all of my photos so then it wasn’t detecting the places I’ve actually been. There’s no good way to do that just let us do it our selves! I was disappointed as I liked the general idea but the execution was not good. | Will you be adding the Caribbean islands? | 🥺🥺 | Love the concept but can’t get my photos to save | Would give  5 stars but Aruba is missing. Please add | Wish it worked across devices but this is the only app that visually does what I want | Need to add Singapore | I was looking for an app to mark where I've been and thought, " wouldn't it be cool if there was one where I could use my own pictures?"  Not only does this app do that, it does it so well!

It's easy to use and I like it so much I upgraded. | Even though the Location data is correct on the photos, it does not see it in the list to pick a photo . Also when I choose a photo from my library, it will not save on the map.   Great concept though. | I love the idea of this app but I wish there were more countries such as smaller caribbean countries etc. | I wasn’t sure if you’d see it, but I was pleasantly surprised when I saw your response. Thank you very much! :) | I love to travel and be able to keep up with where I have been and where I haven’t!

However when in a country or state it won’t scroll up to list the rest of the places or if I’m trying to select a picture it won’t let me scroll up either. I deleted the app and the downloaded again but it didn’t help | For some reason it will show up on the map like when I put the photo in and click the checkmark it doesn’t show up on the map itself so it’s good but just doesn’t work. | Easy to use;  well designed. | It basically only scans your “Recents” folder. I have 70,000 photos synced from my computer and this didn’t include any of them. So it shows I’ve only been to 2 states when in fact I’ve been to 30+ and several countries. | I love this app but I am a bit confused because an entire piece of Africa is missing half of Somalia is just not on the map the area called Somaliland | I can’t even upload a freaking picture app is stupid | It would be cool if the user could rename the maps titles and add multiple maps for group travel vs personal tracking | Wouldn’t place any of my 460 pictures?? | We really like this app for sharing where we’ve been because it includes photos and makes cool maps!! | This is an excellent app, which provides a great way to visualize your travels.  It's fun to see how many counties within a state we've been to.  The app does a good job of letting you quickly and easily pick a representative photo for each country/state/county region you've been to.  

Highly recommended! | I like it but could let you make the pictures better for it | The app is great except there’s no way to back up or sync maps. I’d love an iCloud sync option so I don’t need to simply save the partial maps I have with meticulously cropped/rotated photos into each border shape! | Fun idea and works relatively well. However, it does not sort all photos correctly. If the location is relatively close to a different state (even a few miles within the state), it often sorts them into wrong ones. Manual selection does not work in those cases either! You can select a photo, but it doesn’t show up in the map on my iPad Pro 12.9 M1 ( It works on my M1 MacBook Air though) | It keeps glitching and going to the beginning. | Best app ever | Beautifully designed and built app. No useless features, just a really easy, fun way to track travel. | This app was exactly what I was looking for. Perfectly perfect!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! | I downloaded this on the way home from a road trip- wow!  What a fantastic app.  I had a lot of fun tracking our trips and adding pictures.  Will continue to use this app for years to come! | I love this app! It is very easy to change the photo selected by the program or to adjust the picture that was selected. I second the idea of using photo dates to re-create a trip itinerary. We do many road trips and it would be awesome to see each journey outlined are highlighted in someway. Thank you. You have done an excellent job with this app and I’m excited to see your future improvements. | I upload 9pics for 9differents states because thats all i have. but i dodnt know how to check out or proceed the process looks like no option. Please can somebody help me. Thanks! 
im new to this.. | I downloaded it and bought the pack on my iPad, but I can’t upload or save any photos to the maps. Waste of money if you want to uae it on the iPad. | Favorite app of all time!! I bought the explorer pack I absolutely love. However, why is there no sections split up for Switzerland? I’ve been to many different parts and it would be cool to see. Nothing big though for issues love the app!!! | This is a really cool app! The United States map is incredible… I love being able to track all the states that I have been to over the years. I'd love to see features such as cropping the photo and moving it to fit the state. Without this feature it makes it hard to pick a photo. I hope to see a upgrade to printing or ordering the photo for those with a photo map. 
(Not sure if this is an upgrade with in the app) 
I'm not sure if this is the same thing, but the online version is a little bit better as i can crop and move and order with company! I also discovered this neat idea through tiktok. | Nice but We should be able to resize photo in state and also have multiple pics in a state | I have a feature request: since the photos contain dates, you could recreate an approximate itinerary for every trip. To know what is considered a trip, the user would have to set its home country. Then a trip is effectively the places visited while outside of the home country. Moreover, min and max dates while outside the home country would be the trip duration. Given a new view for Trips then the user could quickly find fotos of every trip. It could be ordered chronologically. 

Keep up the great work! | I. Cant add anymore photos | It’s an awesome app, I love it. I just wish I could create multiple maps for all of my travels with different people. Other than that I really enjoy the app🙂 | Keeping the iOS eco-system clean, neat and tidy. Came across this creatively simple app after months! Nicely made.

Edit:
Updated to 3 stars from 5 after the in-app purchase that unlocks other countries.
