When you scroll towards the bottom to see more pictures instead it just resets back to the top. This is happening on an iPhone 12 Pro.

Update: Still broken on iPhone 13 Pro | One of my favorite apps. Explorer’s Pack is worth every penny. | Definitely worth the download! Can’t wait to add more places I’ve been. Would be cool to pair to my Facebook. | What I haven’t have some pictures in some counties so I putted colors and you won’t access me so when I mark it visited it won’t let me and sometimes it crashes I deleted this app 1 time | I downloaded this app on my iPad and it will not upload any photos at all to the maps. Please fix this. | fix your app please | I love this app so much but two problems
problem 1. there is a bug when you try to store a photo on Figi,when you select it it goes back to “World Countries”.
problem 2. I want you to make a National photo for maps of countries or continents. | Bc | Love the concept of the app but I can’t upload multiple photos. When I go to select a different photo it replaces the last uploaded photo.

title: The Official MTA App
description:
The official all-in-one-app for MTA’s subways, buses, and commuter railroads (Long Island Rail Road and Metro-North).

- A map-based interface that simplifies trip planning and makes getting around a breeze.
- Reliable real-time information from the MTA, with a new Status tab to quickly see on any service issues.
- Wondering where your bus is? Track it on the map in real-time and never miss a ride again.
- Easily save your frequently used lines, stops, and stations, and access them quickly for a hassle-free commute.
- Stay informed of any trip changes with optional alerts that notify you of delays or disruptions.
- Enjoy personalized smart alerts that learn your preferred trips and proactively check for service changes before you leave.

The MTA app is built for our riders, with our riders. We update the app regularly based on your feedback.
releaseNotes:
This update contains several enhancements based on user feedback:
• Minor improvements and various bug fixes
More to come soon. Thank you for riding with us.
reviews:
As so many have noted, unlike the old version which was easy to use and refresh, it is now near impossible to get info in a quick way, ridiculous number of steps required, and so visually disorganized it makes my head explode. Lovely that the developer is responding to reviews - please for the love of New Yorkers, change this back. | The old app was relatively easy to use and the information could be found without a million taps. This one is so clunky and even for someone very familiar with NYC transit is almost unusable.  We just want to be able to see the train/bus schedules and updated real-time arrival information without having to go through a ton of hoops. | Bring back the older version.
So much more work to get the schedule.
Confusing and opposite of helpful | The new app doesn’t load and when it does it’s slow. The direction is confusing when looking at a subway station, as is the bus direction. | The last three or four updates have been completely worthless… They launch and then disappear from the screen. When you swipe up and over to quit the various apps suddenly there is the MTA app…! Tapping on it repeats the cycle of crashing… What did you break? | Absolutely, horrible service ! It’s appropriate name should be stress A Ride ! I’m a disabled woman and the service between the MTA and the phone operators lets not even talk about the drivers OMG Just absolutely Horrible service! By rare occasions, you come across a great driver professional helpful kind , but majority of the time your not so lucky sad to say ! Sometimes you get lift outside for hours before anyone comes rain, snow smh 
They need to make improvements badly across the board in every department! ASAP | This app is garbage. It is for tourists, not NYers, but if I was a tourist I would draw the same conclusion about what a mess it is. Not remotely intuitive. No home button. Too many back arrows. Uses strange terms like “explore” and “status”. How about bring the old app back, which was direct, like NYers! NYers want to know where their train is. That is it. What a waste of time and money. | I hate the updated app. They took a great app and made it mediocre. The old one was so much more user-friendly. Please, just give us the old app back! | The app doesn’t show the time the train will arrive. It shows how many minutes for the train to arrive so you have to add the minutes shown to the current time to get the actual time the train will arrive. Very disappointing. I want to see the time the train will arrive instead of having to click to see it. | This new update is worse than the one it replaced.  I check it for my bus’ location and it frequently shows no activity, only for the bus to arrive a few mins later.  The MTA is inept at everything it does.  They certainly deserve no more money until they fix their quality and safety woes.  Add this app to the pile. | Let me start out with: I really want this app to work. The subway is such an amazing way to get around New York, and this app has the opportunity to make it even easier for everyone. But it's falling short. A few of the issues that have yet to be resolved:
-Somehow, the arrival times are less accurate than they were in the old app. Also, there's no ETA, only a countdown clock, which makes it harder to plan when to get to the station and transfers. 
-It takes many more clicks to get to useful information in the app. The subway lines used to be grouped by "good service" and "delayed" so you knew at a glance which way to head if you had multiple options. Now that information is spread out and buried, meaning it takes longer to make a decision about which line to take.
-When you open a station detail window, there's so much wasted space that only the first 1.5 trains are visible. More taps/scrolling to get to the information you need quickly. 
-Also in the station detail window, it defaults to mixing uptown and downtown trains in the countdown list. What is the point of this? I don't care about trains going in ANY direction, I care about the trains going ONE direction or the other. Why would this be the default?
-In the map view, downtown stations inexplicably default to the top of the list for every train line, which breaks the brain of anyone familiar with NYC geography. If you change the order from the default, it infuriatingly switches back the next time you open the app. 
-The app STILL doesn't include live train locations, even though this has been available on the MTA website for years now. 

I was really hoping that the MTA would improve on what was at least a useable app, but this new app is just a disappointment. Please, please listen to the regular users and make this better! | The app was great before. Occasional glitches and errors, sure, but 95% of the time it was accurate and up to date. Now it’s wrong as often as it’s right and it’s super tedious to navigate. They changed the defaults but there’s no way to customize the settings to view subway routes, so you have to reset the direction every time, they made it way easier to mistake whether you’re looking at an uptown or downtown train, they took away the arrival times and now it just says how long until the next train (and it’s often wrong). It’s such a huge clusterf*** that I’m back to the days of showing up to the station and hoping there’s a train sometime soon. Please bring back the old app!!! | Please return to the old app where you could tap a line and tap a station. 

I don’t need to search for an address (and by the way why can you search for addresses outside of the MTA coverage area anyway) also why is the subway stop I’m trying to search for not the first result every time after just a few letters? If anything the UI of this app should just be a subway map or a list of subway lines followed by a list of stops on that line.

BRING BACK THE OLD APP. | This new update is beyond terrible. Requires user to click so many times before arriving to the information that was easily accesible in the last version. It’s not clean or easily manageable for someone that rides the subway everyday. I hope the developers take this feedback and revert back to the old one or create a more user friendly app. | App requires iOS 12.4 or higher but immediately crashes on my iPhone 6 running 12.5.7 (I can’t upgrade further until I get a new phone). | Who comes up with this hot mess?😡 | Not intuitive. Things are all over the place. Layout is confusing. Old app allowed me to see train times much quicker at a glance. Things were separated nicely. | I can’t stand this new version.  The previous version was so easy to navigate.  This new app I can appreciate the upgrade but this was a totally, completely, and new make-over and not easy to navigate.  I saw a senior at the bus stop yelling at their phone wondering what happened to their app.  I explained that the app went through a change.  That poor senior eventually asked the bus driver about the app and the driver couldn’t help much and directed them to call 511.  Put the old app back! | I am experiencing all the same issues echoed throughout the reviews. Where I was once able to click twice and find what I needed, I am totally baffled by the new app. I figured I needed to give it time and I’d acclimate, but I only use it when I need it (which, for me, is not daily) so I’ve forgotten how to use it subsequent times. When you have less than a minute to make transit decisions, the old app was a great tool. Now, for me, not so much. Also… it’s bonkers that I can use my phone browser to find more accurate information on BusTime.MTA.info than the app. My browser gives real time info while the official app gives me scheduled times (which are, at best, 30% correct?). I’ve missed or waited on buses that weren’t even coming due to this. As a designer I have empathy for the UX/UI side of this… it has to be hard to hear folks saying they keep trying to understand the app when it should be the most intuitive thing to use. | I don’t know what happened with the redesign. Made it harder to use and understand, especially the bus routes. | How does this keep getting worse every time they overhaul it? There should be minimal taps to get to the subway arrival times. And with each update they bury them further. Also for some reason the subway lines are laid out south to north by default which is the opposite of what it used to be and opposite what’s on the website. I’ve made mta.info a shortcut on my phone and just use that instead.  This app is a joke. | The live tracker is back but the old tracker before the update was easier to use.

The new live tracker seems slower to update, the bus is always between two stops it doesn’t tell you if the bus is at the bus stops

The old tracker will tell you when a bus is less then one stop away, approaching, and then at stop. The new tracker can only position itself between two different stops so it’s never tell you that it’s at stops, the icon  just jump from being between the pervious stops about to reach your stops and then it’ll jump to between the next stops. We seems to have lost the more precise tracking.
the next one is minor but prefer if the bus icon was a different color from the line it’s currently traveling down 
I’ll probably keep using the bus status website rather then the app | To revise an imperfect but usable app to something cumbersome and lacking value is an absolutely on brand move by the MTA.

One no longer opens the app and is greeting with the page you normally use. You have to do a bit of clicking to get to where you want to be.

Correct me if I’m wrong but it seems that there is no longer any real time information. One of given just a schedule of when trains might arrive. This defeats the entire reason for the app to exist. The schedule seems to be an abstract concept in general and certainly isn’t really helpful when you are deciding your route.

Dear MTA programmers, do better. | My app updated automatically and I wished it never did. The app used to show me bus and train times. Simple as that, that’s all I need. The new update looks nice, but is so confusing and makes no sense. I’m doing so much work finding my way around this app, still can’t find a simple answer to when my bus will arrive. | This new app doesn’t even have the same information as the old one. There’s no way to see planned service changes. The new status page layout makes it hard to see all the lines that have delays. It made way more sense grouped by status than by line. There are so many bad UX choices I’m seriously in shock. This app is so bad and it’s worse than what existed before. Bring back the old app, this one is a total joke. | The new version looks prettier but it is SO difficult to use. To find the time my train will arrive at a station I need to: click on my favorites, click on the train, click on the route, scroll through the WHOLE ROUTE including ANY stop that train CAN make stops at even when it usually doesn't, find my stop, and THEN I can see the time it's coming. This is an incredibly annoying and inefficient app. Please take the new design choices and apply them to the former layout!! | This app update is far worse than the old one. It is no longer possible to quickly jump to a subway line and station to see the train times and plan when to leave to grab a train. This now requires navigating twice  screens and scrolling. Th print is very fine and  screen very busy, further slowing things. Terrible UI. Please roll back to something cleaner, including the old one. Bus navigation sort of ok. | I can’t stand the new version of this app, not user friendly at all, so many unnecessary steps added. Bring back the old app for the love of god | Doesn’t even let you search the station. I get every other search but the station. Utterly terrible | Give us back the old version!! Like many other user have said it, the old version of the app had it simpler than current version!! | This app was fine, now it’s an absolute mess. Terrible. | I guess you need some “getting used to “ time. It still has occasional issue with accuracy in geolocation but overall, I’d say the app has improved. Still cautiously optimistic. | The new update makes it harder to find the information you need. Many more clicks and back and forth to find the bus times as compared with the previous version. If you haven’t updated yet I recommend you don’t | New update app is Garbage. Never right. 
Schedule never right. | It’s as of the Uk/ix designers had no experience at all.  This app is so much less usable than the last version.  MTA take note! | What a shifty update. Dont be proud, MTA and contractor, this new app is less usable. | Now that real time bus locations are back, the apps functionality is back to being what commuters need. I don’t agree with every visual change, but as always there is no way you could ever get everyone using an app like this with millions of customers on the same page.

I think some of the changes are for the better, I would personally prefer the old split for specific stops, where the top of the app was one direction and the bottom was the other, but I think that’s something that maybe confused people. I think overall the app is in a great place now. | When this App was initially updated , March 27, 2024. I gave it a 1 Star Review without giving it an opportunity to actually impress me with its changes. Now, a month later, I have gotten used to it, and it is EXTREMELY more helpful than before. This is a 5 Star App that has become more helpful than its original release. Great job. | Used to look worse but work better… Now it looks better but is so convoluted as to be a waste of time to even open. Horrible functionality. One wonders whether they had a single test user because nobody in the right mind would think this new layout was better or even close in functionality. | I like the old Mta app better than the new one this one is a mess to use | Bring back the old version!! We need an app that will easy information at the nick of time, too many steps to get to the information. Plus no service in the subway so it doesn’t load. | Way too many selection screens to get to the train/bus needed. By the time you do you’ve missed the oncoming train/bus. The app no longer finds your stop automatically through location which adds extra time to the search. It auto selects to the uptown direction which can be confusing. The countdown time and the time stamp often don’t match up which can be frustrating. Essentially it’s just become too  complicated for people living in a city that moves so fast. I appreciated that previously it would only take a few seconds to find a route... something I could do while multitasking. I feel like now I’m planning a road trip with multiple stops and I need to sit down and really pay attention to make sure I don’t get lost. | For me, this app went from daily use to never use in such a rapid period of time. The newly designed app is an unmitigated disaster. But what else would you expect from the MTA? | Times for arriving trains are often incorrect, changing often once the page is refreshed. The interface is confusing, with a lot of extra steps needed to find a station or train. | I reported that the app crashes upon launching and the following  reply was sent to me:

Thank you for your comment and we apologize for any inconvenience with the new update. You can report specific issues of this kind right in the app. In the "More" tab, tap the "App Feedback" button and follow the prompts."

The. App. Crashes.  It does not open. | MTA got this right. The offline maps are greatly appreciated; i was having to make searches on the web/use bookmarks for them. And the new layout allows you to see all options at your current location at a glance. Favorites are still there, though oddly located under the “i” icon, and through that you can use “show route” to  see the lineup of stops as before. Trip Planner, given a street address, can suggest alternate routes you might not have thought of. Thanks, MTA! | Go back to the basics!! | Mostly the times being immaculate compared to other apps is my issue. Otherwise the app looks good not too hard to figure out as well. | The only useful feature on the entire app was the live train/bus feature.  No bus or train is ever on time. The schedule is a joke. Removing this feature makes the app garbage. Please put the feature back. | This app is so frustrating since the update. Traveling by bus, it’s so much more complicated to see where the bus is and sometimes it simply doesn’t show any buses even though they are coming.

title: MVV-App
description:
The MVV-App is a journey planning application created by the Munich transport association (Münchner Verkehrs- und Tarifverbund, MVV). It is both free of charge and without advertising. 

It provides travel information for the entire public transport network in the city of Munich and the surrounding regions (districts of Bad-Tölz Wolfratshausen, Dachau, Ebersberg, Erding, Freising, Fürstenfeldbruck, Miesbach, München, Rosenheim, Starnberg and the city of Rosenheim) – no matter whether you go by train, (sub)urban railways, underground, tram or bus. In many cases with real-time information. With the MVV-App you can also purchase selected MVV tickets with your smartphone or tablet on the go. Register once and you have the option to either buy the single trip tickets or you can choose to buy one of our day tickets for your stay in Munich. Besides, the MVV-App provides additional information on public transport in the entire Greater Munich Area, such as public transport and tariff maps as well as any changes in the timetables.

Features:
========

• Departures: The departure monitor indicates the next departures and/or arrivals from a stop or the stops in the neighborhood of your current location in real-time (where available). 

• Trips: The journey planner will help you to find the quickest route from A to B – in many cases with real-time information. Just enter the name of a stop, a point of interest or any desired address in Munich or the surrounding districts as your starting point or destination. With GPS you can also use your current location. The results include all footpath directions. The MVV-App also helps you buy the correct ticket for the selected journey. With just a few clicks you can purchase mobile tickets directly from the journey planner.

• Disruptions: At a glance, you can see disruptions that might affect your daily commute ordered by lines and their operation names. As yet, the descriptions of timetable changes are only available in German.   

• Tickets: With menu item “Tickets” you can purchase selected MVV tickets as mobile ticket. Register once within one of the listed shops (identical range of tickets) and choose your ticket before starting your journey. You can pay for your tickets by using Google Pay, a credit card or direct debit. As electronic tickets are personalized, you have to bring your official photo ID.

• Network plans: In addition, the MVV-App provides you with various public transport network plans and tariff maps. Although most of the plans are in German language, you can find several plans in English, too. For example: the general plan of the regional train, suburban train and underground in the entire MVV area.

• Interactive map: The interactive map does not just help you to come along in the MVV area.  You get access to further information such as nearby departures by using your GPS signal for example.

• Settings: If you choose the appropriate settings, you can for example avoid stairs during your trip or prefer less walking time over the quickest connection. In case you take a bike with you, the journey planner is able to take this into account too. You can also exclude connections not being integrated within the MVV tariff.
releaseNotes: Thanks a lot for your feedback. The update fixes a problem with the graphical indicator of the tariff zones in the trip planner. We are looking forward to your suggestions for improvement, criticism, compliments and questions - feel free to contact our MVV customer service.
developer: Muenchner Verkehrs- und Tarifverbund Gesellschaft mit beschraenkter Haftung (MVV)

Good app if you want to scream at your phone. | Layout looks great! Just can’t buy ticket or use it! Please fix! | Often won’t display tickets to buy.  Need to delete app and download and register again... and again… and again… Shame. | Unable to buy tickets after last update.  It says “no products please pull down…” regardless of which option you select. The app worked fine before this last update. | Credits can’t be used - uninstall and reinstall - logging in again - nothing makes the problems go away. This app is really bad. title: Highway Weather
description:
Travel weather forecasts for your entire road trip at the time you will arrive. Weather alerts, radar, traffic cameras, and plan for rests.

Family vacation? Long-haul trucking? Touring in an RV? Heading to a motorcycle rally? Whatever your passion, we want to ensure that you arrive safely.

There's nothing like the uncertainty of knowing if weather will disrupt your trip. Instead of searching for weather forecasts city-by-city, get all the information you need all at the same time, in an easy to understand display.

Free features for planning a trip:
• Compare forecasts for your entire trip.
• No limitations on trip length.
• Get recommendations for the best time to start your trip.
• Adjust your departure time instantly and see updated forecasts.
• View live outdoor cameras for your trip.
• Get severe weather alerts along your route.
• Add rest stops to long trips.
• Wind and precipitation levels also inform whether travel is safe.
• Global weather forecasts, for all regions of the globe.

All planning features are provided free of charge!

For the hands-free active driving mode, a subscription is required.
• Receive automatic updates while on the road.
• See updates instantly in the app.
• Get notifications when the app is running in the background.
• More features currently in development!

Subscription Details:

• Length of subscription: 1 year (with 14-day free trial period)
• Price of subscription: $14.99 / Year
• Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase.
• Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period.
• Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase.
• Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user cancels a subscription.

Privacy policy & terms and conditions: https://www.weatherroute.io/privacy_policy.html
releaseNotes: This release is a maintenance update to update libraries packaged with the app.
reviews:

Radar is dramatic snow and rain forecast with no precipitation in the forecast  in the timeline. | Waste of space and time. You can do your preferred weather app for better results. This doesn’t update as you travel. It showed partly sunny with chance for rain through Kentucky and Tennessee. It’s poured the whole time. We travel frequently from NW Ohio to NW Florida using I-65. No sun at all, just rain. If it refreshed better with traveling but it doesn’t. So use your map and compare with weather app for more accurate reading. The location detection in real time needs some improvement, but it works and for now it's the only while-you-drive weather app! | This is a very important tool for me that my job so much easier by avoiding bad weather causing costly delays in my logistics business | The radar is accurate on the current day, but if you pick a future date, the radar doesn’t update/change. Sites like Road Now require too much interaction for each state and exit to determine weather conditions. So, when I located your website and mapped out our route along I-40, I was pleanstly surprised with the various filters one may use to receive the information needed. 

Based on the information provided, we planned our trip for yesterday and today. We are approximately 2-hours from our destination and this has not been a pleasant experience. 

The weather conditions we encountered were not predicted. In addition, I downloaded the App, thinking that we could monitor conditions easier on the road - Icould not have been more wrong!

For over 200-miles, the app and website did not register our location or, if it did, the forecast information was not available. Even as we were deak]ling with the challenging weather, the App and website did not indicate what we were experiencing. 

Needless to say, the App and Website Bookmark will be deleted after completing this review. This appeared to have so much potential but from someone who has extensive experience with this route, this was an epic failure. | Lately app crashes or freezes often. Useful app but design is very entry level. | this new update is stupid and the app is now useless | Useless. | Convenient when I travel back home to Iowa from Ohio, I always use this app to check the weather! | Before any major road trip we use this app for the weather on the roads we will be on.  Once it helped us to change our route before we left to avoid tornadoes. | I get a lot of good information on this app | I’ve used this for a couple of years going back and forth from Wi and Fl. Has always been accurate on best time to travel in order to hit the best weather available. | This app was Great at helping me miss traveling in storms!! I use it all the time!! I’m not sure if it tell us about fog but I hope so!!! | I have use this app for 3 East Coast to the West Coast and back again trips on motorcycle. This app provided important information to provide the best time to make my rides and keep me from bad weather, how fast to ride and when to ride to keep me out of dangerous thunderstorms that were traveling east to west. | I just paid to upgrade the app, which I’ve had had for many years. I can’t say enough about how much better Highway Weather is in my opinion. 

Not only was I able to effectively choose a great route with better weather (someone in my party chose the “fast route” using another app and regretted it), but I experienced a subscription related issue and the response I received was so much faster than I expected and a fantastic interaction.

Every time I close the app I have to refresh my purchase.  And I mean EVERY TIME! So very frustrating when you’re only checking the drive. | Hands down a killer app for planning road-trips. Living in NC and driving back to Ohio means I have to drive through WV mountains. This app helps me determine the best times to leave based on the weather | This app simply doesn’t work. UPDATE:   Developer was very responsive and fixed the bug quickly.    The application now works as designed. | This app is great for plan your trip, I’m truck driver, this app help me a lot. Thanks developers!! | Have been using app for 6 months, flawless best indicator of future road conditions, its shows best time to leave and you can adjust departure times a1 app | I does what it says, and pretty darn accurate.. With this app, you should be surprised by weather along the way.. | I was testing the functions on this app. When I pressed an x in the lower left hand corner, the screen went black. I can not recover the app, delete it and reinstall it, nothing. Please review. | Wow, what did they do? Clicking Drive Now does nothing. | I did not purchase the app - only using the free version - but if I choose to travel now it shows me a screen that lets me purchase it. If I decline, the app does nothing | I really appreciate this app as a frequent roadtripper and regular all-weather truck camper. Helps me navigate and choose routes wisely across time and space, when to go, when to stay, and easily allows smart decision-making with detailed info along routes. Thanks! | Must have especially when traveling long distances during possible bad weather months.  Traveled from Michigan to Florida and back during the winter months.  With this app I was able to determine the best times to travel and avoid bad weather and roads.  Great app!! | I am very disappointed in the mis app doesn’t give the information I expect and the travel time isn’t accurate | This app is great for long trips in the winter. | Doesn’t work when you use zip codes ... | The app advertises it has travel routes with current road conditions and that is false! Even using the paid version, it does not work! If I could give lesser than 1-star, I would. | Needs a lot more work | When traveling, especially when pulling a travel trailer.  We need to be able to see if there are high winds and what those wind gusts will be.  We have often changed our leave time based on weather along the route.  This is a great app. | This is a must-have app for anybody who travels on the road.  Whenever I go on roadtrips, I use this app to make sure I will safely get there and conveniently have the weather I want on my journey.  
The app looks a little beta, but I think it’s really all you need. So much potential in this app. But no other app is like this app. | Love this app for planning long rides it’s pretty accurate with what I can expect traveling  and gives a snapshot of the weather in cities along the way. | No good...doesn’t follow your location. Also, I tried the free trial and kept asking for subscription each time.  No good | I used this app to plan our departure date when we decided to drive cross country instead of fly during the pandemic. Probably the best free app I have ever used. It helps to really think about your trip and add way points with realistic pause times. I adjusted my route along the way and the weather was always spot-on. | We have been a motorcyclist for 35+ years and travel about 18K per year on two wheels. I have said to friends I have been waiting for this app my whole riding career. Nothing in weather prediction is perfect but this app gives excellent predictions and makes my road travel easier and SAFER! I highly recommend the product! | Horrible app. Can’t o diddly squat without paying and can’t see enough of tyke functions to know whether it’s worth buying. Route locations with weather info are odd; not your normal towns and cities and some didn’t even pop up on the normal map apps. If you’re gonna want people to buy your app give them something to look at first. Free websites work better.
Don’t waste your time or money.

title: Firebird Tours
description:
ABOUT FIREBIRD

Firebird is one of the leading travel companies in the world for planning and organizing quality journeys for individual customers and groups. We organize excellent programs to some of the world's most amazing destinations in Europe, Asia, the Americas, the Middle East, and Oceania. Each year, tens of thousands of travelers use our service to travel, and hundreds of thousands use our services to plan trips. Over 20% of customers who travel with us choose to travel with us again, which speaks volumes about the quality of our service and value for our customers.


FIREBIRD APP FOR EXISTING CUSTOMERS
The Firebird App helps our customers to travel conveniently, as all information related to your trip will be at your fingertips - your travel itinerary, hotel reservation confirmations, train tickets, drivers, and transfers, etc. You will be able to buy additional services, upgrade your hotels, and communicate with our support team in real-time.
The Firebird App allows you to plan new journeys. It will use AI to generate new amazing itineraries when you just tell it where you want to go. You can then discuss your itinerary with one of our helpful destination specialists, share it with friends, or simply keep it saved for the future.


FIREBIRD APP FOR NEW CUSTOMERS
Finally, the Firebird App also supports new customers. You can build your entire trip from scratch in seconds. You will enjoy the speed at which your ideas turn into real travel plans. You will also appreciate the level of detail of those travel plans. And when you decide to book your trip with Firebird, you will experience our stellar service.
releaseNotes:
Thank you for traveling with us!

What's new:
Fixed minor bugs.

I am worried that it will not work properly when there as it is not allowing the features I need to access now. IT is supposed to be fixing it but that has been 2 weeks and it is still not working properly. | Firebird did an excellent job in helping plan our trip to Scotland and Ireland.  The hotels, guides and other activities were terrific!  Every detail was planned out and executed wonderfully!  We will use Firebird again! | I have asked a lot of questions over a period of months leading up to our Oct trip.  They have responded well every time. | Very in-depth and user friendly interface | Great guide and very punctual, everything you can ask for when you are a nervous traveler.

title: Foresyte - Discover. Plan. Do.
description:
Travel together the easy way with the only collaborative planning app that lets you chat, coordinate, discover, share, and book in one spot.
 
Plan, Chat and Coordinate.
Chat, coordinate and stay connected when planning for trips, retreats, bachelor(ette) parties and more.

Collaborate on Itineraries.
Travel together the easy way by collaborating on your itinerary. Share information, post updates, vote or comment on ideas, and reach consensus through full-group interaction.

Discover New Places.
Uncover top travel spots from the Foresyte community. See recommended places to stay, things to do – even dining or nightlife to enjoy – from community travelers who’ve been there before.

Inspire Your Travel.
Plan the perfect trip with expert-recommended stays and curated itineraries, helping you maximize a visit to any city. Explore the globe with real-cost estimates, transit options, and a customized checklist with everything you'll need.

Instantly Book Your Plans.
Once your group decides on the travel, instantly book your plans while the app keeps everything organized.


~The Foresyte Way~
Planning trips with friends shouldn't require several different apps to fully coordinate. These moments are meant to be fun, not stressful, and planning is half the fun when done right.

During an era of distractions and buried commitments, Foresyte is on a mission to enable friends everywhere to stay connected when planning the moments that matter together.

Discover. Plan. Do.


TESTIMONIALS
My friends and I do a lot of traveling for powwow season and, being like a giant family reunion already, it can be CRAZY trying to coordinate everyone with places, times, and pooled funds. We used to “volunteer” someone to play point person for the group and be in charge of making sure everyone was on the same page and all registration fees have been covered…but this app has made EVERYTHING so much easier, even when we’re all in different parts of the country trying to meet up at an event. Easy to use and fun, it’s like it’s own festival on my phone. And we’ve found the coolest places we would’ve never checked out if Foresyte hadn’t recommended - highly recommend.
- Michelle Collins

I downloaded Foresyte a couple months ago and this app is solid. Me and my friends just used it to plan our trip through Europe earlier this month and it worked great. Group chat inside of the trip itinerary is such a great concept
- steve s

Foresyte seems like the type of app that could become an everyday essential. Very clean interface and rich set of features.
- KevinKeef

My bro asked me to plan his bachelor party and his friends are kinda flaky. This definitely helped me pull everyone together for the travel weekend.
- Ruby4401

I travel frequently between work and personal trips. Foresyte is a great way to manage my travel calendar apart from the 1000 other meetings listed on my work calendar
- ChrisW

As someone who travels a lot I've always wanted a better way to visualize my schedule. This app solves the problem of needing to check various sources to pull together upcoming group trip plans on our bucket list.
- MiniMom

I have been needing some way to plan for all my trips coming up and I’m so excited to have found this app. I can fully enjoy the moment because I'm financially ready for it. Love the new updates too! Makes it so easy to use now. The perfect trip planner
- emm18

title: Venice Travel Guide and Map
description:
Offline Maps and much more! Discover new places and insider tips. Collect, save and organize them as you like. And have the best trip ever!
 
With us, traveling got easier and even more fun. Here’s what you get – the shortest possible version:
 
• Free offline maps – no roaming, no hustle
• Insider tips and places to discover
• Multifunctional lists to plan and organize your trip
 
We let you discover new places, beautiful spots and insider tips at the touch of a button. Collect your personal best-of and save it for later. You will experience your best journeys yet with detailed offline maps and in-depth travel content on your mobile travel companion.
 
And here’s why 5+ million travelers love our apps:
  
CLEAR AND CONCISE MAPS
Never get lost again. See your location on the map via GPS, no internet connection is required. Find streets, addresses or attractions and get pointed in the walking direction.
 
IN-DEPTH TRAVEL CONTENT
You’ll never have to buy another guide book. Our Guides features pictures as well as comprehensive and up-to-date information is available for thousands of places and attractions.
 
SAVE ROAMING FEES
Maps and guide content are stored on directly your device so you can access them at any time even without an internet connection. An internet connection is of course required for initial downloading of data or booking hotels.

SEARCH AND DISCOVER
Search a specific place by name or browse by categories like restaurants, architecture, hotels, shops, bars, etc.
 
PLAN TRIPS AND CUSTOMIZE MAPS
Book the hotel for your next city tour right within the app. Remember and save all the places you would like to visit. Create new or individual ones. Mark them with different colors or add notes to them. 
 
SHARE WITH FRIENDS
Create your own reviews and ratings of your favorite places. Share these tips and recommendations with friends and other travelers.

title: Trip Planner with AI
description:
Embark on a seamless journey of exploration with our innovative Travel Planner AI app. Designed to elevate your travel experience, our app empowers you to effortlessly plan, customize, and manage your dream vacations. Here's what sets us apart:

Intelligent Itinerary Generation:
Let artificial intelligence be your travel companion. Simply input your preferred locations, dates, and interests, and watch as our AI crafts a personalized itinerary tailored just for you.

Effortless Trip Management:
Navigate through your adventures effortlessly with our user-friendly interface. The list view provides a quick overview of all your trips, while detailed screens allow you to delve into the specifics of each planned expedition.

Comprehensive Trip Details:
Gain a comprehensive understanding of your planned adventure. Dive into detailed itineraries, explore curated suggestions, and ensure every aspect of your trip aligns with your vision.

Map View for Each Event:
Effortlessly visualize your itinerary by viewing each event on an interactive map. Pinpoint the exact locations of your planned activities and explore the surroundings, enhancing your overall trip planning experience.

Free to Use:
Enjoy the full suite of features without any cost. Our Travel Planner AI app is completely free, making it accessible to all travelers ready to embark on a new era of hassle-free trip planning.

Embark on a new era of travel planning with our Travel Planner AI app. Your next adventure is just a few taps away. Download now and start crafting the perfect getaway!

releaseNotes: Bug Fixes

title: Schengen Simple
description:
>Why choose Schengen Simple?

Schengen Simple answers the key question that other apps don’t:
What is the maximum I can travel for, on any date, whilst ensuring I can still go on ALL my planned trips, never breaking the 90/180 rule?

To illustrate what makes Schengen Simple unique: say you have a trip next week and another in 2 months, and you want to add another trip in between. With Schengen Simple, you’ll know exactly how long that trip in the middle could be without causing an overstay. No other calculator can do this.

Other calculators can only tell you if a trip fits in with the trips that came BEFORE it. They are just counting the trips in the past 180 days. Schengen Simple’s algorithm is smarter, always looking forwards and backwards, ensuring ALL your plans are compatible.

Most other apps' calculations are misleading. Even apps which claim to account for future trips don’t really, which is why they overestimate your allowance.

>Trust your calculator

Here’s a simple test you can do to choose the right app for you.

Enter a 90-day trip in the calculator you’re testing. Now check the allowance for the days leading up to this trip; most will say you have an allowance of 90 because they’re only looking backwards. This is wrong, as we know you are already committed to the 90-day trip you just entered. The correct allowance should be zero for the 90 days preceding this trip. Other apps will incorrectly display that you have a 90-day allowance, and then when you try to enter a trip, will complain you’re causing an overstay - which we find frustrating.

The above example is simple as there is only one trip. As you enter more trips of varying lengths, we need to account for many interacting 180-day windows.

This is what makes Schengen Simple unique - it handles this instantly and accurately.

You’ll always know how long you can travel whilst ensuring you can still take every trip in your calendar.

>Features

• No need to nominate a date of entry, Schengen Simple analyses all your past and future trips, instantly updating your allowance for your entire calendar. Making it fast, easy and accurate to plan your travels.

• Never worry about having enough allowance to take your future trips. Always know how long you can travel, on any date, whilst ensuring you can still take your planned trips.

• Passport Control mode displays exactly how long you’ve been in the Schengen Area in a given 180-day period.

• Seeing your allowance under each date in your calendar gives full visibility of when your allowance changes so you can make smarter decisions about when to travel. Often if you wait a few days, you’ll get an increase in your allowance. Only Schengen Simple lets you see this at a glance.

• Allowance Analysis - easily probe why your allowance is what is for a given date, so you know which trips you could edit to stay longer.

• The Schengen Simple algorithm has been tested rigorously, so you can fully trust its calculations. This includes rigorous testing against the official EU calculator.

• Clear, simple and easy to use - even calculators deserve beautiful design.

>Pricing

Get started with a 1week free trial, after which an annual subscription gives you full access to all features - prices vary by country.

>Why should I subscribe when some apps offer a one-off price?

• Schengen Simple is a service we are committed to growing and supporting. We are dedicated to keeping our customers happy over the long term and building a service they’ll love, with many great features in the pipeline.
• We will never sell your data and don’t advertise.
• We stay up-to-date with the Schengen Area and its rules to keep you informed and give you peace of mind.

Try Schengen Simple for free - with no obligation to continue.
We think you’ll love it.

Privacy Policy: https://schengensimple.com/privacy-policy
Terms of Use: https://schengensimple.com/terms-of-use
releaseNotes:
We're always working to enhance Schengen Simple and provide the best possible experience for our users.

Version 2.3.2
• Adds support for multiple email clients to make it even easier to get in touch if you need help.

We Value Your Feedback:

If there's a feature you'd love to see, or if something doesn't seem quite right, please don't hesitate to get in touch. 

Every bit of feedback, big or small, helps us to refine and improve Schengen Simple - we’d love to hear from you!
reviews:
Finally, a stress-free way to manage your allowance. As a frequent traveler to the EU, this has been a godsend! | As a citizen of the US who travels many times a year to the EU, often for unpredictable and long stretches of time, this app is essential for my planning and essential for my sanity. In a nutshell, it works perfectly, and erases the stress and uncertainty of doing the 90/180 calculations manually. However, I must also say a word about the design and UI: This app is so elegant, so polished, so aesthetically gorgeous in its simplicity that I show it to all my designer friends and colleagues. The user interface is intuitive to the point where I was using it fluently within seconds. Likewise, the homepage shows you all the information you need to know immediately in a simple and attractive layout. Frankly, it’s as if they hired Massimo Vignelli as their creative director.
